author: Fat Mac
review: I’m a wizard, Hagrid.This really is a wonderful adventure game and what Harry Potter/ Hogwarts fans have always dreamed of. Becoming a wizard, learning all sorts of spells and using them in quests, battles and in general is extremely fun and satisfying. Gameplay is smooth and the atmosphere is amazing and immersive with lots to do and explore. I personally have been playing on the Steam Deck and it has been a good experience. The game will be a good time sink, completing the main storyline and wandering around the wonderful world of Hogwarts.

author: Kitten Pot Pie
review: Really fun story, with great mechanics. I love learning about the past of the Wizarding World, and I was surprised they figured out a way to make the Legacy experience interesting and captivating. Give it a try! The first 2 hours will let you know whether this game is for you! But if you're a fan, take a bite of nostalgia with this game. The scenery and character graphics are beautiful (except for the cats, who dropped the ball on the cats?), and while the character creation could do with a more in-depth update, it's not as bad as people say, but I do agree it's somewhat lacking. Still, you can play as someone who is still wholly the character YOU customized, and it shouldn't detract from the overall experience and nostalgia that this game provides. Get lost in Hogwarts! I am a Harry Potter fan and have been for decades. It was my childhood, teenage-hood, and adulthood favorite stories and movies. As I grew up with them, I don't care about whatever negative news or publicity has been getting around in relation to J.K. Rowling. She had no participation in this game, if you do your research, so no one should be discriminating against any other individual for their love and passion for this game and the Harry Potter series. None of the negativity changes how these novels helped me through traumatic times in my life, and it never will. Harry Potter holds a wonderful and magical place in my heart, and no amount of garbage, lies or unfortunate truths will sway my passion for these stories. So don't let others control you and tell you that you're a terrible person for playing this game. They're intolerant and desire tolerance while not accepting ANYONE for their own beliefs. Ignore, move past, and make YOUR own decision.

author: Ellye
review: Early impressions are extremely positive, this is one of the best open worlds I've experienced in a game so far - for example, I never felt any desire to use Fast Travel or to turn on quest tracking, because moving around the world is way too fun. They made the whole place interesting. You know how games with huge areas will have a lot of doors "painted" in the walls that you can't interact with? This game has even more doors... but all of them are functional. There's places to explore everywhere. And, personally, I'm not exploring for some ingame rewards (those are, frankly, a bit meh) - but because it's been really fun to explore.The gameplay is pretty fine so far, playing on hard some of the combats can be a bit of a challenge in a good way. The game incentives you to make combos while dodging/parrying enemies, leading to a very action-y combat experience that feels good.I really love how the main character can be pretty talkative, and actually talk about the weird things she sees instead of keeping everything to herself like way too many game protagonists do. Great voice acting for the female MC too, I haven't heard the male one to comment. Overall, voice acting for most everyone is good, but there's one glaring exception: there's one minor Hufflepuff student that has the single worst voice I've heard in my entire life, and that voice doesn't seem to match his face or his face movements at all, it's bizarre.Regarding performance, I'm having a stable 60 FPS, but I'm having to play on lower quality than what I've expected, having to set everything to Low and use FSR2. Loading times are pretty good, at least, and I don't have any noticeable frame drops; just a pity about the low quality.

author: moonrise
review: WTF I like Harry Potter now?This is the ultimate HP theme park experience, just buy this game instead of going to Universal Studios. There's a lot of detail and interactable objects in the game world that just make it a joy to experience. The game also provides a multitude of activities to choose from and it's easy to find yourself so immersed that you lose track of time.Combat is a bit simplistic, like a dark souls-lite with many different spells to combine and a combo system to tie it all together. However, it is still fun and controls feel very responsive. Countering attacks and chaining different spells together are both satisfying and rewarding. Talents are also available to tailor your gameplay preferences by adding to your abilities anywhere from spellcasting, stealth, and consumables.One thing I do wish was improved is the variety of dialogue options. Most of the time you only get a couple options to choose from, it makes it feel almost kinetic. However this doesn't prevent you from being a total A-hole if you want to be ;)Tl;Dr: Buy game, gud game. PS: Friendly reminder, don't forget it's canon that poop can be magic'd away in HP, which means everyone is crapping themselves constantly.

author: IT'S Khan
review: I wish Hagrid was the one to tell meYou're a wizard Khan!But i know that's just impossibleThe graphics and music feels damn perfect to me, especially the wizarding world always been a crazy fan most probably obsessedLoved the gameplay it's funAmazing optimization no stutter, lag, crash, or any bug or glitches that i came across in a few hoursIt's highly demanding or probably just my issueTaking over 7+gb vram (8gb gpu)Ram 14-16gb (2x8gb)1080p ultra texture rest settings high-mediumTAA High no upscalingInside the castle 65-70 fpsOutside castle dropping to 45 average 40-50Waiting for the rtx to be delivered XD next up steam deckFeels stupid to spend over a thousand bucks just for one game but it's worth it

author: moravna
review: ↳ My dream of becoming that all black wearing, robe swishing son of a gun with magic has finally come true. | February 11, 2023 | [★★★★★]

author: Blvk_Knxght
review: The game does a great job of capturing the magic and wonder of the Harry Potter universe, and is sure to bring back fond memories for fans of the books and movies. It's the childhood experience you've been waiting for, and highly recommend it!

author: MEDEA
review: You are a student at Hogwarts and will have a story of your own in the Hogwarts- Harry Potter Universe.Story 8.5/10So far, I cannot say too much regarding the story. It is captivating, but not mind breaking like for example a Bioshock. Solid work and an immersive journey into the Potterverse.Graphic 9/10The graphics are breathtaking and the amount of details is something else. Everything all around you is moving or enchanted and you will definitely enjoy the ride, even if you are not the biggest Potterhead. The magic and how it is captured really makes a difference and you can clearly tell, the game was made with love.The only thing that was slightly off were the facial expressions sometimes. I had some 2 minor lags, but nothing compared to a some other games I played.Gameplay 8.5/10You cast run and cast spells fluidly. Fighting is a little tricky sometimes and you will maybe need a few takes to get used to it. But once you get it, it is really cool.Music 9/10 Music is fitting and the original soundtrack mixed with some new aspects. Final Verdict: Must buy! Potterhead or not. It made me pick up my old books and rewatch the movies.

author: Brandon
review: Hogwarts Legacy is an incredible game that lives up to the hype! As a Harry Potter fan, I was thrilled to pre-order this game, and I'm happy to say that I haven't been disappointed.The story is excellent and fits perfectly into the HP universe. The game starts with a generic "chosen one" scenario but gets better as you progress through it. I will keep the information private, but the story is engaging, and I would love to read it as a book.The gameplay is overwhelming and features many amazing and satisfying mechanics. Exploring every inch of Hogwarts and its surroundings is a treat, with many collectibles and puzzles to uncover. The side quests are exceptionally well done, allowing you to understand your fellow students better. The combat system is fantastic, featuring a variety of spells that can be combined for different effects. The fast travel system using Floo powder or brooms is a great touch, making travel and exploration even more fun.The RPG elements could be better, but the character creation and skill tree are still outstanding. The voice acting is excellent and adds to the game's overall atmosphere.The atmosphere is simply stunning. Hogwarts is massive, and the attention to detail in the handcrafted halls, rooms, and dungeons is breathtaking. The neighbouring villages and landmarks are just as atmospheric, making you want to explore every inch of the world.In conclusion, Hogwarts Legacy is a must-play for any Harry Potter fan or RPG lover. The gameplay, atmosphere, and attention to detail are truly unique and make this game stand out in the gaming world.9/10 - Just fix PC FPS Drops.

author: Ardy
review: Surprisingly good combat, fun charming story, huge, beautifully detailed worldso epic

author: ¤ βℓооđч ¤ Nico-Kun!
review: Allow me to begin this review by saying that, as a Harry Potter fan since I was a kid (practically grew up with the books), Hogwarts Legacy is the Harry Potter game I've always dreamt of, allowing me to finally visit Hogwarts as a student myself, having my own adventures instead of following the plot from the books.The story is set around 100 years before the books. You play as a Hogwarts student who just recently got accepted into the school, and as a fifth year no less! While this may seem weird, as one would expect to start from first year, it's both explained in the story, and honestly allows the player to jump straight into the action, instead of going through the basics. Anyway, at the start of the game, you're just about to depart to Hogwarts alongside Professor Fig, who's been getting you up to speed with some basic spellcasting. Things don't go precisely well on the journey there, and you end up getting involved in the latest goblin rebellion. Honestly, I can say I enjoyed the story, though the best part of the narrative comes through the companion sidequests. While there's four main companions with a certain involvement in the main story (one for each house), only three of them get their own personal side story.When it comes to gameplay, it's an open world action adventure game with some light RPG elements. While there's dialogue choices throughout the game, they don't really affect your relationship with other characters, nor do they lock you out of content (well, you can choose not to learn the Unforgivable Curses). Combat is done through spellcasting, while at first you only have a basic cast, as you progress through the story you unlock new spells, including, as I mentioned above, the Unforgivable Curses. Now, the game basically allows using them willy-nilly, and there's no consequences for going on a murdering spree; of course, it can be excused as you're fighting Dark Wizards and evil goblins. Beyond that, you can also get a broom to get around the map (no Quidditch, though), or even a hippogrif mount. There's also different skill trees in the form of "talents", which give you different upgrades, and while you can craft equipment, you can upgrade certain pieces of equipment. Also, a great plus is that you can change the appearance of your gear to that of any other gear you've found, so you don't end up looking like a madman wearing mismatching clothes.There's lots of stuff to do in this game beyond the main story and the side quests; perhaps too much, at times, as it can feel a bit tedious going for 100% completion. There's different mini puzzles in the form of Merlin trials, broom races, and at one point in the story, you unlock the Room of Requirement, which works as a sort of "base" where you can brew potions or grow plants to use in combat. Plus, you also get to rescue animals and put them in your own personal shelter, treat them well, and they'll give you resources (of course, it can feel a bit morally questionable how you "rescue" animals to get their resources, but the game makes it look like you're at least treating them fairly, and you can even release them to the wild).Graphically, it looks gorgeous. Hogwarts itself is very detailed, as are the surrounding areas. And the map is huge, too; not only do you get to explore Hogwarts, the Forbidden Forest and Hogsmeade, but there's also plenty of little hamlets spread throughout the map, all with their own little collectibles, merchants, and side quests. The sound design is also very good; the dialogue is well written and the performances are all very good, and the soundtrack is excellent; some tracks resemble the movies, but the game has its own style as well.Now, to talk about Hogwarts itself, it's fantastic. The design of the castle resembles that of the movies, but there's still many details you'd find only in the books, including characters; Peeves, the poltergeist, makes an appearance here, as well as the different house ghosts. Since you can go to any House, they all get a very detailed common room, and a positive I have to note about the game is how they made Slytherins not be complete jerks. Sure, it's always seen as the "evil house", but over here, while they're still very ambitious folk, most of them aren't hateful people, just a bit of overachievers. The professors you meet are also great characters, and while there may not be as many lessons as one would expect in a game that's all about being a Hogwarts student, you still get a nice taste of student life.All things considered, I must say I definitely recommend this game, and it's certainly a contender for my personal GOTY, though we'll have to see what else comes out this year.

author: edrocked
review: When the game isn't crashing, it is really fun. I cannot believe how poor and sporadic the performance is though. My PC specs are mid-high range, and this game is all over the place. Fixes like changing graphic settings sometimes do something, and sometimes do the opposite. Game updates, re-installs, driver updates, dlss swaps, .ini tweaks. I've tried it all. If you are ok spending a quarter of your play-time trying to resolve issues with it, go for it. I'm pretty tired of having no idea why my game crashes, why the frame rate is great and then terrible. I'm hopeful for a future patch that might fix it all.

author: Thick McRunfast
review: Many years ago I acquired a superpower that gives me the rare & unique ability to ignore both sides of the political spectrum & it was a godsend. I found after receiving said power that life is much more enjoyable so I decided to call my new powers "mind ya own damn business". After some years I discovered there are others like me & things went great... for a time.The 2 great evils of the world, known simply as the Diabolical Right & the Nefarious Left, refuse to mind their own damn business & insist that we should always follow one of them. But our power is strong so we don't give in to either. We stand strong & continue to do whatever the f*ck we want while minding our own damn business & hoping others learn to do the same.Joking aside, is a fun game but is a little heavy on system requirements. I turned Ray Tracing off & played with everything on Ultra & had no frame drops anywhere with a 3070.P.S. If this dumb*ss review pissed you off then hopefully one day you to will receive the "mind ya own damn business" power. Also everyone should just get ready for the Professor Garlick hentai that we all know will be coming soon.

author: Toaster
review: Positive: - Hogwarts Legacy has lots of little details that give a lot of credibility to the Harry Potter universe. - The music and sound effects are well-done, and the voice acting is excellent (english/french)- Very few bugsNegative: - The combat system is not very engaging, and it can feel repetitive and clunky.- You can't activate the VO with the subtitles in your native langage...- The story is not amazing and the few side quests are very generic, both in terms of gameplay and scenario. Overall, Hogwarts Legacy is not a bad game, but it's also not a good game either. If you're a big Harry Potter fan or you're not too difficult about video games, you'll most likely enjoy it. If you are not one or the other or both, I suggest you wait for a discount.I would have preferred to give a neutral rating, but unfortunately this is not possible.MEH/10

author: *^SaoSin^*
review: How is Hogwards Legacy story so far? The game is fun as hell. Sooner or later though you will always end up being "goody two shoes". You cannot be evil in this game. You cannot make significant choices changing game world, or even simple quest outcomes. I don't know about throwing avada kedavra into cats, but yeah all side quest are about making friends in school, and completing ancient trials. That sort of murky friendship swamp is not stopping. You may easily imagine trip to Disney Land and that would be this game in a nutshell.Where are interesting characters?Where are moral choices?Or even if it's one way ticket make it memorable not miserable listening to the NPC's.

review: Good, I love it !And I also have Merlin's Cloak.I has been playing for 4 days, started playing on February 8, 2023, has been playing for a full 4 days, has been playing this game at a fast pace, didn't have a good rest, the body is a little unable to hold on, not so desperate to play, plan to play slowly. author: The Real Peanut
review: The Story is extremely shallow. You are dropped in the game and you are immediately a super hero. I should also add you have absolutely no back story. At least when Rowling introduces us to the boy who lived it starts from the beginning and develops Harry prior to Hogwarts. Not only are you the immediate super hero, you start off as a 5th year student. Likely to do with the larger demographic of HP fans are in their 30s now and the studios thought it might not be appealing to play as an 11 year old but you still could come up with something... Such as starting off the game as a first year at 11, and that be the tutorial and as the tutorial is going along you're quickly going through the years where you learn who it is that you are playing as and at the end of the tutorial is when you are beginning your 5th year. Instead they decided to just throw you in as an underdeveloped character beginning his first year as a 5th year as this already amazing wizard that the player did nothing to achieve that in game. Admittedly my suggestion is shallow at best too but it is still far more developing than what we got. Then to make it worse, when you're going through your classes you're constantly showered with "Wow thats amazing, it took me years to figure that out". Alas, the immediate super hero. Your character is also aware of who the main antagonist is and who his right hand man is, yet you, the actual player, has no idea. I mean who Ranrok is as a character. You personally have nothing to go off of. Lets talk about risk vs reward. There isn't any. Early on during a quest you get a notification saying that you cannot wander the castle at night without risk of getting in trouble. Yet I do it every single night and literally no one stops you. There are several times where I have broken the rules and there is 0 tangible punishment. You help steal ingredients from the Potions Profs office. Then you get caught but thank god you made such a good potion and the professor just says "Well I like people who take responsibility for their actions. You made a great potion today. That was no easy task". Going back to showering the player with "wow youre amazing". Also I should add that you don't actually do anything to make the potion. It is all done in what is essentially a cutscene. Another example of there being no punishment, when you learn how to fly you have the option to veer off course with a classmate and take the scenic route thus breaking the rules. You get caught, the prof says both of us will be penalized by taking a hefty amount of points away from your house and that should deter you from doing it again. THERE IS NO HOUSE CUP!! Therefore there was no punishment. Therefore no reason for me to taper my behavior. Also why the hell is there no house cup??? Wasn't this game supposed to give you a feel for being a hogwarts student? AND ALSO why the hell is there no Quidditch?! You get sorted very early on and the headmaster, who is kind of a villian but you never interact with, says "Due to an injury on the quidditch pitch there will be no quidditch season this year". What injury?? The school year just started.. The students just arrived so how could there have been an injury. Why is there no quidditch?? Flying is in the game.. So is the Quidditch pitch. Outside the quidditch pitch, there are students in their quidditch house robes volleying bludgers around. You also find the snitch flying around in the room of requirement. Quidditch isnt even a complicated game. The assets are there. Put it in the game. Mark my words, Quidditch already exists within the game at launch and they will soon release Quidditch DLC and that DLC will just allow you to play it rather than adding it to the game. Similar to what EA did with Mass Effect did years ago.  Also in the main menu screen, the snitch sometimes flies around your head basically mocking you.Side objectives are mediocre at best. Its just mostly go collect this stuff or go kill these goblins and bring me my loot back. On the topic of quests in general, the game just points you exactly where to go which is odd in a game that is supposed to be immersive and open world. Rather it just holds your hand. There is one side mission that has you look for these objects that are usually high above you and even if it is not your specified objective if you enter a room and one is in there your character will tell you to look up in a very indirect but direct way.Then there is gearing.. Why in an HP universe game is there gearing?? Even then It also lacks depth. It honestly feels like an exploration device cause they could not come up with anything clever to entice you to explore more.The only real cool thing about the game is adventuring the school. However as a whole due to the fact of extremely shallow story narrative and very forced plot devices and no house cup and quidditch, I would strongly strongly advise that you do not purchase this game until they come out add features to it to make the game worth playing or it is on a massive sale

author: Zylo
review: Get ready cause this is a long one, might even want to grab yourself a cup of coffeeAs a fan of the Harry Potter series, I was excited to play Hogwarts Legacy, and I have to say, I wasn't disappointed. The game offers a vast, detailed, and impressive recreation of Hogwarts and its neighboring regions, which is packed to the brim with locations to discover, collectibles, and activities to clear. For a Potterhead like me, it was a dream come true.The combat system in the game is varied and satisfying. As I learned new spells, new combat opportunities opened up, which kept the game fresh and engaging in the long run. The customization possibilities are also excellent, featuring a myriad of cosmetics and skins, and my own customizable 'base' to furnish by hand at leisure.The progression system in Hogwarts Legacy portrays my growth as a wizard quite well, giving me new tools and utilities to access previously-locked content and areas. I also liked the solid roster of side characters; most of them are likable/unique enough, and their writing isn't complete garbage.However, the game is not without its issues. One major issue is the excessively repetitive open-world activities that create bloat and annoyance for those who want to complete all side activities. Additionally, combat balance issues with potions, 'healing spam,' and unforgivable curses make most fights quite too easy, especially when upgraded.Another problem is that most named foes and quest bosses are just normal enemies on steroids, with no variation in mechanics and no unique behaviors. I also noticed some inconsistencies with lore and character behavior. For example, if I used unforgivable curses in public or during quests (with witnesses), nobody seemed to give a damn.Moreover, I experienced significant frame-drops inside Hogwarts when transitioning between different sections and in specific places throughout the castle, regardless of settings. In some cases, fall damage doesn't even register on enemies.Overall, it took me 42 hours to complete Hogwarts Legacy, taking considerable extra time to clear all optional content and find around 90% of collectibles/secrets on Hard difficulty. However, I don't see a reason to replay the game once finished, except for achievement hunting, as the content is linear.Despite its flaws, I think Hogwarts Legacy is worth buying, especially if you're a fan of the saga. The amount of content and quality are more than fair for the proposed $60 price, expected from an AAA release.In conclusion, Hogwarts Legacy is by far the best game ever made based on this franchise, but it's not a masterpiece by any means. Fans of the series will almost certainly like it, but it's still drawn back by its issues.

author: Agent York
review: I can't believe I am giving this a negative review...I did enjoy my time with this game, hence the 32 hours, but I can't just blindly add to the wall of blue. .After playing this game nonstop for the early access and the BLINDING nostalgia and love for the franchise, I don't think the game is as great as everyone says it is., let alone Crucio as well as Imperio. All I got was a single off-handed negative comment and THAT WAS IT. I kid you not. It was a similar story with my fellow students, but I can forgive that just a little bit more.. Sure, you DO get to learn the unforgivable curses, (and that was my favorite side-story..you can even deny to learn them if you really want) but does it change much in the overall story? No, not at all. You can't be the precursor to Tom Riddle (lol) In fact, they seemed to have no effect on the final boss mechanically, though that was probably intentional. Without spoiling much, the final boss was far from normal.I enjoyed the 'main' student relationship-sidequests (and no, there are no romance options. I am not complaining, just letting you know). My personal favorite questline was the one with Poppy Sweeting from Hufflepuff.OH, and Quidditch is cancelled this year by the Headmaster! Haha...I couldn't believe it! Hopefully it gets added VERY soon.Anyway, yeah I would still rate this game a 6/10 due to the sheer fact that after the nostalgia, I feel the promise rings rather hollow. No quidditch. Perhaps some updates/dlc will help, though I have my doubts, even if it will be fun at first. Fun at first, but you quickly discover you are no factor in changing the story for good or bad.

author: Vegeta Sama
review: As a Harry Potter fan, I love the game. So very much. It’s truly a dream come true and things like customising my wand even though it really serves no purpose made me insanely happy. Things like the Common rooms and castle not being as interactive don't even bother me, because throughout Hogwarts, I just wanna be on the move and explore. Yes, I do wish we could sit in those gorgeous Common room couches or take a quick nap in our dorm’s bed to alternatively manual save/time skip, but either way, as a seasoned gamer and Potterhead alike, this game, flaws and all, is freaking incredible!

author: SUOMENLINNA
review: really good so far. easily the best content in the IP since the original books. solid game play, excellent visuals, and a good narrative. Hogwarts itself is a real work of art. I cant think of another game that has made this in-depth of an interior structure. I came in expecting set pieces, all the locations from the movies, connected by intricate but linear hallways, and un-open-able doors; but the castle is entirely believable as a school, and only the room of requirement is instanced. common rooms, classrooms, bathrooms, suites for teachers and visitors...etc...etc...etc...for HP fans: its not even a question, you already own it. for anyone into RPGs and fantasy as a genre: its a really good choice. for #allies: come on....the devs worked really hard, there isn't anything in the text that's anti-trans, and Rowling made her bag before it even opened for pre-ordersas to the bad that I've noticed:Some stalling issues, endless loading screens on some fast travel that forced me to end process, and a pair of hard crashes thus far; but this is all to be expected for an open world game in week 1. I have faith it'll get patched. The IP has more money than god.some (more than less) of the dialogue is stilted somewhat. The VA is only 'passable'. But it's not a deal breaker, as i can rationalize it as "its the 1800s bro, that's just how people talked". Just be aware that the folks saying "best writing of the year" are probably overcompensating to fight the review bombs. some visual nit picks: while robes are nice and billowy, skirts on fem outfits are highly static. long skirts are accurate to the period, but there is more reason than thirst trapping for short skirts in gaming; its easier to get away with skipping clothing physics if the fabric is above the knee. and trousers all look like 'trousers'. essentially the clothing could be more aesthetically pleasing. but this is all stuff that can be modded. also sad there is no romance sub plot. had I looked that up BEFORE buying, I may have held off for a sale. favorite part of HP was his tumultuous dating life. I realize that the Devs are probably correctly concerned that the twitter mob will start calling them pedo's if they have anything more than platonic friendship for the 16 year olds in the game; but it's a boarding school story, come on. When I was 16 who was dating who was half my personal drama. I'm not here asking for CDPR style sex scenes, but the story is worse for not having a cute boy/girl we can spend the whole school year pining over and culminating in *gasp* holding hands at the end.

author: MysticalCyan
review: As a Disclaimer, I received this game for Free, and Completed it 100% Entirely earning the Collectors Edition Achievement and beaten it on Hard, without using Potions or Plants, connecting my game to Pottermore, as well as having the current DLC. I wanted to experience all this game has, and give it a fair review. I also live streamed the entire game and it is on my channel at .Story is Phenomenal, Music is Fantastic, Combat is Good/Okay some enemies feel clunky but combos are phenomenal to pull off, UI is a mess and swapping spells is pretty meh, taking care of beasts is charming and fun, creating potions and crafting is incredibly lackuster. inventory space is lacking, environment looks great! At first. Once you seen it already, you have already seen what it has to give, also feels like the game didn't go far enough in Hogwarts, also there are some bugs which are not THAT bad thankfully. I rate the game a 8/10 and hope they release expansions or dlcs, to improve upon what is here! I really hope this isn't a release and drop game.More detailed explanations below. The story is fantastic, and the characters are all incredibly fun to get along with. Some of the twists and turns you encounter is very fun to see, and many of the quests have tragedy spoken about it all over the place. It's a bit dark in this time of Hogwarts but the experience is quite Epic and I find the story telling and characters to be one of if not the most phenomenal thing in this game. The Music is incredible and really gives off this magical experience when playing the game. They honestly nailed it really well, every track fits well with the situations, although there are moments where the music is either a bit too loud or just disappears during some encounters. Despite that, the Music is one of the major highlights of the game as well as the sound of spells and explosions. Very boomy, very nice.Textures and Facial Expressions on medium were okayish, weren't the best looking but also weren't the worst! The effects for magic however was amazing and they did a really good job on teleporting and spell colors and the vibrancy of some environments really popped and it was a wonderful thing to experience as it felt just like the movies.Spell combinations were a huge highlight in this game, it was a very nice experience to use the utilities of each spell off of eachother in order to win in combat. I absolutely adored the spells HOWEVER. Enemies are quite . Some of the enemies will teleport to hit you, some of them will all attack you at once, and you have to Shield / Dodge multiple times because if you dodge/block one spell, you won't dodge the second either. It is quite unfortunate, and a bit frustrating to experience that as getting hit on hard difficulty despite traits/defensive stat basically meant 80% of your HP was gone no matter what. Spells were great, enemies were meh. A very weak part of this game unfortunately, the fact that you have to rotate 4 spells at a time was kind of frustrating, it made swapping to different combos kinda of finiky. Same with trying to utilize consumables, you had to select out of your pool of them in order to just utilize one at a time, its why I didn't rely on potions or plants during my playthrough. Revelio spam is also kind of annoying.Taking care of beasts is great! However, the lack of inventory space early on for both gear and beasts is kind of frustrating, same with the 4 species limit in vivariums, I really wish we could just have a huge field of beasties all mingling. Creating potions and crafting is legit non existent, you gather materials and then you just wait 15s - 2 minutes for a potion to be made, which you only make one at a time individually and cannot craft in bulk or gather in bulk. Its a time waster, I honestly wish there was a potion crafting minigame and you made potions in bulk as well as could sell excess materials for galleons. Crafting gear and gear in general is honestly kind of lame, once you have good traits you basically are just over powered, I used traits to boost all spells globally in damage and it just carried me as long as I didn't get hit as defensive stats don't matter. Exploration was also tedious and very very wide. There was a lot to do that didn't really contribute to anything aside from achievements. Another thing, is while you can explore everything and enter almost every room, once you have seen it already, you have seen all what it can provide. There is nothing really new and the world slowly becomes incredibly dull and empty aside from the seasonal changes from progressing in the quests. There are also no house points you can earn, and some things and activities you can't really do. This game on side stuff, really didn't go far enough in my honest opinion to make the roleplay experience of being in Hogwarts authentic. Honestly, I never really encountered many bugs, most of them were visual or just me getting stuck on a rock. However one major bug I encountered was entering a end game dungeon and beating it, and the NPCs spoke in the subtitles but were not there. Once I got that quest LITERALLY at the end of the game, the NPCs were there but because I beat the dungeon already, it just skipped to the end. It was very jarring and I honestly feel sad cause I missed an experience. I very much hope this game gets updated and more contented added in the future. While it did great on certain parts, it felt like it didn't go far enough on others, and felt shallow in multiples areas. The Main Story was great same were the characters, and the initial view was wonderful.I had a great time playing it mainly because of the story, music and views, with some frustrations related to combat, inventory, ui, and side activities either being subpar bland or jank. I recommend this game, and as above I give it a 8/10 and really hope it gets improved upon. The story, music, and setting in of itself really makes the game worth it in my opinion, and I will be paying my friend back in full for allowing me to experience it. I also raised $600+ dollars for the Trevor Foundation while playing it, the issues people are experience regarding the cultural thing. Just, all I will say is, Dislike the Artist, Love the Work. Magic is for Everyone, she who shall not be named cannot prevent it from being shared.

author: Nance
review: 10/10 YOU CAN PET CATS. No but seriously I can't walk past a single cat without petting it at least 2 times. I will just say that the hype was definitely worth it because I'm absolutely in love with this game.The story, the atmosphere, the whole aesthetics in general are great. Even though the game is singleplayer you never feel alone. The map is huge and it's beautifully done with so many details and places to explore. Just walking around the map is already so calming and cozy. There is many iconic places around Hogwarts and many things can be recognized if you read the books or watched the movies, just that it plays before those. But it's also an interesting world for non Harry Potter fans. However I wish they added a tiny bit more details like being able to sleep in your dorm, being able to eat or take a shower. Would feel more realistic to me. Also I feel like some voices don't fit the characters, for example Arthur Plummly and Everett Clopton.But otherwise I really can't complain, the game is amazing and I really hope they will add some DLC 's in the future.

author: AwesomeAssassin
review: I was quite skeptical at first, but this game exceeded my expectations and then some. Definitely recommend it. If you're a HP fan, this game will be a dream come true. If you're not a HP fan, you will probably still enjoy it. Map is quite massive and the combat is unique and enjoyable with tons of puzzles all around the world. Keyboard/mouse controls are well thought out and are imo much better than controller. The devs actually put the effort to make PC controls great. Tried both controller and kb/mouse, definitely prefer the kb/mouse, you can do everything much faster.Will update this review once I've played more and finished the story but after playing 26 hours, I'd 100% recommend this game. Go for it!

author: Mystrix
review: It's like I've been waiting for this game my whole life.my dream game come true :3   10/10 - Amazing! as of yet!9/10 - Adventurous! It doesn't feel repeatedly and that's really good!10/10 - Satisfying and Awesome!10/10 - Massive and full of Mysteries! 10/10 - Best I've ever seen in a long time! It is AMAZING, however I personally encounter some texture bugs now and then, idk if it's the game or my PC.5/10 - Very immersive! You can find plenty of npc's doing funny things and interact with each other. HOWEVER that's pretty much it, you can't interact with them that much and you get to break into their house and loot their stuff with them looking at you without any consequences.10/10 - Astonishing! 10/10 - Flying is the best thing ever! Love it! I love the feeling I get by flying on my Broom or Beasts. it really feels nice especially because the world is massive!10/10 - Get a lot of rewards by doing so much stuff! Tasks, Challenges, Loot and so on. I love it! 7/10 - I love how you can change the appearance of your gear <333 However a lot of the gear you get might look super silly and weird. But the amount of cosmetics you get for everything else is amazing!4/10 - Not so challenging, very easy to me personally. But I love how there's puzzles for both quests and in the open world!5/10 - They are amazing! however it doesn't feel like there isn't that many different kinds of enemies, like for example Werewolves, Cornish Pixies and so on. Although they might be in the game but I might haven't encounter them yet.9/10 - Sooo many beautiful and cute Animals and Beasts! They make the world feel more alive!8/10 - ↓↓Down Here↓↓I wish there was more different paths you got to chose, and consistences for your deeds. The game feels very straight forward when it comes to puzzles and quests. When out exploring the enemies I encounter are the Humans, Goblins, Spiders, Dugbogs, Corpses, Wolves and sometimes Trolls. for a big world it has a very limited amount of enemies. Hard mode still feels pretty easy, together with potions and all that you're pretty much unstoppable. Exploring in the forbidden forest doesn't feel that scary and dangerous due to how strong we are and the lack of different enemies. The game is Astonishing! The Graphics is AMAZING, it feels very immersive and nice to explore in the open world. The combat feels so nice and satisfying, makes me also feel powerful. Hogwarts is so big and full of mysteries. The Pet System is awesome!. The amount of customization choices we get to have is very good!. I love how much details there are in this game, A lot of content! The NPC's always surprises me with funny things. The Stats, Gear, Mounts, Wands and Talents/Spells is just AMAZING. Good job! The quests are really getting me hooked, and the friends you get in this game is amazing! You can really connect and feel different things about them.  Considering all the cons we also have to remember that this game is what it is and that's how they wanted to make it. We might want things that is similar to other games but at the end of the day this game is how it is for a reason. I love and appreciate the amount of work and effort the developers have put into this game!I got the Pre-ordered "Hogwarts Legacy: Digital Deluxe Edition" and LOVE the gameI've been grinding this game since I got to play it, and I yet have SO MUCH MORE to do in the game, not even close to finishing it!you might think that I am over exaggerating with my ratings but that's how I it is, honest with how I feel about the game. 8/10 Expecto Patronum on them haters all again :3

author: Mandalorian Crusader
review: I am playing with a 1080TI,  an i7-8700K CPU and 16 GB of RAM.I am playing on high settings and the Game runs well and stable at around 70 / 80 FPS.To the Game content itself:The Story feels fun, immersive and interesting so far. The voice acting felt good to me with the exception of 1 character that felt kinda weird to me. The way they talk also feels right for the period and setting of the Game, but take that with a grain of salt since my native language is German. The world itself was well made and I have often taken a break to just stare at the murals and paintings in Hogwarts.The combat is incredibly fun and is a lot better than I expected and decently challenging.The map is big and with all the challenges and things to discover it feels full and alive.So with the Game so far I can honestly say it was a good buy and recommend it to everyone interested in Harry Potter or action / adventure RPGs. I am now 35 hours in and I am not even halfway through with the game.

author: SexBub-Bomb
review: Writing this about 10 hours into the campaign.Aight first things first : The game is terribly UNOPTIMIZED (atleast that's what I've noticed on my system). The stutters are absolutely horrible at times sadly. The recommended settings by the game itself (Medium on 1440p) was struggling to maintain constant fps at times, especially in Hogsmead and during fights. DLSS didn't seem to make a highly noticable difference to performance either (but yes you get a few extra frames). And Raytracing even at the smallest level is out of the question in case of my 3060. As of right now I've settled for 1080p with a mix of medium and low settings.And for the gameplay part, the fact that we have a game like this set in Hogwarts after all these years makes me so happy (and I'm not some hardcore Potterhead). Its been really fun so far. I heard that combat was not that great prior to playing this but I've found it be pretty good actually. As for the spells, you have to attend classes, do assignments and side missions (not boring ones) in order to learn them which is kinda fun. I believe I've only scratched the surface when it comes to exploring the whole map and from what I've seen so far it's just so beautiful. Hogwarts looks so so good and extremely detailed. And you get to enter almost every single room with a door (I've been inside almost every room I've seen so far except for the ones that asked to me to level up). Recommending this because I hope (and trynna be positive) that the optimizations issues will get sorted out in the next few updates :) Also this is a review of the game and not any indication of how I feel about the statements made by the creator of the franchise. I hope people try to separate art and the artist and see the game for what it is. :)

author: Knuffybaer[GER]
review: Avada KedavraHogwarts Legacy is an action role-playing video game developed by Avalanche Software by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment.The action takes place at the time of the impending goblin uprisings of the 19th century in the Harry Potter universe. The story of the game is thus a prequel to the works of Joanne K. Rowling, who is not involved in the development of the game.At the start of the game, as is usual in role-playing games, the player creates their own character. This is a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry who receives a belated invitation to the school. The player then has the opportunity to choose which house they want to belong to. The player soon discovers that he is no ordinary student, possessing an unusual ability to perceive and control so-called ancient magic, which is exceedingly rare and potentially dangerous. The player can choose how to use this ability as the game progresses. In addition, it will be possible to customize the character and develop his skills.The game takes place in an open game world in the Harry Potter universe. This will contain already known, but also new places. In addition to the Hogwarts wizarding school, the wizarding village of Hogsmeade, Diagon Alley and the Forbidden Forest are known as venues. The player will also be able to interact with creatures from the Harry Potter universe.+ best Harry Potter game+ magical and enormously detailed game world+ fun flights with broomsticks or beasts+ harmonious soundtrack+ a lot of fancy clothes and improvements+ countless side and collection tasks+ many accessibility settings- nice, but rather emotionless main story- pale main characterIf you like Harry Potter or want to become a fan in the future, you should definitely access it here.

author: Leyla
review: Wow! Just played 20+ hours and it has been an epic adventure so far! The attention to detail in the game world is incredible. The fact that I can WALK from Hogwarts to the edge of the map without a loading screen just puts into perspective how truly open world this game is.Want to make your way to the objective? Forget it - 1000 things to do on the way! The spellcasting mechanics are so much fun and the storyline is captivating (playing as House Ravenclaw). Can't wait to spend more time exploring Hogwarts and the wizarding world. A must-play for any Harry Potter or action RPG fan. Hats off and Kudos to the devs!

author: Vyrtualis
review: I've played nearly every Harry Potter game ever released, including handhelds. This game isn't just a damn good Harry Potter game - it's a damn good RPG. The world is immersive, expansive, and unique. Characters are memorable and believable. The story is exciting and engaging. Spells, potions, herbs, and more are all here, and feel exactly as they should. In every way, this game puts you under a spell of its own.I was skeptical about Avalanche and WB fulfilling their promise of the ultimate Harry Potter experience, from the moment the game was announced. I've never been more happy to be proven wrong. They knocked this one out of the park.

author: CapAnson
review: It's not a perfect game.  It's a bit of a resource hog. Loading times take just a LITTLE too long for my liking.  NPCs a little uncanny valley-ish. Water does weird things when you go swimming.  But games never get that right. You start as a 5th year and if I HAD my preference you'd start from the beginning as a small kid with the world being more innocent and fairy tale-ish and it would go through the entire time of Hogwarts with your character growing and the story gradually getting more serious and mature as the game goes on. Kinda like the books. I suppose that's a little too much to expect and such a game would be spectacularly large.  For the most part I think it delivers exactly what you'd want from it.  The graphics are generally awesome.  Lots of stuff to explore.  Lots of little attention to details that fill out the world. Puzzles and mysteries and spells, etc. Items and treasure. Combat seems to be handled well so it's not too cumbersome.  Plenty of cats to pet. That alone deserves a thumbs up.  As for the controversy. Well ironically the game is pretty darn woke and inclusive. Almost to the point of immersion breaking. Almost. But you either are all in on that or just roll your eyes and get on with it.   Otherwise nothing political really enters the game. It just seems to be a well made PG-ish World of JK Rowling simulation. Which I imagine is what people want.

author: KingKrouch
review: Above average for an open world game, has a pretty engaging combat system (to open world AAA action RPG standards), and outside of the stuttering issues (Which unlike what people have been claiming, are still an issue on Radeon graphics cards), mediocre raytracing implementation, and high VRAM utilization (Those two reasons are why I'm holding off on playing more), the PC port has absolutely zero things to nitpick about. Has plenty of scalability and upscaling settings, has PlayStation/Switch/Steam/SteamDeck button prompts support, native PS controller support, native ultrawide support, arbitrary framerate support, most of what you'd expect from a modern PC port in 2023. The port stuff is especially surprising, as outside of this, Fortnite, and HiFi Rush, most Unreal Engine games on PC may as well be low-effort Xbox debug builds that ship unpolished (I've boycotted making any game mods for Unreal Engine games, as they share the same problems, and are holding back PC gaming). Glad to say this is not the scenario here. Good work, even the console versions have a framerate cap separated from the quality settings, so they should be fantastic on future hardware like the PS5 Pro or PS6 (for example). Keyboard and Mouse input also has separate UI related tweaks from controller input as well (Being able to drag and drop spells onto slots, having the spells laid out in a horizontal manner, being able to scroll between spell pages with the scroll wheel).I do however wish the game had an option to not use a Over The Shoulder perspective, and the option of furthering the camera (The FOV slider is a band-aid for a shotgun wound).If you are wondering why my playtime is short, it's because I played on a relative's Steam account as Family Sharing was not enabled until the game left Early Access. I played about 10-20 hours on that account in offline mode. My save transferred over without problems.The big controversy from a vocal minority on Twitter/ResetEra/Reddit is a nothingburger. Not like anyone on those websites should have their opinions taken seriously. I thought an IP as big as Harry Potter was gonna be the thing to cause a gaming crash to happen (due to the massive wave of terrible/soulless/incomplete/buggy AAA game releases), but I was left pleasantly surprised by how high the bar got put. I hope Avalanche gets to work on more licensed games. If they patch the problems with the game after launch, then it's already better than the treatment FromSoftware gave Elden Ring on PC, despite fanboys astroturfing it as a perfect release. This and HiFi Rush are probably GOTY contenders.

author: Baker
review: It's not a ground breaking game or anything.  Petty much just you normal mission and side quest formula with some  simple puzzles and exploration things to do.The castle modelling and graphics quality and style is excellent and generally the game itself  stands well with the fan base.I think aimed at the 13 -16 year old aged group and if they are Potter fans they should absolutely love it to bits.The story  is keeping me interested and that is something a lot of games fail to do.Combat is simple but fun, in fact the whole game is simple but fun.There are some places where performance take a hit on my PC, Places in the Castle mostly.  It hasn't hurt my gameplay in anyway for me as its only small dips but it is noticeable even with my 3080. So far it has not happened at any time during combat. I think it might get fixed with a patch at some time but anyway for me its not game breaking having a small few seconds of lower then normal frame rates.probably should add my PC info and game settings for reference.I put global settings on high then raised textures and post processing to Ultra with RT offand DLSS at quality. I have i7 9700k with a RTX 3080 10G  and 32 GB RAMI enjoy the game and will give it a recommended thumbs up.

author: PimpSlapBlue
review: I recently had the pleasure of playing Hogwarts Legacy, and I have to say, it was an incredible game. The game's immersive world, deep lore, and engaging gameplay all combined to create an unforgettable experience.One of the game's standout features was its setting in the wizarding world of Harry Potter. The attention to detail in the environment was impressive, and I felt like I was really exploring the magical world I grew up reading about. From the Forbidden Forest to the Hogsmeade Village, every location felt like it was ripped straight from the pages of the books.The game's story was also well-written and engaging. As a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, I had to navigate the challenges of school life while also uncovering a dark mystery that threatened to engulf the wizarding world. The game's moral choices also added to the sense of player agency and made me feel like my decisions had real consequences. But I later found out that my decisions had no real consequences and that there is no honor system like in red dead redemption 2.The gameplay was also excellent. As a student at Hogwarts, I had to attend classes, learn spells, and engage in duels with other students. The game's RPG mechanics allowed me to customize my character's appearance, skills, and abilities, making me feel like I was truly crafting my own wizarding experience.Additionally, the game's sound design and music were outstanding. The soundtrack, featuring a mix of orchestral and magical themes, perfectly complemented the game's setting and added to the overall atmosphere of the game.Finally, I have to say that the game's attention to detail was impressive. From the intricate spell animations to the various magical creatures I encountered, it felt like every aspect of the game was carefully crafted and thought out.Overall, I would highly recommend Hogwarts Legacy to anyone who loves the wizarding world of Harry Potter. The game's setting, story, characters, gameplay, sound design, and attention to detail all combined to create a truly magical experience.

author: Doctor Slitheen
review: For someone that's never been interested in the Harry Potter world and has never consumed any media about Hogwarts, this game has been an absolute pleasure to play. Graphicly, it's just about what you'd expect from a AAA game in 2023. Even if you're not playing on the absolute highest settings on some next-gen system, the game still looks gorgeous for the most part. On top of that, the game takes place over the course of a whole year, which will take you through different seasons that change the look and feel of the world and it's really just a pleasure exploring the same places, but from a different perspective. Storywise, the main plot is pretty simple, stop the bad guy from becoming the most powerful wizard. That being said, it's still pretty satisfying and it takes you on quite a journey to achieve your goal. Besides the main plot, there are a few side plots that do a great job of keeping you engaged in them. In my opinion, these side quests are the real highlights of the whole story. Gameplay and exploration is where this game shines the most. The combat, contrary to how I expected it to be before the game came out, is really satisfying and engaging, with plenty of spell combos and multiple ways to approach it, whether you want to go head first or take it slow and stealthy, you can do so. Enemy variety is as it should be, it doesn't need any more or fewer enemy types. Exploration feels rewarding and there is A LOT to explore, collect and interact with. Where there are puzzles, they are simple enough as to not get too confusing, but also not so easy as to become boring. There are a lot of different mini-games world events scattered all over the map, which is quite large. From doing Merlin Trials, which are themselves very diverse and have a good amount of diversity to not get too repetitive,  to constellation spotting at night, broom flight challenges, rescuing beasts and caring for them, treasure hunting through all kinds of places or just freely flying around casting Revelo every 5 seconds, they are, in most cases, fun to do. Unfortunately, it does lack one very important and crucial activity, a fishing mini-game, but I guess nothing is perfect. The Worldbuilding and NPCs are pretty complex, with plenty of small towns to explore, and charming side characters, each with their own little story and dialogue, and lots of houses for you to rob from facing no consequences whatsoever. Every shopkeeper has their own life story that are eager to tell you about. Overall, while Hogwarts Legacy might not be the absolute best RPG out there, it is a really solid one. And for what little it lacks in some aspects, it makes up for tenfold in enjoyment and pure fun. There are very few issues with the game, and I can't really recall any major bugs. If you are a fan of the Harry Potter universe, this game will certainly meet all of your expectations and will satisfy your Hogwarts student dream. And even if you aren't a fan of the universe, I'm pretty positive you'll find a lot of enjoyment and entertainment from this game. If you are just a big fan or RPGs and you don't know what to play anymore, this will be a very good pick. And for any completionist, the achievements are simple, mostly straightforward, and will have no problem 100% it.

author: Oskej
review: We should start with the biggest issues I have, finishing at some minor inconveniences.The world of Harry Potter and Hogwarts Legacy has the benefit of the real world essentially creating endless possibilities to warp it and change at will fitting the fantasy world of wizards and witches endlessly trying not to bring muggles into their business. This alone should be enough to make one hell of a universe… universe that Hogwarts Legacy barely expands on, that Harry Potter movies altered to bare minimum, enough to make couple of movies out of it. The thing is, videogame is not a movie, and it requires quite a lot more work to create believable, enjoyable and well put together world that does not need explanation outside of environmental storytelling on its own.Second most visible and painful problem is the checklist well known from Ubisoft productions like Assassins Creed, so called fillers that they’re giving players to sink hours into completion that has nothing of value, but cosmetics, upgrades, craftables. Hogwarts Legacy has quite a lot of them, and I can only assume that they were made purely to fit the popular world designs of triple A games that we were fed for past couple of years. Once you try any of those collectables once, all of them work pretty much the same, and there’s way more than enough of them to give you a headache, especially if you’re a completionist.What also stands out is that every cave has exactly the same design, every bandit camp is the same thing, and there is simply not enough unique locations to do something better with it.I should put it in the first place, but considering that game with mute protagonist and NPCs that you can talk not even once to in order to complete the game, it lands on third place, just because it exists in this game and it is beyond annoying.Most of the characters are boring, and their dialogue is something you would see more in a parody of Harry Potter more than actual and serious game.Side-quest dialogue is stiff, and feels like not enough budget was put into minor background characters, while everything was pumped into cutscenes including characters vital to the main story. Considering that I did not finish the game yet, and I’m probably not even halfway through it I can’t really have an opinion on main story, but so far every single side quests I completed was just a simple fetch, kill, gather quest that also feels like a filler, in addition to world design issues I stated earlier. I believe there are some quests that are interesting, but I am yet to complete them.Nearly non existing. This one is essentially dropped from Avalanches to do list. You can spin the globe, pet the cat, have some beasts, whatever. Interactions with what matters are not there. You can get one liners from some students in the castle. Every interaction that starts the quest is something you would expect current AI robots to do. It is not believable. Characters just stand waiting for you to approach them, do your thing, come back and then never interact with them again. For a videogame following this design you would expect to find characters asking for help midway through the thing they ask you to do, not just stand and wait for their savior. If you take into consideration games like Red Dead Redemption 2, Hogwarts Legacy is 10 steps back in terms of interactivity with the world. I will not mention the whole ‘choice matters’ thing, because there is no choice to nothing. The most important to me, certainly not to others.I will start by saying that designs in this game are wonderful. Ambience and aesthetics of the castles interior are on par with Elden Rings.The problem starts when you’re getting bored of the castle and you want to explore outside of it, because… there is not a lot to explore. If you take the checklist locations you’re really left with couple of places that shine the most. I think that while with real life locations, such as Hogwarts being in UK, worldbuilding gets the most opportunities to shine, while world design can get tricky to pull off, and you can clearly see that just flying around the map. Couple of extraordinary locations on a simple map with just mountains and plains is something that Horizon Zero Dawn was suffering from, and it is a shame.

I'm just playing another UBI game with Harry Potter skin

A few small game glitches so far but nothing game breaking or that breaks the immersion for more then a split second. So far 8.5/10, polished, well thought out, amazing game so far. author: TheBearJew173
review: Edit 3/24/2023:Finished the game. They haven't updated it to fix the issues listed below. Turning off ray-tracing helps with the crashing issue a little, but the game still crashes sporadically more so when fast traveling. Overall, I'd only recommend this if you like collectathons, this is worse than Assassin's Creed in that respect. They have you collect objects that literally mean nothing with zero attachment to them, and expect that to be the post-game experience. I enjoyed gaslighting my friends, stealing things from people to get reactions, and wearing a pumpkin for a majority of the game tho. Other than that, pretty boring.The no consequences for your actions seems like a half baked system that they didn't have time to finish, especially when considering the final fight of the game.________________________________________________________________________This is only a temporary review to say that performance has been noticeably worse since the last patch. My game has crash 5 times in 3-4 hours of play since the update. It is especially problematic when fast traveling frequently and walking around Hogesmead. Another issue is that lighting has been pretty bad since the most recent patch where they updated ray tracing. Indoor environments are lit like the light source was a bright as the sun and in the room. In the over-world lighting is pretty inconsistent as well, where things vary from really bright to normal. Textures and pop-in have also been worse since the that patch.The game has had issues from the start but they have mostly out the stuttering. Hopefully these other issues can get ironed out fairly quickly. Overall, the game is solid albeit with rushed design at times where things don't make sense as to why they are in the game. As someone with no experience with the books nor movies, the game could do better in explaining past events in the world that they allude to in the field manuals.This will get updated once I finish the game.

author: Virtualmass
review: I can't recommend Hogwarts Legacy at the current price of £50.This game is feels really rushed. The first half is incredible, the prologue was a completely unexpected cinematic gem, Hogwarts itself is a joy to explore, the initial lessons offer nice flavour about the spells you're about to learn, the characters are unique (albeit a bit cliche) and you're really feeling that 'I'm a student at hogwarts' vibe. Then you get your broom and the game becomes a generic open world RPG as if Harry Potter himself has joined the Assassin Brotherhood. Everything that makes the first half so interesting is gone, lessons are uninspired cutscenes and you then you learn an unrelated spell after, the world is littered with repetitive tasks/collectibles, characters become the same blend of 'good-natured but incompetent' and quests become 'go to dungeon, kill baddie, retrieve thing'. The final half of the story lets down the great introduction by offering no meaningful choices and an unemotional, obvious finale. Itemisation is shockingly poor. I picked up a 'legendary' item within my first hour of play which was discarded by a basic item in the next hour. There's no interesting item attributes to focus or balance just offence and defence when you could have had spell cooldown, damage, critical, debuff, stealth detection etc... The talent system also felt pretty shallow with most of the spell talents just adding an AoE component. The inability to unlock every talent and/or respec is just criminal. Personally I felt the potions should have been harder to obtain but with longer durations/more powerful effects. It just became an chore to brew them and apply them constantly. It would have been much cooler to hunt down a rare creature for a material, to brew into a potion that gave me a 5 minute buff or even something permanent. Witcher 3 is really best in show for this. That being said, I found the combat plants a fun thematic inclusion.Combat was generally quite fun and a challenge at times. The air-time mechanic was probably my favourite aspect of the combat. It did however feel like there were really only two classes of enemies - those that could be crowd controlled and those that couldn't. The controls for combat were not great and found myself messing up whilst trying to switch up spell slots on the fly.Credit where is credit is due, the world is beautiful. Hogwarts obviously is the masterpiece but there are really fantastic sets throughout the world. Overall this game has great potential and I hope the success it has achieved will inspire fundamental changes in DLC or a much deeper sequel.

author: RPG Gamer Man
review: NOTE: This review was done on Version Build 1121649.Hello friends! Welcome to my review of Hogwarts Legacy.Alot of real life people arguing about this game and causing a big mess. In my opinion, if you want to just play the game and ignore the real life jank, then do it. You do not need to follow what everyone else says, do your own thing. Now that i got out of the way, let me talk about this game. The game revolves around the world of Harry Potter and the Wizarding World. Harry Potter is not in this game, but it is in the same place he attended wizard school in the movies. The game takes place in the past around the 1800's, the turn of the century. Alot of things in harry potter movies are somewhat different in this game. Also, you can explore various locations around the wizarding world, including scotland and hogsmeade. Many of the spells from the movies are also in the game, and you can learn them throught the year. The game itself is pretty open ended and you can even explore and put the main quests on hold until later. Be aware that some places will not be accessible until you learn certain spells. This will block where and how far you can explore. The season also changes the further you go into the story.The game is also open world, like a ubisoft title game. There are also collectibles hidden around the world you can find. These will take some time to find if you plan on trying to find them. The game is not perfect. It does have some bugs in it, and the developers are currently fixing it still at this point. This means it could improve from what it is right now. Anyways, the following is my PRO/CON list:PROS:- A open world game in the wizard world of harry potter. If your a fan of the movies, you may want to play this game.- Collectibles around a open world.- Side quests.- Ability to learn new spells thought the year.- The first game in more than 10 years where it is linked to the wizarding world.- Easter eggs in the game that link them to the harry potter movies, including a quiz by a npc.CONS:- There are some bugs that can mess with collecting items in the game. It can cause errors on the map in the game. I experirenced a issue where it showed a field page i collected, but never disappeared off the map.- Repetition of the game is a big problem. If you do not want to do it, take a break and then come back to play it some other time.- The open world seems too open at some points and wish to have more things to do in it.- Many places you explore look similiar, especially the treasure vaults.- Some people are complaining about stutters or other issues, but i hardly had any and im on a 3060 graphics card. Make sure to set benchmark in the game to get graphic settings correctly.Do i recommend the game? Yes, because the last harry potter game i played was lego harry potter series on ps2, and really missed the games. In the end, it is whether you have fun with the game if your a fan of the movies or not.

author: Tsuyu Aihara
review: Se você curte o universo criado pela J.K Rowling, esse é o jogo! Eu adorei o jogo.Vale 250 conto? Se você gosta de Harry Potter, sim. Ele é quase tudo que um fã queria.Porém, se nunca se importou em ler os livros, ou ver os filmes, eu recomendo esperar promo.Em questão de gameplay, é divertido, e os puzzles são bem legais.A main quest é decente, não é ruim, é bem legalzinha, mas não tem nada de grandioso também, é bem simples, já falo isso, porque hoje em dia você tem aquele povo que quer que todo jogo seja um Silent Hill 2 ou Elden Ring com 200 de QI em roteiro, povo chato pra caramba.As side-quests do seus colegas segue no mesmo pique.Enfim, eu dou um 8 para o jogo, da pra se divertir muito.

author: mr_gamezombie
review: I'm not a big fan of the Harry Potter novels or films, however, the game is fantastic. You can tell there has been a lot of care put into the world and game design. The gameplay is interesting with fun puzzles to take up your time plus a refreshing take on wand/magic combat. I highly recommend the game.

author: Rhyfelwr
review: I am not a fan of Harry Potter at all, I saw the movies ages ago but that’s it.However…The game is simply amazing! One of the best AAA games in the past decade. It’s just so much fun!What I like:- Excellent snappy combat- Gorgeous graphics, truly next gen. (for a price)- Interesting quests (there are fetch quests but they are short and sweet)- Main Story so far is entertaining, much like a HP spinoff movie.- Loads of content (10 hours in, barely scratched the surface)- Great characters and voice acting.- Exploration is unparallelled, you never know what you find in the next nook, pretty much all doors are open, the castle is GIGANTIC, and that is only part of the map.- An amazing collect-a-thon! I loathe collectibles (looking at you Assassins Creed) but Hogwarts somehow makes it fun and rewarding.What I don’t like:- Awful PC performance, especially if you want to use Ray-Tracing (my RTX 4070ti struggles on ultra)- Controls are clunky at times. Not the worst console port in that regard though.- Some QoL issues and gripes.- Underutilised house quarters, perhaps there could be a tiny bit more interaction with the world (eat, sleep, wait, maybe minigames)- Underwhelming gear and loot, feels pretty much as Cyberpunk 2077, you just swap out gear for the highest number one and toss the rest. (huge missed opportunity there)Overall the game is a 9/10 for me, truly next-gen and a labour of love. Also for a huge open world RPG it is relatively bug-free too. Performance is bad, but there is DLSS and graphics can be toned down. I am willing to look past that though, because the game does live up to the hype!

author: Ekşili Pilav

Nevertheless, for die-hard Harry Potter fans, it's still worth checking out.
