author: IJspegel
review: tl;dr:7/10 - must buy if you're a fan of the Wizzarding world, wait for a sale if you're not. The wizzarding world was the constant franchise of early 2000's. For people like me who went to middle school around the time the books and movies were released, it was a pop culture phenomenon. It was everywhere, you read the books, saw the movies, played those early EA video game adaptations back when they were good. And after the 8th movie came out you were around the same age as the characters, you were done with school and heading out into the real world. This franchise means a lot to the 'millennial' generation and I'd say Avalanche has done a great job capturing what made the franchise so special all those years ago, while still taking into account that the target audience isn't twelve anymore.Fans of the franchise will love this game. Hogwarts has everything you'll recognize from the movies, and even stuff from the books that never made it to the silver screen. The smallest things, like the potion ingredient store closet or the jail cell on the roof they kept Sirius Black in for all of 2 seconds in the third movie. The House Elf kitchens and the ghost ballroom from the books, they're all there for you to discover. It's a nostalgia trip and that alone is worth the price of admission, IF you are a fan.Avalanche has done everything it can to make this game appeal to all, unfortunately they listened to the twitter side of the internet for what would appeal to them. The response this game has gotten online is nothing short of hilarious, the very people this game is made for are trying all that they can to stop people from playing it. Their whims are being catered to at every turn. From the for 1790's Scotland laughably diverse student body and faculty, merchants and townsfolk, to the sexuality of every side character seemingly being non-straight. You'd think they'd eat this game up, but no. I hope that sends a message to the industry that you can not please these people. For people less familiar with the source material, or those who never really cared that much, this game must seem a bit mid. When you get out of Hogwarts you are greeted with a massive overworld that is completely littered with useless stuff. Mostly consisting of what are called Merlin trials, which require you to do a tedious little puzzle to trigger an animation. This gets you inventory upgrades, so you'll have to do at least a few, but there a dozens of these menial things everywhere. As well as the caves, which are all copy pasted from the same handful of templates and get you nothing other than a piece of gear which is always worse than what you already have. You can completely ignore these but they will always clutter up your compass, map and minimap.Combat is simple and can be trivialized with potions and plants, I finished the whole thing challenge dungeons and all on normal difficulty but it never actually got difficult. Maybe that changes on higher difficulties, but the combat isn't what makes this game worth playing anyway.This game shines in it's presentation, like I said, if you are a fan of the wizzarding world you will love this game. But it doesn't quite capture the (pardon the phrasing) magic of going to a magic school and having your own adventure. I think most of that is to do with the lack of interaction with your classmates. You do your main adventure mostly on your own being aided only by a professor. Your classmates are relegated to side quests, which I think is a shame. Because what connected the audience to the story of the books and movies was building this bond with new friends and together becoming stronger than any adversary. Here you are the chosen one who could've done it all by themselves.Portkey games has this phone game 'Hogwarts Mystery' that does that way better. I hope they decide to port that to PC in some from or another now that this is such a rousing success.  Who you are in this game is vague, your origins are not revealed. Who are you? Why are you only joining Hogwarts as a fifth year? Where do you come from? It seems there's a prelude missing and kind of an important one. The choices you make along the way also don't matter to the story one bit.  Avalanche clearly want you to spend the bulk of your time in Hogwarts. You get a whole room all to yourself for you to interact with animals, build the perfect pen for them. Create your own space decorated to your liking, you can sink hours into just that if you wanted to. Technically it runs well enough. It runs on the Unreal 4 engine, so there's still pop-in everywhere when you're outside zipping through the map on a broom. It also does a small frame drop every time you charge into a different area of the overworld map. Inside Hogwarts that all goes away. It does have to load a second or two at doors at times still though. So you can see the seams in this seamlessly connected world, but they didn't really bother me.Enemy AI is single minded and dumb, when you blast someone of a platform or just remove them far enough from their path, they have to run all the way back to where they started. They won't attack you during their little hike until they get there. None of them will ever dodge out of the way.The amount of content here is nothing to sneeze at, and considering the success of this game I'd be surprised if Warner Bros. didn't come out with some cut content as DLC. There's a screenshot of a dragon on this very storepage that is just not in this game. The made character models fro dementors that are only used in one cutscene for one Hufflepuff specific quest in Azkaban. We only hear about stuff happening in the ministry. Definitely room for expansion.For fans of franchise this is an absolute must-buy. For everyone else, you should probably wait for a sale. It's a fun romp, but like I said, without the nostalgia trip it loses a lot of it's appeal.

review: Not great. I dont care about the politics of the game, but the gameplay is weak. Combat is cumbersome and the story drags...  Gear is tedious to manage and awful looking and just gets replaced a few minutes later. Couldve been a great RPG, but its not. If your HP obsessive its likely heaven, but not for your average gamer.  Get it on sale and its good buy, but not at full price.70 GB of updates after initial install. What a joke of a game.- Update after some more play, its still "Meh" But some of it can be fun. Id get it on sale if you like RPGs- Update again, its pretty good. most frustrating are some of the collectible and puzzled in "dungeons" Can be very tedious. World is HUGE and pretty fun to mess around with. I still give it a "Meh" rating, but overall 6/10 in general. 8/10 to just play around with to kill time.

author: Snow🧸
review: It’s a beautiful world but it feels empty because none of the characters ever react to anything you do. Outside of quests, NPCs are about as interactive as a table or a chair, you can shoot spells or curses at them but they don’t move or say anything.It’s not much of an RPG, it’s an open world action adventure game with some side quests and almost no customization to speak of. Cyberpunk 2077 removed the RPG label from marketing before release, but somehow, that game still managed to incorporate more RPG elements than Hogwarts Legacy.Performance on PC is also very bad, frame drops are prevalent in both Hogwarts and Hogsmeade, and the day 1 patch fixed none of them. I have a 3090 and 64GB of ram but my frame rate with RTX disabled hits the low 20s, enabling RTX makes the game unplayable.

The first time it crashed I didn't lose my game but the second or third time it crashed I lost my game and I was angry because I thought it was going to be impossible to recover but after reading a Reddit page that had happened the same thing I ended up being able to recover it, I don't know how. Finally, I wanted to say that Hogwarts is a labyrinth to say the least and also there are some combats that are a bit boring. As I said before it is a very good game but if you have a not very good PC I recommend that you play it on console.

author: Teavee
review: The game is cool, but as always the optimization on release wants better. On a multi-core processor the game loads only one core to 100%, the other cores are loaded only 20%. Videocard loaded at 70% ( 1660TI 6GB ). RAM game eats very much, so if you have even 16 gigabytes of RAM, be prepared to play with lags. The prologue works well, but after the prologue, you can forget about optimizing the game. I hope that in spite of these problems, Hogwarts will get an update as soon as possible, which will solve the optimization and performance problems.

author: Viz
review: As sceptical as I was for the single player nature of the game I decided to give it a chance and boy does this game do the world of Hogwarts some justice. Hogwarts is absolutely beautiful. The game is enthralling from the on set and immediately pulls you in. Immersion and the scale and beauty of this game is just second to none. The story thus far remains very interesting and there is definitely a sense of character progression both in power and character development.I am truly loving the scale and size of the game and the amount of content is insane, there is quite a lot to do and a lot of collections and that just keeps you set to explore more and more. Hogwarts castle is just insanely huge and intricate with so many secrets to explore and epic encounters to watch inside and outside of Hogwarts where the world does fully feel magically alive.The games foundation is well set and can only get bigger and better. I do hope they add multi player features and eventually add Quidditch to the game. I am very impressed as someone who wasnt going to get the game immediately and do recommend the game to anyone who has grown up watching harry potter. Its our own little slice of the harry potter world and  we get to fully dive in and explore the very best of it.

author: LoL feLi
review: "Hogwarts Legacy is a role-playing video game set in the wizarding world created by J.K. Rowling in the Harry Potter universe. Players take on the role of a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, attending classes, participating in magical duels, and exploring the castle and its surroundings. The game was released in 2021 and has received mixed reviews from players and critics.One of the standout features of Hogwarts Legacy is its beautifully crafted world. The game's graphics are stunning, and the attention to detail in creating Hogwarts and its surroundings is impressive. The environments are rich and immersive, and the game does an excellent job of bringing the wizarding world to life. Players will feel like they have stepped into a magical world as they explore the castle, attend classes, and interact with other characters.Another highlight of Hogwarts Legacy is the character customization. Players can create their own student and choose from a variety of races, including humans, elves, and half-giants. The customization options are extensive, and players can choose from a wide range of hair styles, clothing, and accessories to create a unique character. This is a great feature, as it allows players to personalize their experience and make their character feel like their own.The gameplay in Hogwarts Legacy is a mix of action and RPG elements. Players will attend classes and participate in magical duels, using spells and potions to defeat their opponents. The combat system is intuitive and fun, and players will find themselves becoming more confident in their abilities as they progress through the game. Additionally, players can explore the castle and its surroundings, solving puzzles, and discovering hidden secrets.One of the criticisms of Hogwarts Legacy is its lack of replay value. Once players have completed the main storyline, there isn't much to do in terms of side quests or additional content. This is a disappointment, as players may feel like they have exhausted the game's content once they have completed the story.Another issue with Hogwarts Legacy is its writing. The game's story is somewhat underwhelming, and the characters are not particularly well-developed. While the game does an excellent job of creating an immersive world, the writing is somewhat lackluster and fails to engage players on an emotional level. This is a shame, as a more compelling story could have elevated the game to new heights.In conclusion, Hogwarts Legacy is a well-crafted game that offers players a chance to step into the wizarding world. The graphics and world-building are impressive, and the character customization is a great feature. However, the lack of replay value and underwhelming writing are significant drawbacks that may turn some players off. If you're a fan of the Harry Potter universe, Hogwarts Legacy is worth checking out. But if you're looking for a more robust RPG experience, you may want to look elsewhere."- ChatGPT

author: Darkvice
review: Here is my brutally honest review. Is this game a Masterpiece? No. But it was so close to being one. Graphics are 10/10 - However, I have had to tweak with settings running a 3080ti. Getting stutters every once n awhile. Runs just as good in ultra as it does on medium settings. Not game breaking but needs a slight performance patch. (keep in mind 2000 series users, I have reports of players having trouble with the 2070-2080 cards)Sound is 10/10 - However, I have had issues with character dialog where the volume level of people speaking rises and falls in different conversations. Leaving me adjusting my volume level. Also the sound has issues with direction. Depending which way your character turns/faces you can't hear people talking anymore. Personally this greatly annoys me.Gameplay Combat 9/10 - Could have been better but its good enough to keep your interest throughout the game. Gameplay - 6/10 - This is where the game starts to take some hits. Between tedious potion brewing, Gathering resources, Character development, Gear (No shortcut having to re-equip cosmetics and gear constantly), Gear Progression, Menu Navigation, Choices don't actually matter, No Good/Evil system. Its all super annoying and time consuming.Controls - 10/10 - Now keep in mind I'm using PS5 controller only. And it plays and feels flawless. (Except when trying to mount your broom. Keep in mind that they need to fix the L1 and O key combination times. They way they have it setup you have to wait 2 seconds before pressing O otherwise you'll just dodge)Should you Pre-Order? - Honestly the Dark Arts Cosmetics are probably the best looking gear I've found in the game so far so its worth the extra $10 in my opinion. Especially if you want to try and get as close as possible to a dark wizard. All the other gear looks like ♥♥♥♥. Don't get me wrong this is a great game well worth the triple A price. I myself plan to 100% the game and spend over 100 hours on it. If you like Harry Potter even a little bit I'd say its well worth your money. The story and feel of the game is great.Its just a real shame it fell short of being a true masterpiece.

review: Beautiful game, stunning graphics and throws you right into the Harry Potter world of Witchs and Wizards.Worth the price, its not over taxing its buyers with the $10 + tax increase, so $60 is fair for this, but can easily wait for a sale and pick it up for 20-40% and get it for a steal.Hogwarts castle without spoilers, is as big as some games are, you can explore it for hours alone.Pros:- Graphics are amazing- Overwhelming things you can do- Wizarding world- Story is great- Brooms, magic and more- Customizing - Price- Optimized Cons:- Minor bugs- Some tiny texture issues- Some tiny lag momentsWorth every penny, specially when you consider how long you will invest into this game. A must for any Harry Potter fan. Get it.Now I just need to find Hermoines great great grandma. /wink

review: Even with all the stuff going on around the game, I still love to be able to relive my childhood playing it. Going from chamber of secrets on my parents PC to graphics that look almost like straight from the movies are amazing to experience.I haven't played the game too much yet so I can't say anything about bugs or other problems, but it runs smoothly on my not so high end PC and so far I've enjoyed it a lot!Also something I encountered to have trouble with was finding where my deluxe outfits went, since you can't see them straight from the gear settings. For anyone else playing on PC, equip any piece of clothing first from the gear menu, go and hover your mouse over the the specific item slot and press F to be able to see the deluxe outfit pieces! You can't see that option for hats and such if you're not wearing any, so just put on anything to get to the extra outfit screen c:I hope everyone who buys the game enjoys it and gets to live through the Hogwarts experience we all wanted to have as a kid!P.S. Destroy the vases

author: Phaota
review: Ignore all the haters.  This is a highly enjoyable game with beautifully crafted environments, unique characters and fun fighting situations.  It's like "Red Dead Redemption 2" of fantasy games with it's massive open-world.  For fans of Terry Pratchett's "Discworld" book, game, film universe; this is as closest we will ever get to having a game in the same vein.  BTW, Pratchett came up with a LOT of what is in the Potterverse well before J.K. created it.  Hogwarts is like the Unseen University, just more beautiful and with professors that give a crap about education and Hogsmeade is a smaller form of Ankh-Morpork.  Yes, there are the occasional bugs, but that is going to be expected in such a huge world game.  Hopefully the devs will be more open-minded in regards to fixing them than Rockstar, since they just gave up on RDR2.

author: ⚽️The England Kid⚽
review: It's an ok game, but what really grinds my gears about this game is that it completely retcon the prequel Harry Potter trilogy by J.F.K Rowling, as all the previous characters have been written out of the lore/story.

Otwarty świat jest piękny i pełny po brzegi. Podsumowując w tej grze jest co robić, nie chce się odchodzić od monitora grając w tą grę. author: Onyrix
review: The good:- Strong side characters- Visually impressive combat- Magic brooms-  - The soundtrack- Some beautiful and funny cutscenes of daily life in the castle and your friends' shenanigansThe bad:- The overly grandiose, poorly paced and inmutable main plotline.- Very clunky PC controls- The beautiful and misterious castle being  by a story that heavily favors the mediocre outdoors- Repetitive trials and camps all over the map- Horrible loot discouraging exploration- No variation in enemies (Spiders!!)-  armor system- Sneaking is poorly done, overpowered and  compared to the combat- No curfew at nighttime outside of two missions, and even then the prefects A.I. is  poorly done- - Your character never gets to have a group of friends or interact with anyone outside of their missions- No romance (yes they are all minors, but you don't have to take it further than a kiss on the cheek)- The mobile-like quality of the mechanics in the Room of Requirement (the fake landscapes are stunning though)Overall, a pretty disappointing experience. The devs have focused too much on an empty and soulless open world and a narrative ill-fitted for a lone student. In my opinions, a more intimate experience with your friends on the castle would have gone a long way in fixing many of the game's problems.

author: GoldTk
review: If you suffered from the bad optimization of this game, why not try a mod made by great people? It can boost your fps in a great variety. It's on nexusmods :)

author: JACofAllBlades
review: I was not a Harry Potter fan. I'd seen the movies with my kids, but couldn't have described one from another. Because of the brouhaha around J.K. Rowling I decided to purchase the game just to spite The Cult. I am so deeply impressed with the amount of love and detail that has gone into this massive game. I'm sure I'm missing a lot of the easter eggs and details, but it's abundantly obvious that this game was a labor of love.The story and voice-acting is the best I've seen in a video game, right up there with The Witcher 3 or the Arkham series games. The ability to adjust the gameplay to your individual style is exceptional and the graphics are gorgeous.I've now purchased all 7 of the books and have begun my journey into the world of wizards and witches. To the devs: you deserve all the accolades that can be given for games like this. I can't imagine how this must feel to people who have been fans for years. Well done.

author: bearsboi
review: I LOVE THIS GAME! the definitive wizarding world experience. create your own witch/wizard, choose your house, make your own wand, get your own broom, decorate your own house-like room within hogwarts, explore a big open world including all of hogwarts itself and hogsmeade. if you already know your house and wand, you can even connect your wizarding world account to the game and it will affect the beginning of the game, which is a really cool little feature. the characters, dialogue, and story are all very well written which is refreshing considering the current downward trend in these areas when it comes to some other games. the open world isnt too big for its own good, so it doesnt feel empty. theres lots of things to see, explore, side quests, dungeons, puzzles to solve. all of the spells you learn can be used both in combat and out of combat to fight and solve puzzles. combat can be challenging and requires good reflexes and knowledge of combinations which the game teaches you. as of writing this review there are some performance issues which i expect will be patched with game and driver updates. if you like the wizarding world, or even if you aren't familiar with it and just like whimsical fantastical settings, you will enjoy this game

author: ❀ Anakya ❀
review: Harry Potter fan or not ? Doesn't matter. Just buy it. its worth it trust me.

author: Sniffalus
review: This game just isn't good. I don't understand the "Open world" effect on the consumer mind, causing rave reviews despite lack of content. The gameplay is almost entirely designed for your brain to go AFK and just autopilot like an automaton, the "puzzles" aren't actually puzzles and offer no challenge, every single part of the game is made to handhold you through it. The collectibles aren't even fun because they aren't tied to any real challenges, they're just log completion percentages or main quest rewards or random loot chest drops.One of the main side "puzzles" you complete over and over again is literally just simple 2nd grade algebra and assigning the numbers 0-9 to a series of symbols that never change and are presented IN ORDER on a door. At first I thought you at least had to count the number of limbs the creatures had, but nope, you just have to count 0-9 left to right on the door.It had a lot of potential but the devs seem to have a philosophy of "No barrier to entry" which means everything has to be dumbed down to the lowest possible "difficulty".I'll keep playing to see if it gets any better and update my review if it does but I doubt it. Kind of just going through the motions really.ALSO A *BIT* MORE OF A MEME POINT BUT THEY DON'T EVEN HAVE COLLECTIBLE CHOCOLATE FROGS, WIZARD CARDS, OR FLAVORED BEANS IN THIS GAME WITH LIKE 20 COLLECTION SYSTEMS, LITERALLY WHAT WERE THEY THINKING?Edit: It's getting worse the further I go on. Why doesn't potion making have a minigame or mechanic? Or herbology? Or the beastkeeping system? Why is everything just *get resource* *use resource* *wait for timer*? Why are Merlin Trials completely braindead "Cast single spell on nearby objects"? It's all chores. Where is the gameplay? It's just more and more and more and more examples of the devs being afraid to put ANY barriers to entry or inconveniences, and failing to produce an enjoyable game as a result.

author: lortCecil
review: As a big fans of the Wizarding World,I highly, highly recommend this game!It's enjoyable for both that seeking for a challenge in duel or just seeking for the story like me.The world is HUGE and you have tons of things to do even without the quest! I got goosebumps for some cut scene of the game that shows Hogwarts. Truly feels like I become a Hogwarts Student.Hopefully one day this game could support multiplayer. It always become more fun and exciting with friends!

author: mewingtons
review: One of the best adventure games out there right now, comparable to the level of exploration as the Red Dead Redemption series. The team who worked on this did a solid job on the world with a tremendous amount of details. The whole environment seems alive with interactivity, and the scenery is beautiful. The moving pictures, the various dialogue interactions and events, the little items you can move, etc. all come together to create a truly unique experience and makes it feel like you are really part of the Harry Potter universe. Also, the fact that you can roam around Hogwarts castle and the surrounding areas without loading screens is a great touch that makes you just want to explore and helps to not break the immersion. There is so much to do and see with story quests and side quests available, as well as dungeons, puzzles, item collection, customization, and different scenarios for each house, which adds to the replayability. Even more, no pay-to-win or DLC microtransactions to ruin the experience. So far, the game has run without any hiccups or bugs after about 10 hours of gameplay. I can honestly say I am happy to have spent the money on this game and feel I have gotten my money's worth, as recent games have been lackluster to disappointing overall. Hogwarts Legacy has really set the bar about how games should be released.10 Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans out of 10

author: Renegoddess
review: Awalnya sangat meragu sama game ini sampe sempat 2x refund beli yang regular edition. Terus kemarin tanggal 10 februari juga banyak SJW di discussion forumsnya jadi makin ragu sama gamenya tapi emang intuisi tidak bisa diragukan karena dari awal emang liat gamenya kok kek yg bagus gitu ya, pas udah jamnya early access jadi tangan sangat gatak buat beli alhasil beli lagi untuk ke 3 kalinya tapi yang Deluxe Edition biar sekalian bisa download duluan mumpung Wifi di Thailand kemarin lagi bagus bagusnya.Ternyata gamenya keren abies, biasanya main Fallout atau Elder Scroll itu agak cepet bosen karena walaupun seru tapi rasanya sangat datar aja gitu seru yang buat saya 2 jam perhari udah cukup.Tapi somehow ini game emang bener2 nagih. Explorasi dan vibes tiap region itu bener bener beda. Dari Hogwarts yang bener bener wah ancient abis, Hogsmade yang bener2 homy and cozy, terus Forbiden Forest yang bener2 vibesnya terlarang banget itu bener bener point utama yg gabikin nyesel keluar duit hampir sejuta buat game ini. Walaupun memang variasi musuhnya terkesan repetitive tapi explorasi, view, dan vibesnya yang bikin saya nyaman sama game ini. Dan ya memang tidak ada game yg sempurna ya bund, kadang lagi asik asik liat pemandangan tau tau fps drop dari 50 ke 30 tapi selebihnya itu lancar dan masih sangat playable buat dinikmati. Dialogue scenenya juga udah di set jadi NPCnya ga bener bener random penempatannya, sangat bagus banget drpd Fallout yang kadang kalau kita maksa buat ngobrol tau tau ngebug entah kemana.Overall ini game 9/10 buat gamer seperti diri saya yang suka cepet bosen sama gamenya, sayang aja ada bbrp hal kaya Quiditch dll yang entah tidak di implementasikan atau belum di implementasikan, harapannya cuma kalau bisa ini game ada ekspansi lebih via DLC baik kelanjutan cerita ataupun fitur multiplayer/ local coop karena somehow battle sendirian rasanya agak hampa dan terlalu OP. Mungkin kalau ada fitur companion seperti Fallout dan Elder Scroll bakalan lebih immersive, tapi ya we know its a different developer. Anyway , i still dont want to complete the main story as a Ravenclaw, because the house have many and long sidequest that i wanted to explore first rather than completing the main story, because why not.

review: best game I've played in a long time.

author: TheBB88
review: AMAZING!!! 10 Points to Hufflepuff!!  Such an amazing world to explore and live in 10/10

author: Iron|Cu!
review: The best Hogwarts experience ever made is finally here. Though it's not without its flaws, Hogwarts Legacy is a phenomenal game that has a lot of great "somethings for everyone." This is by far the best wizarding world video game to ever come out and stands with a select few games that prove more is more. Immersive, beautifully done, with plenty of spells, challenges, beasts, quests, combat and also nice storytelling. It's such a fun ride that you could go for 100+ hours and not even feel it. It's like taking a sip of Felix Felicis. Despite not being a perfect game, and some technical issues on PC, its a very special experience and a must play!

author: Voorz77
review: Наш профессор еб*шит вообще адовые зелья.Ну такой вот примерно рецепт усредненный, потому что вариаций масса.Берется пиявочный сок, он не греется, греть - это не про моего профессора. Он берет это сок, вываливает его в котел и начинает жарить. Добавляет в него огромное количество яиц пепламба, златоглазки, водорослей и меха ДВОРНЯГИ! для вязкости, клыка паука сверху. Все это жарится до дыма. Потом снимается с огня и остужается в Выручай-комнате. Потом профессор заносит и щедро полив зловонием мертвецов начинает пить. При этом пьет с котла постукивая по ней палочкой. Пьет и приговаривает полушепотом ух ревелио. При этом у него на лбу аж пот выступает. Любезно студентам иногда предлагает, но все отказываются. Надо ли говорить о том какой дичайший пердеж потом? Вонища такая, что домашние эльфы откидываются.

author: Oberon
review: I haven't had this much fun in a game like this in quite a while, sure some my enjoyment is triggered by nostalgia but I'm also having a pretty fun time. I can tell the team put a lot of effort into making the world feel alive and lore friendly. The open world actually is open with a bunch to explore. The combat is how I expected, it has its kinks but is pretty easy and fun once you get the hang of everything. The flight system is better than I expected it to be. I would have loved a bit more freedom to shape my character and their relationships (i find the majority of the side people to be kinda meh) but this is fantastic groundwork for any future game. Overall i'd give it a solid 7.5/10Edit: As I'm playing more i'm updating my score to 8.5 the game has impressed me more than I expected.

author: buura
review: Hello to all game enthusiasts..I've never written a review for a game, but I couldn't resist this one..Yes, I love the Harry Potter universe. Let's start with that:Every scene and every landscape in the game is a masterpiece. Each element has been carefully crafted, and it's clear that a lot of effort has been put into it.The game truly reflects the world we imagined from the books. The visuals from the movies and books have been brilliantly synthesized. Instead of using the names from the original story to sell the game, they've been carefully avoided. The references are just right. The game takes place in the 1800s, so there's a different teaching staff, different enemies, and different problems. The variety of enemies and the way the story progresses gave me the feeling of detective work that I had in the books, and like in the books, you find yourself in the middle of a big problem, and you collect bits of information from the many events around you. The story telling in the game, and the progression of information and mystery, made me very happy.The game, like classic Harry Potter games, is full of puzzles that you have to solve and hidden secrets that you have to uncover all around the castle, and solving these and working for them is really fun.The graphics are beyond great. I didn't encounter any bugs or optimization problems. The spell effects, inspired by the movie, are fantastic and look great. I can't find anything to say about the design of the school, it's perfect. Even after spending a long time, it still continues to enchant.Regarding the music, the original music from the movie was not abandoned, and generally new fantastic music has been created based on that theme.The story has a completely new Hogwarts and teaching staff. The characteristics of the teaching staff are completely different from the original story. For example, you may not see the professor of dark arts as a bad character. They have characters that are quite intriguing. In terms of voice acting, they've found a voice that's very similar to Daniel Radcliffe's, and generally his reactions are compatible with Harry Potter. This didn't bother me.The only thing I think the game is missing is that the chosen school sections could be a bit more effective. I would have liked more specific tasks for the chosen section after selection, and more tasks for your section...In conclusion, the game is amazing. It is not unrealistic to think that the producer will make us happy with new tasks and expansions in the future.I wish everyone good games and I definitely recommend playing this game.

review: the game is kinda good the story and the graphics are pretty awesome but i wont suggest to buy the game just yet as the game has very poor optimization so just wait for the optimization fix and then you can buy and really enjoy the game to the fullest.

review: This game is amazing! It is almost what every HP fan has ever wished for. It's gonna be up there with the contenders for greatest open world gams.I have critizise , It would be the inventory system, especially for your gear.While i do appriciate the transmog system, It's done to a certain overkill. As many of the gear you pick up looks straight up goofy at some times while others are super cool, they cann both take away parts of the emersion in the cutscenes . You still want to have the best stats possiible and will have to equip the trannsmog every time you pick up somethiing better.I wish you had an outtfitt systems that is easily changeeable, kind of like they have in RDR22, Same goes for mask and hood beiing able tto toogle on and of by the press of 1 buttom (preferbly with animatinnn in game,) Instead of having to navigatre trhough the UI all the time.This so i dont mistakenly roll up with the soriting hats ugly sister  In the dark arttts class, like I'm some Redneck-Wizard!Other tthan that 10/10

author: Jono
review: I'd just like to say that I don't really write many reviews for games all that much, however there's a specific exception for Hogwarts Legacy. I'm a huge fan of the Harry Potter series and having read the books and watched the movies, this was something that had caught my eye for many years!As many others have already mentioned, this game feels like such a well worked piece of art, in which the devs have really taken their time with constructing the most true to life game possible, whilst staying true to the nature of Hogwarts. I have no doubt that future optimization patches further down the line will help smoothen out some FPS drops that many seem to be reporting, including myself. The soundtrack is beautiful and the audio in this game really needs to be experienced with headphones on for the full immersion experience. If you're a fan of Harry Potter in general, I would highly recommend this game. Even if you're not and would like to experience a beautiful open world RPG with the ability to learn many spells, meet fun and new characters, and enjoy collecting and exploring a great world, then I'd recommend this game too at full price.Take care and happy gaming team :)

author: SherShow
review: As a person playing hundreds of RPG's id like to simply say the game is amazing! Especially considering the state in which other games have released in the past few years.I was never a fan of the HP universe and the drama around this game is just funny to me. The quality of the experience this game provides speaks for itself. Its a great adventure for fans and people who simply dont care about HP.Spells feel JUST RIGHT!World is very open and you can even reach max lvl and finish main story and still miss lots of great things. One super annoying thing in my opinion is how somehow its more "woke" than it should... lets be honest... Its year what? 1800something? Trans? Openly gay people? Yeah sure... No racism?  Its truly a magical world XDI really struggle with how people can think its ok to prosecute people for even playing this game... Its a good game. Deal with it :)

author: Halo
review: After nearly 30 hours of playing, I just wanna say that my time with the game has been brilliant, and I highly recommend it as a fun open world game. Combat is pretty fun and can be challenging, even on the normal difficulty; and the story is not that bad, either. PC version has some technical issues, you might have to force yourself to play on Low settings until the devs patch the game. Nonetheless, if you have the money, go for it 👍However, I know there are MANY people unsure out of fear of backlash from friends or rando's on the internet due to the IP being owned by J. K. Rowling. Trust me, I hate her too and am annoyed with the nonsense she spouts from her bigoted brain of hers, I DO NOT support her views or values whatsoever. That doesn't mean I can't enjoy anything that came from what OTHERS have made based from her world; I still enjoy the movies, and I most certainly am enjoying Hogwarts Legacy.You are not a terrible person for getting this game, you are not a transphobe, you are not aiding in her already deep pockets. You are valid, you should do what you want. Boycott if you want to boycott, but DO NOT bully or harass others for buying/playing this game. If you REALLY care that much, use the $60 to donate towards a charity that benefits those that J.K. hates so much. Remove the art from the artist; if the very same actors who have played their role in the Harry Potter movies DISOWN and REMOVE THEMSELVES from J.K. and her ideals, then you can too.

The Author doesn't dictate the Story all the time.

review: Officially my new favorite game! I am loving the puzzles, nonlinear gameplay, clothing/appearance items, graphics, dialogue, and pretty much everything. I am an exploration game junkie, the more secrets I can find on my adventures the more excited I become, and this game was made for me. :) <3

author: Trevor Reznik
review: Simply enchanting. Hogwarts Legacy is a game every gamer must play: wether you're a fan of Harry Potter or not. Wether you like JK Rowling or not. Grant yourself some enjoyment and get this masterpiece.PS: The fact that this game remains at €60 puts Square Enix' preposterous €80 price point to shame even more. Go eat a bag of marbles Square Enix.

author: Nyagro
review: I initially planned to buy this once it goes on sale but the peanut brain takes of certain individuals wanting to boycott this game and convince others to do the same were beyond stupid and I could feel my few precious braincells rotting away.60 bucks is a small price to pay to prevent that from happening. The game is reasonably well optimized. Compared to some of the other ♥♥♥♥ fests we experienced in the last few years, this seems like a rarity in the AAA game industry.The game itself seems very fun. It's definetly something people should enjoy playing at their own pace as the atmosphere, from the bits I've experienced so far, feels very well put together and fitting for the Harry Potter universe. You can see the love people poured into this game and I have no regrets supporting such great products. Kudos to everyone involved and keep up the great work!

author: Arkimedes
review: Performance/bugs:My config: Ryzen 5 3600 (X570 chipset), 32GB DDR4 3600Mhz, RTX 3060 OC (12gb), Gen3 SSDI played in 1080p with 60 fps limit and it was running at constant 60fps (no raytracing, DLSS set to quality, all settings on ultra).I finished the game in about 75 hours (I did all sidequests and most challenges) and I didn't encounter any crashes, performance issues or game breaking bugs.Bethesda should really pay attention!Gameplay:It's not a perfect game but I really enjoyed it and it has great potential with future MODs and hopefully DLC.I love the movies and this game looks incredible. Architecture, textures, sounds, atmosphere,... everything feels like straight out of the movies.And most importantly there are NO MICROTRANSACTIONS ! (those would be a deal breaker for me)Combat is enjoyable and can be great fun when trying new spell combinations or making use of the environment.Definitely better than Witcher 3.The biggest downside are the challenges.I mean they are pretty good and there is great variety, however you have to do them too many times.Merlin trials were very anoying and too repetitive for me because I wanted maximum inventory size.Despite that I really enjoyed just run or fly around and explore without knowing where I'm going or what to expect ahead.I also spent lot of time decorating my room of requirement and magical worlds for my creatures.But I was expecting more assets so there it definitely room for improvement either by patches,DLC or probably most likely MODs.Increasing creature limit would be nice as 12 is way too small.Definitely looking forward playing this one again in a year or so with some cool MODs or DLCs.

author: Arek
review: I'm not a Harry Potter fan and even so the game has been amazing, so I imagine a fan will tear up with the attention to detail and overall quality.The game allows you to focus on the main story and completionists will find a ton of all type of collectibles and puzzles spread all over the open world, specially in the Hogwarts Castle and Hogsmeade. I thought they would be a chore, but the game has several ways to point out what you're missing and where, although you may need help with a guide in a few occasions.It doesn't really have any innovation in its mechanics, but it uses good known formulas for open-world RPGs (level, spells and item progression, character and item customization, a small player hub that will expand throughout the adventure and allows you to customize all sort of cosmetics/decoration, and lots of lore, secrets and references to be found.

author: Serene
review: Hogwarts Legacy lets you roleplay as a Costco version of Newt Scamander , raise questionable plants and run around the castle  putting your grubby little mitts on everything.  If that isn't the definitive Hogwarts Experience I don't know what is.         Jokes aside Hogwarts legacy does a great job in effortlessly letting you into the world. The castle is exceptionally well made and running around exploring it a joy.  The combat is a blast as you have a veritable arsenal of familiar spells to play around with.                                                                                                                            I do have minor gripes about not having mandatory classes everyday but that's just me.  The game feels like it's optimised really well as aside from a few minor drops in fps whilst outside , it runs well.Overall if you loved The Wizarding World as a kid, you'll have an absolute blast playing it and if not ,the games is still fun enough to keep you engaged

author: Stop Freezing Me
review: Couldn't really ask for more in a Harry Potter game.Interesting story, fun magic that has lots of interesting environmental interactions, surprisingly challenging and deep combat, puzzles that don't hold your hand, excessive character customization where all cosmetics and rewards are earned through gameplay with no MTX or season passes. Incredibly rich and detailed world to explore, borderline Red Dead Redemption 2 levels of graphical fidelity and environment art. Runs pretty damn well on my 2070 with DLSS enabled. You really can explore the castle and grounds in unparalleled detail, there isn't an inch of the place that doesn't look incredible. There are probably an absurd number of secrets to find.It's all oozing with Wizarding World charm, of course, so there's stuff for fans around every corner.If I had a complaint, the dialogue and RPG systems could be deeper, so this is more of an action game with light RPG elements than a true RPG.

author: Grey_Kn1ght
review: This game slaps and JK Rowling did nothing wrong.

author: Archie
review: im a wizard

author: Jub
review: This really is the time of my life, absolutely wonderfully crafted game.Apart from some performance issues, it works really well for me and it's super fun.A lot of great features, played for a while already and it keeps surprising me with new things.Definitely a game for everyone I'd say!

author: mojo priest
review: One of the game's positive aspects is the feeling that the developers have managed to create. As a player, it really does feel like you're at Hogwarts, with all of the familiar settings, characters, and spells.However, the game's biggest problem is the extremely boring gameplay. All of the puzzles are too easy, and if you do happen to struggle, your character will start thinking out loud and reveal the solution within five seconds. A good chunk of the quests revolve around farming items rather than engaging in immersive story quests, making the gameplay tedious and repetitive.Another issue with the game is that it feels lifeless, lacking any random events or anything to make the world feel alive. This makes exploring the world feel like a chore, rather than an adventure.Some other problems:* You can stand right next to your teachers and cast forbidden spells like Crucio without them even reacting. * You don't have the ability to make choices that significantly impact the game's outcome* Finally, the game's quest system is outdated, with the game constantly reminding you to return to your quest, making it feel more like a game from the year 2000 than a modern RPGOverall, while the feeling of being at Hogwarts is well-executed, the game's boring gameplay, lifeless world, lack of consequences, and outdated quest system make it a disappointment for those expecting an immersive and engaging experience.

author: Toothcake
review: I was 10 when the first Harry Potter book came out. I couldn't get into it. My fandom was established with the movies, and even though I enjoy them, I'm not what I would consider a huge Harry Potter fan. But my wife is, and because of her, I've gotten to see the full breadth of what this game is. At several points in the game, she started crying despite herself. She'd get mad about it, chuckle, and then carry on only to be gobsmacked by some other tiny detail that only she could appreciate as a fan of the books. In her words, the devs understood and captured the appeal of why everyone wanted to live in the Wizarding World. Say what you will about the controversy surrounding the HP universe, but I think it's clear that the devs put a lot of love into making a Hogwarts that is for everyone. Mechanics-wise, it's similar to other WB games but the Rock-Paper-Scissors-Confringo combat is frantic enough to be consistently interesting. The side quests are actually interesting and fit within the overall narrative. The only downside is that quite a few of them are collect-a-thons of varying flavors. If you're a lore nerd, then you'll be pleased.Oh, and despite what's been reported prior to the official launch, your House choice DOES actually make a difference. My wife and I had two different approaches to a quest based on House choice, with both of us meeting characters and visiting locations that the other didn't. My gripes are minor and deal more with the immersive qualities in RPGs. You can't sit, the cats meow sounds weirdly demonic when you pet them, and there isn't much reason to spend time in any of the spaces when you're not questing or collecting. I kinda wanted a Bully-style immersive game, but I understand why they went with the approach that ultimately shipped. Haven't finished it yet, but I am happy with what I've played.

author: peeper keeper
review: The team behind this game is incredibly talented! Great game!EXCEPT: Holy **** has no one on this team ever played a PC game before? The combat controls for targeting default to Caps Lock to set target. Okay, weird, but I can rebind it to Tab.Second problem - the targeting option I've set Tab to does not toggle through targets; it only selects and de-selects the target.Alright. The solution here isn't obvious, but after a quick Google search I find that the button to change targets on keyboard and mouse is the damn arrow keys? When I'm playing with my left hand on WASD and right on the mouse? Do you want me to sacrifice access to one set of inputs? Or grow a third hand?Fine, I guess I'll rebind one of the "Select next target" options to another key. Idk, middle mouse button I guess... But wait! That "Select next target" option only goes to the next target *to the right.* End up with the rightmost enemy targeted? Pushing that button again does nothing. You need to also bind the "Select previous target" equivalent to toggle an enemy to the left.On controller, you just flick right stick either direction to toggle through them. Easy. On PC, I'm being warned I'm overwriting one of 100 other commands trying to find some logical way to get this to work.Please, devs, I'm begging you: Make a mouse drag function like right stick flick on controller and select the next target in that direction, or make multiple presses of Tab cycle through the targets like 90% of games with a similar lock on system.Other than that, again, great game. Just posted this after a frustrating encounter where I felt like I was fighting the awful PC targeting controls more than the enemies in front of me. I'm swapping back to controller for now.

author: EdLine
review: It's not perfect, there are some things that you will notice easily that are a bit off and some things that I personally wish would've done differently or had some more detail in them. Overall this game is amazing a solid 8.5/10 and GOTY material. I'm absolutely in love with this world, it's a bit different from movies or books and it doesn't have to be it's carbon copy because they deliver non the less. Music and atmosphere is just breathtaking. When light just has the right angle Hogwarts looks magnificent. At night it's a whole different vibe and I love it for other reasons. Not just Hogsmead but also small settlements around have their own vibes and feel cozy. I find myself using a broom way more than floo powder(fast travel). This world doesn't feel empty at all it's jam packed with enemies, puzzle, caves and other activities. Just there for you to explore and that's why it's so rewarding just to take a flight on your broom to your quests and do a little exploring on the way. You will also need those resources for different mechanics in game. I haven't finished the game as of writing this review and I'm not half way there yet. Sure I could point out all the negative points out, but they don't defy your game like in some other titles. No doubt in my mind I will be playing this game for many more PT's with different houses making different choices and shaping my character according to them. In the end it's a huge recommend from me. Just enjoy the game for what it is, definitely made my dream come true. Stop focusing on what others think and explore it yourself.

Still not great but Ill go ahead and give it a recommend now.  Aside from performance, the game is phenomenal.

author: tsoba-tsoba
review: HP fan over here. Pros:- Beautiful world. The designers really felt the harry potter lore and did it right. There are a lot of details (in the castle). A lot of stuff based on books and it's quite precise.- You can pet a cat. (Sorry tried to find something more valuable but didn't managed to)Cons:- Main plot. It's not interesting and boring. You do not care about the character or have sympathy for them. Except maybe for Sebastian story and the Poppy's. I felt literally nothing when I finished. I just didn't care after 60 hours. They do not even say anything about protagonist- Your answers do not matter. It's linear. Literally nothing you can have influence to- Bad RPG mechanics. No any karma, steal everything, cast unforgivable w/o consequences. - Repetitive. After 10h you won't see anything new. After Hogwarts grounds you won't encounter anything new even if you opened only 1/4 of the map. Same mobs, same attacks, same crates with garbage- Unbalanced. You literally own everybody after reaching 25+ level. There is no challenge, just tapping mobsIt does not worth those money they asking at the moment -- that's why I do not recommend it.

author: Shaun Roselt
review: I haven't 100% completed the game yet, but from the first couple of days of gameplay, I'd say it's pretty good. It's by far the best Harry Potter and Wizarding World game out there. Definitely recommend!I do however have some complaints:* Character Customization is extremely limited. You can't customize your appearance a lot.* There's no zoom in and zoom out for mini map. The mini map zoom level is always the same.* FOV isn't very big or wide. I'd like a wider field of view than the current maximum of 20.* I'd like to be able to choose whether I want my character on the left, middle or right side. By default it's on the left side and you can't change it.* The world is very limiting in some places. As an example, at various locations I cannot jump onto a ledge or wall even though it's not very high at all. I can jump onto higher things at other places. It's almost as if there's an invisible wall. I wish it was more open world and it would allow me to go anywhere.* No Multiplayer 🥲. I think it would be awesome if friends can jump onto my world and we can explore the world together or instead of dueling with Sebastion, I duel with my friend in multiplayer.* I can only hold a maximum of 25 Wiggenweld Potions in my active slot. I think this limit should be increased to 50 especially on Hard difficulty.* Hard difficulty isn't hard enough. It would be nice if there could be an even more difficult settings than "Hard".* There isn't a lot of Steam Achievements. I'd like to have at least 100 achievements I can chase and go after. The current 45 doesn't feel like it's enough.

author: mrzo
review: Graphics are great, the size of the world as well.However, it is really boring. Like many other reviewers have already written, the main story is quite convoluted and basically a go-there-collect-this-and-come-back. Then-wait-until-i-give-you-the-next-task. No interesting character development, no emotional bonding. Just some plot-driven McGuffin hunt.The dialogue is exceptionally bad. It is basically a wall between me and the game that I actually would like to play. Quite often my main character simply repeats to other characters what I experienced so far while I have to sit there and get bored. Why didn't they put any effort into this?! There are simple tricks for writers of books and movies to make a scene or story more engaging. It is possible for video games, too.I don't really care about any characters in this game - not even my own. Fnishing quests felt like doing a homework assignment - sometimes even literally. My brother and I wanted to play this game over the rainy holidays but it is simply not entertaining. Now we have to buy another game to fill the hours.My brother's remark: Hogwarts Legacy feels like you have to replay Skyrim from 2011 but not in the good way.

author: trap-brat
review: While I recommend this game this review will have a lot of BUTs in it. I will also avoid Spoilers.When I started to play I felt the same feeling as I did when I played Fable for the first time:Here is a magical world filled to the brim of possibilities, adventure and to shape the path I choose to journey.  PERFECT!Is it a good game? Yes but excels in creating the illusion of being more than there actually is. Not so perfect...What do I mean with this? Well.For one:Restricted areas of the castle is only restricted during quests. After you completed said quest you can head to the restricted area without any penalty. In fact there is really no penalty at all when it comes to this game. You can run around, with a professor slinging unforgivable curses without a care. Some npcs will however comment on the use of these curses in the like of "I see you are not afraid of the dark arts". This leads to the second grand illusion of House points:During the play through you can pass the hall with the hourglasses for each house showing the current house points. For me, they never moved. There was no added nor removed house points except for a scripted event in the beginning of the game, and at the end. This makes the house-cup as relevant as the Quidditch tournament. Third... No Quidditch... Fourth: Economy. This part kinda broke me a little. And here's why. In the game you need money, either to get rare ingredients, upgrades or gear. Now there is two ways to get cash. Sell gear that drops from enemies or can be found in chests around the world, or donate beasts. That's it. You can't sell ingredients you have gathered, you can't sell potions or flora that you have grew. And the prices are fixed. So with gear the lowest rarity goes for 60g, whilst the highest go for 200g. No matter if you have upgraded the gear or what level it is. I tried to donate a Unicorn only to see that it gives as much gold as if I would have donated a Niffler. Why? Well beasts and gear are not hard to come by, not even Unicorns. So it would be too easy to get filthy rich too fast.What was good?Well A lot of things.The sound design and music is really well done and the same can be said about the voice acting. The Ambiance!The detail of the world not only inside the castle but the rest of the world like the hamlets and Hogsmeade. (I wish the dark forest was a bit bigger but hey its alright). The combat system is fun and fast! Basically you learn all the fun spells and then create combos how ever you like. And I must say that the voice acting in the combat is amazing form the Main Character. You can hear the tone in their voice change when casting an unforgivable curse like Avada Kedavra, like the character actually wants to kill the enemy. The Writing wasn't that bad but the conflict where the overhanging/looming threat is, could have been more explored, to my taste it was a bit bland. It's a stunning game when it comes to the visuals, and combine that with the travel system on beast or broom made me skip the fast travel system in most cases. So in summary: It's a AAA game that does what AAA games do the best: A real shiny exterior with the illusion of being more complex. But the parts they focused on is done very well. Exploring the world and Hogwarts is amazing but you kinda feel like an observer running a collectathon through Hogwarts and its restricted sections rather than a student. Or through peoples houses after breaking their locks with Alohomora. What this game needed was more consequences for the Main Character. Now there is no reason not to go into the forbidden forest. There is no reason not to use unforgivable curses. There is no reason not to.. and so on. That's the main issue. Then there is a lot of quest-locks for stuff like one beast cant be found in the world until late game, probably because it gives an ingredient for half of your gear to get to upped to lvl 3 ( max ). And getting it early will make you OP etc.Overall, I enjoyed it! Made me wanna replay the first Fable Game.  7/10Maybe wait when it goes on sale if you are unsure. I'm gonna do a second play through on the hardest difficulty since Normal was a breeze. I might come back to add or change this review depending on what I find.
