author: JoOngle
review: Hogwarts Legacy is going to be legendary, and this is why:Many people who have reviewed this game after 2-5 hours gameplay are missing the incredible changes in the game, I will not spoil it here, but I can tell you it's full of surprises, you're going to see "Demoscene" like experiences in this game (look that up if  you don't know what Demoscene stuff is), it's like this world of graphical effects and splendor to a degree you don't expect in regular AAA games.I'll be short, because the game is just too big:- Endless amounts of side quests and dialogue.- The graphics can be amazing at times.- Full of surprises, once you think you saw it all after a few hours, it all changes.- Pretty decent stories, it captivates you enough to want to continue the next day.- Lots of little hidden secrets.- Big complex experience system, you can chose the direction of your focus.- Long lasting game, sure you can run through it in 20 hours, but you'll miss out on 90 percent of the game, so expect 100s of hours here. I'm in the 30th hour so far, and 29% complete, and I think I did everything pretty darn fast.- Very forgiving if you just follow the story, you can literally press random combos and not know the first thing about it and you can still succeed.- The game can be a little dull and tedious in the beginning.- Lots of stuff to remember and learn, if you're not keen on 100+ different combos to learn, this can be quite daunting and exhausting.- The menu system can be utterly confusing, it's pretty obvious it was made for a controller and not foremost a keyboard, this can be super frustrating, it took me hours into the game realizing I need to press "G" to use the healing potions, and it took me even longer to understand the value of upgrading clothes with the loom.- If you're suffering from a bit of misophonia like me, then the repetitive music can be annoying in the long run.- The dialogue CAN be a little bit of a long stretch for impatient people, you know that friend you have that goes ON and ON about the LEAST interesting things in life, well - there's a lot of those here, and just like real life there's no SKIP button for that. If your keyboard comes with a "" function, then USE IT! You're gonna find yourself in a hectic spider battle randomly switching spell menues while franticly pressing 1,2,3 and 4, Q, R and mouse clicking aka bullet-hell, so during the heat of the battle, you will no doubt encounter your windows menu helping your enemies to defeat you. Other than that, this is the game your friends will be talking about the next 14 days, and then it's gonna be legendary. You need a ton of patience, good memory, lots and lots of energy, finger muscles and you def. need to stop talking about this game to your friends if you want to keep them.

author: //Hammer
review: Phenomenal game, if you enjoy RPGs and/or the Harry Potter universe you will more than likely love this game. This game has numerous things to do right out of the gate. The amount of hours I have spent in the Room of Requirements alone is unbelievable. There is so much customization not only for your character but for your very own Room of Requirement.The only downsides I have ran into this far is the lack of dialogue in various conversations with the NPCs. There is very limited lines that appear, I would also like for a way to pause cut scenes. Especially the longer ones since being a father I have to randomly step away and would likely miss an important conversational topic.Other than those two things this game is hands down a game changer in the world of the RPGs and I would give this game a solid 9.5/10.

author: Jing
review: Despite some of the bugs and various glitches on day one release (which every game has now, so whatever) its a fantastic game. But probably one for the more casual player. Some of the quests are generic and unimaginative with a few even having me rolling my eyes at the basic request of kill "big bad here and get item". With that in mind, the goods in this game heavily out weigh the bad. The set pieces are exactly what I expected from this world. Ruined castles, magical forests with weird alien creatures, fun  and engaging characters (with whom you'll actually start to care about), and there is even a dragon.  But where this game really shines is the music. I personally feel that Hogwarts music and ambience is of a cinematic quality that I haven't  heard in a game in a long time. It should be highly praised for it. When flying a hippogriff, you can actually feel you character taking part in a flight montage. Its *Chefs kiss* perfect.Overall, if you go into this game expecting some hard core gaming, you're going to be disappointed. But if you go in just to have a good time with some Harry Potter spells, engaging characters, and a fun main story, you're absolutely going to love it.

author: Mindinmatrix
review: Hogwarts Legacy is an amazing game that I can't recommend highly enough. As a huge fan of the Harry Potter franchise, I was really excited to play this game and I was not disappointed. It really captures the magical and immersive world of Hogwarts, and it's so much fun to explore.The graphics and sound effects are absolutely stunning, and they really add to the overall experience. I loved the attention to detail and the way that the game stays true to the books and movies while also introducing new and exciting elements.One of my favorite things about the game is the gameplay itself. I loved being able to attend classes and learn spells, and the quests were really challenging and fun to complete. The combat is also really engaging and adds an extra layer of excitement to the game.I want to give a huge shoutout to the developers for creating such an incredible game. It's clear that they put a lot of love and care into every aspect of the game, and it really shows. I think anyone who is a fan of Harry Potter or just loves adventure games in general will absolutely love this game.In summary, if you're looking for an amazing and immersive gaming experience, then you definitely need to check out Hogwarts Legacy. It's an incredible game that is sure to provide you with hours of fun and excitement.

author: PureFallen
review: Review contains slight spoiler in favor of giving you advice in case you decide to play it.The amount of bugs are surprisingly low for a Triple A game released this days (kinda like how it should be..).The few bugs that you can stumble into are usually reverted quickly by loading one of the Autosaves that happen everytime you enter a new room, area, or all few minutes.Battlesystem is better than many had expected. There is strategy adjustments you can do for every enemy(type), yet after a certain time you may end up looking yourself to search for a generic combo for them all.Lots of Lore Accuracy and Insiders for those who watched the movies *and* did read this books. This is the closest of proper execution the franchise has seen so far.Sadly, the game does many mistakes of the recent generation of Open World Games.Rather than risking to have an empty Open World, the world is filled with a shietton of repetitive tasks with Checklists, which may end up becoming a grind at a certain point and will cover the broad majority of your roughly 50 hours playtime.Enemies scale with you that defeats the purpose of the Levelsystem if not for your Skilltree. However, there are more Skills to choose than Points obtainable and no way to re-assign them, so once you unlock the "Talents", you may already want to plan your 35! Skillpoints ahead in time. Whenever you going to use Dark Magic or not in your playthrough may be a decision you already do there.The equipment you find also scales with you, so when you explore to much in the Earlygame, you may run out of gear to find and use in the Endgame. Always wearing the best items to find and then using the "Change Appearance" Option (which is rather hidden in the Gear Menu) is recommended, as well as of rushing Side Quests and Main Quests as soon as possible.Overall: If you like the Franchise or the recent trend of Open World Games, it might be giving a shot. If you already did not like how for example AC: Valhalla handled their Open World, it is probably best to be avoided.

author: Mazzervoj.ttv
review: After completing the game to the max and getting all the achievements, I can do nothing but promote this game. Ever since my childhood after reading the magic chronicle I have been waiting for a game to put my hopes and dreams into reality. Seeing the intro to the game alone turned me back into a child, my nostalgia was hitting peaks wandering around the castle. The developers took the words off the pages and made a mystical and magical universe for us to wander and explore. A mixture of exceptional graphics and animations used to make a fantastic looking world for people of all ages to get lost in. From petting animals and feeding them to gaining materials and exploring the dangerous roads and caverns across the world. The game offers a little for everyone no matter the age. The attention to detail in the game is extraordinary, the castle is a 100% representation of the way we remember it from the pages. Filled with little trinkets from the movies for us all to find and enjoy. From the darkest dungeons of the Slytherin house to the moon lit common room of Ravenclaw the player can get lost chasing all the collectables, get ready for the dings they never end. But the game isn’t all fun there are some challenges with puzzle rooms and difficult bosses that will teach you how to use all your tools effectively to let you progress through the amazing story line. The game is filled with amazing side quests to keep you busy and levelling to get you ready for those long hard story line quests. This game is very easy to lose track of time in you find yourself not doing much just flying around the world either enjoying the scenery or just chasing a Fwooper or two or maybe even searching and breaking into the many different places to find the many and many collectables . There is no real way to play this game just do as you please, the open world is amazing and with little to no issue from day one release.  You can choose who you want to be either the good guy or the masterful dark wizard, the world is your oyster. Plus what other game lets you flip a cow and reward you for it. Gameplay wise the game runs smoothly with little to no issues depending on your system of course. The game can be a little demanding with all the amazing graphics. Definitely recommend playing this game with a controller as the targeting system and change of spells is much easier on the controller. The fights are really smooth and fun as every spell makes you feel like you’re the most powerful person in the world, even though that is not the case at all. You get to make the choice if you want to use the DARK magic or not, it’s all down to the witch or wizard. My only wish is that you should be punished for using the THREE UNFORGIVABLE CURSES but rant over.  Just hope you don’t have a fear of spiders cause they are everywhere from wandering the lands to caves and caverns filled with hairy eight legged pests. Overall the game is well worth the money, you will get hours and hours of enjoyment and a little frustration. Enjoy the wonderful world of the WIZZARDS and the many many cats that roam the world and castle.

author: emmy
review: i usually don't like RPG games and i only played this because i love harry potter. i have rewatched the movies a million times, done hp roleplay (cringe <3) for 11 years, practiced a lot of hp trivia, etc., so i know a lot. and that knowledge makes this game a lot better and more fun. it does treat you like you know nothing, so i feel too smart for the game :') but it is amazing to finally see all of hogwarts. i spent 11 years busting my ass off trying to describe rooms and locations in hogwarts that had never been shown in the movies. it is rly hard to do that without visuals! so its nice to finally put an image to all these locations i had in my head. similar to the fantastic beasts movies, it was amazing seeing creatures, plants and potions that had never been visualized in the movies. i dont rly care for the plot. if anything, id prefer if this was just hogwarts simulator. but, regardless, everything is quite fun. im just not sure how fun it is if ur not a giant hp nerd... my brain has yet to fully understand how much this game means to my inner child. i remember being 11, crying my eyes out in the cinema after having watched the last movie. everyone was leaving and i was wondering why they werent sobbing like i was. i wish i could go back and tell myself about this game :)

author: Dream
review: I'll keep it short. The game is pretty damn great. A lot of effort has been put into this, the setting and world design especially. In a lot of ways it really is a great game. I sincerely hope they continue to improve and add more things to the game in the future. That said, there's a  on PC with Hogwarts Legacy. I'm using an RTX 3060 TI: meaning for the lower tier graphic card it is especially noticeable. - Task manager interestingly shows 0% GPU usage when the game is running. If I go back to the desktop, the GPU usage goes up. Task manager isn't a good place to look for your real usage however.- So using MSI Afterburner, I could see that my gpu stayed around 40-50% usage in all areas of the game. This is a major issue. Your gpu usage should generally be around 90% for the smoothest game experience (this is common in all other games), yet the port Avalanche Software has made is poor. The game is virtually bug-free and quite fantastic, but this is a huge issue. I cannot smoothly run the game on the graphics I want without issues.I want to wholeheartedly recommend the game. But I simply can't ignore it. If anyone has a lesser graphics card than I do, you will have major problems running the game smoothly.

author: Kevo
review: Buen juego, bastante divertido e interesante, pero podria mejorar muchisimo, luego de jugar otros mundo abiertos, se queda muy corto y basico, pero en tema de ambientacion y sentimiento un 10/10.Para alguien casual que no es gamer o no juega mucho o no sabe, es perfecto, para aprender y divertirse. Para un Gamer, te queda corto y notas que no tiene mucha profundidad y realmente es bastante sencillo y simple, lo que te deja con un sinsabor y ganas de que hubiera sido mejor porque tiene mucho potencial.PROS:- El Combate a mi parecer es bastante bueno, da oportunidades y combos.- Ambientacion es increible, te sientes hasta cierto punto en la pelicula. (si no fueran por los NPC tan simples, seria 10/10).- Buen Soundtrack.- Tan Basico que es bueno para No-Gamers y nuevo publico que le gusta harrypotter.CONTRAS:- NPcs muy pobres y no puedes interactuar con 99% de ellos, y aparecen y desaparecen en las noches.- Movimiento y saltos del personaje bastante raros y paredes invisibles por todos lados, lo que hace que no se sienta como un Mundo Abierto. (quieres saltar una cerca?, no puedes hay una pared invisible arriba).- No tiene mayor influencia la casa que te toque ni las decisiones que tomes, lo que lo hace muy lineal.- Customizacion y equipos de personaje muy pero muy basicos, para tontos, cero profundidad en nuevas baritas, ropas, equipos.

author: Xan
review: Hogwarts legacy is worth the playthrough. Definitely a runner for GoT, for an outstanding world to explore. Took 60 hours to complete all achievements and I had a blast. This game is actually fun, which is hard to say for a lot of the game currently out right now. I recommend playing on Hard for the best experience. The other difficulties seem way too easy during my other playthroughs. 30+ hours of story and many collectibles and hidden things to find. 11/10 I would recommend to any category of gamer.

author: Mau
review: So far the game has been really fun although I do have some cons-The story is not captivating and its a huge miss. Comparing to the actual HP story.-Online multiplayer would make the game insane,focusing on combat maybe tactical team based would be cool.-Way less spells than i was expecting. I was thinking i would learn more.-I feel like Puzzles should scale with game difficulty or something. Blasting through the puzzles but combat on hard was a great challenge i enjoyed every time i bested an enemy i couldn't defeat.-Was thinking there would be more Enemies. A lot feel copy and pasted with minor things between types.-Was very disappointed to see the copy paste bosses in the "trials" as there are so many monsters in the HP universe they could have brought into the game.-More dungeons and secrets are really needed.Overall the gameplay and world are a 8-9/10 story is a 3/10 maybe lessIf this game took some pointers and went for souls like elden ring type game then this would be something to play for years to come. bosses and mobs should really vary and make you guess on whats nextright now the replayability is really low.

author: That_Jeff
review: This game is a gift to the fans. The amount of details everywhere. I kept getting distracted just staring at paintings and looking at the architecture of the castle and Hogsmeade. It has a lot of potential and I hope they expand the game and make it a huge thing with expansions and stuff. They should definitely invest more on puzzles/secrets since the combat can be quite simple (yet satisfying and responsive).Exploring and finding stuff is what kept me moving around. Revelio is kind of OP for that purpose but still fun nonetheless. The Castle is MASSIVE and it's pretty much easy to get lost or just walk in circles without noticing. The music is also something to be noted. The sense of adventure and the first time you fly your broom are really magical. The essence of the Harry Potter universe is totally in the game. All that being said, the enemy variety is kinda meh. It kinda gave me the same feeling I had when I played Immortals Fenyx Rising. Exploring and discovering puzzles was fun. Combat was there to change the pacing a bit but the exploration and finding pieces of lore was where the fun was at.Anyways, Great game for the fans out there. Hopefully we get to see some Azkaban expansion where you have to catch fugitives or whatever. Go after fantastic beasts or even have like big conflicts between the houses. Who knows. Possibilities are there.

author: Alfie
review: If you're a Harry Potter fan, this is a must play. From the music to the combat, it makes for an incredibly immersive experience where you feel like you're living in that magical world. If you're not a Harry Potter fan, it's a mixed bag of a game. Visuals/music aside, it's an average AAA RPG with a fun  combat system and a decent enough story to keep things interesting (although it's slow going at the start). This game is very clearly a console port which is fine, but it sometimes makes the menus feel clunky to navigate with keyboard/mouse. If you enjoy using a controller, this game is ideal (I suspect this is an excellent fit for the steamdeck once we get some performance patches).The world is large and very atmospheric. It's full of character & charm with areas you can instantly recognise from the films. It is however plagued with generic repeatable exploration tasks, similar generic caves/"bandit" camps and generic fetch quests. They're fun initially, but the monotony sets in quite quickly - it could have done with a bit more variety. My only real negative gripe with the game is that your decisions do not matter, which makes for little to no replayability. There's no point in being an "anti-hero" as the dialogue and overall story/outcomes make you "the hero" no matter what you do. The real crux of the problem for me is that the player character's spoken dialogue and general attitude/behaviour throughout the game are entirely at odds with any "anti hero" choice presented in side quests etc. The developers clearly wanted the game to be played a certain way; the rest is just smoke & mirrors which is a little disappointing.So overall, pick it up when it's discounted if you're a non-harry potter fan. It's certainly worth a play.

Trying to alert the authorities.  I can autograph that.  A little gusty out there today,wasn't it, comrades?  Yeah. Gusty. author: Daeyon Dies
review: It's a magical experience is all I can say right now, truly awesome to be immersed in the Harry Potter world like this...CONS:- Stuttering on PC with more than adequate specs, though, with some tinkering it seems to be running better!PROS:- Everything else

author: Astro
review: Honestly speaking this is probably already my Game of the Year for one simple reason:It's a complete game. Wow, imagine that in 2023. Buying a complete game at launch? Heretical. But, this is the real deal. The story is great, the gameplay is phenomenal, the side quests are brilliant, and guess what? You actually earn costumes and skins by playing the game and completing challenges. In 2023, micro-transactions are everywhere. However, you can earn everything in the game simply by playing the game. I cannot believe we've come so far in the gaming scene where the concept of earning things by playing the game and not through micro-transactions is groundbreaking. Hogwarts Legacy is such a breath of fresh air in that regard. I'd recommend it on that fact alone.

author: Fox
review: Pretty decent game, but it could have been so much more.The part that's bugged me the most about this game was the lack of consequences. Nobody cares that you're a student wondering during the night; nobody really cares if you casting spells at students or teachers; and nobody cares if you break into locked rooms/buildings. Breaking into restricted areas was acted as such a big deal within quests. But once that's over and you're finished sneaking around the locked/"restricted" areas for the quests, it doesn't even matter anymore - nobody cares.(Also you're going to hear the same voice lines over and over again. Your character just won't shut up.)

author: Kadachiii
review: Absolutely stunning, and runs better than some reviewers might make you believe. It runs a benchmark when you open it to suggest settings, and I'm not noticing any frame drops even above the recommendation. This game has honestly let me live out my dream of going to Hogwarts and I am very happy about that. While the spell list could have been more expansive, I think the game more than makes up for it.On another note, the puzzles are simple but not too easy, and I also think the loading zones are phenomenal.TL;DR: Game is good don't listen to the biased people

author: turbodimon
review: Очень посредственная игра в открытом мире в оболочке гарри поттера. Если вы фанат, то наверно будете в восторге, а если вселенная не импонирует или вы к ней равнодушны, то можно проходить мимо этой игры. 9/10 тут никаких нет, игра на 6-7/10. 1. Совершенно типовой открытый мир, как и в другой AAA параше, выходившей за последние пару лет. Задания уровня "сходи вот сюда, убей 10 пауков, вернись обратно". Единственное отличие в том, что на карте нет миллиона вопросов, доп.задания открываются, когда ты находишься вблизи NPC, который его выдает (вблизи это пару километров). 2. Идиотская система получения заклинаний. Казалось бы, ты ученик хогвартса, наверно было бы прикольно осваивать заклинания, ходя на соответствующие занятия. Ну, оно так и есть, только проблема в том, что для освоения этих заклинаний тебе нужно выполнить дебильное задание из 1 пункта, а потом прийти на занятие, посмотреть кат.сцену, и выучить это заклинание. Господи, как же меня это достало под конец.3. Этот пункт вытекает из второго. ДОП.ЗАДАНИЯ НЕ ЯВЛЯЮТСЯ ДОП.ЗАДАНИЯМИ. В начале игры тебе ясно дают понять, что основные задания помечаются желтым маркером, а дополнительные - серым. Но, по мере прохождения, оказывается, что это не так. Под конец игры я уже четко сформировал себе набор скиллов, которые мне по нраву, и больше мне уже ничего и не нужно было. Но почему-то я перестал получать задания. Сначала подумал, что дело наверно в механике игры, когда новые задания ты получаешь через почту (об этом позже). Но оказалось, что доп.занятие не являются дополнительными! Вновь продолжить прогресс по сюжету я смог только после того как выполнил сраное задание на получение флиппендо (который мне вообще не всрался) и после того как выполнил задание на размножение каких-то зверей, похожих на маленьких драконов, уже даже забыл как они называются, чето на Ф. Почему игра заставляет  меня выполнять дополнительные, неинтересные для меня, задания, при этом ясно дав понять в начале, что они дополнительные?4. Совершенно идиотская система снаряжения. Цвета снаряжения в этой игре не имеют никакой значимости, тут нет смысла и интереса искать какую-то крутую легендарную вещь. В этой игре ты тупо апгрейдишь циферки, при чем под конец я уже вообще перестал менять снаряжение, потому что эти циферки на уровне погрешности. Уже в начале игры ты находишь легендарную вещь, у которой скажем, нападение 10. Чуть позже в следующем подземелье ты находишь зеленую вещь, у которой нападение 12, меняешь на нее. На этом построена вся система снаряжения и так происходят апгрейды на протяжении всей игры. Много профита от +2 к нападению? Нет. Спасибо хоть, что трансмог завезли, но, к сожалению, трансмог не привязали к слоту, а к конкретному предмету. То есть, когда ты надеваешь новую вещь, трансмог сбрасывается и тебе приходится настраивать его заново.5. Летание на метле. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, ну как можно было запороть такой важный элемент игры? А заключается косяк в том, что разработчики зачем-то налепили на локациях ТОННУ зон, в которых запрещен полет. При чем, это не объяснено никак лором, а скорее какими-то техническими причинами. Как же меня это задолбало под конец. В одном месте ты успешно пролетаешь через гору, а в следующем месте пролететь над горой ты не можешь, потому что БЕСПОЛЕТНАЯ ЗОНА. С какого фига она там бесполетная? Это не хогсмид, это просто гора, через которую я хочу срезать путь, но нет, так решили разработчики, и тебе приходится облетать эту гору другим путем, при чем это не всегда просто сделать, так как КАЖДЫЙ РАЗ когда ты садишься на метлу, с радара пропадает GPS навигация до цели. Казалось бы не критично, ты же на метле, просто лети к маркеру, но это невозможно как раз таки из-за бесполетных зон. Под конец игры были моменты, когда мне приходилось слезать с метлы и бежать пешком, потому что так хотя бы тебя за руку ведут путем, который можно пройти, а на метле этот путь порой бывает крайне трудно найти из-за бесполетных зон и из-за того, что с радара пропадает путь до цели, а открывать каждый раз карту, чтобы увидеть каким путем все таки можно пролететь, очень затруднительно из-за долгих анимаций неспешно открывающейся книги.6. Боссы/мини-боссы. Это кошмар и позорище. Через пару десятков игры и с обычными-то врагами уже наскучивает разбираться, так как к этому времени у тебя же сформирован набор скиллов, и каждый раз ты выполняешь одни и те же действия. Но боссы это какой-то новый уровень идиотизма. Вонючие тролли, например. Что они из себя представляют? Это враг, у которого есть всего 4 атаки (от двух можно только уклониться, остальные две можно парировать), у которого в десяток раз больше хп, чем у рядового врага, и против которого твои способности не наносят ни черта урона. С какой целью делать такого босса? Видимо, чтобы искусственно удлинить игровой процесс, другого объяснения нет. Я испытывал боль от каждой схватки с троллями: угрозы они не представляют никакой, это не секиро, уклоняться и парировать тут не составляет никакого труда, но твоему времени угрозу они представляют достаточно серьезную. Бой с троллем занимает минут 5-10, без преувеличений, все эти минуты состоят из монотонных действий, когда ты уклоняешься и парируешь, и между этим кастуешь на него весь набор своих скиллов, потом долбишь его дефолтным заклинанием и ждешь кулдауна скиллов, и так пока хп не упадет до 0. Тоже самое касается остальных боссов/мини-боссов, они тут называются "Печально известные враги". Название в принципе оправдано, печально известны они совершенно идиотским гейм-дизайном. Нет, чтобы называть врага боссом, недостаточно сделать ему миллион хп.7. Элемент веселого фермера. Спасибо этой игре, она вернула меня в 2010 год. Чуваки завезли в игру про гарри поттера механики из веселого фермера: тебе надо варить траву и зелья, чесать и кормить животных, чтобы с них упали ресурсы, необходимые для прокачки снаряжения (бесполезная прокачка, которая мало на что влияет), и самый прикол в том, что время на варку и кулдаун на следующее выпадение какого-нибудь пера из животного идет В РЕАЛТАЙМЕ. В игре есть механика пропуска времени, когда твой протагонист просто ложится спать на пол, тем самым меняя цикл день-ночь или ночь-день. Так вот, механика пропуска времени не работает на элементы веселого фермера. Если зелье варится 15 минут, то ты ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ будешь ждать реальные 15 минут своего времени. Господи, спасибо за cheat engine, который позволяет ускорить игру в 5000 раз и пропустить это недоразумение.8. Отсутствие рпг механик. В этой игре нет ничего от рпг, кроме создания персонажа в начале. Но это не твой протагонист, это заранее собранный за тебя персонаж, отыгрыша в игре никакого. По-моему разрабы до выхода игры говорили, что можно отыграть темного мага и вообще выборы на что-то влияют - так вот, нет, отыгрывать тут никого нельзя и выборы ни на что влияет, более того - выборов тут нет. Что из себя представляют выборы в 100% случаев в этой игре: ты убил 10 кабанов, пришел обратно к NPC, он задает вопрос "ну что, дашь мне эти шкуры?", на что у тебя есть два варианта ответа: "Да, конечно, держи" или "Да, держи, но ты мне должен заплатить". Ну это уже просто смешно, насколько жалкая эта "система выборов". Не знаю, может разрабы действительно считают, что выбирая второй вариант ты типа отыгрываешь злого персонажа, но нет, это не так. Касательно злого персонажа, в конце игры тебе типа дают сделать "злой" выбор, но, во-первых, он ВООБЩЕ НИ НА ЧТО НЕ ВЛИЯЕТ, и во-вторых, смотрится это совершенно неуместно, потому что на протяжении всей игры твой персонаж ВСЕГДА за все хорошее и против всего плохого, этот выбор в конце просто-напросто смотрится по-идиотски. Дописал бы еще пару пунктов, но к сожалению достиг лимита символов на обзор

author: Naraldeth
review: The game is not amazing by any stretch of the imagination. It's very basic in it's execution of combat, mission variety, enemy variety etc. The talents are absolutely useless. As far as an RPG goes it's not very intuitive either, you can either play goody-two shoes wizard, or slightly less goody-two shoes wizard. There aren't multiple endings, choices don't mean anything, house selection doesn't mean anything, you don't get dark spells until right at the very end of the game and even then you can only use said spells on pre-selected enemy varieties and can't go round 'blasting' every wizard you see like all the media outlets were hyping you up to believe. Flying controls are kinda crap too.The graphics are phenomenal and the world building is where the game really shines. Hogwarts has been meticulously crafted into a sprawling labyrinth  The combat for the first 10 hours is fun, after that you pretty much fall into 'simon says' style combat - Enemy puts up a purple shield, hit them with a purple spell, puts up a yellow shield, hit them with a yellow spell. It's all very basic.It's still worth the play and there's lots to do, even if the 'lots to do' is mostly running around finding obnoxious amounts of collectables that don't really reward the players time. If your an RPG fan, you've seen it all before and the game will introduce nothing new to you, you may enjoy it as a time sink in a wizard power fantasy.If you're a HP fan you'll also probably be obsessed.Looking at the game objectively through a lens it's a 7 or an 8/10 at the absolute best, but i've no doubt that many will be rating it a 10 purely on the namesake.

review: So I generally don't play much single player games and I am also not a big fan of Harry Potter, not that I don't like it.Anyway, the game feels amazing, there's so much to do (side quests, puzzles, secrets, other then the main story).I have noticed a few bugs after a few hours of gameplay, but thats to expect of such a huge game with so much content.I tried both on Keyboard and Controller, felt better on the controller, but both are good.The combat system is very well made, you do have to get used to the spells in orders to do combos, and the combos a talents that you can do a bunch of different ones.I can't think of any downsides, maybe the fact that they did not add quidditch, but I do think that in the future it's still possible to add since the quidditch field is in the map, maybe as some sort of update or dlcAnyway, game is tops 10/10 everyone should give it a try

author: Malix
review: I don't usually write reviews for games. I have been waiting for this game since the leaks and I can safely say that the game truly lives up to its name. If you are a potterhead/gamer since the childhood looking to live your life as a student in the Wizarding World and the castle of Hogwarts, then this is the game for you!PROS:- Story/Narrative is well thought out.- Graphics are insane/new gen high effort.- The amount of details in the castle, let alone the world outside the castle, is insane.- Combat is actually good when you put effort in the combos.- Enemy variety is not bad.- Exploration/side stuff doesn't feel like a hassle.- Immersion/atmosphere is amazing.- Customization is great.- A lot of content overall.CONS:- Optimization/Early access fps drops in certain areas around the castle.- Dialogue felt emotionless.- Lacked mini boss variety in the side content.- Cutscene camera work felt repetitive.- The music becomes not in theme sometimes.- Crashed once.- Sometimes your choices really does not matter (maybe changes dialogue but nothing else).I strongly recommend the game whether you watched Harry Potter or not. And yes I was the kid that imagined a new gen open world harry potter game. My dream came true and I shall rest at ease.Overall 9.3/10:)

author: JCMG
review: Go buy this game! If you like the Harry Potter movies and you wish you could explore the world as your own character sorted into your house of choice, this is the game for you. Sure, we all wished it was online so people could play this game together. Yes, like many of us we wished Quidditch was a playable sport in game; you never know, the devs might just grant our wishes in the future. Ill have fond memories of this game for years and years to come. Put the Call of Duty / shooter games aside for a moment and give Hogwarts Legacy a chance. With a Swish and Flick you will be sent off on a journey you will never forget.

author: Guac
review: I don't usually write genuine reviews, but this game I actually feel pretty strongly about. I'm not going to touch on the controversy regarding it either. This game has a lot of problems. Its story is horrid. It has the qualities of most Harry Potter stories - plot holes, needless wish-fulfillment fantasy, flimsy world building. But, despite this, Harry Potter succeeds because it has charming and lovable characters. This game doesn't have that. Everybody praises the main character for flimsy reasons. Here's an example: At one point in the story, we attend our first day of Beast's Class. One of the side characters, a girl who is obsessed with animal, continually praises us for being so good with animals - even though we've only brushed them and fed them. Then, when a Slytherin laughs at her, and we very blandly say "that's not funny", she shows us a secret which she's never shown anybody else! Which is strange, not just because we're a bland, uninteresting self-insert of a main character, but because we barely know each other at all. I've probably had two interactions with her outside of this, and all of a sudden she's showing me something she's never shown anybody else before! That's ludicrous! And the entire story is written like this! Even the teacher praises us for being so good. Is it because everybody else around us is so wildly incompetent that we come out on top? To the player's knowledge, we have little training outside of Hogwarts, besides a few tips given to us by the professor to "catch us up to speed", since we're transferring in as a 5th year (which also isn't given any explanation). You could say our massive aptitude to all of this is due to our secret ability to see ancient magic, but I just don't buy that - because besides our power, that doesn't make us likable. We're a bland protagonist with no character traits other than being nice. That's not all though. It's an "open world" game, but I have interest to explore the world. Because, see, most open world games have a plot driven by the world itself. That's what makes their worlds so intriguing, because we need to explore and become more powerful to progress. Games like Breath of The Wild, and Elden Ring, where the player needs to progress through the world, overcome trials, and sometimes just vere off to do something completely unrelated to the main storyline, that's what makes open world games so enticing. That you can get lost in it, and just become absolutely captured by the beauty of the world and what it has to offer. The world drives the game forward, and the plot is built around that fact. Not this game, though. This game is structured a lot more similarly to games like Spiderman PS4. That game was fantastic. The movement was amazing, the characters were decently fun, and the story was enough to keep you playing. In this game, the world is arguably more interesting than Spiderman PS4, but I have no reason  to want to explore it. You just play main storyline quests and have no reason to play the boring side quests or explore the boring world. I will say this though. The world is absolutely gorgeous. I don't say that lightly. It is one of the most beautiful games I have ever played. The combat is excellent as well. It's one thing which kept me playing the game. It's really well polished, incredibly fun, and it's very intuitive. The stealth sections as well! One of the first quests in the game is a mission where you sneak into the restricted section of the library with Sebastian (the best character). The level is a joy to play, it was really fun. The world really needs to be appreciated, but another criticism I have of the game is that you unlock things far too slowly. I wasn't able to fly around on a broom till I was about 20% of the way through the quests. Until then, I was forced to use the horrid fast travel system in the game. The fast travel system is absolutely awful. There are too many fast travel points for one, it makes exploring completely pointless. For two, the quests often require you to go back and forth from multiple locations, so you're forced to go through loading screen after loading screen for boring fetch quests. And it's such a shame because the broom flying is one of the best parts of the game. Once I unlocked it, I seldom used the fast travel system at all, because flying is just so much better. Despite all this, I recommend this game, because despite the fact that I find the game pretty bad in a lot of aspects, there is polish and beauty to this game. If the game were awful, I would've stopped playing it, and I wouldn't have reviewed it. I'd honestly give it a 7/10, maybe a 6. But one thing is for sure, it's not worth $60. Wait for a sale. $40 or less? Buy it. I recommend it. But at full price? There are so many better games out there.

author: ArtMagus
review: Despite all the controversy surrounding this game, I can’t express how much I LOVE it. It is a masterpiece of love and dedication to the wizarding world. As an artist, I understand how Art must be judged separately from the artist. Rowling has some terrible ideas that are objectively harming people. That being said, this game was made by an enormous team of people that have nothing to do with that, and who put genuine love into this creation. I know it has its flaws and some elements that drive controversy but I hope people can set that aside and know that you are not a bad person for playing this game. You are not a bad person for loving the wizarding world despite what some people say. Stories are a reflection of ourselves and humanity has plenty of flaws that will show plainly in the stories we make. Hopefully, those stories can teach us to be better people in the face of those flaws but that isn’t always the case. This game has many positive and inclusive stories that shine above any of its less-than-sterling shortcomings. So with that rant out of the way, this game is SO MUCH FUN. I haven't had this much fun with a game in a long long time. Not only that, I can't think of enough words to say just how boundlessly beautiful it is. This is the Hogwarts that all of us who grew up with the wizarding world in our hearts dreamt of for so many years. There is only one thing I want. Only one thing I NEED. They need to make this Hogwarts into a multiplayer virtual reality experience!!!!!! I’m Deadly serious. I want to walk down these halls and genuinely feel like I'm there. GET ON IT AVALANCHE SOFTWARE!!!!!!!!!!

author: Frith Ra
review: First off, I know that for some this game's mere existence is divisive. But I chose not to let the beliefs and actions of the author of the source material overshadow what Avalanche Software set out to do. This is a project clearly made by fans for fans. It demonstrates passion, creativity, and innovation. All while not employing predatory monetization practices that plague the industry of late. This is the kind of game that needs to be encouraged, not shunned.Hogwarts Legacy is an absolutely sprawling RPG with so much to do. I'd honestly compare the scale of it to something like Skyrim. While the Hogwarts castle itself has plenty to explore and discover it goes so much further than that once you get out into the larger world around the school itself. It paces itself in a way where you gradually unlock more aspects of the game as you progress through the story so as not to overwhelm the player with everything at once. It rewards exploration and experimentation. Even when you find things you can't interact with or complete just yet you know that later on you'll have a reason to go back and see what rewards are waiting for you.There's also so much customization in this game. While the character creation is perhaps a bit limited by the lack of facial sliders you still get some decent options to be roughly the kind of witch or wizard (or even a blend of both) you want to be. Throughout the game you find and unlock various clothing styles and very early on get the ability to change the appearance to any other style you've previously collected. No looking like you walked through a wizarding thrift store just to have the best stats. You even get to choose the style of your wand and find different styles of wands for it. You get to find different kinds of brooms to ride. Then later when you unlock the Room of Requirement you get to customize that space freely with all kinds of decorations that you find as you explore the world.I could likely go on and on about everything I've discovered in the game but even with my 30 hours in at the time of writing I feel as though I've only just scratched the surface. While all of the side content and exploration is of course optional, the benefits to completing as much as you can make the whole experience that much more enjoyable. Managing to 100% complete this game will be a feat unto itself so you can expect dozens if not hundreds of hours to go into a single play-through. To put it simply, this is one of the best open-world RPGs I've played in quite some time. Hogwarts Legacy shows proper respect to what the books established whilst also putting its own twists on the wizarding world at large as it tells its own story. It is simultaneously a love letter to fans and a standalone experience people who have no experience with Harry Potter could possibly find themselves getting invested in.Avalanche Software has created something truly special with this game. If you are on the fence, please don't let others make you feel as though you cannot give it a try. This game is a very different interpretation and makes every possible effort to have something for everyone. The work the developers have put into this should be acknowledged for their own merits and I believe that this will open even more opportunities for them to make fantastic games. Maybe if we're lucky they'll even add on some more DLC to Hogwarts Legacy and improve or add in the things they didn't have time for prior to release.

author: R1B3R
review: It is everything I, as a Harry Potter fan since I was a kid, could've ever hoped for.The amount of details, the love they have given to this game, full of life and wonderful, it's just incredible. If you're not a Harry Potter fan you can enjoy this game, if you've watched the movies, you'll find many familiar details and you'll enjoy it even more, and if you've actually read the books, you'll find 100x more details.And if you've done all of that dozens of times, as I have, it'll take you two hours to go from one room to another because you'll be looking for the smallest of details that you may miss.I'm just thankful to be able to explore this game. Hope you enjoy it as much as I do ❤️*UPDATE*After almost 100 hours of playtime, with my Ravenclaw run at 100% completion, and another 50 hours or so of watching Hogwarts Legacy content, I can safely recommend this game for all the Wizarding World fans out there. If you're not a fan and you want to know how good is Hogwarts Legacy as a videogame, there are a bunch of things you might want to be aware of before buying:- It's not a game made for tryhard gamers. The game, even at Hard difficulty, is not challenging at all. They didn't want it to be and that's fine, it's a game that you can enjoy, gameplay and combat are satisfying, but again, not challenging. This is not Elden Ring.- The main story is not the best. It's probably not the story's fault, it could actually be great, if it weren't for the NPCs. This gotta be something they work on because NPCs look dead, they only have two different expressions, it's like they can't show emotions at all. It's crazy to think that the different beasts that they've added have more life that NPCs.Besides the NPCs problem, I don't think they've given the real feeling of being a Hogwarts student. I've felt more like a Hogwarts tourist, because most of the time you'll be outside of school grounds. More classes could have helped, a points system for the house tournament (this should be mandatory for the love of god), and definitely more missions inside the castle.- Open world is absolutely stunning, everything about the design, environment and music is superb, award worthy for sure. But it's repetitive with the puzzles like Merlin Trials or Ancient Magic Hotspots. It's just doing the same thing over and over only to give you more hours to play. Some of them like the balloons or astronomy tables are the perfect amount, but I don't know what were they thinking with Merlin Trials.- Performance: I don't think there's much to say about this, I don't understand how it runs better on a ps5 than on some elite pcs with a 3080 and all that. In my case, with a 3060TI, i5-12400 and 16GB RAM, it's been difficult to play in ultra. Dropping from 60 fps to 20 or worse, the stuttering is constant... Once I completed my first run (I wanted to enjoy the game first) I went from ultra to low and installed a mod to boost performance. This last step made a huge difference and now I barely get fps drops, but they should fix it, not force most people to end up using mods. Remove Denuvo now that it doesn't serve any purpose. And this game has to run on the Nintendo Switch, I can't wait to see the Hogwars Legacy 2D version!

author: TillyBucker
review: Hogwarts Legacy is one of the best open world games I have ever played. It's so refreshing to see a new game release that isn't buggy to hell, or still in early access. Across my current 34 hours I have only come across 2 bugs and both haven't been major and have given me a good laugh so I see that as a positive. The only negative aspects worth a mention is that the voice audio could use some work, the pitch setting on the voice makes your character sound like a cheap voice changer, and some of the lip syncing is a little poorly animated. As well as that the game could be better optimised, however that will come with updates.Overall, the game has been a staggeringly positive experience and I can't wait to play more

author: UNCLE B3N
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a highly anticipated action role-playing video game set in the wizarding world of Harry Potter. The game offers players the opportunity to immerse themselves in the magical world and experience life as a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. With its richly detailed environments, engaging story, and the ability to cast spells and explore the iconic wizarding school and its surroundings, Hogwarts Legacy is a great game for fans of the Harry Potter franchise and action role-playing games alike. The game also features a wide variety of customization options, allowing players to create their own unique wizard or witch and explore the vast world at their own pace. Overall, this game is a must-play for fans of the Harry Potter universe and action role-playing games.

The game blends exploration with puzzles, combat and slight horror very well, although for some sci-fi, fast paced oriented players I could see this game not be their thing.The game has a trans bar tender, a lesbian researcher and a literal shop where you can change every facet of your appearance if  you messed up in character creation, also doubling as a trans fantasy. Whoever boycotts this game because it harms snowflakes has no idea what they are saying and is regurgitating what they've been told, sjw gtfo.

author: Kellamity
review: I am in love with this game but so many won't be.I am trying to achieve everything but so many will get bored early.I am playing in semi-stable 60fps but most will play with barely 20fps.Lore is amazing and pulls so much from what's already established but at the same time, the main story is not that captivating.Many characters are lovable, well constructed, and amazingly voiced, others are just shallow and uninteresting, all of them animated with a stick up their bum - but feminine running animation is gorgeous and light.Does this make Hogwarts Legacy a bad game? In my opinion not at all - but the target audience is not what one would expect.Harry Potter books are specific - they are mostly slow-paced, heavily descriptive stories full of wonders and a lot of time to proceed with the story. Up until the last chapters we are exploring the world of Wizardry with a great deal of affection and curiosity.Avalanche Software took great inspiration from this and is revealing their creation rather slowly and unlike any other modern action game. At first, we got some action, then almost none but this is used to create enough space to wander - and there is plenty of space to wander. The first time they allowed me to run around Hogwarts undisturbed I just walked to discover what was hidden in the castle. It's a rather peculiar choice regarding hard-core gamers but the ideal solution for Potterheads, younger audiences, and casuals. You will get immersed only if you are willing to accept a slow tempo of progression.This is a very pretty game but not graphically and I will elaborate a little about that. I tried low settings, medium settings, ultra settings, and even raytracing but to be honest that doesn't matter. This game is not pretty by current graphic standards set by game-benchmarks. It is stunning and gorgeous because of its environmental storytelling and details. Oh, so many details! I don't mind occasional stutters and drops to 20 fps when I can just stop for a second and admire armors humming, galaxies swirling around under the roof, or owls flying between buildings. Hogwarts Legacy has an ambiance unlike any other game and a carefully crafted world full of so many details, easter eggs, references, and small events you will want to stand around and to nothing to admire them. You don't need 60 fps, raytracing, or ultra in 4k settings for that - they are working just as well on low in Full HD.I love/hate Avalanche that they made me progress the main story so far to unlock so many big game mechanisms but at the same time I didn't get overwhelmed by them too early, I got to adjust and use everything available for me at each point. I can't remember the last game that encouraged me so smartly about using everything I am learning and at the same time showed me what I still have to learn. I was constantly but gently getting pushed forward by curiosity and anticipation. Each time I progressed I was heavily rewarded all around the map! it is such a great way to make you WANT to go back there and explore!As I mentioned this game will match mostly specific audiences - so many people will drop it because of a slow pace, lack of understanding of source material, and annoyance caused by unstable performance. Everyone else will love it so deeply and will get lost in Hogwarts during magical beasts' caring, potions brewing, or flying around just to admire the view. I love that it turned that way because sometimes you just need a slow-paced, comforting game for an awful evening at home. This game wraps you in a warm blanket of magic experience, lets you wander like a kid, and with a gentle hand pushes you to keep exploring.

author: Nero Kunivas
review: An excellent experience from start to finish. I've yet to fully wrap up all loose ends at the time of this review, but I simply must put it out there how well made and refined this game is. Hogwarts Legacy features a very enjoyable and well put together combat system, a great story, wonderful characters and of course the timeless world of Harry Potter to explore to your hearts content!Be it Hogwarts, the all-wizarding town of Hogsmede or even the grounds beyond, there's so much to explore and it is worth every second. The character creator is great, the companions you befriend along the way are truly brilliant and well fleshed out in their personal storylines, as well as the game not being afraid to get quite dark when it wants to. It also handles its representation very well if I say so myself, you might not even notice it when it crops up.All in all, Hogwarts Legacy is a game well worth your time and your money. I'd highly recommend buying it, to experience the game and support the devs in their future endeavours!

author: Schmiesen
review: If you're one of the guys who just wants a RPG that captures the world of Harry Potter very welland offers great immersion thanks to the world design, soundtrack and graphics - just buy the game. The only thing you need to pay attention to is your rig. While the game looks pretty good, compared to some other, older games, I don't think that the requirements are justified. If you want to know more about the game, here we go:- the gameplay is pretty much that of Arkham Knight but instead of leaping to an enemy and kicking him in the face by pressing X/Y, you just wave your wand by pressing R2. Batmans special moves (X+Y for example) are now R2+Y/X/B/A. Pulling off combos makes your ancient magic meta fill up which you can then use to almost one-shot most opponents. Make sure you enable off-camera targeting though. - the devs tried to avoid any pronouns in the game - which, among other things, lead to pretty mixed results in the dub division. Some monologues could've been ripped straight from the books/ movies (quality wise) but whenever a NPC talks to you, it feels like they treat you like an infant. The way some people in the writing department phrased things, makes me feel that my character isn't taken seriously by anyone.Furthermore there is some big overacting going on here. First drama class cranked up to 11, that's what it feels like.- be aware that there still some issues with the stability of the game! Try to make use of the manual save function in this case. - The world is big and there are like 4-5 different ways to reveal secrets around the map. You can either collect scrolls by using I-forgot-which-spell (elemental sight for those who play Genshin Impact) or use your spells like fire to light up something that will then reward you with a scroll or a chest. Much of lore to be discovered, probably less than half actually read. It is fun but nothing ground breaking.- for those of you interested in the LGBTQ aspect of the game: there is literally no restriction in how you can customize your character. You can even pitch your voice and give yourself transition marks. But you can't make some people happy, can you? It's just impossible.The trans teacher however feels like they've already finished a male teacher and gave him a wig. If you ever turn in your homework last second, that's what he feels like. Should you buy? Besides the great immersion, this game offers nothing really new or ground breaking. But it is above average, so it is worth more than "on sale". And since the world isn't small, you'll get a lot of hours from it. So yeah, 60 bucks is a fair price.

author: Loki
review: I had some issues knowing how to start this one, so I suppose just jumping straight to it, eh?The game: It is vast, with tons of exploration options, discoveries, puzzles, minigames and tons more to do. I have clocked 43 hours (as of when the Review was written [Updated at 52 hours and finished the story]). I still have not finished the game, because I keep getting sidetracked. I continue to find interesting little places to explore, or a puzzle to solve, and I forget what I was doing, why I was doing it and how I ended up where I would be at that moment.SO enviroment is well done - although I do miss the occasional conversation to over-hear as you walk past a group of people, and not just a random comment. Non the less, the game is still beautiful and well done - but still a little lacking.Character Creation: A lot of options. Face, hair, scars, eyes, eyebrows. So many options! And not to start on the hairstyles! My god! Created a second character, and I spent about an hour just trying out hairstyles and colors. However, I do miss the options to alter nose, jawline, chin, lips, eyes and ears like in other games. Most modern games gives the option to customize smaller pieces of the face, and not use a pre-set. However, it is alright - but lacking in options.Graphics: Beautiful! (Unpopular opinion: Games don't have to look realistic to be beautiful. But it has to be well done)Other in game functions: Well, usually I would have a romance category, but I don't think that is something you will find in this game. Wand: I thought it was a standard twig I would have to wave around to make sparks. Boy was I wrong. Once you get to pick up the wand, you can customize it. Wood type, what it looks like, core, length, etc. Doesn't stop there though - because I thought I had to be stuck with whatever twig I chose as my companion, right? Hah! Then the handles came into my life and I now how an unknown amount of handles for my wand I can cycle through at will.Clothes: Although you have a uniform once you get to hogwarts, you can still alter the look of your robes and wear anything you like. Although I don't fully understand why they chose to do this when the school literally have school uniforms, I digress. Bit more creativity, and no complaints about that. (Tip: Get all the keys and house tokens - you will not regret it).Exploring: Well, as I stated first, the game is vast. The world is big and have a lot to offer for the easily distracted human. I am one of those. I have lost count of how often I have been on my way to Hogsmeade, and gone off course because I found something interesting that led me to something else that was interesting. Soon enough, Hogsmeade has been forgotten and I have gotten stuck in a two hour exploration adventure fighting trolls and goblins... Where was I going with this again? Oh, right... So, I though "If I have to walk to explore, i will tear my hair out". But no - you do get a broom - and a hippogriff. And you can fly them at will at the school ground and around the world, with few exceptions (Blasted Hogsmeade....).Room of requirement: I fear this room. I really, really do. Because I am afraid I will be stuck in it for HOURS decorating... And I have...So, now that I have touched what I felt was most important, I want to touch a few things that I found frustrating. The game is choppy. It drops frames wildly. Which is a nuance. No matter what I did to play around with the settings, it still happened. Even when Steam and the game was the only thing I was running. So the performance could be better. A lot better. Please fix this!Although the game does offer a lot, there are things that is lacking. Character creation is one. Player choice that matters is another, consequences for learning forbidden magic is not a thing (but it should be - I should not be able to cast it in front of Professor Fig and he be fine with it. Quite frankly, he should be outraged about me using crucio...) and more ending options would be good. This ads re-play value, and right now, it only ads value in the fact that you can get achievements specific to each house, a small quest for each house - but little else. Which means, you want to achievement hunt for the 45 current ones, you only have to play up to a certain point and that is it. With more endings and with one or two hidden endings would make people play it even more.I was slightly disappointed to find that quidditch was not a thing this time around.The next thing I really wish was NOT a thing in the industry is this entire "exclusive". It infuriates people, and PC players are often the ones ending up with the short end of the deal. Like this time. Player store in Hogsmeade to sell stuff you find for a higher price? Like, WHY?! The amount of times I had to LITERALLY hunt for valuable clothes to sell is stupid. Please fix this. And the Felix Felicis potion? Why is this made exclusive? And I am not even going to go into the extra dungeon console got, because that infuriated me.Hopefully the stall and the potion will be made available for PC players as well - though I suspect not. However, I hope the devs do make a DLC with more spells, more potions and new places. Along with an update that could possibly make it more of a risk to learn the three unforgivable curses and give us the option to be good, neutral, evil or chaotic evil. Because playing as a Slytherin I should be able to feel like there is not a single grain of goodness in me. As a Ravenclaw, i should be able to feel like I am the "nerd" of the school. You get what I am getting at.Still, all in all - although the game is a little lacking, I still find it amazing. There is much potential that was wasted, and I do hope the devs do possibly re-visit that at some point. (The author said hopefully knowing it would never happen)Also, just a small disclaimer: I do NOT support the author and creator of the Harry Potter universe or their opinions. However, I still believe this game is amazing and I will say that if you want to try, do it! It is well worth the time and money!

author: Val
review: There are performance issues that need to be addressed (AMD Ryzen 5 5600 X and 3080 Ti, sometimes I experience stuttering), that being said: the wizarding world atmosphere has been captured .The gameplay itself isn't anything revolutionary, but it works for this game and that's what matters.Audio and graphics are top notch (please fix the performance issues ❤), helping with the immersion.There's something that makes me slightly uncomfortable as a 40 yo: the playing character really feels like a 14 yo: props to the devs on this but, while lowering the voice pitch helped a bit, being able to have them look sightly older would have been nice.

author: nessie's mom
review: So far one of the best games I have ever played. It reached my expectation in most aspects. Though I do wish that we could play Quidditch but the game is fine without it too. I think the developers did a great job with it. I have waited a really long time for the game to come out and I just must say that it's beautiful.From the world-building to the small details that many may not even notice at first. I love how we can change our appearance based on what we want and how we want it. With over 30 hours in the game and holy hell I am in love and whoever's hating on it has never played a good game yet in their life. I am thankful that I can experience what I dreamed about as a child and be a wizard, running around, exploring, and enjoying the breathtaking world of Hogwarts Legacy

author: Sanraith
review: "Brilliant"For me the game feels like a mix of Witcher 3 and Legend of Zelda: BOTW. Lots of exploration, fun combat, puzzles at every corner and a seemingly infinite chunk of the wizarding world.My favorite part so far was finding the bridge on the way to the gamekeeper's (soon to be Hagrid's) shack and using my memories from the films to navigate the terrain. Everything is gorgeous and it feels like you are really there.The only issue with the game is the performance. I could not get a consistent 60+FPS with Ultra settings @4K on capable hardware (RTX4080, 13th gen Core i7, 32GB DDR5), so I had to use the more agressive upscaling option to keep the frame dips above 60fps.

author: Arktag

author: TappLuck
review: Will not lie, there are some pretty generic aspects of this game.The game mostly relies on it being an HP game which should be considered before purchase. If you're not a Harry Potter fan it's somewhat likely that you will not enjoy this game as the open world, albeit large and full, can be a big chore at times and combat, although fun, can get repetitive.The character creation screen allows for a lot of customization but it also is simple at the same time.The combat is fun when you have a plan of how you want to go about it, but as mentioned above, it can be a bit repetitive.Hogwarts is a big place. I mean really big. Which is why it has many fast travel points as they can really cut some of the travelling if you find it tedious. I personally enjoyed walking around the school as I always wanted a full HP RPG.The characters are relatable for the most part and I found myself feeling bad for them more often than not as the companions specifically have engaging stories and intriguing goals with sometimes questionable methods of meeting said goals.The spell learning process immediately returned me to my childhood as you need to trace a figure to learn a spell, much like old PC Harry Potter games.Speaking of spells, the game has a specific system in combat in which only certain colored spells can break certain shields the enemies might have. For example, Confringo which has a red color on its symbol can only break red shields, and Levioso, which has a yellow color on its symbol can only break yellow shields. There are methods of bypassing these shields entirely, which are ancient magic and unforgivable curses.There's no penalty of using unforgivable curses. No one even comments on it in game but for role-playing sake I only used those when I'm with a specific companion or alone.The voice acting is amazing, you can really feel the anguish of characters when they need to be that way.The facial animations of certain characters are fantastic.The way you learn spells aside from the tracing method specified early on is by attending certain classes and completing special assignments given to you by your teachers.The castle and the world in general have so many secrets to discover as well. It took me a good long time to finish some side quests and the story itself but I imagine 100%'ing it will take a bit more.

review: The greatest game that I have played for the past two years absolutely meets all my expectations. I was also pleasantly surprised by the optimization; while it is not perfect, it is good.Thank you very much, developers!

author: Dairen
review: Early impressions and thoughts.Am a nonbinary person. Was pretty upset for a long time about this fictional world being tainted by obvious things; those books were a great comfort to me growing up, even in some hard times. So, I was torn. After a hard night that involved literally crying on discord, I decided to separate the art from the artist (a phrase I've heard in the world of extreme metal, where your Spotify listens may be sending some pennies to racist murderers etc) and honestly I'm really glad I did.At the end of the day, it's just clearly a good game, with a lot of work and love put into it. + Great, fast, mobile, flow-y combat+ Very good character customization, aside from the voice's pitch shifter ending up sounding robotic in some lines+ One of those games where you can insert your avatar or OC into an established fictional world. Downright cathartic for your inner child.+ Story is great so far, arguably more interesting than the actual HP movies+ Lots of modern graphics options, ultrawide support etc+ Tons of accessibility features+ Performance is greatHonestly, no negatives with the game so far.If any part of you or your inner child wants to give this a try and have fun with this, I urge you to separate or compartmentalize your feelings about that monster of an author. An experience like this is worth it, your purchase honestly will have 0 impact on the world anyway. You'll feel much better letting go of those nasty feelings, and may even un-ruin parts of this fictional world that I know was so big for so many of us as kids.

author: Fizzy Deweasel
review: 40 hours in, I can definitely say this game deserved a 10/10. I grew up with Harry Potter but I wasn't much of a fan. My wife rekindled that interest in HP and this game just made it grow STRONGER. Graphics, combat, story, side-quests, it's great!

author: DataDietz
review: The game that you've always wanted from Harry Potter is finally here.I'm only 16 hours in at this point, but I can tell you that I love everything.  The missions and combat really make you feel like a wizard and like you're plopped right in the middle of the Wizarding World.  I am having such a blast just chaining combos of spells and getting a hit of dopamine when I finish it off with that perfectly timed blast.The story is intriguing and well fleshed out.  I don't want to say more to avoid needing spoilers, but it feels right at home within the current Hogwarts Lore and is a welcome addition.Open world elements are there but definitely reigned in, you can tell that the devs played this game and know at what point a certain mechanic stops being fun, and at that point you get a new game mechanic or mystery to solve and the cycle starts anew.It's a really good game and I'm happy to see the development team see success.  A lot of love went into making this game, and it is completely felt and absolutely appreciated.

author: Siggyy
review: DO NOT LISTEN TO ALL THE NEGATIVE PRESS/COMMENTS!!!!. This is by far the best RPG/any game I've played in an extremely long time. There is a tangible feeling of the love that the developers put into the story and environment. For any Harry Potter fan this will blow you away. Any RPG/Story driven gaming fan will love this as well. The game checks all the boxes for me. Beautiful, great story, challenging and everything in between. I've seen people complaining about "20-30hrs" of game play which is absurd. If you play the game how its intended to be played there is easily 70+hrs of enjoyment out of it. If you're on the fence hop on down and just get the game. Highly recommend and hopefully the success they've seen brings us future DLC's and even a future MMO or something similar! Way to go Avalanche!!!!!!

author: Jmee
review: I'm stunned... It's better than I expected. I encountered only 2 trivial graphical bugs such as NPC pathing (not important), but everything else has been amazing so far.Combat seems fun, intuitive, reactionary while not being overly complex, yet not too simple and you still feel good once you master it.Incredible graphics (flowing coat/robe/scarf fabric, finally a game delivering), realistic human NPC (and the character creation, I love making a custom character in a game that still allows for voiced story narrative, it's so immersive.) The environment detail is amazing, I've probably wasted too much time simply marveling at things. Hogwarts itself is so huge I had to drag myself out of it (unfinished exploring) to get a change of scenery outside (and the outdoor map is also pretty huge.)Later on, I got to the flying (damn!) and open world exploration and puzzles (some of which are very innovative and do some new things, unique mechanics with their spells. Kudos to whoever thought those up, I love seeing new stuff, as a jaded ol gamer who's mostly seen it all.I'm pleased with my purchase, and I'm not a real Potter fan. I only watched the movies out of boredom and curiosity. I actually disliked the whole polite uniformed British kids aspect of Harry Potter (I didn't grow up with it), I'm mostly more of a D&D/general fantasy fan. Yet (and this is for the people who like me thought maybe they wouldn't like it if they're ambivalent about HP) this game is still enjoyable. It gives me Skyrim feels, it scratches that itch (as well as dips into many other genres. The Room of Requirement gives me all the decorating/builder vibes I enjoy, the Beast vivarium touches that Pokemon gotta-catch-em-all feel (and, little did I know, you can also keep building and decorating outdoors in your pocket-dimension vivarium biomes!)My friend has been playing it with kb/m while I'm playing it with my controller, and both handle well. The movement is still quick and fluid, it's clearly not a crappy port or something, there's no clunky consolitis (by comparison, the wide-turning horrifically-slow clunky movement in GTAV. Rockstar take note and do better for GTA6, because if they can't outdo this, I'mma laugh). The UI and menus are equally quick and still easy to navigate.I'm extremely impressed. And from an unheard of studio, too (plus so many people were trying to claim it would flop because they had no other decent games under their belt to speak of).And side bonus of pissing off people who think they have any right to dictate to me what I do or buy. I am vindicated that not only is the game moderately good, it's friggin' phenomenally good. GOTY, bet on it.My hardware is ~5 years old so not cutting edge, and I am still able to play on High settings (I did have to sacrifice and turn off all the raytracing. Gorgeous reflections, but was hitting the FPS too much.) The game is playable while still looking great if you don't have an ancient potato. Don't be a buffoon with your settings and then blame the game. It could use a little optimization, but to me that would be icing on the cake, I'm having a great time right now as is.My only disappointment so far is that the puzzles have been too easy (I love some of the mechanics and effects, moving floors, floating platforms, etc.) I realize it's also an IP popular with kids so I'm not asking for insanely tough puzzles, but "a little more" would've been nice.The open world treasure caves are severely lackluster, dip in and grab a chest with no difficulty, and always the same layout. I remember people complanining about Elden Ring's "samey" dungeons -- those fools had no idea how good they had it, those were big with depth and often unique layouts (and actual danger. Everytime I go in one, my wizard is like "This could be dangerous..." And I'm thinking YES PLEASE WHERE?)Hogwarts does everything else exceedingly well, except for those open-world-map caves that barely seem worth the time visiting.
