author: KittySteph
review: No spoilers. Thus far, I've played about 8 hours of HL. I've been having a great experience and find the game to be very fun. The visuals are beautiful, the map is huge, and I love the character customization. One unique aspect I really appreciate is that each person that has a voice line actually speaks instead of only having the subtitle (like some other games). The game right now on PC is definitely having some FPS issues and some bugs here and there, but that's honestly to be expected for a brand new game of this size. On PC it does lag terribly at times to the point its not playable and it would be nice if the developers paid attention to this issue rather than ignore it. This game is definitely more fun if you're able to get immersed and into the role of a wizard/witch! If you love fantasy or Harry Potter for that matter, this game is definitely for you!

author: Kaungsan99
review: As someone who don't know anything about Harry Potter , this game really made me want to watch all the movies. Let's get some negatives out of the way... First , stuttering and framerate drops during the early access days , characters could be written a bit better ( then again , I haven't finished the story so I will see if it got better ) and the first few hours before you getting a mount. But as soon as the game opens up more , the game just get better. Combat is solid. Really simple and easy to understand. But as soon as the different enemy types start grouping up on you , that "easy" combat becomes a great resource management mini game. Switching up different spells on the fly for different enemies , using plants and potions that you grew yourself to gain an edge in a battle while countering the spells is really satisfying. It can get chaotic but as soon as you gain control of the fight , it becomes a dance. Great customization for your character as well. Great fashion designs , beautiful environment and places to explore. Also... you can pat cats and have magical animals as pets. Pre-ordering this for 70$ was a wise move for me.

author: BowtieFungi
review: I've enjoyed it so far! From someone who prefers Lord of The Rings, Star Wars, and Doctor Who over Harry Potter, I thought why not give this a try since there's no good games out for the universes ( till "Jedi Survivor" comes out). I'd say this game is a 9/10 for me! The combat is my favorite part. As much as I wish this was a Lord of The Rings, Star Wars, or Doctor Who game, I'm glad I got this and have had a blast with it!!

author: SpookyWolf
review: Nearing the 30 hour mark I thought it might be time for a review. I honestly don't know where to start, this game has been a dream ever since I was in Kindergarten/Middle School, back when HP was in its prime. So excitedly, I have been waiting a long time for this. -Graphics are phenomenal, the details put into every room, hallway, hamlet, even just walking along a path its just gorgeous and thought out. Almost like a movie except you're the main character. Albeit I have a pretty decent computer, the stuttering can get pretty annoying and less enjoyable, especially when you're in the middle of a large fight and have to time all your dodges and spells. It gets hectic, but I assume this will be addressed with a future update in the near future. I haven't really noticed many glitches, aside from the occasional random NPC vibrating in the ground (which was honestly hilarious) but I've only seen it once. -Combat. It's an easy to learn hard to master type of combat I feel like. Yes it's not the widest variety of spells but mastering the combos is really satisfying and impactful to your fights. And the feats that pop up before your fights help you explore spells you would otherwise not use in combat. I have only unlocked one unforgiving curse (Crucio) and so far it hasn't impacted the flow of combat at all, but I think the other 2 might make things easier depending how powerful they are. -Lastly; Story. I'm in love with it, it's interesting albiet dark in some parts. Which really adds to the severity of what's going on in the world. Side quests are no different, all of them have a story to them and not just a "go fetch this, go kill this" type of quests. Your character has a lot of dialogue and just, life to them, and the responses you can select are just as great. You can be kind, witty, or downright mean in some of the dialogue. Which is a nice character building for your imagination. This game is a 10/10 in my book, and I still have a ways to go! I will probably update my review when I finish the game. Thanks for reading. :)

author: FailureToReport
review: Yes, absolutely yes. The only things I am a little let down by:Main character voice is screwed, there's a slider to adjust pitch but adjusting it just adds an echo effect to it, so just leave it alone. Your wand choice is permanent which can be a little of a bummer if you get hours in and want a different look. No quidditch makes big sad, but I can get why, flying in the game is REALLY not great because it's not mouse steering, you use WASD for directional and have to use Space and Control for altitude. It would be a nightmare to play quidditch with these controls.Spell bar feels way too small. You can only memorize 4 spells at a time on a spell bar, and it never feels like it's enough, I think 5 or 6 would have been a better number. As you progress the story and unlock talent system you can "learn" 3 more spell bar slots, but then you have to mouse scroll wheel through them all which feels clumsy. Other than that, the world looks beautiful, the story has been interesting. I do wish there was more sense of belonging to your assigned house, and I've heard there's no real "Good / Evil" play impact which is kind of a bummer. I was hoping the Dark Arts bundle was a sign that you could be real bad. Also on the topic of houses, I wish there were more "companions" you got to know and adventure with in your house so it didn't feel SOOOOOOO much like a single player adventure. Coop would have been amazing also....

author: mikperiard
review: I think it's a shame that some will miss out on this game due to so  called controversy. For once a game that was worth 100% of the hype. Other than iffy pc performance the bugs and issues are rather minimal (given I've been playing early access and today is day one).We all finally got our letter to hogwarts 11 years to late for me but worth it. The combat is great, the story Is good so far, the world truly feels huge and alive unlike other games... (rhymes with sniper funk). author: Jorunnr
review: It might be the best course for you to enrol in this year ;) Enrol yourself today for some wizardly action! Extremely beautiful game full of places to explore, riddles and mysteries to solve. It is a very enjoyable experience because of a its setting - ghosts wandering around, moving paintings on the walls and much more. "Not so open world" feels alife with a lot of interactable and animated magical objects.  The combat sytem is quite original and feels really fluid - various combos and different ways to defend yourself. However, combat is not mind-blowing and it feels somewhat outdated - spells are fiddly to control as you accumulate more and more of those. BUT ... you can ride a Hippogriff - dope and sold!

author: J
review: My sleep schedule isn't great, but I'm happy. Hogwarts Legacy is a very intimate experience that immerses you completely in the wizarding realm. Overall, Hogwarts Legacy is a must-have for lovers of the wizarding world and everyone who has ever wished to be a wizard (Like I have for 25 years). The attention to detail, from the spellcasting animations to the character motions, creates the impression that you are genuinely living and breathing in a magical world. Hogwarts Legacy is absolutely enchanting and unforgettable because of the your personal connection to the game's universe and characters. 9.5/10

author: Zacattack4781
review: This could have easily been just another cash grab. Another means of using a VERY popular franchise and just people impulse buying a game that has no heart, but that's not the case at all! This game holds it own, and shows a lot of love was put into the development of it. Performance can be an issue if you don't have a decent graphics card, and I hope they add the ability to pause cutscenes instead of just skip.

author: DynamicAsteroid
review: Everyone can go home now. Game of the year.But in all seriousness, the game has some stuttering issues so you may need to fiddle with your settings a bit to fine tune things, at least until a performance patch. I have an Intel i7-11800H & an RTX 3060. Running the game on High settings has minimal stuttering, but is at least playable thus far (I have not had  combat yet, so this could change). Clothing tends to freak out at times too. Make sure your graphics card is up to date as well.The House Sorting (  ) and Wand Selection (  ) are a bit lack luster.  Overall, both felt more like token additions than anything well thought out or meaningful, at least to me.That being said, game play thus far has been enjoyable and I really like running around looking for all the secrets. Dialogue is fun and decently written. Graphics, while run on high (not ultra due to stuttering) are beautiful. The music is absolutely on point. My favorite piece of music is a classical guitar or lute played by a painting you just walk past!! Absolutely fantastic!!Character creation is, in all fairness, a bit limited. My friend and I, however, managed to make younger versions of ourselves to the point we were a bit creeped out with how alike they were at times.But again,  So, does anything else really matter? ;P

author: bcK
review: Initial impressions:- Great atmosphere- Great soundtrack- Love reading and finding out about the school and listening to conversations- Graphics overall are pretty good- Open world map is awesome. There's a lot to do- A lot visual customization to be done throughout the game. It feels really good and refreshing to change your looks especially with the transmog system- Combat feels really good. I'm playing on hard and it feels nice.The not so great items:- Terrible UI. It was designed for console. Map, HUD icons and elements are way TOO BIG and intrusive. Can't edit that.- Performance isn't great in some places. Frames are dipping a lot but if you wait, they stabilize.- Bad implementation of RTX. Tbh, it doesn't even compare with RTX implementation done in other games. The good news:- The not so great items above can be fixed pretty quickly and should within the first month.Overall:If you're a fan, this is amazing. The world feels alive. The school is fantastic and characters are fun and well designed.

author: Chelinka
review: Let me start off by saying this game is obviously gonna have a different effect on HP fans than others, but even then this is a pretty good game.So far the only things that have bothered me are the massive drop in performance during cutscenes and the fact that your character is a bit too cheery (I would've liked to choose a personality type or something but at least they give you some dialogue options that aren't as nice).What I really like about the game:- It's a pretty big open world for you to explore and it looks and feels amazing- I'm always running around completing challenges and puzzles to get rewards instead of doing main quests- the field guide collection helps you learn more about the wizarding world if you're interested- you only have 20 slots for gear in your inventory (which can be increased with challenges) but every gear piece you sell will be added to your transmog collection, which is available from the start. Meaning you can equip the best equipment you have, then press the corresponding button in the menu on top of the piece (F on pc) to open the transmog menu and you can choose to make that gear piece look different. So you don't look goofy af- when doing side quests for people you can choose to keep whatever you retrieved for them to be a duck or even ask for a reward (or you can just give it back for free but who doesn't want to be compensated?)- The combat feels really smooth and once you master it (which is really easy), you can take on enemies several levels above you

author: Jdyn
review: This is a great game. I understand all the controversy and I myself am non-binary/genderfluid and I obviously do not want to support JK rowling, but I've been a harry potter fan since I was like 5, for far longer than I've known shes a piece of ♥♥♥♥. This game is actually quite inclusive too, I was able to make a character that fits me perfectly. Now past all that onto the actual game. This game is basically if you took any other modern massive open world game like TW3 or RDR2 or skyrim and made it harry potter themed. Id personally say the world is probably a little lackluster compared to TW3 or RDR2 but this games world blows stuff like modern AC games out of the water. The story isn't amazing but it is engaging enough to keep me opening the game. The combat isn't necessarily where the game shines but it is definitely one of the most unique styles of combat I've seen in a game especially recently. Its a bit like mass effect or the old dragon age games just ranged only and much more polished. The place where this game really shines is how much depth all the systems and world manage to have while still being lore friendly, magical, fitting to a T rated game. Will this be my 2023 GOTY? probably not, but this game will probably be in my top 5 for this year. Overall Id give it a 7-8/10. Id say if you prefer to play more mature games and/or aren't a harry potter fan this game will probably sit closer to a 6-7/10 for you personally. If you have no issue playing games intended for everyone and are a harry potter fan this game will probably sit closer to an 8/10.Overall verdict: Hogwarts Legacy is a great modern open world RPG with an engaging enough story, pretty deep systems, unique combat, and manages to be pretty inclusive to the LGBT and POC despite it being shrouded in controversy. 8/10Should you buy this game? If you are a harry potter fan or love contemporary open world RPGs Id say its probably going to be worth full price. If you are not a harry potter fan and you think often times open world games are empty or boring Id say its still worth a pickup if you're an RPG fan just probably at a lower sale price.

author: Nimso

author: Indigo
review: It's Hogwarts. All of it. Every last nook and cranny. In perfect detail. What more is there to say?

author: Yorgøs
review: I don't even know from where to begin with this. I have always been a massive fan of the entire HP universe that J.K. has managed to create. I remember back in the days when I started playing Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone on my good old PS1 console. That game back then felt magical and I was extremely happy with what it was. Down the line I also played the rest of the games, all the way up to Half-Blood Prince.The overall experience in those games though, was lacking in a lot of regards and this is where Hogwarts Legacy comes in and fixes the shortcomings of the previous games!Consider this review biased since I have always been a massive fan of the books and the movies and at the moment I'm writing this review I have to say that the devs have definitely managed to exceed my every expectation!Here's a dissection of my experience so far:I could write all day about this game's positives but it would take ages to include everything. In any case, while the pros definitely outweigh the cons here are some things that need a bit of work:I tried my best to come up with more negatives but it's really tough for me to find any. As I said, I'm a huge fan of the HP universe so do take everything with a grain of salt.Hogwarts legacy is a great game. Avalanche has great passion for the universe and it shows through the game. The exploration, combat, personalization and so forth really make this game shine. Be prepared to get immersed in this amazing and magical open-world and uncover all the mysteries it provides. It is well-worth purchasing and I'm sure it really won't disappoint!I would like to end this review by thanking both Avalanche as well as Warner Brothers for making this game possible. I have always been waiting for a decent HP game and they finally made my dreams come true!To all my fellow witches and wizards, I hope you enjoy this masterpiece as well as I do! Until then:

author: RedfordGames
review: (Edited 02/17/2022)I loved this game. This was an enjoyable experience from start to finish. I have not 100% the game but, got the final cut-scene it was a decent grind but, it really was a fun experience.Pros:I enjoyed the story overall. The characters were really flushed out and felt real to the world you play in. The story quests leads to an epic confrontation with the big bad and a climatic finish to the story. I felt compelled to do all my class assignments and experience a lot of the side quests since they were all so interesting and unique.The combat was a unique highlight as all the spells felt unique and help you string together some interesting combos for max damage. It is easy to learn but, difficult to master. The forbidden spells, if you choose to learn them, are some of the must OP spells in the game. They are the most rewarding to learn and use. However, even if you don't learn them the amount of useful combat and non combat spells you learn can give you a unique edge and all situations. Not to mention your characters plot armor spells that only they know are super powerful and basically a one shot for anyone you come across. All in all it is just a ton of fun to wreck some scrubs with all the spells you have at your disposal.The open world and vast and unique. I was surprised that the game was so large and every area felt it has a story to share and was absolutely marvelous to look at. Even as someone that did not pay much attention to the books can appreciate the magic that goes into making everything you look at feel unique and alive.For playing this game three days early, I was shocked on how well this game ran. I didn't have a single major crash or game breaking bug to report.The immersion for the most part was top notch and I could really feel my self being absorbed into the Harry Potter universe. I watched the movies and read some of the books so I can say that this world gets a thumbs up on overall presentation of the lore and magic you experience.The challenge system is very detailed and super helpful for you maximize the fun you can have. As the game actively rewards you for participating in any game mechanic you find your self doing. While giving you additional ways to test yourself in fun and meaningful ways. The rewards you receive are great as well. This can be in the form of cosmetics, xp or enhancements to your abilities.Cons:(Edited): Some of the performance issues have now been addressed and major and minor NPCs that disappeared for me are no longer gone.There are other minor issues that have to deal with immersion that are small but enough to notice. The developers seemed to be very conscious of being diverse and inclusive but, it did not seem very historically accurate for the time game is set in. Like, why in the 1800s were the students and faculty so diverse and inclusive but, fast forward a 100 years to the books/ movies and the diversity is gone. To me that has ramifications I don't think the writers thought about. Also, all Ugandan wizards and witchs don't use wands and the spells are just as powerful. Why does no one adopt this line of magic casting if it is so good? They say its because it just feels more dramatic with a wand but, being able to use magic without a wand would make things way easier and more effective. Another issue I could not figure out for the life of me was the implication of a potential Trans bar keep. Though this did not make since as the 1800s were not known for transitioning people back in those times. This led me to believe its just an unfortunate woman with a males voice. (Edit: This immersion issue is easily fixed by switching languages before her scenes. The other dubs for this game give this character a female voice actress and she sounds much better this way) Also, people would not be very open about gay relationships as the 1800s were not very accommodating to those kind of people back in the day. I understand the developers want to make a game that feels like the world we live in today but, it does not feel immersive for the time frame, that is all. The story has some issues with your choices not mattering to much. I was disappointed to realize that an evil play-through was determined by only one dialogue choice. Not to mention it just changes the end cut-scene in minor way. Yet you still act like a hero and are treated like a hero in the end. So none of the relationship quests, side quests, learning of the forbidden spells really matter in the grand scheme. (Edit: picking your house only changes the color of explosion at the end and the exclusive quest that you get for the house is shared with every other house just with a slightly different coat of paint.)The combat felt clunky at times towards the later game as you can have four different magic slots with different spells in each. However you get four of these spell wheels and you have to pick the best magic slots you need for the situation. So you are switching out spell slots in the heat of combat while actively dodging, breaking shields, and keeping juggling going. If you are on an easier difficulty this may not matter as much but, the combat becomes pretty brain dead at that point. Which can be fine for some but, I feel it is clunkier are higher difficulties. I am will have to accept skill issues on my part but, still there is a lot manage for even a casual such as my self towards the later game.In any open world game I do not like invisible barriers preventing me from exploring further. I much prefer the infinite scenery loops that other open world games have done. Also, some of the villages start feeling kind of the same after you visit the third random village on the map. Only a few of them I really understood why people would want to live there. The rest were different but, not different enough.Conclusion:Overall, this game is very fun. Beyond some technical issues, minor immersion problems and a flawed but fun combat system. This is a must recommend. You can spend hours enjoying the open world and seeing the secrets this game holds.

author: FabulousFlyingTreeWithSlippers
review: One of the best/worst game I've ever played.. But let me explain:Very cool graphics, the design, the buildings, the various styles; Hogwarts is amazing, the amount of detail is mind blowing.Mechanics are mostly bad. Just to say the least, why don't I have a slot for all my spells? Why do I have to keep out some, but then I'll need what I left out because of a quest, a puzzle or something like that, forcing me to swap spell slots continuously! Why? Give me more spell bars, or give me a way to hotkey them however I want.Something I dislike so much is the lack of a moral mechanic. You don't have repercussions when doing bad things like stealing, violating someone house, refusing to return/retrieve stuff keeping them for yourself, using "unforgivable" curses..Story is very lacking. Who are we? Where are we from? You are locked in selecting, sometimes, between 2, sometimes 3 choices during some of the quests but that doesn't change much if anything at all. Your character just feels shallow and you don't really have a choice in the story. Also many side quests are just the same, same thing with puzzles, caves.. Everything is a rinse and repeat.It's cool that you can customize the look of your gear, very good actually! But, again, everything feel mostly the same, you don't really have a great choice, if not for some of the more unique items.. But it's just not enought. I almost unlocked every item but I keep wearing the same things because there's not enought diversity or because some item I might wear it's just modeled wrong and it cripples out somewhere (like on the torso) in a very annoying way.Also mounts! Very cool, right!? But.. Why giving me a beautiful hippogryph when there's no real benefit in it? I can just mount on my broom which is faster and more agile. Sure mounting beasts is cooler! But when you are out there doing the same old side quest/puzzle/cave you get bored very soon. And why in the world I cannot look up or down while flying!? What is this atrocity!!??One last thing that I find very annoying is that this game has very evidently been made with consoles in mind. Everything suggests it, from the fact that you are locked to 4 active spells at a time while unable to hotkey them as you like, to the fact that there's content (not much, tbh) locked unless you are connecting from console. Kinda "meh"..Overall I think this game could be much, MUCH more. Not that they didn't have examples of great mechanics (see Red Dead Redemption) to add to the game (morality *COFF*..).Almost everything feels bland and unfinished or rushed.I honestly don't feel like recommending this game at full price.

author: Tzeer
review: Ok, this has been driving me crazy for seven movies now, and I know you're going to roll your eyes, but hear me out: Harry Potter should have carried a 1911.Here's why:Think about how quickly the entire WWWIII (Wizarding-World War III) would have ended if all of the good guys had simply armed up with good ol' American hot lead.Basilisk? Let's see how tough it is when you shoot it with a .470 Nitro Express. Worried about its Medusa-gaze? Wear night vision goggles. The image is light-amplified and re-transmitted to your eyes. You aren't looking at it--you're looking at a picture of it.Imagine how epic the first movie would be if Harry had put a breeching charge on the bathroom wall, flash-banged the hole, and then went in wearing NVGs and a Kevlar-weave stab-vest, carrying a SPAS-12.Have you noticed that only Europe seems to a problem with Deatheaters? Maybe it's because Americans have spent the last 200 years shooting deer, playing GTA: Vice City, and keeping an eye out for black helicopters over their compounds. Meanwhile, Brits have been cutting their steaks with spoons. Remember: gun-control means that Voldemort wins. God made wizards and God made muggles, but Samuel Colt made them equal.Now I know what you're going to say: "But a wizard could just disarm someone with a gun!" Yeah, well they can also disarm someone with a wand (as they do many times throughout the books/movies). But which is faster: saying a spell or pulling a trigger?Avada Kedavra, meet Avtomat Kalashnikova.Imagine Harry out in the woods, wearing his invisibility cloak, carrying a .50bmg Barrett, turning Deatheaters into pink mist, scratching a lightning bolt into his rifle stock for each kill. I don't think Madam Pomfrey has any spells that can scrape your brains off of the trees and put you back together after something like that. Voldemort's wand may be 13.5 inches with a Phoenix-feather core, but Harry's would be 0.50 inches with a tungsten core. Let's see Voldy wave his at 3,000 feet per second. Better hope you have some Essence of Dittany for that sucking chest wound.I can see it now...Voldemort roaring with evil laughter and boasting to Harry that he can't be killed, since he is protected by seven Horcruxes, only to have Harry give a crooked grin, flick his cigarette butt away, and deliver what would easily be the best one-liner in the entire series:"Well then I guess it's a good thing my 1911 holds 7+1."And that is why Harry Potter should have carried a 1911.

author: Classy Yacht Maker
review: (Not a Harry Potter fan. Never saw the movies or read the books) This game has lots of fan service which doesn't affect me.The game is a collectathon looking for pages. I got to level 15 before I unlocked the skill tree from the story( which you can't respec).Combat is very easy since you just have to focus in the red or yellow circles. Your spells auto target and there is no animation for healing. So balancing attacking, dodging/parrying, and healing isn't a thing in this game. Boss battles are the most interesting part of combat.As a sucker for collectathons, open worlds and a Gothic/ Victorian architecture I could recommend it as a high mid tier game. Could possibly get better later on but I haven't beat the game yet.

author: DaveSkii
review: A Harry Potter fans dream comes true. This game is unlike any other.Easily a 8.5/10. with the 1.5 due to a few FPS drops before Day 1 patch and a few pop ins with NPCs and Very repetitive tasks in the long run-I would like to see NPC improvement slightly, However they are more than manageable and aint an issue.But everything else is CLOSE to perfect and you can tell the hard work put into this game shows compared to other games.The open world is so alive and feels how it should be, Fantastic and magical. One of the best Single player RPG games since RDR2. This is HUGE and can easily make you spend tons of time doing things you wouldnt even think you could do. Easy to get side tracked.I am very excited to see the future of this game with updates / DLC and hopefully mod support. But money well spent.

review: This game is a lot better than I'd expected it to be. Go in with an Open mind and you will likely enjoy this, if not then maybe it wasn't meant to be. 9/10 Easy.

review: Tem tudo que a gente queria, conteúdo, mapa, dublagem, quests primárias e secundárias, muito upgrade, combate DELICIOSO, gráficos perfeitos e a ambientação... meu DEUS que design MAGNIFICO, tem tanto detalhe e o mais importante: pouco o que melhorar.  Eu só posso recomendar que parem de ler e vão logo jogar... kekNum futuro, se forem inseridos Quadribol e um Multiplayer, isso aqui vai ser uma máquina de fazer dinheiro pra Warner.É a Primeira pré-venda em anos que não decepciona, mas vale citar que existem sim muitos problemas de otimização no PC, ao menos até este momento(Pré-Release da Versão Deluxe).

author: Merlin
review: Wizarding World is a universe that I've loved since I was a kid. When I look into the game from this perspective, the map & the content are quite detailed and the plots & the context are directly parallel to the Wizarding World as J. K. Rowling allegories and narrates and also there are detailed explanations on many subjects within. The graphics of the game is really great and impressive and it proves that real effort has been made in terms of physics, effects, particles, animations, photorealism. On the other hand; There are a few shortcomings in gameplay; for example, interactions with other characters and objects are quite weak, main character continues to appear and talk as if nothing had happened after the events that affected him/her physically/mentally, the plot "I think" is weak; I don't think it has a story that makes people curious and draws in. In overall, I would definitely recommend the game to Wizarding World fans and I recommend general to check the gameplay/review and decide but I think this game is great and lot's of fun.

author: ✪SaltyFuck | ShitCunts.com™
review: Great game but has its flaws, I would say it would be the perfect game if the devs worked on it for another year or 2, just a little hollow with the NPC interactions. Most NPC's don't even know your there, they will not even give you a "hey back off" if you attack them, which kinda makes the game not feel truly free/real like Skyrim. I would love to go around "Avada Kedavraing" or attacking people that are not "enemies" but cannot as the attacks just go right through.A big flaw is that there are a lot of areas that are just empty and boring, an example of this is the "Three Broomsticks".I bought a "Butter Beer" In the main story cut seen, I assumed I could visit it like a tavern anytime I wanted. But when I came back to the Three Broomsticks I can't actually buy anything or interact with anyone, its just an empty room with people sitting on chairs and the owner wiping tables.All I want is to buy some "Butter Beer" and just sit down and relax :( other than these flaws "which i'm hoping will be solved with mods", its a very good game, having a lot of FUN I would say 8/10

author: Darth Meht
review: Hogwarts Legacy is the harry potter game i've been dreaming of since i was 10, aside from the extreme frame drops and performance issues its currently facing, this game has drawn me into its magical world from the very first 20 mins.From the addictive fun combat to the amazing characters and quests to the whole atmosphere and setting the game has succeeded in capturing all of the aspects i was anticipating, the most amazing thing about the world though is how much  its alive with always something happening wherever I go whether its in the castle or even outside, its also one of the fewest games which has seasons implemented throughout the whole experience.If you love the world of Harry Potter and/or open world RPGs, then this is your dream game

author: @TimonHub
review: The game is amazingSmooth experience which is awesome specially now days because, even AAA companies releasing half baked games and charging people full price for it.they really nailed the feeling of the movies (HP Movies) in the game, from designing the environment to the characters/3D assets models , very well done-Level Design 10/10-writing 9/10-Gameplay Mechanics 10/10-Voice Acting 7/10 (Needed More Work - feeling wise)-Facial Animation 7/10 (Needed More Work - feeling wise)-Graphic of the game is Beautiful All around the game is Perfectly designed and MOST IMPORTANTLY it's fun and entertaining

author: Cynical Whore
review: I cannot overstate how excited I was for this game. Like this is literally everything I wanted when I was 12. The opening alone had me floored (Thestrals handled perfectly) I am about 20 hours at time of writing level 18 but I have spent SOOO much time just wandering exploring. I love everything ive encountered. How you learn new spells, the combat and combos. Special shout out to the Talent System for actually offering interesting upgrades not just X does 5% more damage. We have genuine upgrades. Fire spells that also create a ring around you, improvements to stealth, extended combo windows. Utilizing the environment and things like plants feels so fun. How enemies interact like hanging a giant toad monster from his tongue with levitation to turn him into a pinata essentially. I will revisit this when I complete the game but, I cannot understate how much I enjoy this. OH AND THE ROOM OF REQUIREMENT. Its so much more than I expected I had to have spent at least an hour and a half just customizing mine.

review: Truly awesome game, the beginning really gets ya and slows down for a bit but then the game really opens up in a crazy way. Combat is great, exploration is addicting and customization could be better but its solid. Get the game!!

author: Koernerbroetchen
review: I played this game since the 07.02 and I instantly fell in love. I already started having tears in my eyes when I heard the music at the intro. This game is a must for every Harry Potter fan or for people who love magic. The graphic is absolutely wonderful, the interactions are magnificent. So many small little details, even the side quests are fun. Everyday there is a new discovery I cry about - today (10.02) I cried bc I saw a Diricawl. Now onto some important stuff~Raytracing made the game laggy for me. When Raytracing was on, I had 17FPs. Without Raytracing and Quality on high I have 60FPS. Other than that there are small lags when the world is loading but nothing big.My specs:Intel i7-7700K 4.2 GHz16 GB RAMGeForce GTX 1080 TiA little thing that's not so great is, that you can't drink Butterbeer at the three broomsticks. Over all I love it a lot. I will spend a lot of my time in Hogwarts, even if it's just admiring the scenery, gardens, paintings and so much more.

author: Garg
review: First things first. If you are fan of Harry Potter, then just buy this. By far the best game of HP license and I think it will stay that for a long time. Get this, don't miss out.For anyone else, this game is well crafted open world rpg similar to Witcher 3 or latest Assassin's Creeds, having its own spins on exploration and activities, very enjoyable (and on highest difficulty - even challenging) combat, solid story and side missions, lots and lots of customatizations for your teenage avatar, fun traveling system via flying on broom (or something else *wink*) and beautiful soundtrack.I could say something about visuals, but I am playing this on potato so all I can say is... It looks nice.Buy this game now, buy it on sale - just don't sleep on it.

author: Filthy Franco
review: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING IN EVERY WAY!!! GAME OF THE YEAR CANDIDATE FOR SURE! I cant remember when I played a game this many hours and found myself surprised with every encounter. So many things to do that the repetitive nature that I had feared doesn't exist in this game. In fact, I realized I was in love when I spent hours just exploring the world on my flying broom.

author: manic fLaws
review: Disclaimer: I've been a Potterhead for 2+ decades now, my bias is through the roof, and thus this review is ONLY of use for people who also see all things Wizarding World through rose-tinted glasses so rosy they're practically Charmed.Pros:1. The game is beautiful; from the delightfully twisting and staircase winding castle, to the expansive grounds, the ethereal Forbidden Forest, the rolling expanse of the open world, and the charming and colorful Hogsmeade, the game LOOKS spectacular, and I often find myself just panning the camera up, down, and around to take it all in.2. There is so much to do; from classes to crafting and everything in-between, there is a wonderful assortment of things to do and you can do them largely in whatever order you like once you've unlocked the task. I've spent hours making potions, traipsing through the countryside gathering ingredients, chatting with random people along the way with this or that quest to do, and I don't think a single one has been a 'Bring me X number of Y' thus far.3. Combat is engaging; there are rarely 1v1 fights and thus some measure of defense is required for nearly every battle, whether it's a spell or a simple dodge roll. For those of us who aren't particularly swift or attentive, there's a dreadfully convenient visual marker for when you're about to be hit, allowing you to get out of the way or throw up a shield like a professional. The game rewards you for making use of spells from time to time, meaning there's actually a reason to do more than spam the DPS button.4. Nostalgia everywhere; if you're anything like me, seeing familiar surnames and imagining you're conversing with the ancestors of characters you know and love (or love to hate) is a burst of sheer enjoyment. New and familiar flora and fauna abound, you'll get a laugh out of the first time you encounter the beloved mandrake, and possibly make a high-pitched sound of love when you get your hands on the ever-adorable Puffskeins.5. Character creation is better than expected; a special mention belongs to whoever oversaw the hairstyles, being able to make black characters with hairstyles in the right textures with attractive hairlines is a rare treat in any game and the fact that Hogwarts Legacy nailed this with an actual ABUNDANCE of afro hair styles is just icing on what was already a delicious cake.Cons:1. There are so many places to sit, a variety of chairs you can customize and decorate, but you cannot actually SIT. This is a terrible oversight in my opinion, I would desperately love to be able to sit at my desk or table, or by the river, or outside a Hosgmeade shop.2. Clothes cannot be re-colored. This isn't unique to this game, it's just a bit of a shame that in a game with so many clothing options, your favorite outfit can't be changed to your favorite color.3. The game will end. Seriously, this is my biggest Hogwarts Legacy fear, that the game will eventually end and there is nothing on the horizon to fill the Hogwarts-sized hole in my imagination that will be left behind.tldr; I love this game, all my homies are playing this game and you should too. JK Rowling was not involved in the creation of this game, but the entire world was born of her imagination and all of the things that make the game great are a direct result of the countless hours she spent, as a struggling single mother, penning the children's series that her fans know and love. Nothing anyone says can change the fact that she is present in every nook and cranny of this project, or the fact that her name will forever be remembered alongside the Wizarding World. Stay salty!

author: Danytsu
review: ---{ Graphics }---☑ You forget what reality is☑ Beautiful☐ Good☐ Decent☐ Bad☐ Don‘t look too long at it☐ MS-DOS---{ Gameplay }---☑ Very good☐ Good☐ It's just gameplay☐ Mehh☐ Watch paint dry instead☐ Just don't---{ Audio }---☑ Eargasm☐ Very good☐ Good☐ Not too bad☐ Bad☐ I'm now deaf---{ Audience }---☑ Kids☑ Teens☑ Adults☑ Grandma---{ PC Requirements }---☐ Check if you can run paint☐ Potato☑ Decent☑ Fast☐ Rich boi☐ Ask NASA if they have a spare computer---{ Difficulty }---☐ Just press 'W'☑ Easy☑ Easy to learn / Hard to master☐ Significant brain usage☐ Difficult☐ Dark Souls---{ Grind }---☐ Nothing to grind☐ Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks☐ Isn't necessary to progress☑ Average grind level☐ Too much grind☐ You'll need a second life for grinding---{ Story }---☐ No Story☐ Some lore☑ Average☐ Good☐ Lovely☐ It'll replace your life---{ Game Time }---☐ Long enough for a cup of coffee☐ Short☐ Average☑ Long☑ To infinity and beyond---{ Price }---☐ It's free!☑ Worth the price☐ If it's on sale☐ If u have some spare money left☐ Not recommended☐ You could also just burn your money---{ Bugs }---☐ Never heard of☑ Minor bugs☑ Can get annoying☐ ARK: Survival Evolved☐ The game itself is a big terrarium for bugsIn the beginning, this game blew me away. I had high expectations for this and only small things disappointed me more than large. The castle exploration is so so much fun, let alone exploring Hogsmeade and everywhere else the map has to offer. The challenges and collections keep you super involved while you're doing side quests as well as the main story. The combat is incredibly fun, with a bunch of different spells to use and upgrades for them that make them more interesting. 8/10 recommend this to any Harry Potter fan, or someone who likes a fun, immersive RPG! I only wish there was more quality of life in the NPC's, as well as minigames to do, Quidditch, more beasts, more customisation options as well as more rpg elements involved, like rewarding you more in dungeons rather than opening a loot box to get something you most likely have already, at a lower level. Even 'companions' didnt feel like companions, the only time they traveled with you was for their storyline, which doesn't really make them companions.Now that I've finished the game, I gotta say that I feel like the story is around a 7 out of 10. It started off strong, but it honestly kind of fell off, felt rushed, and a lot of canon lore being thrown into it just because. There's some major fps problems with the game too, even on high end, the best money can get you PC's, definitely needs some polishing. Bit disappointing, but still a fun experience.

author: Kries
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a third-person action-RPG set in the same universe as the classic Harry Potter series of children's books.Hogwarts Legacy is just beautiful, fun & nostalgic. Discovering a movie landmark or easter egg just puts a huge smile on my face. This game is all that fans wanted for years and they finally got it.Amazing and massive open world game in wizarding world as a student attending Hogwarts.The world is full of little quirks and magical goings on be it enchanted hedge trimmers or musical instruments setting a cosy happy vibe wherever they are.Music is amazing.Combat is smooth and realy enjoyable.Visuals and environment are crazy detailed and biggest selling point of this game.Story is not fantastic but its still very good.Yes, I like it!

author: Lyedar.gif
review: Hogwarts Legacy, a game that for once delivered on it's promises. Trailers have for a long time showed off a game that is not delivered on release day. But Hogwarts Legacy is everything it wanted to be. Truly be a Hogwarts student, go to class, learn new spells, complete assignments. Of course it wouldn't be Hogwarts without secrets, so there are many to find across not only Hogwarts grounds but the surrounding area.Content is spread out in a way that you can truly dive into each element before the next one is introduced. Potion making, Plant growing, Item Identification and more await. I know Beast Caretaking is there somewhere but impressively I haven't reached it yet and I've played a good amount of the game.The story is interesting and exciting. I want to learn more about what's going on in the main story and find more of the side content as it's fun and very lore building. Everything building you up as this student of Hogwarts whose learning new magic.I recommend this game with no hesitation. There are a few stuttering issues, but as I play it slowly goes away.

author: [EXD] Frix
review: I don't want to give a negative review but i'm certainly not praising the game either.If you are a Harry Potter fan the game is worth it. If not, i can't really say i'd recommend it.From here on out the review contains spoilers so.The lack of options in conversation is extremely disappointing, while there was no honor system i wish that you would have had a much greater impact on the game. The only noticible difference i saw was that there were multiple ways of approaching JackDaws Rest. I got the owl tower.The room of requirement is just a time consuming mess and honestly it just becomes an endless supply of potions and upgrades. There is no legendary gear for you to go and aquire like in skyrim with some seriously unique items.All the treasure dungeons are super lame where you just enter and there is one chest.Dialogue is straight up reused. When you finally decide to let your fellow classmates know what happened in the prologue it is the exact same voice line word for word.The world doesn't really seem as lived in and  reactive as i would have expected. Thinking of games like Red Dead Redemption 2.Another point where this game fails compared to Red Dead Redemption is how unrewarding learning new spells feel. The only time i felt like i had earned something was when i learned the unforgivable curses by completing that quest line.Other spells and charms are just tossed in your face on a day to day basis and given to you with basically no effort. The tasks that you were given are so generic and there is so... so much filler content. I think my biggest pet peeve is the spawning of brooms and mounts. That they just well... rather magically appear instead of coming to you. Again coming back to Red Dead Redemption 2 where you call your horse and it actually comes running to you from over the horizon.Inferi can't be killed with Avada Kadavra until you set them on fire.... would expect the killing curse to actually kill anything that isn't a main story boss.All the main bosses in the game are easier to beat and the trials. Than some open world encounters. Large amount of enemies are more troublesome than bosses due to lack of crowd control options. There are soo... soo many different types of enemies that are taken down in different ways it is really difficult to master. On top of that, they are hard to distinguish visually.

author: Jojo
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a game that has been the subject of much excitement and anticipation among fans of the Harry Potter franchise. And I must say, it does not disappoint. This RPG is a testament to the creative potential of the wizarding world, offering a rich and immersive experience that transports players to the magical realm of Hogwarts.The attention to detail in the world-building is nothing short of astonishing. From the grand castle and its various classrooms, to the bustling Hogsmeade village and Forbidden Forest, the game captures the essence of the Harry Potter universe with aplomb. And the character customization options are simply spellbinding, allowing players to craft their own unique experience and become the wizard or witch they've always dreamed of, thus making it truly your legacy.What truly surprised me was the fun and fast-paced combat system. The game offers a variety of spells and abilities, each with their own unique animations and sound effects. The fluidity and excitement of the combat is truly a sight to behold, and is sure to leave even the most jaded gamers spellbound.All in all, Hogwarts Legacy is a game that is not only a must-play for fans of the Harry Potter franchise, but also for gamers looking for an intelligent and captivating RPG experience. It's a game that will leave you enchanted, bewitched, and begging for more. So grab your wand, put on your cloak, and get ready for the adventure of a lifetime at the most magical school of all- Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

author: Jaevwyn
review: Lets get the sticking points out of the way. Yes the game has a trans character. Yes your character is referred to at all times with they/them pronouns. GET OVER IT.Now the game itself! absolutely loving my time spent thus far, the castle is full of little secrets and hidden things to find, i think theres a convincing amount of life in the NPC's to allow yourself to immerse into the game and lots to find outside of the castle too. I recently got access to being able to capture Magical Beasts, and also learned that there are "Shiny" (differently coloured) beasts, so my story and side quests are on hold whilst i play hogwarts themed pokemon for the next 10 hours. The games performance is far from perfect, even on my respectable system, but doing the quick DLS fix (look it up in the forums) has helped a ton with that. The camera is very vertically restrictive when flying which can be a bit tedious in places, but flying as a whole is very satisfying... gorgeous views! The combat is very fun, the way to combo spells to keep enemies airborne is a good time, the downside is that a lot of enemies kinda just stand around whilst you do this... I am playing on hard and only use health pots during bosses and am not struggling at all, it is satisfying still at least.The puzzles and objects that can be interacted with are a nice break from everything else going on around you, I have found a few times now that sometimes I do not have the right spell for the job, encouraging me to revisit areas keeping each comb through an area feeling very fresh.I have tried a few of the mini games, such as setting times on the broom or summoners court, and enjoy the gimmicks in those, hoping to see more of them! I very much enjoy the Harry Potter franchise, regardless or the political issues surrounding it, but feel as if this game can definitely be enjoyed by people new to the franchise too.The biggest downside of this game is the damn steam forums, its a toxic cesspool. Avoid at all costs.

author: Dr.Omba
review: Worth it for that one funny spell

author: Twee Sesamzaadje
review: This is one of the few games where a long introduction to the mechanics isn't annoying at all.Even tho it's a totally different game, the overall feel takes me back to the old Fable 1 days.So far, the world feels alive, with lots of small animations and rewarding exploration/visuals. At heart, it is still your typical modern open world game, but it's done right.Good voice acting and movie like cut scenes. Overall it is better than I expected. It does not feel rushed and authentic enough to the IP (I admit the IP does boosts the games fun ratio a lot here). But as with all open world games, some XP farming mini quests e.g. pressing 'revelio' at a specific place, get a bit tedious over time. The battle system feels solid and as long as you time your doges and blocks right, there is lots of freedom about how to use your other spells/potions/plants. I think hard mode is pretty forgiving and should be treated as the default difficulty for most players. Going for the other modes for a more chill experience.Puzzles in quests are fine, a bit BoTW style, but the internal dialogue is bit too hand-holding for my tastes. Sometimes, in quests when I'm just looking at the nice scenery for a few seconds, I get this voice-over solving the puzzle already. Many puzzles in the open-world could have been far more interesting, but I think they went for the "fun for all ages" approach here. It would be nice to see what the mod community can do here over time.Mouse and keyboard controls are good, for a console optimized game, with the exception of broom-flight. Why did they choose helicopter controls with dedicated hoover up and down buttons when you could immersively fly up and down with your mouse :((There is already a mod solving this)I have experienced a few small bugs and glitches and one bigger where I had to restart the game and a bugged quest. But non too bad as the auto-save is on point, but I hope they will release a patch soon to fix fps drops after using the revelio spell in the castle. Outside of the castle it's fine.The internal dialogue bugs a lot, saying irrelevant things to places already visited. Saying things like "I wonder who lives here" when you pass a house where you know the person inside. Deek can relate to dialogue bugs as well.The loot system is a bit weird, you can find super legendary items on the street and common items behind two locked doors in a locked chest. Only really rewarding appearance unlocks.I would have liked to see a bit more student life, making classes a bigger thing, to differentiate from other open-world games. The player character is above it all and feels more like a visitor, but with all the privileges in the school they wished for.Lastly, Lets hope they improve the gear management, you spend a LOT of time deleting obsolete items this really is a hassle, as you get a lots of gear. It would be nice if we could toggle appearance per gear slot instead of per gear item, or even save different appearance-sets.

author: Zaerick
review: Performance issues and "controversy" aside the game is incredibly impressive. In my 25 years of gaming there has been only one other game that has gotten me so emotional I had to put the controller down and compose my self for a moment. Being able to finally explore Hogwarts is a dream come true for a child of the 90s and early 2000s. I never expected this incredible level of exploration and detail. It's going yo be a very very long time if at all for a game to blow me out of the water the way this has.

author: Franco
review: It makes you feel like if you were watching a new Harry Potter movie. The game is just beautiful, only thing so far I have noticed until now is the perfomance, you get FPS drops no matter what your hardware is. Hopefully it gets fixed soon.

author: Empress
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a game I've had high expectations for since it's announcement. and looking forward to play it for a long long time And when it's released only for those who bought the Deluxe Edition, I entered to play. . . . And I found out that . . . It's a very fun game OMG!!! I haven't played such a fun game like this in a long long time. This game has me addicted and want to play it anytime and anywhere just like "Elden Ring"!!! Hogwarts Legacy is a very worthy game. It's a very fun game that makes me addicted and want to living in the Wizarding Word and makes me wants to go back to watch all the Harry Potter series again!!! This game should have Animation or more DLCs coming out!!!. Because I want to play this game for many months!!! I love this game so much, This game never let me down when it was released and while I was playing also!!! And this game deserves "Game of the Year 2023" too! And I will definitely vote this game as the "Game of The Year 2023"!!!♥10/10 MUST PLAY♥PS. Harry Potter and Wizarding Word fans shouldn't miss this game!!!
