author: JimiJimo
review: I've been into Harry Potter for as long as I can remember and while my enthusiasm for it has waned over the years my love for it hasn't. So this isn't exactly gonna be an unbiased review but I absolutely love this game, exploring the world has been a delight and exploring Hogwarts has been something I've wanted to do for so long not to mention finally having a proper RPG in this universe where you create your own character is something I think most of us who grew up with the series always wanted. I find myself getting distracted and just getting lost in the world in all the best of ways, can't say for sure if it'll be the same for someone who isn't as into the series as I was but for anyone with even a passing interest in the game's setting, I'm sure it'll be an enjoyable experience. While I do have a few complaints most of them are nitpicks except for one, the performance is pretty bad with constant dips in performance. Even Cyberpunk wasn't this bad at launch for me in terms of performance but otherwise I fully recommend the game especially when the performance is finally fixed.

author: M'igo Kazan
review: The game is fun at first while you focus on story quests to unlock all the basic features you need, but once you unlock Alohomora and can actually explore the world properly, I find it's big but mostly empty, with the dungeons and puzzles being all the same : linear, generic and mostly unrewarding (thanks to loot scaling with yer level, there's not really any unique loot that has a "wow" factor and gives an incentive for exploring, except maybe as a cosmetic), the quests are pretty much all the same concept but with different inane dialogue, and there's just.. nothing worth exploring really, unless you *really* want to clear out the map and complete those collection logs for the cosmetics, so it's a surprisingly linear experienceHeck, even the story is nothing really worth talking about and just something you have to go through to unlock all the spells and features and the few story dungeons that exist are just sorta there, and as unimaginative as the rest.  There's some cool physics puzzles and the game is charming enough, but I actually think it would have done better as a story game, without the open-world elements; keep Hogwarts, Hogsmeade and the story dungeons, and the game would have been much more impactful

author: Alas
review: Hogwarts Legacy made quite a stir on release. The JK Rowling controversy notwithstanding, it looked great and was praised as the Harry Potter game all long-time fans of the franchise were waiting for. I am not such a fan. My attachment to the franchise is rather looser. Yes, I have watched the movies, even liked some of them. I have also visited the exhibition housing the movie version of Hogwarts. But it's not a big or important part of my childhood, as it is for many. Nevertheless, there is some familiarity and I do like a good open-world game from time to time. As such I was eager to try this game. A rare event. Let's see how that went.Arguably the game's greatest selling point is the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry itself. The Castle is lovingly reconstructed and fully explorable. Well, provided you can be bothered to do the fetch quest necessary for the lockpicking spell at least. It is also iconic enough that even people with my limited familiarity will recognise a great deal of locations, items and activities. The rest of the world is also generally beautiful, with some impressive vistas and interesting art direction choices to be seen. Unfortunately, it is just looks. The game offers but limited opportunities to interact with the world. Outside of preset activities/missions you can't really do much. You can't go to classes, or even prank your fellow students. That was a mild disappointment. But still not enough to sully the accomplishment that is Hogwarts.Unfortunately, this is where the good part ends. The game has little else of value to offer. The plot is a D-movie level schlock, unoriginal and entirely unimpressive. Anyone who doesn't guess the direction it's taking at least halfway in is simply not paying any attention to the game. Not that I could fault them for that. The main character is an underdeveloped and overused archetype, a Mary Sue that can do no wrong, even when playing with the Dark Arts, it's all kosher for Mary. The overwhelming majority of the missions are simple fetch quests. In fact, the game offers a masterclass in how many different ways once can masquerade simple fetch quests. The game tries to make up for its lack of interesting content with padding. There is, naturally, an inventory system and other cookie-cutter RPG-lite elements too. Those also serve little purpose and wouldn't have been missed if they weren't there. The setting in general comes with its own set of issues. For instance, the decision to set the game in the 19th century is completely incomprehensible and detrimental. Adding this distance to the timeline effectively eliminates the chance of encountering the more famous canon characters and their relatives. Or hearing of their tales. Which would have allowed even those with a more peripheral association with the franchise to experience some nostalgia, ie from the movies. It makes even less sense if you consider that the game earns nothing from this timeline change. Hogwarts and the wizarding world is effectively stuck in the 19th century anyway. You could have set the game in the 21st century and almost nothing would need to change to accommodate for it. If anything that way even all the ridiculous forced diversity present would make somewhat more sense. Somewhat.Finally, there is combat. Lots and lots of combat. Seeing the bodycount the protagonist racks up I had to keep reminding myself that this is still based on a book for kids. Be that as it may, there are some interesting elements here. The variety of spells present can offer a number of ways to approach a fight. It all works out ok at first, but as you progress through the game and the battles become longer, it hits you. It is tedious. Spam all your spells, wait for them to recharge while avoiding the enemy, rinse and repeat. That's it. Thankfully, there is one specific build that is utterly broken and can be used to end nearly all fights much faster. It requires the use of the Dark Arts though. So if for RP reasons you opt not to go down that path, well sucks to be you. Personally, I'd rather sacrifice every goat I have at the altar of lord Voldemort, than sit through one of those long-winded fights again.All in all, this was a disappointment. I can't really say I hated the game, despite all its flaws, mostly because I couldn't muster enough of an interest to give a dime. For all the noise that surrounded it, it is just a bland open-world experience. One of those where you have a checklist and you just go from place to place on the map gathering collectibles. Granted, the art directors and artists do deserve an Oscar, but everyone else involved is up for a Razzle. Perhaps megafans of the franchise will appreciate the game for what it has to offer, a glimpse of the wizarding world. Still, as far as I'm concerned, Hogwarts Legacy commits the most cardinal of sins. It is boring. As such, not recommended.

author: Drew

author: KryIsDying
review: I have finally finished my experience, and I will say I'm a little disappointed. Before I give any criticism, I will give credit to where credit is due. This game is gorgeous, and for the first 20 hours I was mesmerized by the magic and scenery. The gameplay was definitely a learning curve for me, but once I got used to the mechanics on controller, it was very fun and satisfying to duel other students and enemies. I also enjoyed customizing my Room of Requirement to my liking and stumbling across interactions and hidden areas throughout Hogwarts itself. These aspects felt like my personal highlights to the game.SO I'm sure I over-hyped myself for the game before the release and was expecting a sandbox-esque rpg with a lot of lore to discover. Unfortunately, Hogwarts Legacy isn't as much of a rpg as it is more of an action-adventure game. Much of the story I found to be very shallow and a lot of the characters (if not most of the characters) I had a hard time caring about throughout the story. The ending, for me, fell flat and lackluster, feeling very rushed and an afterthought.In conclusion, I don't think this game is bad and there were parts of it I did enjoy. I do think that the devs put focus on graphics and design above the story and lore. With that said, I would give the game a 5.5/10, and I would recommend this game for older kids (14-17) who enjoy the Harry Potter series.

author: Sniforge
review: The game overall is a good game.The story is interesting, But the game mechanics leave much to be desired.A lot of the game is copy paste, hogwarts itself is small in scale compare to what it is supposed to be, there's a minecraft harry potter mod that has a better hogwarts than this. You have to unlock the fun elements of this game, so at the beginning it feels weird... you want to explore but you don't have the proper tools... you can't figure out things on your own.. you actually need to do side missions in order for the solution to unlock, which is a horrible mechanic.The school and the map feel empty, the npc's are very VERY outdated, they don't react to you, they are solid walls you can't even touch them or bump into them, you can shoot any spell at them they won't even react, they will just go on with their animations.  This game would've been amazing in 2008, but in 2023... it's disappointing really. I give this a positive only for the story. The rest of the game.... feels outdated.

author: Badger
review: If you're a Harry Potter fan then this game is an easy recommendation. Even if you're not it's still enjoyable, although there are some areas that could have been improved.Pros:- Interesting(and surprisingly large) open world to explore with lots of things to discover and mysteries to solve.- Nice graphics overall but was particularly impressed with the effects and animations.- They definitely nailed the atmosphere from the books and movies.- Some interesting and memorable characters.- Decent story.Cons:- Itemisation was poor. They could have done more with the gear and maybe added some more interesting items to use.- Bit too much talking. The story was ok but at times I just wanted to play the game instead of watching.- Combat was frustrating at times. Casting spells on wrong enemy due to lock on issues. Also a bit boring towards the end.- Enemy variety was poor. Would like to have seen more variety.

author: Redkitties
review: REVIEW SCORE: 3/10WHY:Combat:No invincible frames while casting. Want to use the tools/utilities the game encourages you to use? Interupted while using plant bombs, doesn't go off, no invinc frames. Want to use a potion that'll help with the 5+ mobs the game throws at you during main and side quests? You click it, drink it, and get interrupted, doesn't go off, damage taken because no invincible frames. Want to cast a spell to break an enemies shield? If you can SEE it- these things flicker in and out of existence- wondering why it's taking no damage? the INVISIBLE shield it has! guess you'll just have to squint and try the 3 different types of spells you have- but WAIT, as you cast a spell, it gets interrupted because there's NO INVINCIBLE FRAMES. Want to cast your own shield? it lasts half a second! because unlike the enemies, it WORKS DIFFERENT, for some unknown reason, it's more like a parry than a shield! But thank goodness you have a dodge that you can be hit out of rolling/aparating (with the talent upgrade), and even when you complete your dodge roll, the enemy has blinked to where you come out of it and hits you with such a short warning simple- THAT DOESN'T PROC/SHOW MORE THAN HALF THE TIME- that you can't even dodge again, or cast your shield spell. On top of that, the enemies have lazer focus on you, so you get double hit by a spell and the melee enemy! And that's not even mentioning the enemy AoE effects! Like the warning prompts to shield or dodge, these ground AoE effects are so faint! In every situation where you're thrown 5+ enemies in a gauntlet, you can use this AoE lightning potion that is SUPER helpful- it breaks enemy shields and deals damage! But wait! the enemy (ONE enemy, as far as i can tell) has a lighting AoE spell as well! and it DOESN'T show up at all when you're using this potion! So you just get one shot!Oh, and your spell range is very short. so for big enemies, you still feel like you're in their face and you can't effectively kite.EDIT: i forgot to add, when you play on PC/keyboard+mouse, it's frustrating to have like 20 spells, and only be able to cast 4 at a time/have access to 4 spells. You have to swap between 4 different groups of 4 spells. makes it incredibly difficult to have fluid combat. I wish there was an option where i could just have a spell bar, honestly. ( I ended up using a mod from nexus that let me rebind the other keys so that when i hit "5" it would swap spell group and cast number 1 of that spell group. It was nice, i just had to commit the spell slots to memory during my 70 hours of playing,MonkaS.)0/10 FRUSTRATING COMBAT.Note: I did play on the Hardest difficulty, and all it did was promote me stacking health potions. Get hit once? health pot because all my health is gone. Even with the best gear upgraded and slotted with this games form of "gems".STORY: Honestly, the side quests were WAY more interesting than the main quest. NO, it's not because of hate crime. Although playing through this game, at every turn I did have moments of joking with myself, going "Wow, Hogwarts promotes teaching children to steal, break into peoples houses, never go to class (as they were always short cinematic that did nothing and didn't add anything to the story) endorses slavery with house elf's still, enforces racial biases are cultural norm with how goblins and centaurs are seen by the character world," just all in good humor of pointing out these big no-nos.Talking about the spells, as someone who played all of the harry potter games as they came out, I already knew all of them! including some that weren't even in this game! So as I found myself doing the pre-quests to unlock the spells, i found myself, a seasoned harry potter gamer, frustrated and low on patience, because these pre-requests to unlock the quests were filler- they offered nothing to enrich the experience of playing the game, and barely added any lore to the known universe.The side quests, as I said, were fantastic. I liked the side characters, and I wish that there were more. Some classes let you talk with other characters, and I wish each of them, who had names and I recalled their faces/models, got the same character/friendship quest lines as three of the side characters did. As someone who played Mass Effect and Dragon Age, I am down to do 8 character side quests that adds and expands on not only the main story, but the characters themselves, as well as the universe around me, the player character. The main story was short, disappointing- but only because it was boring. Go here, do this, big battle royal and boss fight, all x 4. Then, another, and then, the last boss fight. Which, had the same combat problems as I listed above that i'll list/summarize here so it's easier to digest: AoE prompts too quick to respond to, no ground AoE warnings, no invincible frames when I cast, No STUN reward on the boss when I complete mechanics that diffidently seem like they should- at least in every other video game I have played.Honestly I have no idea how i would improve on the main quest besides adding real choices that aren't just "Keep things the way things are" or "Do the bad thing that x,y,z, but not really, because I'm still the main protag, so I have to be morally good." No ambiguous choice, no morally gray, not even a "RED" option that would be "DESTROY". Something that I was actually really surprised of, because in this case, I DO want to destroy the reapers- and I'm not given the option?! Crazy.Side quests: 5/10, Carried the game hard. Main quest: 1/10 was okay, eh, could have made the game without it and I would not have missed it. Honestly. It's okay to just make friends and stop "petty" crime as a 15-year-old, I don't have to save the world every damn time.EXPLORATION: Not as bad as what assassins creed as become. Yes when you complete something there's still that annoying unstoppable cut scene, like every time you would take down stealthily someone in Deus Ex except 5 times longer. Yes, there's flying. Yes, there's collecting. Yes, there's marking things off the map and feeling satisfied. Yes, there's clothing shopping and transmog. Yes, there's even breeding animals in your broom cupboard! But does the things add any lore or imagination or thought to the world? not really, no. So...It's just things to do and things to unlock. Minimal satisfaction, and luckily, there's enough that you can staggar the side quests and main quests with the exploration so you don't feel like you're dead, awake, and just doing chores.Overall? Maybe a 4/10. Water textures kept bugging and threatening to crash my game.I read ahead online and saw there was a checklist to graduate your school year after you complete the main quest- as i'm writing this critique on a break from the last boss. I think from exploring throughout my 51 hours of gameplay, I have that checklist done except for the remaining two(?) post-game quests. So that's nice, I guess.Overall, I wouldn't recommend this game, and If I did, I would tell everyone to buy it for around 30% off, and play on the easiest difficulty, because the hardest one is not satisfactory, especially with how the combat is. Still, I did enjoy seeing a new harry potter universe game, and I hope that this low scoring and the problems I have listed do not discourage but instead encourage a better next video game, whatever this company might make. And that we don't always need to be in High School to be a wizard/witch, the world/universe exists outside of Hogwarts/childhood.And if anyone is wondering HOW I COULD BUY this video game because of who receives the money?I'll humbly service my fellow Queer people until the good orgasms out way the whatever 40-some percent goes into the coffers of someone whose far richer than the Late Queen of England.

author: Cryptid Queen
review: As much as I'm enjoying the gameplay itself and the beautiful world, I can't recommend buying this game in it's current state. The intro gives false hopes as the game starts becoming a stutterfest with massive and constant FPS drops when you arrive at Hogwarts. From there the performance has not gotten better. I'm running 1440p High preset, no RT with 60 FPS cap. Did not see any performance difference after changing settings so I left it at the recommended High preset. Hopefully some patches will come through to properly optimize the performance but right now, don't make the purchase. I will say that the temps on my card are superb compared to other intensive AAA titles, though. If the game sees performance patches, I will gladly change my review to recommended.Gameplay = FantasticPerformance = CrapSPECS:RTX 3070 8GBi7-11700f32GB RAM 3200MhzGame is running off a 1TB 980 Pro M.2 SSD.EDIT: The day one patch did fix a slight amount of stuttering, however the majority of the performance issues are still prevalent. Hogsmeade is probably the worst right now, with 33-43 FPS being the average in that area. Traveling inside Hogwarts still gives massive drops. The combat is done extremely poorly here. No way to train or practice and the very little combat you have thrown at you doesn't not give you time to feel out the controls. I'm like 10 hours in and still haven't gotten my own broom, so anyone saying the story mode is only 20 hours is lying. I'll still be waiting on a real patch to fix the serious performance issues most seem to be having.EDIT EDIT: Most of the performance issues have been ironed out. Hogsmeade still has a bad stutter issue but other than that, the game runs incredibly smoother than before. I can now fully recommend purchasing the game in this state. I still think the combat could have been handled better earlier into the game. After the patches, I can now run the game at Ultra (except for effects because High looks wayyyy better than Ultra)

author: KnightLevi
review: Overall Score: 6.8/10I will preface this by saying if you don't like Harry Potter, know nothing of it, and/or don't really care to get into it DON'T BUY THIS GAME. Spend your time elsewhere. If, on the other hand, you love Harry Potter and would like the chance to explore Hogwarts (Unfortunately everything else isn't really the same and even Hogwarts is somewhat different...) Then this is the game for you!Great game, HUGE open world that I was so excited to explore, great quests, puzzles, and mini games. I'm only 9 hours in and there is still so much I haven't had the chance to do that I'm so excited for. Even after getting through the main story I'm sure I'm going to have a lot to do. They paid extremely close attention to detail including things like little enchanted tools you can interact with or tulips(?) that make a funny noise when you walk by them (definitely the smallest feature I had the most fun with), or the candy store with all sorts of funny effects (unfortunately you can't take them out of the store.). I ABSOLUTELY LOVE the fact that there are "Guide Pages" in the game. They are little lore tidbits that you can find here and there while exploring and it not only incentivizes exploration, but makes it feel like you really have a reason to wander around and just look at the huge world that's been laid out before you.Complaint #1 - was that it feels almost like the LGBTQ content was forced down my throat just because it's "politically correct" to be put in the game. Personally I feel like it was only included due to the backlash J.K. Rowling received for some of her comments on twitter just to not only defend herself but also expand the audience to those she may have previously offended. I have nothing against the LGBTQ community my complaint is due to the fact that peoples beliefs and way of living become marketing strategies. That's just horrible to me. It doesn't detract from the game in any meaningful way it just kind of urked me a bit.  Correct me if you believe I'm wrong. Complaint #2 - The voices are messed up. Any character (including your own) whose voice has been edited with the pitch slider sounds like a robot and it really breaks immersion.Complaint #3 - Optimization is DOGSH!T. I have to run the game on the lowest settings to play... Not too terrible for myself as I do like to play a few older games such as TESIII:Morrowind and graphics don't bother me as much however, in today's day and age graphics are almost everything. Not to mention the game is nearly unplayable due to the glitches and bugs for most people who aren't as lucky as I am.

author: Roan Woasbi
review: I'm not someone who is into the Harry Potter stuff.  Never read the books and only thought the movies were okay.  That being said, the story is off to a good start and I love almost all of the characters.  The graphics are great and the music/sounds exactly how they should be.  The side quests are decent as well.The combat is average.  Yes, it's different and unusual, but it's the same thing after awhile.  Pop something in the air, hit it, bring it close, hit it some more.  It's a rinse and repeat.  Plus, the combat doesn't happen that often, which I guess is fine.  It's a lot of walking around and talking to folks.The collectables are just too plentiful.  I wanted an open world game, not a collect them all.  Yes, I can skip them, but that's what they poured a lot of pointless content into.How spells are learned is sorta dumb.  It's a minor mechanic, but it's still annoying to deal with.Minor pop-in occurs, usually students popping in.  But that's a minor complaint.I'm sick of collecting things.  Don't care that it's optional, it's part of the game and should be criticized.  There is literally a mechanic of collecting things so you can unlock a spell to collect more things.  When does it end?I have been a gamer for over 30 years.  I tend to play mostly PC games.  I also bounce around between games A LOT.  I may purchase a $60 game and play it for 2 hours or spend $10 on a game and spend 50 hours on it.  Even if I played a game a short time, it does not mean it is bad.  It just means another game caught my attention.  I also complain about flaws in games a lot, even about the littlest of things.  Keep that in mind when reading my reviews.  If I do not have a complaint, then the game must be special!

author: Calletha
review: While the game is incredibly fun thus far, the performance issues on PC are inexcusable. The game shouldn't regularly crash, especially when my PC more than meets the recommended settings. Once the performance issues are fixed, I'm sure my recommendation will change.

author: Tiny Medic
review: The game is fantastic and covers almost everything you could wish for. Still, I'd like to point out a few things that could have been done better, or at least make you feel like the choices you make are more unique. I love the side quests with the friends you get to know in the main story, but I think it would be better if you get one friend per school you choose, to make it feel more special. Aside from the aesthetics of your bedchamber and your coat, there's nothing special about the school you choose.Don't get me wrong, the game is awesome, but being part of Hufflepuff or Grifindorf doesn't make any difference in any of the quests, which is a shame.

author: Tsudonhim
review: Crashes randomly, textures pop in, long load times, and character dialog sometimes doesn't play. I really should have learned my lesson about buying new games on release when this happened with 2077, but here I am again dealing with the same buggy mess. When it's working it's good. I'm enjoying walking around Hogwarts and the surrounding area. I wish there was more lore with the field guide pages, like with the old Mass Effect codex, but I love lore, so that's probably just a me thing. I'm not much of a gamer TM anymore, so I don't know really what to say about the combat other than it's there. I suck at it, but I'm sure that has more to do with just me being old and bad at games now, and not the actual combat mechanics. I get the idea that you have to match the color of your attack against the enemies' shield color, but it's difficult for me to do while against multiple opponents at once. I don't know if some AOE spells become available later, but that would make it a lot easier for this old-timer. Combat Update: There are potions and magical plants you can use to help you in combat, and you can power up some of the spells to make them hit more than one target, so it get easier to take on more than one person at a time. It's nice I can customize my outfit, but it would have been a lot better if I could toggle on the option to hide the piece I don't want to be shown, like the gloves or face mask, instead of having to choose the option every time I change that item of clothing. Especially because the game is prone to crash on me in that menu over all others for some reason. Without going into any spoilers, I'll say the story is alright so far. It's nothing groundbreaking, but I'm interested to see what comes next most of the time. They've opted to make the MC kind of bland to make it easier for the player to insert their own personality in there. And some dialog options can make them act in conversation one way or another, but I don't think it leads to anything in the story. The side characters are a bit more interesting, but I haven't gotten too far yet, so I don't know how much more there is to them compared to the MC. Character customization was also just okay. It's not as robust as other games but has more options than some. I'll say I don't think the McElorys will be able to get a good monster out of it. Overall, I would wait to buy this until the major bugs are worked out. so far it's been just ok, so unless you're a huge HP fan I just don't see enough here to justify dealing with the headache right now.

author: Carelena
review: We read the books, we watched the movies. The story become a part of our childhood. Now it feels truly great to be a part of that world, to take classes, to fly on a broom, to discover secrets. You can really imagine yourself in that world. They build a really amazing school. It is a must for every Harry Potter fan.

author: Zhyenya
review: It's not often a game can completely immerse me into its world. Within the first 10 hours or so, this game  me in, even for someone who's not a huge fan of the HP universe. However, as the game continues beyond that 10-ish hour mark, you start to notice the flaws. Even though this game receives a thumbs up for me, I think it's fair you should know what to expect.You'll first notice how magical the world is around you. The castle feels alive. You're in classes learning spells and meeting the professors and students. The talking paintings and gargoyles will get a chuckle out of you. You watch Peeves ruin a student's day. You find mysterious doors and wonder how they open. A student is stuck in the air from a levitation charm and can't get down, and his friends abandon him because they forgot about a homework assignment. The headmaster scorns a student for being an idiot. You're slightly scared of the Forbidden Forest as it comes up in the story. YOU CAN PET THE CATS. It all feels wonderful.But then you start to get used to the charm, and you'll want to interact with it.You can't cast spells on students, nor talk with them unless they have a quest to give you. I'll walk past a student who was part of a relationship quest, and they won't say anything to me. You'll eavesdrop on other students' conversations, but they have no flow. There are no prefects or other authority to enforce the rules of the castle; it doesn't matter when I show up to class or if I'm out past curfew. The open world doesn't help either. Although it's fun to cruise on your broom and view the world, there isn't much life or activity outside the castle. Unless you're achievement hunting, all of the collection chests, Merlin Trials, field guide pages, and so on feel like filler.Also, you can learn the Unforgivable Curses  No consequences, no story implications, not even unique dialogue from NPCs. Regarding combat, you'll learn four categories of spells: Force (purple), Control (yellow), Damage (red), and Unforgivable Curses (green). With four spell tabs of four spells each, you can have 16 spells at your disposal at any given moment. You'll first learn how to juggle enemies and keep them in the air for as long as possible. You'll also have "combat challenges" that give you a random challenge to complete, and some of them will teach you powerful spell combos (one of my favorites, Glacius -> Diffendo). Some enemies will have purple/yellow/red shields. Hmm, they have a colored shield, and I have colored spells. After a while, the combat becomes pretty easy, even on Hard difficulty. Also, on the "Collections" menu you can learn about each enemy's specific weakness. For example, if you cast "Flipendo" after a troll slams the ground with his two-handed club attack, the club will flip and smack the troll in the face for decent damage and a stun. You would think this is useful information, but like I said, the combat is pretty easy. As long as you can block/parry effectively, and you have your go-to spell combos and juggles, you don't need to know enemy-specific weaknesses. I didn't even experiment with specific enemy weaknesses until long after I finished the main story and was achievement hunting. No spoilers, so don't worry.I actually really enjoyed the relationship quests. I was invested in their personal stories and learned why they were so passionate. I never really understood why the main villain was passionate other than a bad experience with wizard-kind.You're "the chosen one" who can interact and wield Ancient Magic, an extremely rare ability. To some this is a very boring and cliché story, but that's OK! I can work with that, but clearly the developers didn't work with it.Outside of progressing the story and a "focus meter" for a powerful attack during combat, Ancient Magic is so boring. This is by far my biggest gripe with the game. BY FAR. I promised I wouldn't spoil the story, but there was so much wasted potential. You can't infuse your modern spells with Ancient Magic. You don't learn more about how your powers work, or what else you could cast. You could add so many game mechanics and RPG elements with this "rare" form of magic BUT THEY DID NOTHING FUN WITH IT.These were my personal gripes with the game. The Harry Potter universe doesn't fit the open-world format in my opinion. Focus on Hogwarts so you can jam pack it with rich experiences and interactions. Also with so many god-tier open-world games such as Breath of the Wild and Read Dead Redemption 2, the bar is up extremely high, so it will definitely not reach those expectations. I think the developers Confringo'd themselves in the foot by making it open-world instead of hyper-focusing on detail.With all of that being said, I give these criticisms with tough love. I seriously haven't been so entrenched in a video game's world like this game has. I don't regret playing this game, and there are plenty of magical moments to make the game worth it. 7.5/10 wtf there's no Quidditch

author: ChoopChoopMyMorningWood
review: I came to support Rowling & stayed for the game.Exceptionally well made for beginners of RPG games. Very streamlined & story focused.However, when you already have experience with such games, the beginning may seem very slow to you, as it does to me. I am a couple of hours in & I still feel like I'm in tutorial mode, because the game constantly teaches you everything it has to offer, in numerous steps. Usually, I like to branch out of the master story, to explore the world on my own, although this is not really possible here, because everything is closed off, if you don't have the right level or the right amount of story finished (both are very closely connected to each other, as you will learn).After 6.9 hours playtime, I finally can do real open world RPG stuff!What I personally don't like about this game, is how all different factions are streamlined & feel the same, when you talk to them. There does not seem like there's a big difference in mentality. Anyone you can hear talk, sounds the same, from what he's saying. So, if you wouldn't be able to see, who belongs to which faction, from his robes, you wouldn't be able to even distinguish a Slytherin member from a Hufflepuff one.The biggest issue for my playthrough is, that I chose Slytherin for a reason, but from what I am saying & what I'm doing, I basically have my balls cut off, doing the same stuff any nice, kind & too helpful pupil would do.I wouldn't expect a different storyline, just for one house, but I would've expected different interpretations. For example, when I help someone, it's mostly to help me & my fellowship, rather than the others. While playing Hufflepuff for example, it would be probably more altruistic.So, I really miss the faction differences, one would expect in such scenarios. (At least something like in the older Elder Scrolls games, where you would be hated, disliked, liked or loved, depending on your faction, etc.)The other thing is, that it does not feel like it's super broken or anything, but it's clearly unfinished. For example, you cannot even talk to random people. You just press F & they say a single line. You do not even engage in a dialogue. I would expect this would work in certain scenarios, like in the beginning when you get to the school or at least with a couple of school attendees, that randomly walk around the places inside the school. At least give me a real dialouge.I'm giving a thumbs up, because it's fine so far & I can certainly recommend it to Harry Potter fans. It's clearly made for a wide range of age, including children.If you are well versed with RPGs & are not a Harry Potter fan, at all, you should play less than 120 minutes & decide for yourself, how you like the pace. The pace won't change for a while, which you cannot skip, circumvent or delay. There are lots of cut-scenes & goodies for fans of the franchise.P.S.:All the non-sense about attacking the licence holder, before the game came out, was futile & simply unnecessary.The game is already extremely politically correct. It does not talk out loud about political opinions, but it clearly wants to display through its cast, that they follow whatever freak might accuse them of not showing, if they wouldn't have included it.So, don't worry, whoever is honest, will acknowledge that the game is fine, even for those, who complained about the licence holder.

author: Abryn
review: This game first had issues but is now very enjoyable. Phenomenal exploration, animations, mechanics and simply beautiful. The PC optimisation still seems rough when comparing to other realistic graphics games. In general very good game and has gone beyond expectations disregarding the lag at release. Brilliant game, I recommend.My computer specs are:RTX 3080i7-11700KF32 GB RAM

author: Polar Vortex
review: I was in 7th grade when the first HP book came out, and I read one per year through graduation. I was working through college at Barnes and Noble when Half Blood Prince came out, and experienced what a HP book release looked like to a bunch of fans like myself. I graduated college the year Half Blood Prince made it to theaters, and had my daughter the year the movie franchise ended. A HUGE part of my life included "living" in Hogwarts. Previous games were fun, but this one is completely built for fans of this fantasy world. We can attend classes, explore the entirety of Hogwarts, secrets and all, AND THEN explore the rest of the world. They even went to the trouble of giving not just a day/night cycle, but seasons as well. Meandering through Hogsmead during the fall and seeing the halloween decorations makes me so happy. I didn't expect this game to be as good as it is, but I'm almost 50 hours in, and loving every second of it. I STRONGLY recommend this game to all fans of this fantasy world who want to feel like they are living in it.

author: SquareHead
review: well what a let down! just another huge open world that's boring and not very creative. this is a magic world and your looting scarves over and over again.  this is like a 10 year olds version of a rpg. there is about 5 types of enemy the whole game. the menus are glacially slow. all the loot is boring looking clothing and stupid glasses. no npc's are interactive apart from one that need to be in the story or quests. you can carry hardly anything even though your a magic using hero. combat isnt the worst ive seen but gets very boring only using the same spells over and over and never having any other means of combat but magic. flying is okay but you cant fly in places you should be able to. the castle looks really cool but is basically a maze of stuttering mess and 'secrets', if you enjoy walking about hallways spamming revelio your gonna love it. character creation is basic and boring. crafting is boring. im 20 hours in and feel like im still being drip fed tutorial like missions. the handholding is real! im at the point where i dont really care about the game anymore as i feel like its never gonna get interesting

author: MTB
review: One of the most disappointing purchases I've ever made on steam. Terrible performance issues like frequent fps drops to 10-20 fps that last anywhere from a few seconds all the way up to a minute and crashes should be non-existent in a game like this when I have a 5800x3D, 3080, 32GB of fast ram, and playing on an NVME ssd. Changing settings doesn't ameliorate these issues either. The worst part is that on console, these performance issues don't exist. The PS5 version doesn't have the aforementioned issues whatsoever. I'm tired of getting poorer performance on PC than on a console that costs the same as my CPU alone at launch did. It makes the idea of buying AAA games on PC pointless.The game doesn't deserve anywhere near the 93% rating it currently has on steam, but because it's Harry Potter it gets a free pass.

author: »cieply!
review: A beautiful world but a hollow game, which at times felt as if it was made by people who do not like games. Long sequences with zero gameplay that are pure presentation, which is made even worse by a supbar story. We spend a whole game chasing a mcguffin, in the end not even learning precise nature of said mcguffin. Some dark magic questlines were interesting, but unfortunately they went a very tired and predictable route of black and white morality, with good magic bringing peace and happiness and dark arts bringing nothing but pain and sadness. Often control would be taken away from the player to allow the story to progress where the writers want it, even (or especially) if it made little sense (think all the Kai Leng shenanigans in ME3). Strangely enough no professor seems to mind the player casting avada kedavra right in front of their noses. Lastly there is a lot of mechacincs panning out the mediocre gameplay and story to make it longer than it should be. We have to grow magical plants, captu... "rescue" magical creatures, breed them, collect fur from them, all on timers that are to make us come back over and over again as if we were playing magical crossing. I imagine this might be a cool feature to some though, so maybe it just was not for me.

author: Stain
review: The game is a love letter to the world of Harry Potter & an absolute fan service.Hogwarts Castle is absolutely beautiful to look at and is painstakingly filled to the brim with various details. While the characters are nothing breathtaking, each fills the world well, is written well, and is voice-acted well. Professors and companions are quite memorable, as are the major NPCs. Music score is very beautiful & especially a vibe while flying, in vivariums or is Hogsmeade.Gameplay is quite fun. Combat is easy to learn but hard to master. The various systems, such as flying, the vivariums, and the beast care, are all significant parts of the fantasy of the wizarding world. Lots of puzzles and collectibles are strewn about the world. The journal entries do make em worthwhile if nothing else then for the lore. Gear system could have been better as the way it is now apart from legendary rarity none matter at all. The upgrade system based around traits are good however unlock incredibly slowly for their max level. An immersive money sink is required, as apart from basic utilities to progress the game and occasional clothing, there is nothing to spend the money on. Side quests apart from companion quest aren't much to write home about however do provide some nice pieces of cosmetics.The character creation could have used a bit more robustness as, more often than not, you may end up having three different NPCs that look like player characters at the same time and in the same place. The game could have benefited with a default player character with more detailed model in order to avoid the above fiasco as it is anyway fully voice acted. The NPC could also use a bit of an overhaul to increase the believability of the world.The game could have used with a few more side quests or with a bit more experience as a reward for various activities as on the first play through in spite of doing every side quests apart from 'The Man Behind The Moon' I wasn't able to hit level 40. As a reference the Field guide completion was at 94%.The dark arts path was a letdown; it unlocks incredible late & is overall lack luster in terms of its effectiveness. However, the rest of the talent trees hold up well and can allow you to hit for some incredible damage numbers.The sum is greater than the individual when it comes to Hogwarts Legacy. Much of what I have listed can be chalked up as nitpicks. They are only apparent because of an otherwise incredible attention to detail. All in all, Hogwarts Legacy is an easy recommendation in case you want to just get lost in a world for 100 hours on end, with the added benefit of it actually being a good game and not a grind fest designed to suck in all your time like so many AAA games these days.

author: Beratna Keldrig
review: Finally got my letter. Peace out, muggles.

author: KonaKoala
review: I paid for the deluxe edition of this game but it runs like absolute ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ on fire I have a decent PC but it stutters and the frame rate is terrible I have everything on the optimised settings and it still is laggy AF this needs to be fixed because I didn't pay £60 for a game I can't play

author: The next 3pac
review: No quidditch? No Diagon Alley? No Ministry of Magic? Instead we get 100 boring caves with boring loot. - Professor Sharp is a discount Professor Snape- Professor Weasley is a discount Professor McGonagall- Professor Fig is so unlikeable, I wish he got killed in the prologue. Why is he even involved in the whole story?- Remainder of Professors are stereotyped or also discount HP Series professors, eg: Professor Garlick, or the Divination teacher being a wannabe ♥♥♥♥♥ fortune teller.- The headmaster is boring and the game uses him to scare you about being expelled but nothing ever happens regardless. - All student NPCs apart from Sebastian, Ominis and Poppy Sweeting are boring. - Slytherins aren't even Slytherins, they are just discount Ravenclaw. What happened to being 'le bad purebloods?' - All broomsticks except 1 are horrendously trash, they look like something out of some anime. In what world would they add motorbike seats to a broomstick? There is literally only 1 model that doesn't have it and feels somewhat like from the movies. - 95% of cloth appearances in the game are horrible. Also, no Nimbus broomstick models. The upgrades don't actually upgrade your speed or control, they only extend your broomstick sprint time, which is unlimited anyway if you fly at a low altitude. All voice actors are tryharding and forcing their lines, they are overly expressive. The devs didn't know whether they want to make a cartoon game for younger audiences or something realistic. All dialogues are too long and boring, and they are unskippable. I never asked additional questions because I don't want to sit for 5 minutes talking to a NPC. Combat is good, though I would've liked an easier way to switch between spells, 4 per spell set is not enough. Would've been good to allow us to change the basic attack to something if we use a talent point or upgrade the wand or whatever. Ending was boring and obvious. I chose to take the power for myself and I didn't even get it. He just waved his wand around as if he's gonna absorb or control the power but he didn't? What was the point in giving me a choice. Hard difficulty was too easy. Only heal, edurus and maxima potions were needed, and rarely. Getting better stats on clothing was stupid, the differences between green-blue-purple-gold loot was minor and I only changed my gear every few levels. Rest was sold for tons of gold. Upgrading gear not worth the time, I only put some traits into my clothes by the end of the game. So many collectibles and unlockables scattered in the world and the devs didn't think to give certain rare things (like unlocking your house chest) an end-game item stats that is by far better than randomly collected chest loot, since some keys were locked behind alohomora anyway. Appearance-only reward for the house chest is a big disappointment. All in all, the game had a huge mountain of possibilities and decided to trash it. I'd recommend watching the film series instead of playing this.

author: Mopei_ECO200Y
review: I bought this game because I am strongly opposed to child sex change surgeries and pumping children with the hormones of the opposite gender, because I don't think that children are able to consent to those changes that permanently damages their bodies with irreversible physical bodily harm. While that doesn't change how JK Rowling still has Trump Derangement Syndrome and refuses to house immigrants in her own mansion despite calling the UK to house more immigrants, it seems that the Woke mob has indeed tried to push a bridge too far by attempting to forcing JK Rowling to apologize for her stance regarding her opposition to child sex change surgeries, I commemorate JK Rowling for standing her ground and refusing to apologize to the Woke mob. I bought this game to support her valiant efforts in fighting child sex change surgeries, and so far even managed to enjoy the game. It also helps immensely that there are also only two genders in this game and you cannot transition from "witch" to "wizard" without any "wix" to represent further mental illness that is outside of the two biological genders of male and female. Though it is disturbing that there are only two presets for white characters with the rest of the presets being black or asian and the game tries to push you very hard to make non white characters, the cementing of there only being two genders still overwhelmingly outweighs as a positive over the forced diversity (less white people) and being an asian myself who isn't white, I can live with that. I still created a white character though, and I would like more presets for white character options.

author: Pingu
review: If you're looking for a Harry-and-Newt experience, this is it. It gives you the experience to be both a student and an adventurer at the same time. Amazed by the graphics and the details that they put into the game and lots of side missions with high replay value (by choosing other houses.) Only thing missing is the Quidditch tournament but hopefully it will be released as a DLC in the future. Seems like the developer themselves are huge fans and manage to grasp the fans' expectations.

author: Seifer
review: This game is extremely well developed, there is a lot to get distracted by, and so much to do right away.What to Expect-First few hours are pretty slow as there is a lot of information, backstory, and new relationships being defined for you, After that everything is opened up and there are so many enemies to enguage, and strategies to figure out.- Story is really compelling, and you don't have to be a Potter fan to enjoy it- Combat is amazingBiggest Gripes- Caves are extremely underwhelming. I would have liked to see something closer to Skyrim, Elden Ring, or really an implementation that called for us to explore and be engaged. Instead each cave, despite your characters vocal 'I better be careful in here' they take literally under 60 seconds to finish with usually a single chest to open.- I would have liked the ability to actually companion with some of the followers. It would be cool to explore with another wizard.- I would have liked there to be more comments/interactions from your actions. Like casting an unforgivable curse in front of students or professors.Other than that, this game far exceeded my expectations, and I would recommend it to anyone interested in exploring the wizarding world.

author: Dewguru
review: I am thankful that this game appeared on my radar. I've never played a Harry Potter game in the past, and only watched about half of the movies, although I did read all of the core novels when they were first released. So, I enjoyed the franchise, but I am not a devout fan like many others.That said, this game would have passed by me without knowing about it, if it wasn't for all of the nonsense about boycotting it, and the crazy hate that a game has managed to generate before it was released. I purchased this to take a stand, and as a result, I've found myself impressed and have been having a great time with it.It's visually great looking, and so far I'm enjoying exploring the world, dueling with my wand, and I'm curious where the main story is going.I do wish the side characters had more dialog interactions with them, beyond just their side quests. And while the game normally runs smooth for me, there are times where it does stutter for a moment as it's clearly loading in assets.If the game ends strong, I'll likely even give it a second play through, to see how some different choices may change things up.

author: Josef Wissarionowitsch Stalin
review: TL:DR: Too little Hogwarts, too much 0815 Open WorldAfter completing the main quest line, the character quest lines and extensive exploration of the open world, I have to say: Great game and truly successful. The love and care that went into this game exceeds all expectations.However, there are also criticisms:-Basic premise: If you are looking for a Hogwarts school simulator with lessons, classmates and common room feeling, you are wrong here. The castle is only a backdrop and only "lives" during the quests or cutscenes. Exploring the castle and the surrounding area is very nice, but quickly fades away.It's basically like a modern Assassins Creed or Far Cry, but in the Harry Potter universe, you're not really part of the world.-Main Quest and Side Quests: The main story starts strong and unfortunately becomes very weak towards the end or the narration just stops. The side stories with the individual students is the highlight of the game.-Obvious cut content: Important parts of the game that would have complemented the gameplay loop are simply missing. In particular, a night system for Hogwarts and a morality system would have been appropriate here.You run around with your teacher and friends in several quests shouting Avada Kedavra left and right without anyone caring.The "ancient magic" that you master after the story of the game also comes up far too short outside of quests and cutscenes.-The spellcasting: The game leans very heavily on your character becoming a "Dark Mage". You kill with every spell and the unforgivable curses have a huge skill tree to defeat enemies even better. Especially without the skill tree, some spells feel useless.-Open World: The open world is unfortunately far too big as we know it nowadays. The north of Hogwarts and the south up to the central mountain range are perfectly okay, but there is a huge area underneath that is only visited twice during quests and is otherwise completely uninteresting.Large empty areas with copy-paste bandit camps and animal spawn points, a few balloons in the air and puzzle tasks. That simply didn't have to be there. Instead, places like the forbidden forest are too small in my opinion.There is a lot to do in the world, but what you can actually do is very limited. It's not much fun to solve the same puzzle for the 15th time or to defeat the same 10 different enemy types.-Items, Potions, Animals and Crafting: The system is kept simple and especially the plant cultivation and animal husbandry are quite nice and go fast enough not to feel like a grind. The potions are strong enough that it is actually worth upgrading before battles. However, it is almost pointless to upgrade items before level 40, because you get new items all the time and hardly need to rely on the modified values, even on the hard difficulty level.Translated with  (free version)

author: sloth.exe
review: better than expected

author: lydocia
review: Honestly and genuinely the most fun I've had in a game since Skyrim. The setting completely had me. It doesn't happen often that I'm driven to 100% a game, I simply can't not complete this one.

author: Cobalt Thunder
review: Avada Kedavra, what a wonderful phrase.Add Quidditch, k thx.

author: Bunni
review: I feel like I just woke up as a child again but instead I'm still an adult.Optimization isn't the best but I'm going to power through it because honestly I really just like this game and it's always been a dream to have a wizarding world based game on me, who I create, not following the same story of Harry Potter that I've seen a million times over. It's a huge breath of fresh air and I love it.

author: Makattack
review: If buying a game that was developed by a team that actually treated the consumers as humans and released a game that isn't riddled with Micro-transactions and isn't so poorly optimised that it's near unplayable, than I'll be a transphobe if that is what's required

author: ZIDAN
review: DO NOT BUY! Absolutely atrocious performance on a 3070Ti, 5600x and 32 GB ram. Frame drops everywhere, stutters as you move around hogwarts about every 5-10 secs, absolutely tanks framarate to 5-6fps during cutscenes. Great game, ambiance, characters and gameplay but the experience is totally ruined by god awful performance. Enjoy the game elsewhere but please not on pc. I've tried everything, its just plain broken. Many are overlooking this from pure excitement of a harry potter game; but trust me any other game would absolutely be bashed in this state.Other Cons:- Horrible shimmering ray traced reflections; often jumping in and out of screen;- Glitched animations leading students(other npcs) to have twitchy movements and awkward animations;- Shader Compilation every time you launch the game;- No Exclusive Fullscreen so you have to change the resolution of your desktop. This also means DSR or its AMD equivalent will default your refresh rate to 60Hz if you play at higher resolutions and downscale;- Many objects and surfaces shimmer at resolutions below 4k regardless of anti aliasing setting;I don't care anything about the J.K Rowling stuff and absolutely love Harry Potter. This is especially why I am distraught and feel scammed. Bought it from greenman gaming so can't even refund. SAVE YOUR MONEY or buy on other platforms guys. But I'd advise not buying at all to send a message to devs and publishers that this is not okay. They clearly didn't give a f**k about PC players. Lackluster performance, complete and utter disregard towards optimisation, missing basic options, even the spells are bound to 1, 2 3 and 4 i.e. awkward kb/m controls. This is how much they cared. P.S - If you're enjoying the game regardless, hats off, to each their own, but this still doesn't change the awful performance many of us are getting.

author: Mr. Epic
review: Game received so much unwarranted hype. It gets so boring after the initial excitement of being a wizard. The main issue is the main character. Very uninspired with zero personality or charisma. The game also wants to skirt around the whole JK Rowling transgender stuff, so it doesn't use any gendered language. You aren't allowed to explicitly say whether your character is a male or female. Whenever somebody refers to your character in dialogue, they use they/them pronouns, which lame as hell and a cheap way to solve the gender issue. Story is also boring and dumb.

review: mid poorly optimized

author: Jussuf
review: Best Harry Potter game so far. Witcherlike combat - fastpaced with combos. Great exploring.

review: Doesn't run well at all.

review: Great game held back by performance issues.

author: Silver

review: its actually unplayable with the amount of lag i have gross they even allowed it to come out in this state

author: StevenDTD
review: Amazing adaptation of the source material. You can really see the love and care from the developers when wandering around Hogwarts. Every single detail is very carefully crafted and is amazing to be immersed in.

author: DreadTomb
review: goty

author: ☾ Shadow ☾✩☽ storm ☽
review: harry potter but make it open world and u have the greatest game ever made and that goes without saying im only 8 hours into the game and there is still so much to do as a 5th year student . challenges and getting quests from all the students at the acadamy and even your professors . maybe we will get some kind of expansion for this game in the future that would be bad ass .  10/10 would learn stupefy all over again :D

author: Seraph
review: The open world is pretty nice for this game, but the combat gets pretty stale quick. Side quests aren't very rewarding. And the story is as bland, generic, and confusing as they could make it. MC is the chosen one who can use vague ancient magic that can do a bunch of random stuff depending on what the game needs. I only like a few NPCs. Most of them are annoying. And your choices/ role playing options as a character are very limited. Basically, do whatever you want-- it'll all have the same outcome.And yes, the 'controversy' over jk rowling was stupid. But this game's attempt to compensate for that is even stupider. This is supposed to take place in late 1800s, yet 'reflects the world we live in today'. Just made everything feel like a joke.This game is pretty, but too simplistic for my taste. And the story would only please the type of people who protested it. Ironic, really.

author: Endymion2314
review: While the game was initially fun, the lack of support for PC in fixing the obvious graphical issues and stuttering have made me uninstall the game. I might come back in a year when hopefully the dev team have fixed the issues.

author: Venom
review: it's okay :)

author: Falacu
review: Very good game with some minor performance issues.

author: scott gillespie
review: i love the game so far, playing on hard mode with no mini map, or guide and after getting lost in the castle im finally exploring the world. for my first hairy potter game, im loving it and i cant wait to get even more lost.

author: pL4St1c
review: Easily one of the top 5 most entertaining games I've ever played!

author: Shakabrah
review: Obviously this game is awesome. Forget anyone who says otherwise. They're legit hating.

author: ProbablyHunter
review: There are definitely some things that could touched up on, but overall this game is filled with passion- quality in almost every aspect.Sure, some games are just for fun, some are just for looks, and others are just small novels. This game made me happy. (And it was fun, too.)

author: Ranger Danger
review: When i was a child, we got little demo versions of games out of Cereal boxes, so one day, as i was munching on my cereal, i found a harry potter and the chamber of secrets game demo, which i eventually put aside because it kinda didnt sit right with me. Now, almost 20 years later, Hogwarts Legacy dropped.This game is incredible. It is everything young me dreamt of as a Wizarding world game. it is magnificent!my pc cant really run the graphics higher than low and it still looks pretty as hell!The combat is intuitive and there are a lot of secrets to find, trolls to slay, magical beasts to find and characters to meet! My Advice: delete twitter, dont jump on any of the cancel culture ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, just get in there, play and havee fun!

author: adamore14
review: I am about 6 hours into the game so far and here are my thoughts. If you a big fan of the HP universe, then you will likely get significantly more enjoyment out of this game. However, I am a casual fan and still am enjoying it quite a bit. The amount of detail in the environment is immense, one of the best looking games I have played in a while, there is a lot of character and detail everywhere you look. The story is really well written too, really feels like a genuine HP story. As far as the open world and game mechanics go. It is really strong in some areas, there seem to be a good number of optional locations and objectives, but there isn't a whole lot of opportunity to really customize your build. Overall, it is more Witcher 3 and less Skyrim as far as RPG elements go.

author: Walen7
review: For all Lovers of Skyrim, then POKEMON GO, and in the end FARMING SIMULATOR Kind of nice and dynamic game Combat actions on high and some sort of fun levelCutscenes are amazingHoundred of hours to spend With Love

author: Fendord
review: lots of performance issues

author: Fenix
review: Either you're certified Potterhead or just casual gamer, you should try this game. The exploration is just *chef kiss*. Combat can be bit challenging, but once you get the hang of it, it becomes easy. The puzzles are a good brain teaser I would say. The ability to decorate your own Room of Requirements is just satisfying. Overall, just a strong candidate to win GOTY.

author: Dr_Gui1tarfanat1k
review: Over the years I have become disconnected with the HP films, however, I was excited for the release of this title-- contrary to main stream media. This game has delivered!!! No microtransaction, pay-wall, pay to win lore, all just good old-fashioned RPG fun. I easily spent 5+ hours my first play-through and look forward to returning to the game, films, and books. If you are skeptical, try it out anyway, there is a rather large community of happy people currently playing and willing to share tips and tricks. Also a big plus that this game is able to fully run on the Steam Deck!

author: MasterLash
review: So far this is an awesome beautiful game, well worth picking up and playing. Not often I say this lately but this game is worth full price. Id love to see a couple expansions like a dark arts arena for pvp as the combat in the game is good and I would also like to see quidditch added. I will add more of a review as I progress the game.**Edit **So after a good deep dive into the game I can give my view on a few more things. Good and bad.* Challenges - About 70% of your game time will be doing small quests that make you work something out. first time I did this i thought it was awesome. Sadly they have around 7 ideas for these and just make you do it 60+ times for just the Merlin trials alone. With the spells they have more ideas would of been easy or even half the number of the things are its beyond boring. 90% of caves turn out to just be the same steps to a small open area with 1 chest that offers random loot likely worth 90 to 200 gold. Pointless and over done. Only one set of challenges made me pay any sort of attention and those where the Depulso rooms.In short all are good but someone made the bad decision to make you redo them way wayyy to much. Really ruins the memory of doing them for the first time and stops you wanting to replay the game.* Talents - Very op, It dose not matter what you pick you will be crazy op as the bad guys cant keep up with you even with out godly talents. For example the Edurus Potion Potency talent.Available from level 5 will make you invincible for a short time, you can also carry 12 of them so you could be untouchable for a very long time. Super easy to replace ( and free after you buy the seeds ect) That is one level 5 talent of 48. They could do with a little re balancing to make the mid/late game feel as fun as early game combat.*View/ Surroundings - Beautiful, Everywhere I have been has been amazing. Only game to give me this much wow was Red dead 2 and elden Ring. Plus seeing these places in movies and reading them in books just adds to the hype.*Combat - Tricky one as I honestly love the combat and feel with all its options you can play how ever you like and be relevant, My only issue is you become op way to fast and nothing stands a chance vs you. Plants = Aoe control god, Potions = You becoming a god, Light or hard spells your a total bad ass. Id even say the light spells offer a more fun pace as pulling a dark witch to you spinning them around, turning them into a tnt barrel then throwing them at there friend is just golden. Dark Arts are crazy strong so fun to use when you feel slighted. Play how you like and your be op no matter what you do. hell I dont even block just elden ring roll away from everything. * impact of choices - Non, at no point have I felt what iv done has changed the story in any way. It is like most traditional rpgs where your following the hero not like alot of newer styles where everything you do affects the world. You could cast the kill curse in front of everyone in Hogsmead and they would just go about there day. *Customisation - 10/10 You can change your char, room, wall paper, outfit, broom, mount, appearance. Only thing I would add would be to change the colours of gear but honestly they pretty much nailed this category well.Upgrading gear - pointless, you never need to worry about gear as you are just so op anyway plus you get better gear non stop with every chest,Taming beasts/Breeding- Ok yea its pretty pointless but it feels nice and I think its turns into a beautiful set of rooms for you to play with. Really add to people wanting to Roleplay this. Bugs- Iv not come across many at all, the off chest giving me another 500 gold and a few robes glitching into the npc bodys to make them look really silly. Basically a few little things that really never affected my game play more than add to my giggles. Stuttering lag ended soon after launch and even that wasnt that bad.Overall Its a great game and I believe still worth the full price. I would love them to add dlc as soon as they can to keep the hype rolling as they have a good work that needs more main storys.I dont feel the game is that long and a bad call to make you do the same puzzle tasks hundreds of times for nothing more than to add hours to the game play leaves you wanting some real content. That said its so beautiful and hell it might be one of only a few games to come out that is playable. Its exactly what you expect and want it to be. Anything else you want me to review just add to the comments and I will give you my honest thoughts.

author: Mira
review: As a TRANS gamer and someone who loves the Harry Potter world. This game has been nothing but blast. Upon release it mad minor hic ups for FPS drops, which was easy to look pass.Gameplay: 9/10The combat is responsive, snappy & most of all? Engaging. You learn more tricks about fighting enemies and cool combos that introduced within the tutorial systems of fighting the training dummies.Scenery & Graphics: 9.8/10It's an emersive world that you can get lost in. You can get freaked out by the creepiness of dungeons, the noises spiders make when they're crawling on the ceiling and most of all being in dark places only being lit by Lumos. I found myself captivated instantly and consistently within the grasp of this game.Story & Plot: 9/10Without spoiling. You'll see. :) the game has a good story, there are moments it leaves you puzzled, but things will come and get filled in later.Dislikes:The character creator - This is just me being picky, but the voice ai is awful for pitch, but the hair styles are posh and I love them! Sliders would be a good addition one day for this game - Obviously more DLC is coming to this game with how it is built.TLDR: I think you should play it and ignore what haters are saying. It's a great game to get lost in and forget about the troubles in the world. There are more things to worry about than royalties of a beautiful game going towards someone who is voicing their opinion.

author: JaegarOne
review: So in depth, you can basically do anything you can dream of in the world of Harry Potter. From catching magical beasts, growing your own plants, brewing potions, flying on brooms and beasts, you could enjoy this game as a Harry Potter version of Stardew if you wanted after progressing far enough. 10/10 will keep playing again.

author: Luna_Celestial
review: I'm not one to write reviews, but I had to for this game. Hogwarts legacy is an amazing game! From the story, to the world, to the characters, just everything. It is amazing. 31 hours in and I've pretty much just explored doing side quests and just seeing the world around and inside of Hogwarts. Now it's not without its faults, there are a few things that are repetitive like a lot of the "challenges" in the game, but even with that I still find myself loving every time I do it. Another thing negative for me is that many of the characters in a sense feel emotionless and soulless, the main character included (at least the female one, that's who I chose) dont get me wrong i think the voice acting is amazing. it's just the animation in the faces, specifically the eyes that seem off idkBut anyways, It's honestly just a really fun game in my opinion,, and it is one that I know im going to just sink so so many more hours into because I truly can't get enough of it. (If only I didn't have to work lol)Solid 8.5/10 and I very much recommend this game, it's truly amazing magical journey!! ^^

author: Datura Plays
review: I'm calling my lawyer and suing Avalanche. This game destroyed my real life and now I live in Hogwarts 24/7. Join on my 100% completion adventure and let's sue them together!

author: elWalas
review: This is a must for any person who grew up with the HP books like me. It's a dream come true. This doesn't mean that the game is perfect, just that it's allows us to explore freely all the places that we imagined while at the same time having most of the movie places perfectly represented. 9.5/10.

author: niddLer
review: After being disillusioned with some AAA games like Dying Light 2 and Cyberpunk 2077 and others, I didn't expect or have a big expectation for this game, but I must say this is AMAZING.I'm not a HUGE Harry Potter fan, in fact, the first time I saw the movie was 2 years ago, during the Pandemic. I never really had much curiosity but since I was stuck at home I decided to watch. I liked it, it was a cool experience but I wasn't obsessed with it.But after beginning to play this game I went and started re-watching the movies because it felt so GOOD, this game is splendid, from the character construction to the ambient to the AMAZING Hogwarts Castle with INFINITE rooms to explore, which is something crazy. In my first couple of hours, I  went to the Castle and roamed around discovering rooms and secrets.The combat is fun as well, but a bit confusing with all the spells, In fights I usually just press random buttons to cast spells.The graphics are amazing, and the architecture and detail of the Castle are incredible. The customizability of the Room of Requirements is something that I didn't expect, the Vivarium is also cool, with the possibility of having a lot of tamed friends there.Overall this game exceeded my expectations by A LOT and I'll most likely give it my award for the Best game of 2023.

author: Mike_OD
review: If you are a fan of the books, I highly recommend this game. This game jives with so much of my own imagination when I originally read the books. Hogwarts Castle itself is beautiful, inside and out, I could not have asked for a better take on the castle. Hogsmeade is a more fleshed out village and again something more in line with how I originally envisioned it. I could go on and on about how the game tickles that joy center in my brain for how it brings my imagination to life, but let's move on.Combat in this game is a joy. Better with controller for sure, but doable with mouse and keyboard. Before they started showing it off, I was skeptical on how it would work but the combat just flows so well. Being able to chain attacks and either switch to another spell set or simply swap spells out on the fly makes the combat feel very alive. Playing on Normal difficulty is a nice challenge at times. I haven't even finished the game yet and already sunk a bunch of hours into it. There's been some small gripes here and there, but nothing overtly egregious to say "this game doesn't deserve your money.Ignore the noise, if you're a fan of the IP and enjoy Open World Action Roleplaying Games, then get this game.

review: For now, not recommended.Terrible PC performance, fps drops. Even got stuck in textures doing main mission. Huge lagging. Can not enjoy the story.Might change review when all is fixed.CPU Ryzen 9 3900XGPU RTX 3080RAM 32GB

author: Nethiuz

author: Sadistic Sweety
review: This game feels like it's another twist of a Fable installment. It's got a lot of content, plenty to see and do, and for someone who is not a big fan of Harry Potter stuff, this game is a lot more. I'm sure the actual fans are in love right now. Gameplay is good, graphics are decent, music and ambiance is wonderful. Customization, action, puzzles, open world maps.Combat is fun, great animations and it feels actually entertaining to play. There's also quite a lot to unlock and learn with skills and combos. This game is certainly not your cash grab as you'd maybe expect these days in gaming, however it's a fairly large game and I can say I didn't expect to be so entertained.

author: joridiculous
review: I really like this game, but holy cr*p it is absolute garbage after the latest (March 8)patch. RayTracing is F-ed up, Crashing is a guarantee, especially when travelling (you are lucky to do 3 in a session before Crash To Desktop). Memory use is insane. It Will use all your available memory regardless of you have 16 GB or 64 GB. A sh*t ton of problems for people having no problem running the game pre-patch, now many of them cant run the game at all.Stuttering and namedrop is over the top after the patch, even on a i7-13700F, RTX 4090.Save your money. Buy the game on sale IF Portkey ever bother fixing the sh*t PC port. Or try some of the mods. They will not fix the problems but at least you can have a better looking game and some performance improvement and get rid of ALL the annoying cr*p.

author: CPTONEEYE
review: Absolutely phenomenal game. The graphics are amazing, movement is fluid and the flight feels well balanced. The game has countless puzzles and keeps you engaged. I was really happy to see that all aspects of the game were well thought out and executed. I also noticed, whoever was in charge of the dialogue did a good job at synchronizing the mouth movements. I Would however like to see some type of multiplayer function added to the game in the future.

author: MrDexter
review: I only played about 3 hours, lovely game so far. Except for the fact that it barely runs for me. The game goes from running at 70-100 fps to 5-20 fps for 20+ seconds, changing the settings makes no difference. We all know why this is happening, the DRM that shall not be named... I did not pay 70€ for a game that barely runs. Refunded it as it is a mess right now, but i will come back to it once this has been resolved.

author: Plastic
review: Runs terribly, unplayable for a ton of people, positive reviews are either the few who it runs well with who have good pc's with tons of ram (64) or people who are ultra forgiving and are like "Oh hai all, games great, bit bad perf but they'll fix it, it's hawwy potta, yayyy, much recommend, bai bai" which is so bad faith it's unbelievable.
