author: Omnimaniac
review: Hogwarts Legacy will be the most overhyped and also the most boring game of the year.The immersion and role playing elements are absolute trash, I never once felt like a student as hogwarts as I was always wearing some goofy ass costume due to my gear. There is little to no interaction between mc and the other students and there are no minigames to play with them either. MC is a complete teachers pet regardless of what you want your character to be like and in that aspect it makes sense that the other students ignore you. There are zero consequences for your actions, so you can't be whatever you want to be as the story is set in stone, you can't fail anything either. You can use unforgivable curses as much as you want and nobody will give a ♥♥♥♥.The progression in the game is also horrible. Around a third of the way into the game you unlock the ability to unlock locks and what you unlock is tier 1 of 3. Exploring before being able to unlock tier 3 locks is a waste of time as you'd have to backtrack just to get that one tier 3 lock. Gearing doesn't really matter at all and you just smack on whatever has the highest stats, you don't even need to upgrade any gear ever, the only thing gearing really does is make you look like a clown. There is a fashion system so you can change appearance to not look like a clown, but it resets whenever you equip new gear, so you might as well just stay as a clown. The game tells you that you start unlocking talent points from level 5, but you can't unlock a single talent before you're well over level 10. The talent points themselves are mostly useless due to the combat being extremely easy and the only good talent is increasing revelio range as you're spamming revelio constantly during your entire playthrough.The open world offers nothing interesting to do. There are a ton of merlin chores to increase your gear slots, but none of these offer any kind of challenge. I usually enjoy platforming, but the merlin chore platforming trial consists of jumping from one massive block to another that is right next to the other, they are impossible to fail. It's just so incredibly boring. There are also a bunch of caves and treasure vaults, but most of the time they are as follows; run down a passage and loot 1 chest. Good job you've cleared a cave. Some time you actually have to open the cave or treasure vault in some way, but as long as you have at least one active brain cell this is very doable. On extremely rare ocassions there is something you have to do in the cave to get your one chest, but as long as that one brain cell is still active you'll manage. On even rarer occassions you might encounter an enemy in a cave (OMG) which you'll destroy in a second, what a challenge. There are some other activities in the open world like you can pop 5 balloons in a row on your broom, this is so engaging and fun. There are even landing platforms you can land on and that's about it. The combat is dreadfully easy, you are playing with cheats as your aimbot is turned on probably as it was developed for consoles. You can aim normally, but then the game zooms in so the back of your head covers half the screen. The lock-on targeting system for PC is garbage as the way you switch targets is with the arrow keys, so never lock-on to an enemy, you have aimbot anyway. The enemy never dodges any of your spells either so feel free to massacre them. The enemy AI is really bad as well which makes an easy game even easier, the best example are the dugbogs which routinely gets stuck which means you can spam them down without them even moving. However the game should get some praise now and this is related to some mechanics of different enemy types like how you can use flipendo on the club of a troll after it has swung at you to flip it into its face, these kinds of things kept the combat from being completely boring. The secrets and puzzles of this game were not challenging at all for the most part. For example one of the hogwarts secrets are light 4 braziers on a bridge and then match the symbols. Whoever was in charge of designing the puzzles must have been designing this for toddlers. However I will give praise to one single thing related to puzzles and that is the depulso puzzle rooms as they were the only fun puzzles to do in this game albeit a bit short. The by far best part of this game is the room of requirement which will appeal to people that like making houses in the sims. The room of requirement also have up to 4 vivariums unlocked through story progression which can hold the beasts you capture. The game should also get a bonus for having very good shiny rates for the beasts as I don't think many would have wanted Pokemon levels of shiny rates for the beasts in this game.There's no quidditch in this game which is understandable, but instead it was replaced with broom races. You are challenge by some arrogant ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ named Imelda to beat her times. To describe how easy she is to beat, you can start the race, then go make dinner, eat your dinner, take a ♥♥♥♥ and then come back to still be faster than her. She is supposed to be the fastest racer at Hogwarts, but after leaving her in the dust you can check the leaderboards for the race and she's nowhere to be found. The leaderboard times are not very difficult to beat either which is disappointing. I was hoping there was more broom races, but there are only 3.-Spoilers ahead-As is very common now the story is set in stone, none of your choices have any impact whatsoever. Towards the end of the story two of the main antagonists have a falling out and one of these confronts you and offer you to work together with him to take down the main antagonists. Personally I would have liked to be able to accept this offer, but instead MC is dumb and wants to kill him instead. There are technically two endings, but they are extremely similar and the ending is decided by drum roll... dialogue options before final boss fight. Nothing really matters and that is extremely evident throughout the game. The characters are also really shallow, but then again we don't really interact much with any of the characters.If you want to play a game set in the Harry Potter universe I'd rather recommend the older Harry Potter games as they are far more engaging and challenging.

author: Enevile
review: Alright.. This game.. Wow, you can tell so much love went into the making of it.But, that just makes it so painful to play through.And that is more or less my entire thought on the game. The game is the perfect example of a 5/10.Are there reasons to not buy it, or not play it? Nope. None at all, completely worth the money.Does that mean you should? Well I guess that depends on if you want to spend money for half of an experience.Every thing you do in the game, will make you wish there was more, and that is the travesty of the game. There isn't more, and I dont mean content alone (because that certainly is the case), but I mean;Spells : There are 20-23 Spells, some utility, some combat, and some both. Which just begs the question, how immersive is a world that is completely based on magic, with only 20ish spells? Not even all the ones from the books are in the game, and I would expect there to be more than are in the books. I would expect them to have new spells, and all sorts of crazy interactions.They sadly, do not even meet you halfway here, I would have aimed for 50-100 unique spells, with massive intereaction for the game to feel like a true harry potter game. You get 20ish spells, and 8 or so have very enjoyable and interesting interactions. The rest are just there.The spells that interact will leave you wishing, yearning, and completely unsatisfied while you think of all that could have been.Thats how the entire game is by the way. Pets are even worse, there are about 20 pets you can tame and breed. It does nothing. Helps you enchant your armor.Armor as well, will leave you feeling like there should have been some sort of system ontop of just.. "Power" and "Defense" with enchantments to enhance your spells in .. perhaps 10 very bland and generic ways. Just increased damage, nothing special. Imagine the game with unique effects, like poe or diablo uniques... Imagine this game with the items of Elden ring.Talents are perhaps the closest thing to complete the game has, and that sadly still is a half filled glass.They're interesting, and would be perfect for a teaser to a much larger and robust system.As it is, theres very little downside to just picking whatever you want, as you'll have all of them minus 12 at max level. They dont really change the game a whole lot,and if you arn't doing dark arts, then I imagine you'll actually have unspent talents left over.Exploration and rewards.. They give generic armor upgrades, that will honestly annoy you towards the latter half of the game as its all level based and you wont be leveling too fast so you'll just end up destroying and vendoring things. Theres a slight reward to explore every nook and cranny, until you have decent gear, then the chests might as well contain 50-200g. Which you can't really spend on on anything, as the shops are actually never useful in the entire playthrough.The cosmetic part of the game is really the only part of the game that seems somewhat well and fully done. And I would still love to see double the armor customizations, but I'm greedy. And then we come to the games one saving grace.. The actual look and feel of the world. Its gorgeous, and I love just looking at the landscape or buildings. The painstakingly lovely amount of effort that went into hogwarts and hogsmead are obvious, and.. then that will make you look at the rest of the world and wish.. wish that that much love had went into the rest. You'll actually wish the Open-World was smaller, so that they could have made more unique places. Imagine plundering the endless depths of gringotts, or going to azkaban.The questing, sadly.. Is.. a love-hate relationship. You will love probably 1/3 of the quests, some are very well written, and others will have you questioning why they were even put in the game in such poor condition.And its not very hard to google that there are no plans for new content at this time, as Alan Tew the Lead game designer has said openly.TLDR: This game, should have the early access tag on it. Because it is at best 1/4 of a game. Spend your money if you want, but its clear that IF the game ever gets completed to industry standards, it will be a long time coming.

author: krsname21
review: I, like most people, was really excited for this game.  There was a lot of hype coming from the community as well as the game maker.  Unfortunately, it has failed on many fronts, but there are also some good aspects to the game.  However, at this point, I would not recommend it for the state it is in and for the price it is at.  The good: the graphics are well done, the fight system is pretty good, there are a ton of quests to run, the base story is also pretty good.  That's about it. The bad: there is a serious issue with performance.  Lots of glitching, items floating in random places, in one instance, the mobs had the giant square pixel graphics splaying across the screen unable to be rendered correctly.  While there are many quests, they become monotonous because they are recycled.  The world is beautiful but again, if you've seen one part, then you've seen the whole map, villages and NPCs included.  Also, the constant collecting stuff... like.. I'm colleting just to get some gear glamour?  Not only, but there is WAY too much emphasis on the collection system.  Why even have a story if all I am doing is running around constantly to collect stuff that has 0 effect on gameplay?  Character creation is a complete joke.  For the price of the game and current standards of character creation on massive games, they have completely failed.  The ability to play your character how you want in game is non-existent.  The game maker stated specifically that the player could create their own path through the game, this is false.  You have several dialogue options when talking to some people, but there is no difference of outcome regardless of which dialogue choice you make.  How this game was marketed, there should be multiple outcomes of gameplay and paths your character can take, i.e. pure good all the way to pure evil, complete with varied storylines.  There should also have been varying paths depending on which house you choose.  What is the point of having different houses if it has no effect on gameplay?  The leveling system needs a TON of rework.  I had already made it to level 20, but my quests weren't even to level 10 yet.  The problem here is you have level 8 spells (not even access to talents yet), but fighting level 30 mobs.  This outleveling also causes issues with the amount of quests that show up.  At one point, there are just too many side quests all over the map.  There are a lot of quests that will disappear once you've hit a benchmark in the main story, so if you don't do them, then you lose whatever possible upgrade you can gain from them.  And, when you have 20 side quests available, you just get thrown too far from the main story and it kills the flow of the game.  How you gain upgrades (armor) is also not working.  There needs to be a way to acquire the recipes in a more accessible way than just RNG from a bandit chest.  I mean, we're playing freaking witches and wizards, and you're teling me I can't acquire a recipe in a legitimate way to make my character as powerful as I can?  Joke.  The main boss fights that you encounter are also a complete joke.  There is practically zero strategy invovled in beating them.  When I fight a boss battle, I want to feel like I actually achieved something.  With this game, you just cheese your way through fights.  There is no sense of accomplishment.  There's a lot more, but I think at this point, pointing out the issues just becomes redundant.   The main point here is they need to take a step back and seriously reconsider the way the game moves forward.  There is a ton of potential here to redesign and and make HL an amazing game with some serious longevity (maybe consider also making an MMO).  Right now though, it just isn't working.

author: TempoTribe
review: The game is very non optimised, there seems to be a ton of lag in dense areas for reasons I don't know. It crashes constantly, especially when using the Floo Flames to teleport. I figure these issues are due to the density of objects within certain places. I'm sick of the game forcefully closing all the time, I'd rate this a yes if they didn't rush the project and release an unfinished non optimised game. Note: I play this game using a RTX 3070 ti, meaning there should be no reason for these issues. For reference the specifications listed, are less performing of that than the 3070 ti, I am not gloating nor expecting for every game to run smoothly on an expensive product.

author: Rappin438
review: Incredibly fun, incredibly terrible performance.if you grew up loving HP then this game is a must buy.If not, it's still a must buy, but maybe wait until its patched.I can definitely see myself putting over 100 hrs into it.

author: Female Cartman
review: Horrible Early Access. Like for most people on the release time the "Play" Button way grayed out. No matter how many times I restarted the game, steam or my computer it didn't change. I verified my files and I later re-downloaded the game, absolutely did not help. I emailed support with full details on what measures I've taken and screenshots of how I do own the Deluxe Edition in my library. Got a generic reply explaining random things about the game, things that didn't have anything at all to do with me. I then didn't get a reply for 2 days. After 2 days I got a copy-paste of the first reply, nothing else. Game was literally unplayable for so many people. The Community Discussion page was going crazy with tons of people who were having the same issue and there was absolutely no help. Horrible release that I, along with other poor fans, had to pay for. Crap. The game has since become available and is pretty but this was worse of a release than No Man's Sky.

author: Willyto
review: The Harry Potter game we always needed. Forget the haters, if you like Harry potter and it's universe you must play this game.I can't stop playing, as simple as that. I forget to eat, go to the bathroom and I am unable to take breaks. It's that good!The gameplay is fantastic, great exploration, fun combat with different mechanics, lots of spells and combinations, interesting story and lore. The attention to detail the whole map has is just amazing. There's things to do anywhere in the map, puzzles, dungeons, treasure, trials, challenges, etc. The design of the game is beautiful and the OST is just brilliant hitting the right themes at the right moments, excitement, sadness, epic. Flying around in your Broom is a wonderful experience! The locations once you go inside on foot are plagued with details, exciting combats and plenty of enemies.The outfit customisation couldn't be better, you don't have to hoard everything to get dressed, once you get it you can use that skin on any item keeping the best stats with your desired aesthetics. What a great choice from the Devs. This is Fashion Hogwarts at it's best. Want to roleplay as a student of your house? Do it. Want to change into Swimwear for a swim on the lake? You can! Want to be the Demon Souls knight? Yes you can. Just love this details on the game.

author: tranletuananh1992
review: Overall the production quality is there, all the assets are beautiful to look at and Hogwarts looks exactly like I'm imaging.The problem is related to PC performance, this game is a mess, stuttering and framerate drop happens very often, it goes away when your shader cache is filling up, but the whole experience is not very good.As a typical console game first title, the keyboard & mouse experience is so-so, personally I hate the part that the game does not use all of my available keys for spells (1-9). One good point is you can forget about lock-on and switch feature, since the mouse is more reliable so you can just aim and fire, no strange behavior like using controller.Mid game is boring, you will have fetch quests, collectables, etc. Since most of the NPCs are bland and the some puzzles are just a waste of time (unlocking, collect house medals, etc.) it brings the whole game down.In summary:- Are you a Potterhead => just get the game- If not, wait for sale or at least wait until the game has patched for PC performance issues. It's a very bad PC implementation.

author: Zeesar
review: I have never seen the movies or read the books so I have basically no idea about Mr Potter or the you know who. Yet this game got me hooked right from the start. It looks beautiful, the gameplay is super fun and the music is fantastic. And also: Trumpet-Plants.

author: Divinity

author: Apex Predator
review: the game is ok. the combat is satisfying, the graphics are beautiful and detailed. but except one quest line, this game is too kid-friendly plot-wise, it lacks depth and tastes for more mature audience. Also, 99% of your choices have no impact or consequences. why even bother let players have dialog options when it does not even matter.

author: aleksa2808
review: It feels as if the developers created an awesome recreation of Hogwarts, Hogsmeade and the surrounding arreas and then, since they already had the world in place, decided to implement in it a game with a decently interesting main story, an awesome side quest story, simple but very fun and flashy combat, as well as a rewarding exploration system. From what I expected out of a licensed game set in the HP universe I can say that the end result went above and beyond my expectations.On the other hand, for anyone not into the HP universe this would probably feel like a pretty generic open world game. There is definitely a lot of room for improvement in a lot of systems, such as making the combat more complex, making the gearing system (a lot) more complex, making the open-world challenges more interesting (most of them are pretty boring and there is a LOT of them), making the main story a bit more interesting and adding more interactions and puzzles to Hogwarts itself (the Repulso rooms were a blast! the math puzzles not so much). I hope that now since they got a huge amount of world-making work done they can focus on these other systems and make an amazing sequel!

author: Willbob
review: Although this game has it's flaws in terms of performance and a couple of bugs - which are both quite regular annoyances to be honest - the game is truly a magical experience. Every corner you traverse is guaranteed to lead to a new wondrous moment.Combat feels pretty good and has some mastering to it that is just as satisfying as the rest of the game. This game's dopamine doesn't always come in the traditional way. You're supposed to explore and the game rewards you for it mechanically, but mostly, you just witness a moment that you feel like only YOU got to see - that is something special!

author: torquemada99
review: amazing game super immersive

author: bambootaboo

author: 0xyg3n.hac{h3llfire}{se}
review: Dang. Childhood restored a little. Especially in 'eyes wide open' climate.Great game :)

author: Alakay
review: I'm surprised how well optimized this game is and how beautiful it is. The map is way bigger then i expected and the spell combat is dope.

author: Djinnt
review: Good game, please patch the stuttering though

author: Githion
review: UPDATE: 33 hours of play time now and I still love this game. The battle mechanics continue to be entertaining, the new spells and talent system are enjoyable, broomstick and gryphon flying are incredible and a lot of fun. A certain secret room and its flexibility are rocking my world. This game has A LOT of depth. --------------------------------------------------------First, I was skeptical of the game at before playing. There's a lot of ways a game developer could miss the spot with a game set in a universe like Harry Potter and my expectations weren't very high. I'm delighted to say I was proven wrong. I have 6 hours into playing and so far I absolutely love it. I enjoy the beautiful graphics, the battle mechanics feel intuitive and natural and not at all what I was expecting. Being a Portkey Games project and having played the mobile Hogwarts Mystery I was expecting more spell tracing and less active battle, but again I was proven wrong, and happily so. It's incredibly entertaining not to be limited to casting spells only in certain areas but instead to be able to freely fling spells all through the school. It's encouraged in fact to discover secrets and hidden treasures! A quick list of the things I really like for those who don't want to read a lot:- Gear appearance (and ease of "transmogging" your clothes appearances)- Spellcasting- Open world gives a skyrim meets harry potter vibe- Money is earnable but not just given to you without a little effort at least- The story is rich and engaging- Beautiful graphics and amazingly beautiful landscapesSome things I think could change or be improved:- More interactable NPCs- A bit more clarity on the defense and offence stats from gear and how they effect your character- A more in depth Sorting Hat experience, the interview with the hat is only a couple questions so it would feel more authentic and give you better investment in your character if you really felt like the hat quizzed you more about yourself.

author: VanSHOE
review: When will they teach me the Unforgivable spells? >:(

author: Mr. Curieux
review: J'aime ce jeu

author: dickolas
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a very good game, however it feels rather uninspired in parts of its gameplay and design. This really plays like most open world Warner Bros. Games, such as their Middle Earth series or Mad Max. If you are getting tired of games like the God of War reboots, Horizon Zero Dawn, and Evil West then I honestly wouldn’t recommend this for you. However for everything this game copies it does it really well, combat is especially entertaining. My big gripe is that The first semester of the game really takes its sweet time in pacing the unlock rate for different spells. I might have been at 6-7 hours before I unlocked my broom and I was really only doing main quests. I would honestly recommend waiting to explore the world at ur own pace only when you’ve reached the fall season.Great game

author: Androes
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a wet dream for Harry Potter fans. This is one of the most immersive worlds I have seen. Avalanche studios really did their homework on Harry potter lore. The game is set in the 1800s way before Harry Potter. You play as the “chosen one” with special powers to see ancient magic. The game play is nice, they have many collectibles and lore artifacts you find. The story is very good and entices you to move forward, but the best thing is the characters. The side characters quests are even better than the main story!! Make sure to do all the side quests you encounter, all of them are worth it. 9/10

author: Miel Pops Wario
review: They made THE game. This is a Harry Potter's love letter to the lore. Every little small detail comes from the books. The old games, those PS1, PS2 games come to mind except the graphics look meticulously detailed and perfectly portrayed with the latest ray traced lighting. You got all kinds of activities that seamlessly are integrated to exploration of the map. The combat is very satisfying with lots of options. It feels like the most RPG of the Potter games with a dash of fast-paced souls action in the way of a nice dodge roll with apparent iframes. Lest I forget the story, it's top notch writing, acted very well (in the mo-capped scenes), and engrossing. I could sit down and watch a movie with this game's premise.The ray tracing is very taxing and I think the DLSS is not fully working right in the launch version of the game. I have good hopes that they'll fix this soon. In conclusion get the game, and maybe turn down a few settings or turn off RT.

author: 도깨비
review: Best game I've ever played in a long time. Not too long not too short, just on point and perfectly polished. Can't have enough of this game.

author: Blackcloud
review: Truly a good game. The castle is incredibly designed, and the exploration around the world feels rewarding. The combat is responsive, enjoyable, and with a fair amount of difficulty.I would recommend this game even to non Harry Potter fans.

author: ❖ Swook
review: I'm not going to go into details, because I'm too blown away by this game! It's been a while since I've been so immersed into a game and I'm not even a Harry Potter fan. It's like they thought of everything!Imagine if we had games like this more often. Even better, imagine if we had games like this for universes like Narnia; Pirates of the Caribbean; GOT etc. where you're making your own character and interact with that world in your own way. Great job to the devs!

author: NurAstana
review: I have been looking forward to play this. A fan of HP universe, I also enjoy playing video games in general, so this is right up my alley. The game turned out to be quite disappointing, unfortunately.There is very little pros, so I'll mention them at the top:1) a variety of activities (merlin trials, broom races, beasts/pokemon collecting, exploring caves, dueling, summoner's challenges, etc)2) a big world to explore, and game gives you the means to do it comfortably (broom, mounts, floo powder)3) Hogwarts is designed with a lot of fine details and looks niceThat's it for the pros, I guess. Here come the cons.1) It's not really possible to customize the appearance. Yes - there are races, no - you can't be fat or have a big nose, or thinner lips. There is a painfully limited amount of everything - faces, hair styles. You just have to roll with it.The facial animation gives justice to Mass Effect Andromeda. Most of the time characters have neutral expressions. As soon as they try to smile, though... it looks so janky ICANT. The game intentionally avoids facial expressions as far as I can tell. No one's cried or looked surprised, or angry throughout the game. It's all expressed via voice.2) I was 100% sure that we were going to get a list of questions or a prolonged conversation with the Hat, that would determine our House. HA-HA-HA, are you brave, loyal, curious or ambitious? I could not link these options to the Houses for the life of me.3) We start not knowing a single thing about our avatar, we finish completely oblivious as well. There is literally NO background, no story, no nothing. The character is completely empty. How old are they? Where do they come from? We spend a full year at Hogwarts - when is their frikken birthday? Who are their parents?This absence of information makes the character completely unrelatable. There is no bonding, no sense of association.4) Our "companions" struggle to share some of their backstory, but end up one-dimentional anyway:- a girl, who loves animals- a brave and just African girl- an emotional dark wizard boyThey have no life outside of their relationship with us. The dialogues are so pompous and lifeless, MY GOD. They repeat themselves sooo much - it happens all the time actually, the repeating. All other students cannot be interacted with, and don't have any meaningful NPC routine. They say the guys near the House points sandglasses are still cheering, up to this day.5) This whole 4 sets of 4 spells thing.... Try pressing 1-2-3-4 for spells and Q for to shield and Ctrl to roll.Thanks god you can change the bindings a little. Also, who on earth produced this great idea to have only 4 sets of 4 spells, but 26 active spells??? Why do I have to meddle with them every time I need to change smth in the Room of Requirement or brush a beast??6) - : there are 4 or 5 distinct trials. As soon as you've tried them all - that's it, they are not interesting anymore. There is no challenge whatsoever, they are not puzzles in any way, just busywork. The animation IS UNSKIPPABLE AND ALWAYS THE SAME, it gets even more annoying the more you do it.- : the same issue as above. Besides, the loot is limited to gear items, so there is no element of surprise, you're not eager to find out what you're going to get. Besides, the clothes models are VERY much alike - some only differ by the shade, and the choice is rather poor in the end.- : once you catch and put them into a vivarium there is nothing else to do. Yes, you'll brush and feed them a couple of times, maybe breed. You can give them a toy and watch them play a bit.- : the Alohomora mini-game is so brainless, yet you can't disable it. You also have to watch the UNSKIPPABLE animation, again.Dueling and summoner's challenge are actually fun, but the game portions them out as quests, so you can't just play/fight any time. Besides summoner's challenge opponents are extremely weak and give 0 competition.7) There is nothing to buy really (besides brooms and spellcrafts), so you just sell-sell-sell to clear out your inventory. I ended up with 80k gold. At the same time you can only produce money by selling gear items, so you have to loot-loot-loot. You can't sell ingredients or potions. OH YES, you can also sell beasts, but you're not a poacher, RIGHT?8) I think the devs/writers/POs/whoever forgot that the main audience for this game is adult people, not 10yo kids.Poachers are bad, but we are good, so we snatch the beasts from their dens and put them in our perfect little zoo. Could you justify it a bit more, please? Maybe it would be better to save the caged animals, and they are wounded or smth, so they can't survive on their own for now.Killing is OK as long as it's not an Unforgivable curse... I mean, c'moon.At the same time you can cast Unforgivable spells in plain sight, and no one would bat an eye.9) You may as well skip all secondary quests - the fact that you have completed them is not reflected in the world. To illustrate the extent of this - I was SHOCKED when professor Weasley mentioned that she was aware that I had saved (caught) a unicorn. The game's never mentioned any of my other actions.Okay, I'm gonna stop for now, but if I remember smth else I will update my comment.

author: lo9rd
review: This is a tough one to review. It's a great Hogwarts walkaround experience, the combat is better than I expected it to be and roaming the world is fun... but overall, 20+ hours in it's still giving me new mechanics and I've felt like it's still holding back. I can't stand games that have the bulk of the game as an extended tutorial. Especially since the Hogwarts experience is quickly engulfed by the size of the world and fast travel. Without more Fire Emblem/Persona style relationship and classes it feels a missed opportunity in a lot of ways.Gameplay wise, the quests and story so far are passable, but the open world is as by the numbers as you can get. Exploration quests, puzzle quests, collections upon collections upon collections and the gear upgrades aren't exciting whatsoever despite them being everywhere.It's a really strange game to try and review, yes I'm having fun, but there is always a "just let me play" frustration behind it all.

author: .Z
review: An average, borderline mediocre game. Like the movies, the magic fades away as you progress through it. The dialogues are boring and cringe-inducing, and the story is beyond stupid and unsatisfying. The quest system is outdated, and the missions themselves are as basic as some of the worst Assassin's Creed games. The game is filled with idiotic filler content like "Catch 100 Pages" or "Do 100 Merlin Puzzles," which can be resumed in the same four or five gameplay loops that repeat ad nauseam. There is an in-depth Requirement Room system, a breeding system, and a crafting system, all of which are utterly useless as the game is made for kids, and you will cruise through it on the highest difficulty level whether you engage with those systems or not.The only great aspect of this game is the wonderfully modeled world. Roaming around Hogwarts during the first few hours is truly amazing, but sadly the game keeps disappointing after that.Overall, I think the developers were not properly managed, and the focus wasn't put where it should have been. Better dialogues, a better story, or a fully-fledged karma system would have done so much good for the game instead of crafting or 6,000 useless skins for the Requirement Room.In conclusion, I highly recommend avoiding this game unless you're a big Potter nerd.

author: Khali∻
review: I spent 32 hours playing the game and was thoroughly impressed with what I saw. The attention to detail in the game's design is truly impressive, with every corner of Hogwarts and its surrounding areas brought to life in vivid detail. The story itself is engaging, with a strong sense of progression and character development.One of the things I enjoyed most about Hogwarts Legacy is the freedom it offers players. With so much to explore and so many secrets to uncover, the game allows you to move at your own pace and tackle challenges in your own way. Whether you prefer to focus on combat, exploration, or puzzle-solving, there's something for everyone in this game.Combat in Hogwarts Legacy is satisfying and varied, with a wide range of spells and abilities to master. The game does a great job of balancing the challenge of combat with the need to strategize and use your abilities effectively.Overall, I was thoroughly impressed with my time playing Hogwarts Legacy. The game offers a truly immersive and engaging experience that is sure to delight fans of the Harry Potter franchise and newcomers alike. I can't wait to see what the final release of the game will bring.

author: Garneth
review: VERY FUN. Definitely well-intended and well-developed.Please give us a sequel.

author: always losing
review: yer a wizard harry

author: Graybell
review: This game gave me a weird sense of fulfilment. The game play is super enjoyable and I loved that it was open world with exploration encouraged but not required. The NPCs had good backstories and I actually found the side quests actively engaging, which is unusual for me!The music is amazing and very nostalgic and it feels like a love letter to the films. I liked that there were morality questions in the game but found the lack of consequences for your character to be a little odd - using unforgivable curses in front of teachers for example without repercussions - and the voice lines can get a little repetitive.Overall though I really loved this game, it felt magical to play and would definitely recommend it, especially for those who grew up alongside the books and films.

author: ixFeisty
review: Overall, the game was a fun experience.  I had a problem with performance issues at first but figured it out after spending hours optimizing my PC using Google and YouTube, which I never had to do for any prior games I've played on my PC.  There are also a few bugs I encountered but nothing game breaking or couldn't be fixed by just teleporting.  Besides those two problems, I really enjoyed the game.  I will admit, the game feels really short even for a completionist as myself.  I played my first playthrough without any guides or searching on google to figured out anything and still manage to beat the game and obtain all but 3 achievements in about 80 hours.  Still worth playing as it's a unique experience and I recommend it to everyone.

author: ⛦ The Raven ⛦
review: I've not finished this game and feel like I'm far off completing it yet but my God, I love this. There are some issues with FPS stutter and whatnot but gameplay-wise, I have very little to complain about. Plus, I know a first-day patch is on the way that is supposed to fix this. Sometimes it feels overwhelming with the customisability of everything, from your gameplay style, the spells you want to keep on at all times, the skills you can unlock, your character's looks/fashion, etc. But, IMO, the game presents things slowly so you can adjust to what you can do.I love everything about this game. I'm just saddened that despite the (at least) four years of development by a large team, who were clearly passionate about making this game a refreshing and incredible experience, it only takes THAT ONE PERSON to vilify this labour of love.

author: broke_gamer
review: Wait for performance patch. I have above recommended specs with a 3070, i7-10700k, and 16 gb ram. Stutters everywhere. Don't let overall good reviews fool you.

author: Sleepyway
review: First hour ran flawless. After that its slide show after slide show and crash after crash.

author: 4star
review: Never been into Harry Potter. But this game is really good. It's fun in all regards, from story to exploring, all systems and collections. Everything just works and is fun. It's an RPG light where you play the role of a student at Hogwarts but you can't really be evil and there are no real choices and branching of story depending on what you do. However the game is really solid and I am having a blast playing it. Even if you're not into Harry Potter I highly recommend you playing this game if you're a fan of open-world rpgs. 8 smirking mugglers out of 10

author: Kuroha
review: This game's performance issues are an absolute joke. I am shocked that it isn't catching more flak for this. I played through the games tutorial with absolutely no issues, not a single instance of any dropped frames. The second I enter Hogwarts itself, the game turned into a slideshow. It stutters heavily even walking up a staircase, turning the camera, entering a new room, stepping near a door or casting spells to the point of unplayability. What I played of the tutorial was fun, wish I could actually play more of the game. I have the exact system that Avalanche themselves recommends for the game on high settings:- Intel i7-8700- NVIDIA GeForce 1080ti- 16gb of ramThey are either entirely incompetent or lying about what the actual recommended hardware for this title is. I have tried everything in regards to fixing this issue, including:- Changing all settings to low- Lowering the resolution- Manually updating the games DLSS- Trying all DLSS settings- Disabling v-sync - Reducing camera acceleration to 0- Enabling TextureStreaming in the Engine.ini- Reinstalling the game- Updating my driversRegardless of patches, this review is staying negative. Companies shouldn't be encouraged to release half-baked PC ports, this shouldn't be an issue and I shouldn't have to spend hours trying to make this game functional.

author: jstc
review: holy shid.

author: Nanaguts
review: AMAZING

author: Dr. Peppermill
review: Great RPG, solid candidate for Game of the Year.  Unfortunately it still suffers from some technical issues but this this didn't prevent me enjoying every bit of it.

review: It worked just fine when it launched for me. Then the first patch arrived and since then the graphics are all screwed up. The character creation is dark and people have a strange white halo around themselves and when talking in cut scenes there is no mouth movement. It has become unplayable so until there is a patch to repair the patch that killed it I cannot recommend

author: sonik_75
review: Its an amazing game for any harry potter fan. ........BUT... the game optimisation on pc is awful. Constant stutters and fps drops just ruins the game. The game is lifeless and the graphics are on the side of eh (i would take a well made game over graphics any day). The game feels repetitive very early on but its not too bad. Besides that, the game is amazing and im really happy as a harry potter fan that we finally have good "true" hogwarts game.

author: THE DUDE

author: Sleepybear
review: Woooow, what an game, The only regret I had, when I was playing this game, was that I had to work during the time it came out. xD The only issue I had in the beginning was the stuttering of the game, but got some more memory ram and it was good to go after that. But Wow that cut scenes and the fighting and the flying of a broom was spectacular.Managed to get 100% on the game as well, which feels like a awesome accomplishment, Since there was so much content, it was all enjoyable to do as well. Having a ridable mount was a great feeling as well. not just the broom, exploring the world of Hogwarts and all of it's landscapes was truly something else. Interacting with all the different professors and students for sidequests, as well the mainquest. Was a great enjoyment.The spells and traits worked very well. And you could go in stealth as well, which was cool. The quests was really nice to go through as the adventure moved forward. hoping for the next game of Hogwarts or whatever the next game shall be, Will be really exciting to see what may came out of it. Really looking forward to see if there is anymore story or DLC that could be added on this franchise of Wizards and witches. The battle sequences was superb! Hope you shall enjoy this game as much as I did!

author: OrphanCrippler
review: Excellent game. If you are a fan of the books/movies, and grew up reading/watching them like I did, then you are in for a treat. There is so much to do, explore and see. I think within my first 10 hours of playing, I still hadn't explored all of Hogwarts castle alone. Even before then, it opens up to be even larger than you were probably first imagining. The story line is pretty awesome so far, and doesn't feel like it's just tacked on to an open world RPG.Only thing I wish they had added was a fully fleshed out Quidditch game to play. I guess I can hope for a DLC later on including it. Even without it, this game has been an absolute blast with new things still unlocking as I play (Room of Requirement being an awesome example).If you are remotely interested in the Harry Potter universe I absolutely recommend it. Hell even if you aren't and have no idea what Harry Potter is, it is still an amazingly fun game.

author: Fableteller
review: Pleasant atmosphere, interesting mechanics and systems, good realization of Hogwarts. Nonetheless the game has some issues with game design, but the biggest problem for me is left-wing agenda with diversity and feminism on every corner without any logic in Scotland 19th century.

author: GourmetCookie
review: This game is a delightfully pleasant adventure into a magical world. When I start to play I am reminded of the great nostalgic feelings I got back when I was a young whipper snapper. The combat is especially filled with a high degree of smoothness, enjoyment, and challenge. Flying on a boom steadily makes me afraid of heights. Traversing incredibly detailed and thought out dungeons makes me scratch my head as I become stumped on a puzzle, but I inevitably soon afterward have a wonderful eureka moment. The game is enjoyable without being too exhausting, which is a thing now, especially as I grow out grey hairs and grab the tea-cup with my brittle fingers by a warm fire. It's cold outside but this game brings a little warmth to my slowing heart.

author: Cynical
review: I like most open world games, its a pretty guilty pleasure of mine, but Hogwarts Legacy was one of the most disappointing games I've played. Its not terrible, but for all the hype this game got, it didn't live up to it. This is the first true "Harry Potter open world game," and they missed the mark. Yes, this is one of the best looking games I've ever seen, but the world doesn't feel like a real place.Take Hogwarts, the main area of this game. It looks really good and there is a lot of areas and paths, but NPC's don't feel like they live there. They usually just stand there, doing nothing, repeating one or two lines over and over. You cannot use your spells on them, and you can't talk to most of them. This is how its like for the entire game, even outside of Hogwarts. NPC's don't feel like real people because there's barely anything you can do with them. The same goes for Hogsmeade. I genuinely was excited to head to Hogsmeade when I heard it was in the game. I was hoping for a place with dozens of memorable interactions and hoping for a cozy experience. Somewhere where I could just chill at after completing a hard mission or defeating a big boss. Instead, the lack of interaction made the place feel lifeless. I only came there to head to the shops or when I had to go for certain quests.The combat is also really bad. Its not just a lack of enemy variety, this game feels too easy. I beat it on Hard and never had much trouble with it at all except for the final boss. All the potions and stuff you can craft is useless. You don't really have to think in the game. You can just keep shooting spells over and over, and either dodging/parrying. There isn't much depth to the combat and it gets really tiresome. Its essentially just attack, dodge/parry, kill. Since the game scales, and you'll never find an enemy that is a lower level than you, your spells never feel powerful. Enemies get extremely tanky during the late game, and it turns into a real chore, where you just attack and dodge without reason. Plus, since you can carry 25 healing potions, its really hard to lose a fight. The story is also really boring. This problem would be fine if the game didn't choose to focus on it, but it does. The dialogue is extremely dull, characters don't have real personalities, and your main character is so lifeless. I was never able to get interested in my own character. The game also emphasizes "choices," but from my experience, there are very, very, very few that actually matter. It sucks as well, they can make a really good story with the material they have. Its in the universe of the Wizarding World, set years before the events of Harry's adventure. They had the freedom to create any story they wanted, as long as they had the same relative places, spells and ideas. Instead, Hogwarts Legacy feels like a really tiresome adventure, where your character just gets all the information he needs through hours of trials and tribulations to defeat the evil "bad guy." Its an idea done better before, and Hogwarts Legacy has nothing interesting to share on it.There are also many minor problems as well. The Room of Requirement feels like a Sims style, "create your own house," just slapped on at the last second without much care. Its extremely boring and doesn't matter at all since the game is already so basic in its combat anyways. The Unforgivable Curses literally do not matter. There is no consequence for using the 3 most broken spells in the whole game. You can use them right in front of the teachers, and they will not react. It'd be cool if the game had some kind of morality system or something. Its the Unforgivable Curses, they're supposed to be banned and never be used, yet you can use them like normal spells. The game level locks you from doing main quests, meaning you'll have to grind tiresome side quests to get back into playing the game. The side quests are not great either. Either you need to collect or find something, or "Help said character complete this task." Dungeons or caves are just combat arenas that have pieces of loot in them. Plus, the loot boils down to simple stat increases and you don't really have to think about what to wear. Just pick the gear that has the best stats and wear that. Personally, I thought that a lot of the gear in the game looked really stupid. Your character can look really dumb sometimes in the game. At least the game lets you change the gear's appearance without needing to change the stats. I appreciate them for including that. There are also way too many collectibles in this game, simply used to pad out time and get old quick.Despite my dislike for so much of the game, I can understand why people are enjoying it. The game looks amazing, its fun to travel on the mounts you get in the game, and once you get them, the world really doesn't feel so big. I actually really liked this. It doesn't take forever to get from one place to another. Even going from the end of one side of the map to the other doesn't take as much time as I expected. The music is astounding. The last third of this game, especially the last few bosses, are really fun and the highs of this game for me, and the parts where the combat truly shines. I can see why people may enjoy this game, but for me, the magic, no pun intended, was lost very early on. What turned into my own adventure and shaping my own path in the Wizarding World soon turned into an exploration game that turned to tedium.I really thought this would be the next open world game that would keep me hooked, but I guess I was wrong. For what is essentially Avalanche Software's first game, this was an extremely ambitious and creative project. I can see that this was a passion project for them and that they put their heart and soul into it. It is just unfortunately, a very flawed experience that didn't live up to my expectations. For now, I recommend waiting for a price drop before buying this game. Its not trash, but it simply isn't the Harry Potter game I've been waiting for more than 2 years for.

author: razing32
review: Hogwarts legacy is an open world action game with a Harry Potter skin.If you like open world games , you will probably like this.If you're just a fan of the series/world your mileage may vary.The world is big - and has a lot of locations from the books.You get to explore Hogwarts Castle and Hogsmeade.My issue with the world is it feels to big at times.Maybe i;m not the target audience but there is just too much filler.You start out fine growing plants and brewing potions but soon you have a lot of other crap.Field guide pages , flying pages , Dadelian Keys , Moon statues , Merlin Trials, Ancient sites , Boss enemies , Astronomy tables etc.It feels like too much at times.And since some of these are tied to level progression or unlocking spells you are kind of forced to do them.Merlin Trials unlock more invetory and since you trip over items on every mission you need them.There is barely any reason to upgrade "armor" since you find more and better on almost every second mission.Combat is a very Simon Says QTE affair. It starts out fine but in late game there are so many enemies it becomes a colored disco.Orange prompt - block , red prompt - dodge , plus colored shields to destroy with colored spells. And a few miliseconds to attack enemies with basic attacks.Seriously - it gets to be - dodge , block , dodge , block , block , dodge , 3 miliseconds to brake their shield and repeat.Also shields should block the spells of the color they are not advertise what spell to use to destroy them.That;s like a bullet proof vest with the caliber of the bullet that can perforate it written on the front.Story is decent , though it does borrow a bit much from the books/series.Harry Potter is a magical child , you're a magical child.Harry Potter meets a Hippogriff , so do you.Harry Potter can see Thestrals  , so can you.House Elves are treated badly there , some here are as well.Some of the side missions are better like Sebastians.The world itself is a bit weird. There are goblin renegades and bandits and poachers everywhere and no wizards seem to bother.Why does a teenager have to fix their problems.That's like a SWAT team outsourcing a bank robbery to a teen from the local high school.Poachers are bad for plundering rare beasts and getting their alchemical ingredients.But when you take them by force from their home to a vivarium and gather their ingredients and sell excess animals to a pet shop that's somehow fine.Oddly there are students and teachers from Africa and India , both of which were colonized by the British Empire at the time the game takes place and not once do any of them say "Oh btw , mister/misses British student , your country is kinda opressing mine. Messed up , 'innit ?"Performance is a bit of a mess and the game is resource hungry. And it doesn't even look that good in some aspects , like facial animation.They cut Quidditch. I just don't get it . Even earlier games on much less powerful consoles had Quidditch.In game reason is some pure blood got injured and the headmaster , a member of the Black family canceled it.You can ride a broom and ride through rings . Wooopeee such fun /sarcasm. Great to see the rings from Superman 64 still found work.Seriously , why the hell did they cut Quidditch ? How about cut some stupid rings , Merlin trials etc instead.Overall it's a competent action game but the amount of side fluff you have to do gets boring fast.Must be why every damn Foo Flame is mentioning your field guide and why the voice actress for professor Weasley emphasizes the FIELD GUIDE.Whether you like this or not depends on you and what type of game you like.Wasn't for me . Not bad , just too loaded with what felt like mandatory side stuff.

author: x10
review: I really enjoyed Hogwarts Legacy... This game has a ton of influence from games that I've loved for some time now. The spells remind me of how ancient tech works in Zelda Breath of the Wild. The spells are physics based and can be used to solve puzzles as well as battle. The cadence of the attacks are similar to Dark Souls (but less challenging). You'll really like this game if you like Dark Souls - but this is far more accessible. This game is not hard, it just has a similar combat pacing. The environment is really gorgeous, and the animation work is amazing.Pros: - Really nice looking game.- The combat is really fun. - Physics based puzzles were well executed.- Dark souls combat cadence and dodging.- The texture work and animations are really good.- Potions, breeding, and gardening were fun to explore and use in combat. - Tons of outfits to choose from and really good customization for your own room. - Engaging quests.- The Hogwarts castle is probably the coolest building I've seen in a video game.Cons:- Did this need to be an open world game? The open world exploration is bland. There's no point to doing most of the "merlin trials" and "caves". I just skip open world exploration in this game and go from A to B. - Loot system isn't exciting.- Puzzles get repetitive 20 hours in. - No quidditch :(.

author: Aleksei.Volchok
review: It's an OK game. Can't say a lot of good about it but not a lot of things rubbed me the wrong way. It's pretty. It's not repetitive. It's an open world without a lot of BS. There's an annoying crafting thing added on top of systems, but it's not necessary even on higher difficulty, so you can engage with it only as much as it's interesting to you. In fact, this is true about most of the game: this is the kind of open world that is fine with you engaging with it as much as you want. The world is static and uniform, but it has plenty of varied simple, and quick challenges with generously spread rewards. It's a fine distraction if you want some mindless fun. Especially if someone in your family is a fan of the franchise and demands you to play it.

author: heyevery10
review: Average story but the world building is great the zones you get to explore and do quests and other open world tasks are lots of fun, the side quests are hit and a miss and I really only liked the Slytherin relationship questline  out of all of them. The combat is flashy initially and getting new spells was really fun but once you have them all unlocked and understand the combat it begins to feel very samey as you develop your own routine for combat., This game is also determined to make you look like a clown 24/7 so I found I was constantly having to transmog my gear sets anytime I picked up a new piece of gear. The crafting system around the  is lots of fun and I found that added alot of reasons to complete the rest of the game. Performance wise the game still is not great and found Hogsmeade and Hogwarts to chug anytime I loaded in even with mods that help with it. Hopefully the performance issues continue to get patched, currently I give the game a 7.5/10 would recommend a sale unless you are a Harry Potter fan

I rate it 3/5.After a couple of hours it started to get a feeling tha I had already played this game before, only in another shape.Probably because its very similar to other games I have played in the past.Positive partsMain story:          4/5Combat system:  4/5Graphics:             5/5Things to improveBoss fights:          3/5Variety:     2/5Side Characters   2/5 The side characters feel kind of hollow with a few exceptions.The side quests are... mostly useless.The game world is a wonderful playground but unfortunately it feels disconnected from the story/quests.

author: bird
review: That part when the graphics turned into Deathly Hallows tale scene. Or the part where we saved 2 hypogriffs and I was flying with one above the lake, then I just scratched the water surface with its leg just like in the movies. Or that part where I first entered the Forbidden Forest at night, sneaking slowly in the fog to avoid centaurs... Or that feeling when I got sorted to be a Rawenclaw student just based on my answers.Or the part where I accidentally discovered the ghosts' party room. Or when I had a tense fight and I accidentally yeeted one dark wizard off the cliff and out of the universe with a defensive spell. And the whole game has moments like these scattered around all waiting to be discovered by you. It's far from perfect and it's really like an 8 out of 10 game, mechanically speaking it's similar to Shadow of Mordor. And this is not a negative aspect, its just what you should expect from the game. If you are an HP universe fan, this is a must have for you still.The music the visuals are all there. Every single detail of Hogwarts, Hogsmeade and the Highlands is just look how it suppose to look. But be careful! The game needs a high-end PC. And don't even dream about ray tracing. It eats a 4090 for breakfast. Thankfully the game looks almost the same without RT. From a sketch of books, to best seller books, to movies and to this highly detailed HP universe game. And we fans have been all there, and now we are at Hogwarts experiencing it real time and interactively.Highly recommended, even purely for the experience alone, along that, it's an enjoyable game.Hope they will add DLC's in the future. The modding support is already great and I've read that the game will receive a 6DOF VR mod too

author: FoxyMellow
review: It's a solid game, despite rumors of game breaking bugs and stuttering issues. While playing I encountered FPS drops caused by NVIDIA drivers, not the game optimization. As a person who doesn't give two ♥♥♥♥♥ about the drama surrounding J.K Rowling and the LGBTQ - ALPHABET , I decided to play the game and judge it solely on performance and quality of play. Long story short: Story is 9/10 featuring interesting plot, fleshed out characters and decent drama. The story also wraps up pleasantly without leaving out important plot points drifting in the wind. Unfortunately the story itself could have been elevated to a whole different level if only the writers had the forethought to do so. Despite that it's still pleasant enough for a HP fan or a casual RPG enthusiast.Graphics are 10/10. This is without a doubt the best looking, most polished Harry Potter game ever created. Characters, creatures, spells, backgrounds, everything looks fantastic even on normal graphical presets.Difficulty is 7/10. While the game does require the player to make tactical decisions and think before engaging a large group of enemies, it's easy to exploit your main protagonist powers to quickly overwhelm and destroy anybody that attacks you. Even on Hard difficulty, enemies don't pose much of a challenge.World building is 10/10 without a doubt. There are so many elements that come together to create an amazing experience filled with magic and wonder. I played for roughly 60 hours leisurely exploring and doing side missions and i feel like a still missed about 10 or so hours of content simply because I beat the game and saw no reason to go for collectibles. Even if a player has never experienced the Harry Potter franchise there is plenty of content to catch you up to speed and deliver a magical adventure. For those who are familiar with the source material, there are subtle (and not so subtle) winks and nods towards feature events happening behind the scenes of the game.Overall the game is fun and delivers what it promises. Could it have been better? Yes, of course. Mechanics could have been more robust. Enemies could have been more diverse. Choices could have had a bigger impact. That's not the point thought. What the developers proved with this game is that they can deliver an open world HP game with an original character that is story driven and impactfull while also respecting most of the source material. I look forward to the next installment which will hopefully explore more mature settings and plot lines, away from Hogwarts.

author: Vibe
review: everything

author: ShadedPineapple
review: As an avid gamer, I am always on the lookout for games that can provide a truly immersive experience, and Hogwarts Legacy certainly delivers on that front. From the moment I started playing, I was blown away by the game's visuals - the attention to detail is truly stunning, and it really feels like you are exploring the magical world of Hogwarts.But it's not just the visuals that impressed me - the story is equally captivating, and I found myself fully invested in the world and characters of the game. What really sets Hogwarts Legacy apart, though, is the way that small tasks and quests are seamlessly woven into the story progression. I usually find these kinds of tasks to be tedious, but in this game, I actually enjoyed doing them - they added depth and richness to the world and helped to flesh out the characters and story.One of the things that really stands out about Hogwarts Legacy is the passion and love that the developers clearly have for the source material. This is a game that was clearly made by people who care deeply about the Harry Potter universe, and that passion shines through in every aspect of the game. The attention to detail, the lovingly crafted environments, and the richly developed characters are all a testament to the developers' dedication and love for the world of Harry Potter.Overall, I cannot recommend Hogwarts Legacy highly enough. It's a truly remarkable game that manages to capture the essence of the Harry Potter universe in a way that few other games have been able to do. If you're a fan of the series, or just love immersive, story-driven games, then this one should definitely be on your must-play list. Five stars, without question. 25HRS

author: Konos-P
review: TL;DR - This is a great game if you're not a Potter Head, and an amazing one if you are. 9/10First off, this is a great game. There are moments that are absolutely breath taking. This game FEELS, LOOKS, and (almost) sounds like the Wizarding World we grew up with.Pros:          • The World is BIG, Hogwarts actually feels like a massive castle and the surrounding country is bigger than you think.         • The Original Story is good. Not 'groundbreaking' but a complete joy to actually go through.          • The game play is very fun. Easy enough to not struggle too much, hard enough that it rewards being good at it.         • The many, MANY nods to the franchise never feel forced.         • Your character looks like an actual person as do most of the cast.         • Even with some older textures, the game is breathtakingly beautiful at times. Watching the sunrise over Hogwarts? Magical. Seeing the "Private Garden" for the first time actually brought me back to the Oxford Botanical Gardens- one of the most beautiful places I've ever been. They really capture the beauty of England and Scotland.Cons:      • The textures are slightly older looking     • Some of the voice acting sounds more like a parody of a character than an actual character.     • Broom Flight Controls are not intuitive to anyone that has flown in other games.     • Wish there was a bit more variety in the clothing, but 1800s gonna 1800s.     • That weird 'blank face' all characters get right before the cut scene ends. Once you see it you can't unsee it.

author: Evrir
review: Honestly I REALLY wanted to like this game as it has ALLOT of charm and the magic is quite fun once you start unlocking spells but sadly I'm still within the group of people who literally cannot play the game without issues where I've seen with honest to god worse specs than mine run it just fine all I've found was the game practically made my machine have a stroke while I can run games like Elden Ring on high settings without much issue and allot going on. I've practically tried all the fixes listed, even turned the graphics into what's comparable to mud just to see if I can play for more than twenty minutes at a time to no avail. It doesn't help the patches have only made performance worse.. don't let the 40 hours lie, I spent most of that trying to get it to run and it liked to say I was running the game even though I'm sure as hell the Exe wasn't even in my task manager.  I doubt I'll get a refund on this game do to that and honestly it really feels like all I did was waste money. For those who are interested maybe give it some time before you buy it least you wanna be one of few who got screwed over like mysself and oh you'll probably get told to 'get a better computer' even if you possess a 2080 and are having issues.

author: Khaos
review: Look I'm just going to be honest. As somebody who never cared about Harry Potter and only played this because my wife wanted me to play alongside her...it really deserves a "meh" sideways vote, but it's closer to a no than a yes for me. This game is entirely reliant on theme, and I don't care about the theme. You take away the theme you have a fairly generic open world slog here.A map full of trials and collectibles that are in no way shape or form engaging or entertaining. TONS of half bakes systems just to say they are in there. "Potions and herbology!" Nope, just a menu, a menu and then a mobile game like timer in your face. Flying exists on brooms and animals but it's so slow and clunky you'll just fast travel everywhere. The game is wide as an ocean but there will be NO DIVING if you catch my drift.The combat is a highlight. The way you can string things together into interesting combos is really fun. Problem is, you'll never be in a fight big/long enough for it to really matter. Once you unlock a few key talents combat can be almost completely nullified. It is still the best part of the game by far though.God...really wish there was a sideways thumb. If you love the HP universe this game will delight you. If, like me, you're not already a fan, it won't make you one.

author: Cypher Prime
review: Been awhile since a game has been able to command my attention and imagination for this many hours. Sadly it's another poorly optimized PC port more dependent on your wallet than dev optimization.  But if you are willing to sacrifice visual quality and deal with consistent stuttering in the most fascinating locations (Hogwarts Castle & Hogsmeade), and are also a Potter fan, this is an easy 9/10. If you are a casual gamer, this is a 7.5/10.  And for the PC Master Race with 4090s to spare and modding is in your blood, this could potentially be a 10/10.Edit: would still recommend but removing 3 points for Denuvo not letting me play my game offline even after 109 hours logged.

author: Snacktooth
review: Someone at WB or Avalanche team said YES thousands of times…. and it’s great!Can I remake the map 4 times for each season? Yes!Can I make a pokemon breeding game? Yes!Can I make whole the house elf kitchen just to hide one chest? Yes!Can I recreate Diagon Alley in Hogsmeade? Yes! Can I make a 15-year-old child go on a murderous rampage throughout the countryside with no consequences? Yes!The list goes on and on. Honestly have not played a game that paid so much attention to detail since RDR2. Best open world game since RDR2 and Witcher 3. Don’t listen to these clowns who say the story is a-aight! Did they not do the Sebastian storyline? Did they skip the pensieve cut scenes from the main story? Not to spoil but there are some hard hitting moments, that left my jaw slack in surprise. What a game. Buy it now, buy it twice! This sort of accomplishment should be celebrated. Congrats to all the creative people who made it possible!

author: Patient 0 <3
review: At first i was like; "Nah, frick that game it isn't mmo, i wanna Avada Kedavra with the homies"then i was like; "Let's check it out on a stream"and then i was like; "Hmm, it actually looks really good*So i closed the stream an bought the game.I'm happy with my decision, it's a really good game.It has good story, lovely map to explore and fun puzzles both in story and non-story related things.The music in the game is what it is. it's Harry Potter not the best, not the worstGraphics are good (would like some Horizon, FF7 Remake graphics since it's a new game. but hey graphics isn't everything).Amazing gameplay, i had just as fun in my last fight as in my first and the spells let you play every fight somewhat differently. the gameplay really lifted this game troughout the playtrough.flying on the broom in the time trials was so fun, would hope for more of them.i also hope for quidditch in the future.My only negative thing i have to say as it is now is, the difficulty is way too easy when played on hard.Mostly 'cause you can do fun dmg builds by stacking traits and power lvl from the get go. The quests should scale to your lvl/Power.Looking forward to see what will happen next, if we get DLC's other than Skins or if this is where it ends. I for sure hope there will be more too it.Big up to Avalanche Software for the work they've done. They had a lot too lose with this and they just won.

author: Cupkate 🧁
review: Just a summary of pros/mehs/cons this time rather than my usual more-comprehensive reviews:+ best ranged combat system I've played in an action RPG+ hogwarts and overall world design are fantastic+ story puzzles are generally very well-made and... puzzling+ voice acting is top tier+ story is surprisingly good, especially for side characters+ characters are well-written and have a nice range of personal stories+ level of customization in the room of requirement is huge+ plenty of cosmetics to unlock just by exploring+ music we all know and love, with some new variations~ lipsync is jarring compared to the high quality of voice acting~ more tedious collection stuff than a ubisoft game~ miniboss attack chains will teleport to you even if you dodge/dash to the other side of the area~ content of the open world is as bland and uninspired as any open world RPG- pacing of story and game mechanic unlocks is the worst I've ever seen in any game- game encourages exploration, but then punishes you for doing so by gating game mechanics behind main story- awkward controls to swap spell sets & use brooms/mounts- generic RPG levelled gear system meaning you either get too much loot you have no use for, or a piece that immediately replaces one you get 5 minutes ago- inventory limit is awful and can only be upgraded by doing repetitive 'puzzles' in the open world called merlin trials- there are 95 merlin trials????- classes after the intro ones are just short non-interactive cutscenes and then you are handed a spell- entirely meaningless minigame every single time you unlock a door/chest- EDIT: apparently there's a whole other 'collectible' thing called Landing Pads which I completely missed because they're never introduced at any point in the game lolOverall a fantastic dive into the Harry Potter world, with rewarding exploration of the castle we all know and love, some bittersweet storytelling, and easily the best ranged combat I've played in an action RPG. That said, the game is also sadly marred by some very dated and clunky RPG mechanics, and if one were to open a museum of game development terms, Hogwarts Legacy would be the spotlight exhibit for "pacing issues".7/10

author: arts&crafts
review: There are too many damn Merlin Trials.Disclaimer! This game is very poorly optimized, it runs very poorly on a 3080/5600X at 1440p (no raytracing, with DLSS) so I would recommend waiting for some patches if you are not a big Harry Potter fan. I am not going to re-review later so I will put this disclaimer so you know what you are getting into.If you are a big Harry Potter fan, this is a really great game. Hogwarts is amazing and I do wish you spent more time there, you spend maybe half the time at Hogwarts, maybe less. The rest of the world follows the basic open world Ubisoft formula and could definitely use some work in a an expansion or sequel as it gets very repetitive. For the game play, I would call this an RPG only loosely. Yes you are "role playing" a wizard but the actual game shares very little with the RPG genre. You have no stats except "Offence" and "Defence" which is a number that can only be altered by changing your gear to one with a bigger number. There is a "skill tree" but the skills only slightly alter the different spells (make explosion bigger for example) and have no effect on how you play the game and you can not make different "builds" with the skill tree, so everyone will be playing the game the same way, maybe using different spells more than others. I would classify the game  as an open world adventure game more in the Assassins creed category than an actual RPG.Overall though, the game is pretty fun and aside from the technical issues, the game play is pretty sound. It is a must play for any potter fans and a pretty solid open world adventure game for non- Harry Potter fans looking for more in the genre. I would say, if you arent a Harry Potter fan at all or have very little knowledge of the Harry Potter world, I would wait for a sale. The best parts of the game are the callbacks, lore and expertly crafted Hogwarts castle that wouldnt hit as hard if you are coming into the franchise blind.
