author: drinksandjokes2015
review: While the graphics and voice acting is top-notch and attention to detail is there, there is something fundamentally off about the game-play itself. The map system is poor and confusing and is not intuitive at all. The combat system is a bit clunky but works ok. Aside from that there isn't a consistent ways to earn money other than when you might randomly stumble upon an item that you might sell, and when trying to locate items to create potions or complete quests there sometime is no hint as to where these supplies or resource might be, which gets a bit tiring and confusing, especially when you cannot buy said resource or supplies. And much of the game-play feels like the world itself is very empty. What I am more bummed about is that they had the chance to do a very deep dive, like that of Fallout 4 of Diablo, for the skills and spell tree, however they didn't try any thing new but rather just used the handful of spells and abilities that fans of the franchise already know. The game so far hasn't added much of anything to the lore or story, so at the very least I was hoping for some fun mechanics and really be able to customize my character a bit more, but the system to do so just isn't there. It feels like a very high-end game made for children, which is disappointing since the core fan-base are now adults who grew up with the books and movies. Feels more like a cash grab for the franchise than it does fan-service.

author: Dukas54
review: As of 0510(CST) 2023-02-14 (February 14th, 2023 for non ISO users) I 100% cannot recommend this game. Out of my 49 minutes of "play" time about 15 of them are actually playing. The list is in order of magnitude of the problem.UPDATE as of 0558 2023-02-14 I now have to repair and redownload about 300Gb worth of files for the other Steam games I have installed. I have never had to do this after installing, "playing", then uninstalling a game.UPDATE #2 as of 1110 2023-02-16 I have had to reinstall Windows 10 due to problems caused by this game. When I lookedat reliability monitor the windows errors started minutes after my first in game crashes, so I it may be related. Also running the health checkup command it found multiple Windows OS files corrupted. I really want to like this game, but due to the issues Iwill be refunding it as I would rather use that money on something that doesn't break my PC.So for a $60 "game" I wouldn't touch it even if I was being paid to. Wait until patches come out, even if they end up coming out for the PC port. If not avoid the game on Steam and hopefully you can get it somewhere it actually works.

author: Nerine
review: A wonderful, but not perfect love letter to the world that many people, me included, grew up with.Hogwarts and the surrounding area are brilliantly realized, and we are given free access to explore at our leisure and to live the student life all the Potter fans have dreamed of for years and finally not as a Harry, but as a character of our own making and in the house that we actually belong to. The game however does fall into a lot of the pitfalls of other open-world games. *cough Ubisoft* Where we end up doing the same puzzles with the same exact solutions multiple times, fighting the same fights again and again, and with all the spells there is also such a huge missed opportunity for more systematic gameplay of games like Breath of the Wild. There's also no time to properly get to know many of the otherwise delightfully written cast of characters, before the game is already over.Overall, though, it amazes me how this got made so many years after the main movies ended and with all the controversy surrounding the property. This one is for the fans and while it has its flaws, it's definitely worth experiencing if you count yourself in that number. Otherwise, probably wait for a sale at least?

author: kisakotetsu
review: It's a good game COULD of been better. My complaints: The amount of HP references are depressing don't get me wrong, love me some HP. But I wanted to see Hogwarts BEFORE HP not spend hours getting reminded of it at every possible opportunity. Even the background dialog is referencing HP. A couple of easter egg references would have been plenty buuut no, they apparently had such faith in this game that they decided to ride the coattail of every starstruck HP fan loving it no matter what.Its pretty repetitive, not just in the copy paste faces but the side quests are so...boring. I found I had the most fun not doing a quest and just wandering. That and it my personal goal to get all the moons. On that note WHY does Alohomora have a damn mini game to unlock something? This is not Skyrim, its a spell to unlock something dang it i would like it to just do it.Last thing, it totally breaks the illusion of being in Hogwarts when you can freely wander any where at night and not get into trouble! So next game let us have to sneak around at night to get moons and treasure and we can quickly slip away through locked doors with Alohomora that works like it should.

author: GhostIsSus
review: I cannot reccomend this game until they fix the optimization, 2070 SC, and a 3600, should have no problem, it runs fine, but randomly will studder and drop to 2-5 FPS until you reload the save, and sometimes it doesn't even fix it.. this game has been out for 2 weeks and they have failed to release a patch, with a few big names on this game, i would imagine they would have put out a quick fix, Preordered it back in Oct, couldn't wait to play it, but this is nearly unplayable, the game was fine until i got to hogwarts.

author: Otohoto
review: I grew up reading harry potter, they're the books that made me fall in love with literature when I was maybe 10yo (mostly fantasy and sf to this day but still), so i was pretty hyped with this game, the thought of exploring a fully open Hogward really was appealingBut i have to say it, this game is pretty disappointingThe good points :-This game looks great! Every single area of the game clearly had a lot of love and efforts put into, the castle is majestic and you’ll get to visit almost all of the locations of the books/movies, all the little towns feels uniques, the dungeons are nice looking, and every part of the map have its own identity, from dark forests to windy coasts it's all looking amazing, this is clearly the best selling point of this game-The gameplay is fun, it's nervous, require some adaptability and is very rewarding when you get to master it, i advice to play the game on hard difficulty otherwise it's clearly too easy-Poppy Sweeting side quests, the only interesting quests imo, but that's mostly because you're dealing with magical creatures I guess-And... That’s it, sadlyThe "meh" points :-The collectibles, if you plan to 100% the game be prepared for a grind (i don't know why i did that to myself), there is some activities in the Highlands, but you can experience them all in the first few hours, after that you'll only find stuff you've already done somewhere else on the map, the best example being the Merlin's trials, there is only 9 different types of trials but there is 95 to do in total, it gets really repetitive and absolutely not rewarding after a while, why bother building a world this big and detailed just to fill it with the same things over and over? At least make sure your repeating activities are fun to play-This lockpicking minigame, why is this in the game? I don't mind a lockpicking minigame in an elder scroll or a fallout game, because it fit in the setting, but here i'm using MAGIC, the magician say the spell and the lock open, that's it! Here it's only breaking your momentum everytime you find a lock, and that's if you took to the time to find enough of a special kind of collectible to UPGRADE your spell to level 3 (??), otherwise you sometime have to leave it and come back later with the upgraded spell to get the collectibles it's keeping, even if it's in the middle of a dungeon (collect collectible to be able to collect even more collectibles? What a great gameplay loop)-The facial animations, i get that this is a hard thing to do in video games, but most characters looks like robots, and I can ignore bad animations and stillness in characters when a game is generous with the rest of the content (Fallout new vegas, The Witcher 3…), but here it’s very frustrating to watch if you combine it with the major downside :The bad point(s?) : Writing and immersion. I don't understand how the people in charge failed to understand that the writing and immersion were the two most important parts to work on in a game set in the world of Harry Potter, this game struggle to capture you and is all the time reminding you that you're playing a video gameThe main character is an empty husk, s/he have no personality, no background, no motive, the only choice you can make that will have an "impact" on the game is the starting house, "impact" because apart from changing your common room that you have no reason to visit once you took a good look at it and the colours on some outfits it's completely useless When you're presented a dialog option you can guess by the end of the dialog that all the option you had led to the same results without even needing to reload to check, if my choices have no impact whatsoever on the game and story then don’t give me a choiceThe plot is forgettable at best when it's not weird or just bad, there are very few side quests for a world this big and most of them are just uninteresting fetch questsThe characters are constantly explaining to you the plot and reminding you things you saw 30 minutes beforeThe game fails at being funny, sad or epic for the most part, i remember one epic moment toward the end, and Poppy Sweeting side quests which are pretty good but that's it, the rest of the plot couldn’t catch my attention because of how “standard” it isThe castle looks really, really good, but there is nothing to do in it apart from searching for collectiblesThe game struggle so much to have its own identity that it's constantly rubbing your face with things and scenes you've already seen in harry potter, everytime pushing you out of it's own story and settingYou spend the whole game fighting and killing poachers, because poaching is bad you see? But in the end you’re forced to turn to a poacher yourself if you want to upgrade your gear, capture animals, or “save” them as the game say, put them in vivariums, harvest resources from them to upgrade your clothes, breed them; you can even sell their offspring if you need some easy money The guy who upgrade your lockpicking spell want you to collect a good number of a certain item hidden in the castle and nearby villages, he want us to do that because the said items "terrify" him and he doesn't feel at ease with these things around, but that mean he know where to find them right? If he did not he'd have no reason to be afraid right? Well if you know just tell me where they are maybe? Who wrote that? Just make this guy a collectioner searching for rares items and it instantly make more sense because right now he's just being an as*holeThere is a lot of things like that that are frustrating to see if you think about what this game could have been if they hired some real writers and worked on the immersion, i would not mind this game being 50% of it's current size if that meant we could have a captivating story and a more interactive and lively HogwardI do still recommend the game because it looks great and is very fun to play, but if you’re a fan of harry potter don’t expect to feel like you’re a student in hogward, you’re more like a visitor in a museum, a very pretty museum

author: thundervamp9
review: Absolutely love this game so far. Having a Story Mode as a difficulty level pleases me to no end, because I play games for the story, not for the difficulty in trying to beat it.I initially bought the game for my Xbox Series X and  loved it enough that I turned around and also bought a copy here on Steam for play on my PC so I could see how it played and looked on a 4070 Ti.Highly recommend the game

author: @Corefitz
review: An aboslutely magical game!Having 100%'ed the game now (including all collectibles) I feel like I can give it a propper and fair review.Disclaimer: I'm avoiding spoilers to give those that have a legitmate interest a fair chance.PROS:-The game looks and feels amazing to play, the moment-to-moment combat is addictive and well balanced, every spell you cast feels impactful, dodging and blocking feels super rewarding... when done right, and punishing when you fail or don't react.-Visually, I'm happy to say I'm able to run on the highest of settings with ray-tracing on as well and... MY GOD. This is how I've always imagined exploring the wizarding world. It looks amazing! A few minor details stick out to me personally, but it is only REALLY obscure details.-The world feels alive! Truly, it does! Every little hamlet you come across feels like it's its own little tight community, every dungeon, den or camp you come across feels well made, only the treasure vaults is very repetitively in their designs most of the time. Enemies react to your playstyle! I went from an all out aggression style, to a stealthy one, mid-way through the game. After a little while, enemies mentioned more and more about my stealthyness over my previous style, but never forgetting that I had done things more 'wands-blazing' either.-Character custiomization is great! There's even a fair few things you can change post character creation! Transmog system is present, free and easy to use! And on that note, there's some gorgeous pieces avalible for collecting... I would highly recomment a -key- sidequest!-Choices are present and while I have yet to dive deeper into those, they seem limited mostly, but not entirely, to sidequests. (Take this with a grain of salt as, again, I have yet to dive into a different character propperly yet.)-The story is my biggest caviot though, albeit it's still only a small one. While it drives the game forward and does so well enough, I find that the sidequests draws me in much better. That's not to say the story is bad, because it isn't. I am just left with questions unanswered after having finnished the story.CONS:-The game lacks from optimization issues, as I've had a few game breaking glitches and even a a crash or two. but I cannot stress enough: THESE ARE FEW! compared to a lot of the other half-baked AAA games we get these days, Hogwarts Legacy stands MUCH cleaner and better polished from the get-go! and it's worth playin through as it is right now.-There is a certain 'Dark Arts challange' that have enemies mentioning you using Dark Arts upon completion, even though, when I did the challange, I hadn't even learned any of said arts, this persists throughout the game. I suspect that the game checks if you've used a Dark Art more than once, it's fair game to mention it.. even though the challange doesn't logically have any relation to the rest of the game what so ever. Because I have otherwise not used a single Dark Art in my first playthrough. Breaks my immersion a bit, but noone else even mentions it so it's a little weird.CONCLUSION:While Hogwarts Legacy is, to my personal preference, a puzzle driven game, if you're not into those types of games, there's story mode for you, which allows you to solve a decent bit of the puzzles with the press of a button. I can't say how many as I didn't play on Story mode, but I know it's there.On top of that, the game left me in tears of joy on more than a few occations. It can be an emotional rollercoaster if you allow yourself to be gripped by it.And let's be honest here: Flyring across The Black Lake on either Broom or Beast during sunsets/rises simply feels freaking amazing.

author: Malvin
review: When I first loaded up this game I was completely mesmerised. The graphics were incredible and exploring Hogwarts was incredible. I have been a huge Harry Potter fan for over 20 years and I really felt like they had brought the world from the books to life.But I was wrong. The world in this game is not alive, it's just a husk pretending to be alive. An illusion. The game is shallow, boring and empty.Never did I feel like my character was really mine, there is not really any choices to be made at all. This is an adventure game, not a RPG. But hey, adventure games can be great with a good story right? Yes they can! But this story is about as entertaining as bird watching (sorry to those who enjoy birds). The school feels empty, students don't react to anything you do. They don't react to the environment. It's just all so plain. This game is the water cracker of RPGs.I wish I could get a refund. Perhaps buy this game if you get it on sale for like $20. It's perhaps worth that much to take a virtual tour of this dull and empty hogwarts museum..5/10

author: Tea-R3x
review: I dont know much about this Garry Potter but I do dislike Twitter peopleanyway its a great game I really recommend it

author: omfgsevy
review: Finally.Single-player, story-based RPGs are back!!! It was worth the wait.

author: Cypher
review: loving this new wizard game, sorry, w*zr*d game

author: Long Island Ice T
review: I was loving this game until one day i booted and suddenly using 98% of my 16gb of ram and freezing more often then playing. It was a Night and Day change i had whatever hours it says ive played this game up here ^ minus one hour of this game running beautifully on high settings- now its quite literally unplayable at low settings. its mind boggling how extreme that swing was.would love to finish this game but can't until they push an update to fix this memory utilization on pc.Hope it happens soon

author: Bocrates
review: I don't like 'Harry Potter' and yet, here I am. Hogwart's Legacy is an excellent game. The 'Wizarding World' dressing adds some flavour, but the real enjoyment comes from experiencing a well crafted and well realised action-rpg. The VA/PA is excellent. The world is open and invites exploration. The combat, while fairly basic, is kinetic and very enjoyable.

author: Meece
review: I don't write reviews, but I'm writing one because of how frustrated I felt while playing this game.6/10 (Exploration and combat are the only reasons this isn't a 4 or 5)TL;DRGraphics - 10/10Combat - 10/10Combat AI - 6/10Immersion - 4/10Story - 3/10Bosses - 2/10 (Final Boss alone drops this by like 3 points)Frustration and Gripes - 10/10[Spoilers Ahead] (All of it is a spoiler)I get that making games is hard and requires a lot of time and theres deadlines, so if you end up reading this just take it with a grain of salt that most of this is a rant of how unfulfilling this game felt while playing.Best parts of the game:Combat - Pretty neat combos and insta-kill mechanics against various enemiesExploration - You can explore the world of Harry Potter, not much more to be saidRoom of Requirement - Very customizable and easily one of the biggest selling points for the gameGraphics - The game is indeed very beautiful, there are many instances in which you'll find yourself admiring the view as you fly around on a broom or creature.Worst parts of the game:Story - I don't even know where to begin. I came into this expecting a Harry Potter level story with me learning about the characters, being able to go on adventures with them and thwarting Ranrok's plan together. Instead, I got the most unimaginative and frustrating story I could've imagined. I really wanted to like it, I really did. The most interesting part of the story was the pensieve memories. Literally the only thing I was looking forward to story wise. Sebastian's entire character is that he wants to cure Anne and hes going to do whatever it takes to do it. There is 0 complexity, thats literally it. His entire story line is him teaching you curses and saying "I have to do this to help Anne!" You can't reason with him, you can't try to stop him, you can only select choice dialogues that all end up leading to the same place. Natty's entire character is stopping Harlow. She had a tragedy happen to her when she was younger, and that's it. Poppy is the animal lover with a complex family background, but that ♥♥♥♥ gets zero exploration. Poppy loves beasts but comes from a family of poachers. However, her Grandma seems to be a researcher or shares a similar extreme interest in beasts and the care of them. So how did her parents come to become poachers? Instead of asking these questions and getting some answers, you can only say stuff like "Oh, im so sorry that happened to you" or find out the most surface level ♥♥♥♥. There is also no companion system or anything like that. You can't walk up to the friends you know and go on an adventure to beat up poachers or loyalists. There will be multiple times your character will say stuff like "I really shouldn't be here alone", but you also have no choice but to be there alone. It doesn't feel like you have a group of friends at Hogwarts, the entire game feels very lonely with no meaningful relationships made. Combat AI - The combat AI is sometimes good, sometimes bad. In the fight against Rookwood, half of the AI just stood there doing nothing. It was like they saw 5 bogies targeting me and decided to take a break. Other times, they'll  stagger spell casts so if you protego and stupefy someone you'll get nailed by another spell and surround you. Stealth combat is pretty dumb. They'll watch everybody turn to stone and have no reactions. They'll occasionally run to the spot if they saw someone die in front of them, but you can just walk away and wait for them to reset, then rinse and repeat. It's pretty boring.Final Boss Battle - He only has 1 form. Big bad dragon. You destroy the three orbs with the correct color spell, then you attack him. This continues on for literally the entire boss fight until the end where he lands (WOW!). After he lands he turns into a Graphorn pretty much. Dodge the charge and fire breath and then beat his ass. He had this extremely large build up where he reveals that he has Miriam's wand and then destroys the container to absorb the final repository, for it to fall flat and become extremely lazy as he just becomes a red dragon that breathes fire at you. Like what was the point of all that? Got me all excited to fight a juiced up Ranrok who was gonna throw a bunch of spells at me for it to be a dragon with multiple phases that does the exact same thing each phase.Gripes:Beasts - You can't interact with them and they don't exhibit any special behaviors. It would have been cool if I put two Graphorn's in the room of requirement, and saw them exhibit territorial behaviors or play fighting of some kind. It would've been cool to see the Unicorns prancing around together. It would've been nice to see the beasts interact with each other, or groom each other. It would've been nice if I could interact with the beasts in ANY way besides summoning a brush or food for them to collect beast byproducts. All they do is walk around and graze or lay down. The only interaction you can do with the beasts is summon a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ BALL. Yeah, the most interesting thing I can do with these beasts after rescuing them is watch them eat and walk around or summon a ball for them to run into and knock around. There is nothing magical about them after you rescue them. Wand Choice - You customize the appearance of the wand and thats it. The capability of the wand doesn't change based off of the core you choose or anything like that. Seems like such a waste for there to be no difference. Could've played around with attack range, damage reliability, cooldowns, etc. Also why is the basic attack always red? I can't change the color of that either? House Cup - Theres barely any emphasis or point in this. The points don't matter because at the end of the game you'll get 100 points and win the house cup anyways. There is no competition and its not satisfying at all in the end. One house will have some points, your house will have the most points, and two of the other houses will have none at all if you look at the points in the Great Hall. Dark Arts - Dark arts are op as ♥♥♥♥ and theres no downside to using them. No one will be wondering why you just used Avada Kedavra, it insta kills bosses like Harlow and trolls, etc. If you think that cooldown is how they balanced it, just pop a focus potion and spam the other spells then you have it back in no time. They keep talking about unforgiveable curses being bad and all but theres no repercussion or story impact to you using it. I understand that it probably wouldn't be as fun open world wise for you to have restrictions on your capabilities, but it felt so illogical it took me right out of the game and had me frustrated.Bosses - You can assassinate most of the mini-bosses. Avada Kedavra will kill them all. You'd think for being proficient in killing people with that curse, they would also have some measure of combating it. Especially as a boss.Immersion - I CAN'T GET IMMERSED MAN. Maybe my game was bugged, but the first time flying on the Hippogryph, there was no music. Took me right out, all I could think of was man, this thing is slow as ♥♥♥♥, feels slower than my broom. Walked into the Great Hall and it was like I was back at basic training in the Chow Hall, silent as ♥♥♥♥. Took like 1 minute for sounds to start playing, but it was still kinda quiet. Walking through Hogwarts feels very lonely, there is barely enough volume with the chatter so it feels like no one is talking, when I spawn a Hippogryph or Graphorn out of my bag and onto school grounds, there is no reaction. Nobody cares that an extremely massive and rare magical beast just appeared out of nowhere, and that I'm riding it. There is barely any quips when you walk around about stuff you did. It'll sometimes randomly pop into conversation for quests where they're like, "You're the kid who killed the troll right?". It doesn't feel like you accomplished anything when I play or that you are celebrated for the deeds you chose to do.

author: Alexandra🌟Shermann~ :3
review: Completed 100%, all achievement.It's decent but no more than that. The game itself had its potential and perhaps if it had been more diversed (not in racial way) e.g. with Quidditch and Broom racing, I would have enjoyed it more.Anyway, it's a must-play for all HP fans and it worth playing at least once.Cats <3

author: Knight
review: Really impressive early game and pretty satisfying combat but the further in you get the more it seems it was rushed out the gate far too early. The expansive map has less depth than a Genshin impact clone, the main story and especially its ending was really unimpressive. The Sallow storyline was easily the peak of the game, with many of the other stories being fairly low stakes and inconsequential to the point it feels like it was written by someone else entirely. Many of the games collectibles only lead to mediocre cosmetic rewards. The biggest sin this game commits is that your actions have absolutely zero consequences. I tried to play the game as "evil" as I possibly could and it just didn't matter, I still woke up the next day a normal hogwarts student, being celebrated for all my heroic achievements and none of it really mattered at all.

author: Simafication
review: Amazing. I was concerned when I heard about this title that it would just be a half-hearted attempt at a mediocre game for a bit of a cash grab from many of the Harry Potter fans. I am pleased to say that's it's not only better than I'd imagined but is one of the best games I've played in years. There doesn't seem to be many bugs at all and my only recommendation is to get the gear slot upgrades as quickly as possible. I don't want to spoil anything and so I won't list how to get them (sorry), but when you progress the story you will have challenges that unlock more gear slots and this will save you TONS of trips to go and sell, or from destroying gear and ultimately wasting money.

author: ✪ wolf
review: Fantastic Game took me roughly 50 hours to fully 100% the game, including all achievements and hidden steam achievements. Very good love the combat, the story, everything, NEED MORE CONTENT THOUGH

author: FriedHuggababy
review: Great game, I'd give it at least 41/100

author: Savrox
review: As a Harry Potter Fan it was an instant buy for me. But was it worth it?Story: Around 15 hours in i have to say the story is decent. Nothing spectacular, no hiccups either. You start in as a 5th Year at Hogwarts and master almost every Spell immediately. The lessons are quite short and i wished they were a bit longer. I would've enjoyed if the game lets you start in 1st Year and you would've learned some of the spells via time and year skips with funny or iconic events or classes. You just feel like you got there and own this place.Sidequests are alright. Just a few Ubisoft-type sidequests. Most of them are alright, some are longer and much more detailled.World: The world is spectacular! It's amazing to deepdive into this world of Wizardry and phantastic beasts. The world is packed with collectibles all around the lore of places e.g. Hogwarts, Hogsmeade etc.On top of that, you gain upgrades and new equipment via challenges and collectibles. In addition you can loot equipment. Furthermore you can explore the world on top of your broom or favorite mount, solve riddles, finds hidden tombs, rescue magical creatures from poachers and clear bandit camps. The music completes this experience. All in all nothing's really new, but no upsets either. The game reminded me several times of Witcher 3 or similar games. Nothing really wrong with that. It still identifies as it's own world, it's own story and it's own experience.Performance: Pre-Release i heard a few things and was sceptical. I've got i mid PC and it runs on medium settings at 60fps and thats what you get. It's not beautiful, not ugly either. Playable to say the least. Framedrops are quite rare, every once half an hour."The Topic": Well, i'am tired about all the cancellation ♥♥♥♥. Her statements are wrong, everbody knows this. But this doesn't make the world she build years back less loveable or enjoyable. The game itself is gorgeous, was build by a team that loves this Franchise and is worth to be played. That's it, nothing more to be said!

review: Childhood dreams come true

review: it's ok

review: Really bad optimization. After I updated my GPU driver, it starts getting black screen while loading. The story vaguely meet my expectation, but thankfully, there's plenty places to explore.  Poor enemy design and combat balance.

author: Axeploseph
review: Hogwarts Legacy: Digital Deluxe Edition 4I loved growing up with the Harry Potter books and movies. The previews had me hyped, and it was the first video game I was able to convince my wife who doesn't game to play along with me (she didn't want to play but wanted to watch me play through which she did).Preordered on Steam, full price: $69.99As soon as the 72 hour early access window started. Only a little more to do before the true ending is unlocked as of posting this review.Wow, a lifetime of buying most things gaming on the cheap, on sale, last-gen, second-hand and bundled. I have picked and chose a few times to buy triple a games full price, and even fewer times I've preordered a triple a game. Despite the controversy surrounding the game, this time, I chose correctly.Attending Hogwarts in an open world RPG was truly surreal and I gladly rode the nostalgia wave. The main story was enjoyable and fresh as it took place far before Harry, Ron, and Hermione got there. There were three relationship quest lines that were well done. The puzzles were fun too, solvable and with decent variation. There were even a few unexpected twists along the way.I had two characters in this game. A Gryffindor (save file with my wife) who beat the final boss at level 31 and a Ravenclaw I played as on my Steam Deck who is currently level 11 (this game was pleasant to play on the Steam Deck on recommended settings). I found myself not enjoying the game as much when I would try to start knocking out all the collect-a-thons (*cough* Demiguises *cough*) and side quests scattered throughout the land. As an ex-achievement hunter, I was getting frustrated and I started to see through the nostalgia. A lot of this extra stuff is not for me. So, we carried on with the rest of the story, defeated the final boss and now found we needed to be level 34 to get the true ending of the game.As it stands, I have 55% of my field guide completed for my Gryffindor character. I have not made up my mind yet as to how much of the extra stuff I'm going to go for but my wife and I do want the true ending, so we need a few more levels. My wife and I were sorely disappointed this game did not feature more activities/features that would make the experience of being a Hogwarts student (not just being at Hogwarts) more immersive. They could've done minigames, more classes, relationships in school, pranks, wizards chess, Quidditch (with all the yearly sports game releases, we desperately need a new Quidditch game!), etc. Make us sneak around at night to avoid getting into trouble and not just for a few quests. At night we could pick the lock of rooms with professors inside and we wouldn't get in trouble.Games I would consider to be in my All-Time top 10 (I don't currently have a list) include the Witcher 3: The Wild Hunt and Red Dead Redemption II. Both have amazing stories and worlds you would want to spend countless hours getting lost in and side questing. Hogwarts Legacy is so beautiful and immersive, but it feels less like a vast open world with so much to do and more like a very beautiful walking simulator. Of course you do far more than a walking simulator but that content isn't where this game shines, it shines in the accurate portrayal of the world so many grew up dreaming of, Hogwarts, Hogsmeade and the surrounding areas. IMO this is a great game that has a stellar nostalgia filter. I think, once we get the true ending, I'll be done with this game and maybe revisit it again when my kids are older. Or, ya know, I'll complete the field guide and achievement hunt, I don't know yet.If you buy the game, turn off Show Hud Tracking Icons and the minimap (and subtitles). Your field guide will help you follow your quest objectives and you will experience far more immersion.We beat the final boss and only need to gain a few more levels to unlock the final quest of the main story. After that, will we 100% the game? Undecided as of right now.Yes, I had a blast being a student at Hogwarts and would be delighted to return again in future installments if there are any. But please have Quidditch this time! (Better yet, make a new dedicated Quidditch game!)Me: Finally got to the final boss, zoned in and ready for an epic battle.My Wife: Honey, look out, the cat.Me: Cat? There are no cat's in this fight.My Cat: *clicks my pc's power button*Haha, I loaded back in and was outside the boss room with battle music going on and unable to reenter so I had to reload an autosave that was thankfully right before the final fight.

author: Lord Greg
review: From a game dev standpoint, these guys really put in the work. This game is absolutely gorgeous.... EVERYWHERE.All the details, all the exploration, all the love. It's so well crafted, well designed, and POLISHED.If I had to point out a flaw, it would be a slight stutter on entering the open world for the first time (which is likely just my out of date computer). Excellent story, dialogue, and hundreds of hours of content. I already know i want to play another save, and this will be one of those games I'd 100% multiple times. It doesn't pull punches and it knows it's audience. BUY THIS GAME.999999/10.

author: RA!N
review: The favorite school of all time ♥

author: Solar Merchant
review: Performance could be better but I expect that will improve with time.  Its perfectly playable, but does shift between 45-90 fps for me with ultra settings / raytracing off.  To me that's acceptable - its not an fps where clicking on heads quickly and accurately matters, and the game looks great.What this game IS though is nothing short of incredible.  I'm quite impressed with the magic system and combat - it all feels great.  And the details and world feel downright magical.  I really hope they continue to develop DLC for this game as I would be delighted for more.

author: Neurion
review: 20 hours in so far. I can say that the game is definitely fun!Pros:- The map is much larger than I expected.- Exploring the world (Especially from the air) is excellent.- The combat is very fluid and satisfying. - The world feels alive.- The graphics are gorgeous.- Flying feels amazing on K&M (I've heard flight on a controller is bad, though I've not experienced that myself).- The beast mechanics are awesome.- Growing your own ingredients and brewing your own potions feels immersive.Cons:- The game can lag in some areas quite badly despite my PC being of a high standard.- You can't look up or down for some reason when flying.- Interaction with NPCs outside of quests is virtually non existent.- NPCs are very forgettable and don't have a lot of depth to them. - You can encounter a lot of invisible walls when trying to climb in places that you feel like you should be able to climb. - While you can occasionally choose a positive or negative response in dialogue, it feels very much on rails how your character behaves and reacts. Verdict:Overall, I am definitely glad that I bought the game. However, the lack of dialogue options will make for a very repetitive replay should you want to play again in the future. There definitely needs to be patches to sort out the performance and bugs, but they're to be expected at this stage. They 100% need to add the ability to look up and down when flying, I can't understand why that isn't a thing when moving the mouse up or down doesn't affect anything else... It makes it very difficult to tell what's beneath you. I'm usually one to utilize stealth over combat, however the combat in this game is too fun to ignore. If you're a Wizarding World fan, then I'd definitely recommend it. However, if you're looking for a deep RPG with lots of choices and stuff, then it won't be for you. Hopefully the game will improve with patches and DLC.

author: SupImSam
review: The gameplay is very fun, the story is captivating and interesting and the world looks beautiful. The thing that completely ruins the experience however is the performance. This for some reason is a heavily debated fact, but in my opinion the PC version of this game is horribly optimized. Some people will be able to play the game without any issues, some will experience crazy stutters and crazy fluctuating framerates (this is what is happening in my case) and some people will not even be able to start the game as it crashes on the seizure warning at the start. Modders have release hotfixes that help a little with these issues, but the fact remains that this game should not have released in this state. With how big and content packed games are these days, it's understandable for there to be some glitche/bugs here and there, but these issues make the game practically unplayable for people experiencing them (which seems to be the vast majority of people even if some people would tell you otherwise.) If you really want to play this game, please either buy the game on PS5 or XBOX OR wait for patches to be released that fix theses issues or they will ruin your experience.Update 1 : Performance has been slowly but steadily increasing thanks to patches, but not everything is perfect still, especially Hogsmeade. I still wouldn't recommend buying the game full price yet, but the game is getting closer to being genuinely enjoyable without many issues.

author: Zer0Gamerz
review: Avada Kedavra

author: Courky
review: good game, it gives me serotonin. You get to explore Hogwarts, what else could a harry potter fan want in their life?

author: friskO-
review: GAME OF THE YEAR 2023. Just need to fix some optimization problems, that's all. Might be come Quidditch DLC or something else.

author: Mirrialliah
review: After getting past the start the game it has drawn me in, i enjoy the graphics and beautiful scenery in the game, even though at times i do see it being a bit jittery or not so smooth. The game play is fun and creative and all the stories within the game pull me into the world. I'm having quite a bit of fun playing and finding it addictive.

author: Batman
review: This game is full of wasted opportunities which would otherwise have made a great game. The developers are relying too much on fillers, like finding over one thousand collectibles or repetitive puzzles and side quests.Loot and items are pretty much pointless. Things like brooms and wands do not make any difference. Got a legendary clothing piece? It will be replaced in a minute by a green level item and inventory management becomes tedious.After a while the game just felt like a chore.Don't be fooled by the amount of hours Steam displays. Getting 100% in-game and 42/45 achievements took about 67 hours, but it was not fun.Now I will have to force myself through it and replay part of the game three more times to get the last achievements.The performance in general was barely acceptable. Average fps was about 90 to 70-ish but would often drop into the 30's, even with DLSS (which games should not rely on to make up for lack of optimization).Walking around, especially in Hogwarts would stutter a lot.My computer is far above the recommended specs: CPU: Intel i9-9900K 5,2 GHz sustained on all cores -HTGPU: Evga RTX 3080 ti FTW3 Ultra 12GBRAM: Corsair Dominator 32GB (2x16GB) DDR4 16/18/18/36 3200 MHzSSD: Samsung 970 EVO Plus M.2 500GBMonitor: Lenovo Legion Y27gq-20 1440p 165HzIn the end I would just say it is sadly a wasted potential and absolutely not worth full price.

author: Cyber Storm
review: I've found the game very clunky, things like being forced to walk next to NPC at snail speed for instance is not entertaining.  The menu and general UI is terrible, feels like an after thought.Twice I had to load old saves as I randomly got stuck in objects.I didn't really find the game fun, but once you pay for it, you continue in the hope that it improves, it doesn't.

author: Greedy boi
review: This game is made for the super fans of this franchise, but ultimately it is not the best game when it comes to the core game play and design choices. Starting with the story, story is the weakest part of this game, and the best part of the story is related to Sebastian quest line which is not the main mission of the game. Visuals are 10/10 and the best part of the game. RPG elements are very weak and they feel forced in. World is big and empty, there is nothing to do except flying over the map and admiring the view. There is no sense of discovery. School  is very underwhelming. This could be a "Bully" type of game, however, you dont do anything remarkable with the classes. All of them are cut scenes and you barely do anything related to that said class. This is the biggest pet peeve for me.Overall this game was very hyped and the scores were not really deserved. This game is a solid 6 or 7 out 10 type of game. Pretty to look at but very boring to play.

author: Ongo
review: This game has amazing graphics, a huge and vibrant open world, a great atmosphere, but...First of all, It's dullThe huge open world is just copy-pasted missions.If you've played for an hour, chances are you have experienced ALL of the possible side quests and challengesThe puzzles are terribly unrewarding. The absolute best-case scenario is that you get an okay-ish clothing style or some cosmetics for your room of requirement, but 90% of the time it's just a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ scarf that you immediately sell.The ONLY thing that increases the combat difficulty is the number of opponents. The combat itself with different combinations of spells is fun and satisfying, but I am not kidding, moving up the tournament table in dueling club simply adds more enemies.Also, enemy variability is poor. Approximately 1 hour in you've encountered all of them.The story is meh. Actions and dialogues seldom make sense, and if they do, they are boring.But the worst thing of all...Freaking ALOHOMORAI cannot comprehend how a team of developers, grown-up respected people, would think that adding this lockpicking mechanic would improve anything at all. It is easy, but time consuming for every lock. And there are a lot of them!And you don't improve, nothing changes with any lock, you just twist two circles until the lock starts moving. No skill required, just angelic patience.

author: TheProphecy
review: Deek thinks you should be proud of all the potions you've brewed!First play-through complete. Normal Difficulty, low settings, as a Ravenclaw.The story is actually engaging if you let it it be, but it can also be easy to just say "not interested" which is an argument for both good and bad. Overall 8/10 on the story.The gameplay (take away the game optimisation for now)is incredible and I think its what we've been asking for. What I will say m&k controls are all over so just go ahead and start rebinding those keys asap. Back to the optimisation GOD IT IS DOG S**T, I meet the min requirements so I played on low everything and it ran like s**t sometimes, but I also know others running a high spec PC on medium settings also getting janky gameplay. Hopefully this gets fixed with the weeks to come. 7/10 (would be 1-2 more if the optimisation was there)The lore and landmarks are accurate and its so easy to get lost in the world of Harry Potter. Game of the year contender easily! I will be looking out for DLC in the future (Tri-Wizard Tournement DLC????? just food for thought) Big cons of the game are; no wizard chess, no quidditch, no real reason to use the common room and finally no free use of polyjuice potion or choice to become an animangus. The whole thing surrounding the Room of Requirement is honestly a really enjoyable concept and doesn't feel like a chore.There is massive amount of potential with what they released with the base game for future updates and DLCs so I really hope they don't abandon it. Content 9/10

author: What-What
review: While the story is interesting and the scenery is gorgeous, this is clearly an unfinished game. I am using a fairly high end gaming desktop, and even setting everything to lowest quality, the quantity of stuttering and freeze-framing is unacceptable, even bordering ridiculous. author: Thigz
review: Game released in a simply unacceptable state on PC. The meat of the game is good, but it means nothing when it constantly crashes on one of the highest end PCs available currently. Would not recommend until it's discounted and the bugs are fixed. It's not quite Cyberpunk release status, but it's the closest any AAA game has come to it since.

author: burkblz
review: Empty and generic.  Just imagine a Skyrim without all the side quests / parallel plots, just the Main Quest, thats Hogwarts Legacy. 15 hours played and I don't think I will launch this game again, I get bored at the thought.  Performance is okay at launch, some drops but nothing too bad for my pc (12600k, 32gb, rtx 3070, 1080p screen), and that usually gets fixed within a few weeks of the launch so I wouldn't worry about it. The game is pretty, not beautiful like RDR2, but pretty. Combat is enjoyable (I play M+K). Flying feels pointless without Quidditch (yep, no Quidditch). The plot is meh (at least from what I've played, I did not finish the game, stopped just after finishing the first trial), and from what I've seen there is no side quests (of the kind that actually adds and enriches the plot), just optional tasks (ex. dodge 10 times, kill 5 spiders, collect 10 scrolls, that kind of stuff) the closest that I saw was  maybe there are more side "quests" like this, but even so it still would not be enough, not by a long shot. I must disclose that I'm not a big fan of Harry Potter (the most powerful and villainous Dark Wizard of at least the century, who wields the most powerful wand that ever existed, can't conquer a school, really???), but I do enjoy a good RPG, and unfortunately this is not it.  And for those who played the Dragon Age Series, seems like there is way more interesting stuff to do at the Circles than at Hogwarts, where mages are free, weird huh? If I were a mage I would 100% choose to be beaten to death by templars instead of being bored to death at (this game's) Hogwarts.I wish I could refund this.EDIT: Got the refund, yay.

author: Cyrus
review: I beat the game until the hidden ending "lvl 34" the start of the game is great, you can see the devs put in good effort for 3 hours of content [to get past the return period on steam], after the first few hours, the game progressively becomes more grindy by making you do pointless objectives.You have some outing quests with your companions, but their stories do not end in a satisfying way, and feel very rushed. They do not have any impact on the ending of the game. Meaning their worthless.The ending is none existent, with a trivial boss fight, and no pay off to your character or the wizarding lore. Likewise Hogwarts itself is hollow with no real secrets. Unlike even Prisoner of Askaban by EA which released more then 10 years ago- which has more secrets and hidden pathways. Classes themselves are time skips with the exception of the first 3, which the devs built. It is clear this game needed another 2-3 years to be completed, as 60-70% of the story occurs in the first 15 hours, the rest is filler and fetch quests.Likewise. the performance is questionable, i had to install two mods of nexus to fix the frame rate on this .game.  This game is a solid 5/10. It has a story- albeit bad- it has gameplay, but none of it is unique in any capacity, it has bosses [all can be one shot by a single spell], and there is no progression. Buy on a deep discount or if you have nothing else to play right now.

author: Huh?
review: Ok, this has been driving me crazy for seven movies now, and I know you're going to roll your eyes, but hear me out: Harry Potter should have carried a 1911.Here's why:Think about how quickly the entire WWWIII (Wizarding-World War III) would have ended if all of the good guys had simply armed up with good ol' American hot lead.Basilisk? Let's see how tough it is when you shoot it with a .470 Nitro Express. Worried about its Medusa-gaze? Wear night vision goggles. The image is light-amplified and re-transmitted to your eyes. You aren't looking at it--you're looking at a picture of it.Imagine how epic the first movie would be if Harry had put a breeching charge on the bathroom wall, flash-banged the hole, and then went in wearing NVGs and a Kevlar-weave stab-vest, carrying a SPAS-12.And have you noticed that only Europe seems to a problem with Deatheaters? Maybe it's because Americans have spent the last 200 years shooting deer, playing GTA: Vice City, and keeping an eye out for black helicopters over their compounds. Meanwhile, Brits have been cutting their steaks with spoons. Remember: gun-control means that Voldemort wins. God made wizards and God made muggles, but Samuel Colt made them equal.Now I know what you're going to say: "But a wizard could just disarm someone with a gun!" Yeah, well they can also disarm someone with a wand (as they do many times throughout the books/movies). But which is faster: saying a spell or pulling a trigger?Avada Kedavra, meet Avtomat Kalashnikova.Imagine Harry out in the woods, wearing his invisibility cloak, carrying a .50bmg Barrett, turning Deatheaters into pink mist, scratching a lightning bolt into his rifle stock for each kill. I don't think Madam Pomfrey has any spells that can scrape your brains off of the trees and put you back together after something like that. Voldemort's wand may be 13.5 inches with a Phoenix-feather core, but Harry's would be 0.50 inches with a tungsten core. Let's see Voldy wave his at 3,000 feet per second. Better hope you have some Essence of Dittany for that sucking chest wound.I can see it now...Voldemort roaring with evil laughter and boasting to Harry that he can't be killed, since he is protected by seven Horcruxes, only to have Harry give a crooked grin, flick his cigarette butt away, and deliver what would easily be the best one-liner in the entire series:"Well then I guess it's a good thing my 1911 holds 7+1."And that is why Harry Potter should have carried a 1911.

author: thundrr
review: EDIT: after many hours the game has stopped working. Everything on low with dlss only gives 8 fps in hogsmeade.At this point, the games performance is absolutely horrible, there are weird things at play between the GPU, memory, and CPU.  I have been enjoying the game, I was skeptical but it does a good enough job and I will be finishing it for sure. I have: CPU:  R7-5800xMemory: 32 GB (3600)GPU: 3080-Tistorage: Samsung 970 Evo Plus. Like reviews online, the prologue mission runs well (no bugs) but once you hit Hogwarts the performance tanks dramatically. Before Hogwarts:2k Ultra + Ultra raytracing: 50-60 fps 2k Ultra + Ultra raytracing + DLSS quality: around 85 fps2k Ultra + ultra raytracing + DLSS balanced: just over 100 fps. After Hogwarts:The 3080-TI runs at 12GB VRAM always, i have dropped settings down to low and it still uses that much memory. On top of that, running at 2k ultra + ray tracing can use as much as 17 GB system memory on top of the VRAM. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------As hardware unboxed pointed out, the CPU never reaches more than 55% for any given thread and uses roughly 15-40% CPU depending on DLSS level, no DLSS is lower CPU usage. I have encountered areas where I run at 50 FPS and the CPU is using 20% and the GPU is at 65% usage, this is typically with some sort of DLSS active. The setting I personally use at the moment to play which can roughly maintain 40fps or higher, but can dip while loading a new zone occasionally.Effects quality: UltraMaterial quality: High Fog quality: MediumSky quality: MediumFoliage quality: MediumPost processing: Low         (any works as I don't use depth of field or such effects)Shadows: UltraTextures: Medium            (can't run Hogwarts any higher, outside Hogwarts ultra)View distance: Ultra         (dropping setting  did not increase any fps)Population: Ultra              (dropping setting  did not increase any fps)Ray tracing: All, Ultra       (I think it adds to the game, definitely didn't put in effort to make non-ray tracing look good)DLSS: balanced               (can put on quality at times, other times frames still under 20 on quality). I hope this helps make the game playable if no drivers or patches fix these issues. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The good: -Lighting and atmosphere-Combat (tricky to master)-Tutorial: I hate tutorials, but they made it in such a way its a side thought and not the focus.-Systems, whether looting, challenges, and collectibles are implemented well. The bad: -Optimization: as noted above-Textures: not the best looking game for textures at all even with ultra (maybe performance patch will allow better processing),- Only 2 voice actors, even though you can switch tone, it does not sound natural. -Choices don't seem to matter, the following dialogue will set things straight. I have been enjoying my time playing the game, the difficulty on normal is pretty average, I will be finishing the game. Had there not been such performance issues, the positives vastly outweigh the negatives, just not in this current state.

author: Sir Spankalot
review: There is so much Stuff i hate about this game:-The Story is bland-The Spell management is stupid and badly ported from consoles-Your Character is a Mary Sue good at everything protigé-House Choice doesnt really seem to be affecting everything so far besides some minor dialouge options-The Room of Requirment controls being 3 different spells for placing, changing colours and removing is terrible design, especially since you cant use the spell outside of the room-Its bloated with mechanics which are absolute overkill -The Puzzles are too easy-The whole game overall is super easy-The Character talks too much, sometimes just blurting out resolutions to puzzles-Enemy variety is very small-You cant interact with other students at all-Most  side characters are cardboard with no personalityWorst of all, the game is super buggy and laggy. I lost around 1h of Progress so farBUTI cant stop playing. Its so fun even though im not a Harry Potter fan at all.Exploring around the world and especially Hogwarts is amazing. The world is gorgeous and feels carefully handcrafted.You run around the school, armour stands saluting you, ghosts coming out of paintings, the people in the art waving at you, Students getting howlers from their parents.Im 30h in and they still dont feel repetetive at all. There are TONS of eventsTons of collectibles which lore tid bits, some made me laugh out loud.You really feel like a Student in a Hogwarts from long ago.They kept the Movie references to a minimum so it feels like its own thing which i really like.Its deeply flawed in many ways and still an amazing game. Get it if youre a HP fan, et it if youre on Open World RPG fan, get it on sale if youre not either of those.

author: PhoeniX
review: Being a fan of the Harry Potter world has led me to play this game, although you don't need to have seen any of the movies to understand the world as it's not really tied to the movies other then Hogwarts. The gameplay itself is great, it's got plenty of things for you to do other than just the main story line. There are alot of collectibles, puzzles, side quests, and things for you to discover in the open world. The music is fantastic. The combat is amazing, your spells feel substantial as your fighting against other wizards or monsters. There are different spell builds you can use to change up the combat, and potions are just as important as spells when it comes to boss fights. You really need to plan your builds based on what your about to fight. I have seen others complain about the graphics being last gen and those people are just wrong. The game looks fantastic and the scale of the world feels just right. The story is great along with all the other quests in the game.If your undecided about the game, take it from me and plenty of other people. Buy it, the game is fantastic. This is not one of the situations that happen constantly now, and a game gets released before its ready. This game was more than ready for release and has set it self up nicely to be a legitimate game of the year contender.Gameplay: 9/10Combat: 10/10Graphics: 9/10Quests: 9/10Sound and Music: 10/10

author: empressgray
review: This is a rated "K for kids" puzzle game, not a open world RPG:As of right now I do not recommend. Yes, everyone and their momma is saying its the greatest game ever and how amazing it is etc etc etc but that is severely inflated combined with nostalgia based biased, popular opinion and newness altogether. Don't get me wrong, it is a good game but waiting for future DLC and expansions to greatly flesh out this game is essential, and not paying 60$ for it.. This game is very lackluster. Yes it has amazing graphics (only if you have a top notch system), yes the combat does feel good...but that's it. Nothing special here. The story is OK but this game is missing all the essential required to make a decent game, RPG, or Harry Potter genre in general. It's like the made Hogwarts and Hogsmeade and they computer generated the rest and populated with 5 different tasks. Which is Merlin Trials, Demiguise Moons, popping balloons, fighting the same 4 enemies or kidnapping the same 5 animals. That's it. That's all you get. Some stupid side missions with dialogue that makes no sense, a bunch of puzzles.The armor is system is level based, so once you upgrade and spend all your kidnapped beast parts on piece you'll find another piece of armor one point higher. All loot in the game is cosmets or armorNo commerce system active at all. Money is only used to buy quest items, 3 broom upgrades or potions/ingredients tables.Crafting systems has a good start to making your own potions and ingreds but that's itYou can't get a broom until about 1/4 done with the game and a flying beast 2/4.There isn't any RPG or open world dynamics to the game. No dynamic events or storytelling, characters have 2 lines each excepted those in side missions. No consequences for actions, no commerce, non-linear gameplay that severely holds your hands. All the stuff that makes up a decent open world or rpg game is missing. Can't influence the world whatsoever with choices. There are no factions to choose from. Plot holes galore in the entire arc of the story and game. Repetitive everything. Those 5 things I listed are about the only things to do on the map except see the sites and the Merlin Trials are the annoying puzzles and there around 30-50 of them. Demiguise moons is just an object to ecollect to unlock 3 different levels of the alohomora spell, all which unlock a chest that unlocks a door to unlock a chest to unlock a door etc etc. And the greatest loot you will find is a piece of cosmetic.NO QUIDDITCH. Like I said, they forgot to add the rest of the game it seems. You can tell they said F it and quit making the game at Hogwarts just to make release. Maybe if they had spent another year or so we would have a true open world RPG Harry Potter game. For now we just have a puzzle game. It does the scratch the itch for the first 10 hours or so, by all means spend your money if you want but I suggest waiting for the actual game and for it to be cheaper.

author: Meep
review: I challenged myself by playing on the hard difficulty setting and was impressed by the depth of the main story and side quests. I spent a total of 73 hours exploring this incredible world and I'm happy to say that there is still so much left for me to discover. More than 70% of the map's contents remain unseen by me. Just a friendly reminder, my review includes my personal perspective and opinions, and I promise it won't contain any spoilers. Hogwarts Legacy is a wonderful adventure-RPG game that offers a well-balanced mix of action and adventure set within the wizarding world. Although I hadn't watched or read Harry Potter prior to playing the game, the developers do an excellent job of providing enough explanation for players to enjoy the game without prior knowledge. The game intrigued me enough to watch the first two Harry Potter films, which I found to be a good prelude to the game. However, I'm confident that even if I had only watched two films, I wouldn't have had any trouble diving into the game. The game provides a comprehensive explanation for players to understand and play the game. The story in this game is beautifully crafted, and the characters are incredibly well-written with dynamic personalities. The motion capture and voice acting bring the characters to life, making it easy for players to form emotional connections with them. I found myself truly caring about each character I encountered and was fully invested in even the side quests. The attention to detail in character development is truly remarkable. If you're a fan of the wizarding world, this game is an ideal choice for you to further explore this magical universe. The game takes players on a journey not only through Hogwarts but also beyond, offering a comprehensive look at the wizarding world and all its wonders. The protagonist in this game is customizable, allowing players to choose their appearance from a selection of provided options. While the customization options for facial features like eye size and nose size are limited, players can choose between two voices, male and female, and adjust the tone. The protagonist is a talented 10-12 year old child starting in the 5th grade, and players can shape their personality to some extent through the limited choice options provided. Although the customization options may not be extensive, I found them to be sufficient for my personal enjoyment of the game. The game features a massive open world map, with seamless interactive content (excluding a few dungeons). I can't even estimate the amount of time it would take to fully explore and complete all the content. There are exciting puzzles and secrets scattered throughout the world that will keep players engaged. If you're a fan of adventure games with a touch of mystery, this game will be perfect for you. The puzzles are not overly challenging, but they offer just enough entertainment value to keep you engaged and exploring. And let me tell you, there's a LOT of content to discover. The combat system in this game is one of its highlights. I played on hard difficulty and it took me 70+ hours to complete the main story and a few side quests. The challenge is not to be taken lightly, and you need to stay focused on your enemies' movements at all times. On hard mode, you have to always be aware of being surrounded and outnumbered, and match the right spells to the right barriers. It's not possible to block all attacks, so you need to mix dodging and deflecting properly. I allocated my trait points for a single-target focus, and I think it was the right choice for the hard difficulty, especially for the endgame. The hard difficulty requires you to use crowd control spells, such as binding, stun, slow, and floating, to control your enemies' movements and take them down one by one with accurate deflecting and evading. Although gear and DPS can make the difficulty easier to some extent, they won't solve the core problem. You'll still die in 2-3 hits and the enemies won't get damaged unless you use spells correctly. That's why I loved the well-balanced and engaging difficulty of this game. I have high praise for the developers who put so much effort into creating this combat system. It was one of the best I've ever played. Almost everything I liked about this game, but I need to bring up two points of concern.  The first is regarding the issue of violence. The protagonist is a 10-12-year-old child, and it's quite disturbing to see them killing adult enemies in the game. It's not easy to deal with the fact that I had to kill more than a thousand people in this game as a child character. Also, the protagonist's dialogue after each murder was not appropriate, making it seem like taking someone's life is justifiable for any reason. I believe that the subject of murder should be treated with more care and sensitivity, rather than just being portrayed as a normal occurrence in a game. It would have been better if the enemies were just stunned and the player had the option to spare their lives or leave them with minimum injury. I hope this issue can be addressed in the future. I do not support promoting violence in any form. The other issue is that the game's optimization issue. I was playing the game during its three-day exclusive early access with the deluxe edition and understand that developers are working to fix any issues. However, with a required 2-3 frames accuracy for a successful deflection, I struggled with the inputs due to a lack of framerate, which caused the perfect window to be challenging to hit. I hope that this issue can be resolved soon. The game features a high-quality story with dynamic characters and emotionally rich motion capture and great voice acting. The protagonist can be customized to a certain extent, but with a bit limited options. The game takes place in a vast open world filled with interactive content, puzzles, and secrets to uncover. The combat system is well-designed and provides a challenging experience, but there is a concern about the depiction of violence as the protagonist is a child killing adult enemies. It was disturbing to me, as it shows the protagonist taking the lives of others with little regard and making light of such a serious matter. I personally wish there was no murder in the game and that the enemies could be stunned rather than killed, and I wish there was a choice to not kill in the game. Additionally, there are some optimization issues with the framerate that may impact gameplay. Overall, the game is enjoyable but could benefit from improved handling of the depiction of violence and optimization.Although there are some concerns about the depiction of violence in the game, I still highly recommend it. My overall verdict is 10 out of 10, and I believe it has the potential to be a game of the year, or even a game of the decade that people will remember and enjoy for a long time.

review: It kind of runs like ♥♥♥♥ which is really hurting the immersion.This is one of those titles that will run perfectly the literal second Denuvo gets removed, so you may want to hold off until they eventually remove it after the initial hype chills out or it gets cracked.The game itself is good but you can read other reviews for more info on that.

author: God
review: So Jini and I bought Hogwart Legacy, hoping for an amazing adventure in the beloved world of Harry Potter.After a few hours of insisting to find anything worth my time in this "game", i had no choice but to give up on it.Don't think i can remember being this disappointed by a video game. The best way i can describe it is : it's a huge pile of hot garbage.Past the initial "wow" of the scenery, there's nothing. Nothing at all.Sure the first couple of hours in the castle do a good job at immersing you in the world of Hogwart.In the end, it only make you fall from higher ground when you realize there's nothing more to it than that.All characters you will encounter (including the main one : you)  are without substance. They as as basic as the most basic of b******.Nobody's ever angry, mad, or sad. They are not believable and therefore I cannot force myself to give a flying duck about anything they are telling me.I find myself skipping every dialogue line after a while because they are all the same boring and flaccid sh**.It doesn't matter anyway because I don't actually need to know anything that have been said. My character will literally tell me word for word everything i have to do. If you start playing this expecting to solve riddles, take on challenges, make important choices or even remotely use any conscious  part of your brain, prepare to be let down.You will get through most of the game pressing either space or the action key. Every single time you end up in front of a situation that requires you to find the right spell to solve, you character will spell it out loud for you.I could keep going for a while about everything that is wrong with Hogwart Legacy but it basicaly is resumed to one sentence : this game as no soul.

author: BANDERA!
review: If you're someone who doesn't have the time to complete this game in one or two sittings then I can't recommend this game as it apparently has a very common issue with game saves. I'm the type of person who manual saves just to be sure and still had all my files corrupted, only four hours in. I cant trust the game to not do the same thing again so I guess for now I will have to wait for a patch to come out that fixes it or go through the customer support of warner bros to request a refund.also, the frame drops are still terrible, way worse then what Elden Ring had going on when it dropped, and I might not have the beefiest graphics card (RTX 3050) but for around half my playtime the textures and pop-in the game were so terrible it was more reminiscent of a playstation 2 game than a new gen game (which is apparently another bug). Really immersive breaking. A shame no one is talking about it.Absolutly game breaking bug. I can't recommend it to anyone in the state its in.

author: toKimo`

author: DasBoot711
review: As a huge Harry Potter fan I have really tried to get into this game. The first couple hours I was just dumbfounded being in the world of Harry Potter and exploring the castle. That wore off pretty quickly after I left the castle. Once you get to Hogsmeade you expect to be in Victorian England in the late 1800s, The characters in the story make it feel more like you're in West Hollywood in 2023 and the immersion quickly fades. Which is when the game has to stand on it's gameplay and content or lack there of.There is a ton of long drawn out dialogue, for the story you're going to need to be traveling 10 to 15 minutes by broom to go and defeat 3 enemies to pick something up. Then you'll need to fly 10 to 15 minutes back to drop it off. The combat is fun but there just isn't enough of it. You're forced to go to classes to learn spells and get fetch quest items. Sadly, it's just a boring game with a ton of fluff. If you're a huge Harry Potter fan pick it up when its $15-20 USD and play it then but there just isn't enough from a gaming perspective to pay full price for this.

author: Light Yagami
review: Generally: 9/10By far the best game in the Harry Potter universe. According to the savegame data, I currently have about 20 hours and am absolutely positive about the game. I was suspicious at first of how the fighting will be and if the world will feel alive, now I have no worries! Everywhere Npc walk around and talk to each other or do something. It's really fun to hear the conversations of the npc.Battle: 8/10The fighting feels surprisingly powerful and is a lot of fun. Beyond the story, you have opportunities to expand your strength and you can feel that, just awesome! There are also enough enemy types.Open World: 10/10Freely exploreable without restrictions! Just nice. I have also rarely experienced games in which you can enter almost every house. It feels very satisfying when not walking into a "blocked door". The world is beautiful and if it had been sold as a walking simulator I would have spent my money well. It's just a great world of this Harry Potter.Fly: 9/10I tell this point independently. Everyone would probably grab a broom and fly around. It's just as cool in the game as soon as you can fly for the first time, when you've had your first flying lessons, a great key moment for the feeling.There are also animals that you can fly with, but I haven't got that far yet, I'm very excited!Quests/Story: 8/10I've come quite a long way and I have to say the story is super understandable and fun to follow. I think it's great that the introduction to Hogwarts has been implemented with lessons, so you really feel like a student.Game mechanics: 9/10I'm absolutely thrilled! There is so much to collect, unlock, puzzle. I had high hopes before release and they were easily exceeded. I'm not saying too much just let yourself be surprised.In total: 9/10Certainly the best Harry Potter game we will have for several years. Of course I also love the old games from back then, but this implementation is simply clean. There should be something for every fan and I'm so happy that a studio has managed to create a good license implementation. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THIS!Future wishes?Quidditch! ... pls

author: SubCrash
review: Very bland game play with very dated mechanics. It looks ok, and the castle is a lot of fun to explore. At first its an exciting new world to explore, but you quickly realize there isn't much there. Soulless interactions with NPCs for random quest, repetitive combat. You don't exist in the world. You aren't a student at Hogwarts. You don't live the life of a student, the joy and fun of the early movies could have easily been added into the game. It very much feels like it was designed about 12 years ago and just released. The jarring cuts to a fixed dialog cut scene for every character interaction is very last/last last gen feeling. Kinda feels like a bad version of Fable. I'd say wait for a sale.

author: Karthadon
review: This game is highly enjoyable- but only for one playthrough. Choices DO NOT matter in this game. Regardless of what action you make, the ending is the same. The only difference is that some characters (side characters usually) won't like you. Which doesn't matter. Because you never have to interact with them again after completing their quest.When I first started playing the game, I thought "Oh, I'll play through it again to get the evil ending". Yeah, well, the evil ending has no different outcome bar the fact that you made a different choice.Another thing, is the paid content. There is a single DLC that unlocks: A single outfit and a mount. The outfit, in my opinion, doesn't look too great. That, and the mount is slower than your broom. Not worth it.That all being said, game is still fun. Would recommend it. Try to get it on sale, though.
