author: ibo
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a solid game but its not without its flaws. Exploring Hogwarts was great ! The map is the best aspect of the game. The gameplay although fun at the start begins to get a bit dry later in the game. The boss fights were very disappointing, they reused boss fights too many times. The story was good and the characters were intriguing. My biggest gripe with the game was easily the level locking of story quests. I personally wanted to do side quests after completing the story but the game forces you to do otherwise. Id finish a quest and then have to grind to be high enough for the next. I should be able to play at my own pace. Overall I think Hogwarts legacy makes a bold statement that there can indeed be a good Harry Potter game. 7.5/10 Very Good

author: Koschei
review: Just finished my first play-through of Legacy. I loved the storyline. Despite what  people might say about the goblin uprising, once you have even an ounce of context, it makes sense. It doesn't feel like we're some Mean-German-Mustache-Man beating down the rebellion. Moreso, we're putting an end to a mis-guided goblin corrupted by magic he had no way of truly understanding.With that said, here is my pro/con list to break it down.Great storyFantastic representationStrong replayabilityInteresting NPC'sAmazing score and sound effectsLasting choicesBoth heart warming and heart wrenching scenesHave to play on low graphics (with my 1080TI)Still experience some lag going through doorsShaders sometimes take fifteen minutes to loadLow optimizationLots of clothing clips

I am a huge Harry Potter fan and this game really scratches that itch (even though this is before Harry was born). I just wish it was an MMORPG that would be so freaking cool. Take my word for it, if you are like me, don't pass up this opportunity to get an extremely fun game.

author: Cruortus
review: Awesome game.  I'm not a huge harry potter fan, but have familiarity with the universe having watched the movies.  The open world action RPG formula has gotten a bit stale over the years, but I didn't feel that at all with this game considering how enjoyable the combat was and how well they filled the game world with NPC interactions.  I found myself waiting to open up combat in certain dungeons to let goblins finish conversations and avoiding fast travel within Hogwarts to run into new ambient NPC events. The broom/fast travel system made it so the normal tedium found in open world exploration wasn't a bother.  My only critique (minor gripe) is that even playing as a dark mage, your character's verbal responses and social interactions still had you as a boiler-plate lawful good protagonist for the most part.  After murdering the 300th ashwinder by spreading curse magic  among their friends and family and turning their paramour into an exploding barrel to kill them with, the "wow they'll never believe I took out an ashwinder" statement was a little out of place.  Or the "Hogsmeade is just lovely" as I'm buying ingredients for more death piranha plants to genocide poachers. Hopefully game 2 (which seems inevitable at this point) fleshes out the choice and morality systems a bit.

author: War Criminal Joseph Kony
review: In 82.5 hours I've 100% completed this game. Is it worth the money in my opinion? Yes. If you enjoy a open world game where there are main quests that you can focus on with side quests around almost every corner then you'll love this game. I wish the broom was faster, after the amount of time and effort you put in to upgrade it I would have like to seen more of a speed increase. I don't expect to go from one corner of the map to the other in 2 seconds but at least feel like I'm zooming fast through the various mountainous areas. The game does a good job of guiding you through what you need to do without being too hand holdy. The difficulties are set up perfect for a wide range of players. Casual gamers can enjoy normal, hard core gamers will enjoy hard and for non-gamers who love the franchise and want to live the harry potter universe experience they can play on an adventure difficulty which turns the game into a almost sit back and relax game making the combat encounters much easier.All I can say in regards to improvements required.... WE NEED QUIDDITCH! Either make a spin off game like the PS2 Harry Potter Quidditch World Cup or add it via a DLC. Either way if implemented right I'm willing to pay £30-50 for it!

Gorgeous AAA game that cannot reach GOTY ever.A good story with weak choices to make. It is not much different whatever you choose.EPIC scene from the start. Drop down afterward.Beautiful open world but it does not attract player to explore.Weak RPG detail equipment and character build.The open world does not present anything new.The game has a lot of potentials but it cannot reach the masterpiece.I love this game but I am also disappointed.10/10 for Potterheads.the best harry potter game ever. Hogwarts and all ambient are so gorgeous.7/10 for everyone else.Weak RPG mechanics and a lifeless open-world game.

author: Rallyman2150
review: Pros:-The world and attention to detail is amazing. I would go as far to say this is probably the most, if not the most, detail visually I have ever seen in a game.-The music has some really high points. They do a good job of making it feel like Harry Potter without copy and pasting the original score.-The combat is actually pretty solid and a lot better than expected. There is a certain style to it and there are small nuances that I was not expecting from this game. -The story is a pro and con. On the pro side it has some really good moments that feel very Harry Potter. which makes it jarring when a voice line or absurd writing drags you over to con territory. -Gotta catch em all. Save animals from Poachers by Poachin....I mean saving them to keep in your own personal farm. Cons:-Some really lame dated RPG elements. Though the challenges at least hands out rewards for doing some of this.  (collect all the useless things, kill an arbitrary amount of generic enemies, delivery all the packages)-Voice acting can be all over the place.-Side quests range from pretty interesting to so bad its hard to believe they are in the same game.-no quidditch-inventory limited without any reason to be (tents are bigger on the inside, why not my pockets)-The story again is a pro and a con. The logic in the writing is maddeningly bad at times. there are times when I am asking why we are doing something one way when the game itself already solved this problem. Or we overlook very simple solutions that could be found by doing the most basic of research or asking a professor.Overall, I will say, I am still surprised at how good this game is. Though, there are some glaring issues that keep it from being an amazing game. What is wild to me is that I have never had a game that has hit such highs while simultaneously being so bad or boring at moments. Like I can go from encountering a dragon to immediately completing a landing pad. There are also things that have great potential that are reduced to simple shells of a idea (treasure vaults). Meanwhile I can pass a snowman who vanishes like magic before me. All while riding a thestral. The games is probably the closest thing to riding a roller coaster I have ever played haha

author: DG Zintho9
review: To sum up the experience, this game has a disappointing lack of content but what is there is good enough to warrant a play through. Potter fans will love getting to explore the setting, those not invested may find the experience lacking.7/10 - Good experience, only really something special for the people who already love HP. It took me around 47 hours to 100% a character, including getting the achievements for doing one of everything for several tasks. This feels fairly weak when weighed against how much time I spent on a 100% run of Witcher 3. Compared to other AAA titles that follow the same formula, there is little attention paid to the activities you can take part in outside the main story line. There are a myriad of different mini games that could have been included in the game that would have allowed a broader experience (Gobstones, Quidditch, Wizard Chess, Trading Cards, etc). The lockpicking activity is overall pointless and only acts to interrupt the gameplay, the same sentiment is shared with the sections of the game where you need to slowly crawl under something or are forced to watch a cutscene after completing a treasure vault / Merlin Trial. I found no real benefit to the beast breeding system, you have enough money from selling all the gear you pick up to purchase anything of value. The inclusion of Hippogriffs and Graphorns as mounts was lukewarm and had no real purpose outside of the singular quests they were associated with. The lack of skill based activities, such as a fleshed out potion making system that promotes following a recipe, maybe similar to how Cook, Serve, Delicious! handles cooking, instead of just only being able to wait for a timer to tick down was disappointing. The lack of a morality system severely reduces the repeatability of the game. The treasure vault locations were mainly dead content that added nothing to the experience, they should have severely cut the number of those present and actually worked to create unique puzzles that took more than thirty seconds to solve while drastically increasing the rewards given. The final cutscene for the house cup was just awful, five people jumping around in a circle while the actual tables of the great hall were completely empty. There seemed to be a lot of attention put into the Room of Requirement, but I never was in it longer than it took to grab all my Mallowsweet and Wiggenweld potions or complete what ever quest had me talk to Deek. The VA performances were good for the main dialogue, but the shouts used for the broom trials were pretty terrible. The quality for some of the audio files also seemed to be fairly questionable. The lack of choice when it came to the PC's VA was disappointing, I would have enjoyed to see maybe three different options that would allow for unique dialogue or interactions. The combat system was fun enough, but even on the hardest difficulty you get to the point where you can kill a troll in three hits without using AK. The music scoring was very good, no complaints on that front. The castle itself is populated wonderfully, I really enjoyed seeing the ambient interactions that the NPCs would have and exploring all the different secrets it held. The sidequests were engaging, I'd say more than the main quests. The graphics are done wonderfully, the facial animations are a bit on the stiff side, but the environments are well crafted.Did I enjoy my playthrough? Yes. Will I be playing it again? No, unless some new content is released.

author: Jimmy
review: Hogwarts Legacy perfectly captures the charm and magic of the wizarding world we grew up with from the books as kids.It is a love letter to the franchise.Just walking around the school gave me goosebumps! And the game itself is an awesome and very fun RPG.I was wondering how they would handle combat but it is fun and engaging. Sort of lite childfriendly version of Souls combat.Im deep into the story and i must say it is interesting and once again it just captures that wizard vibe so so so well.The world building is fantastic!If you are a Harry Potter fan this game is a must. Dont even buy on sale get it full price lets support the studio so that they can make an even better sequel.

author: Willard
review: Solid 8/10Open world is very pretty and there is a lot to explore.Can get repetitive at times with the same enemies and such. I simply do not understand why I couldn't romance Deek. This ruined the game for me.Unacceptable.

author: GoodHushPuppy
review: I'd give it: 8/10Great game! Exceeded my expectations for sure!Pros:- Some great missions!- Hogwarts itself is a joy to explore, so big you can get lost, but that added to the immersion for me.- Mostly good voice acting, especially from the main characters.- Combat system is well-designed and really satisfying.- The Room of Requirement is awesome!- Broom flying is awesome!- Clothing system is one of the best I've seen!- I love the field guide pages!- The animal mechanics are well done.- Graphics are great!- Has a LOT of potential for great DLCs!Cons:- Lacks interesting and difficult missions/side quests. Most side quests are repetitive.- Too much unnecessary dialogue.- Disappointed that there is no Quidditch, hoping it will at least be a DLC.- Character creation system is not good. And the voice pitching feature is just sad.- Friendship mechanic could be improved to add more depth to relationships.- Most characters are kind of dry.- Main story is a bit boring.- Decisions made throughout the game don't seem to have an impact on the overall outcome.- Boss battles aren't particularly memorable or challenging.- Not really any consequences for things like: going into the Forbidden Forest, Getting caught out of bed at night, and so on. Which I thought would have added to the immersion.- Terribly optimized for PC. Even has stuttering on high end PCs.

author: ara.arson

author: Yerske
review: Game is good but overrated.GUI made for console limits PC players..  nothing crazy but still bit annoyingMost characters strongly resemble their counterparts from HP series and end up plain boorish and uninteresting (Only Fig gets a pass and maybe Garlic for obvious reasons..) The biggest flaw is that it does not make you feel that Hogwarts is your new home..  it just a place, finish the crap and move on..  Room of requirement just makes it worse as it separates you from it.  Maybe if things were better planned out and you were locked in castle for longer with decent quests that would lead you and make you connect with your house and professors.. instead of  few cut scenes for classes Still game is good  and quite similar in design to recycled AC series.

author: Preposterous184
review: Overall great game. Main story line took ~20ish hours to complete. World design and graphics are definitely the strengths of this game. World looks breathtaking, and there is a decent amount of things to do. Rarely ran into a structure that didn't either have a purpose or loot. Only downsides of this game are the performance and, too an extent, variety in combat. There is one boss in the game that is entirely unique; however, most of the bosses don't require much innovation to defeat. Performance is the other downside. Computer comes with a 1060 3GB and 7th Gen Intel Core i7-7700. Game runs fine at lowest settings, but stutters at anything higher.

author: AyyyWhatitdohomie
review: Great game for casual players, especially if they are Harry Potter fans. If you are a hardcore gamer who's experienced a myriad of RPGs and games like Witcher 3, RDR 2, Persona 5 Royal, this game's open world will feel empty, boring and annoying at how many filler activities there are. The open world aspect is basically a Ubisot game with Harry Potter skin over it. Nevertheless, Hogwarts itself is ASTONISHING, so so good. The combat, despite getting stale pretty quick, is pretty fun. All in all, a solid game, especially for a first attempt. Now that they nailed down hogwarts, they can improve from here and make a masterpiece of a game for HP fans and a great game in general. Looking forward to it.

author: Fakyu Kominfo
review: The best scenery I have seen in my life, I am a fully grown adult with a kid but when I flied for the first time around Hogwarts, I could not stop giggling like a 7 years old. So much beauty so much details for the environment. Excellent job developers, excellent job artists !! Best $50 I have ever spent !!PS : I started this game with my cheap PC with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ spec, I could not do any battle without freezing every spell casted despite all low settings...so I built a whole new PC only, only for this game. Now I can play it nicely without any lag, its worth every penny haha.Please make the sequel, take your time, I dont care if its 5 years or 7 years. I'll wait :DOr you could create a TV series with Ominis Gaunt as the main character. Imagine the abused child who was tortured by his parents to force him to cast Crucio/Avada Kedavra, he is starved and beaten everyday and finally he was fed up, he finally casted the spell but ended up killing his father/mother/siblings etc. Then get shunned because of it despite not his fault, locked inside the dungeon, starved, worse than Harry's life in Dursley's house. Until one day the letter from Hogwarts came and invited him to attend school, he was freed and happy, although there are several students in Hogwarts bullied him because of his blindness, he found his best friend Sebastian and having the best time of his life. But then he found the nice aunt (who is the only family member actually loved him, died in the Scriptorium) So much potential for this story.

author: antegria
review: It was great to finally come home to Hogwarts. This game revives your best childhood memories, creates new ones and has great potential for memes production. It also managed to gather fun and enjoyable community around the game. There are some things that united us all, no doubt:1) Yes, Slytherin along with Ravenclow and Hufflepuff hold great parties. Yes, Gryffindor, your attendance is very much questionable.2) Ignatia haunts me every day. Yes, I am always up to something and yes, I CAN'T EVEN IMAGINE HOW INCONVENIENT TRAVEL WAS BEFORE SHE INVENTED FLOO POWDER. Jesus Christ.3) Oh, the joy it brings to save those fantastic beasts from poachers. I very much enjoyed becoming a better poacher myself, stealing beasts from their natural habitats, putting them into my fake vivariums and holding them against their will for feathers and stuff. They are fed and protected though, no worries.Despite all the cool stuff that was in the game, the main story seemed a bit short. The house you choose or being assigned to doesn't affect the gameplay that much (apart from possible additional side quests). You cannot fully embrace being a part of a particular house. Different brooms and cosmetics does not affect the way you fly. Same goes for wands.I would appreciate more quests with interesting lines and choices, as it was with Sebastian. For me, it was one of the best lines in the game so far.Nevertheless, all of those puzzles, chests and secrets will keep you entertained (personal no for Merlin trials, tho). Great way to spend time in Hogwarts and well, see you on the next party, don't forget your potions and herbs my young wizards.

review: Czy polecam? Oczywiscie, ze tak!! Dobra grafika, swietny system walki oraz dobrze napisana fabula z pobocznymi misjami/zagadkami. Piekny swiat do ekspolarcji, jak i mozliwosc kreowania pokoju, rozdzki - zabawa gwarantowana!!!

author: kedicik
review: There are only two satisfying things about this game:1) Atmosphere: The environment is simply beautiful. It is quite pleasing to fly around the Hogwarts and surrounding area.2) Combat: Although it could be improved, in general, combat is quite fun. Playing at hard difficulty reduces the reaction time you could have between enemy attacks. It can be quite satisfying as you improve your skills.Let's talk about the the thinks I strongly disliked about this game.1) Quests and Main Story line: It is simply BORING. The main premise is cheesy at best and the story line is very linear.2) Dialogues: There are mostly two options. One "kind" and one "rude". In most cases there is no "in between". The dialogues are very robotic, and some of them are full of cringe.3) Toxic inclusiveness: This is the general trend in the world nowadays. Some Netflix shows, Ring of Power TV series, etc. For the sake of being inclusive of various cultures of the world, producers bastardise the original contents. In this game, this was done relentlessly and I do not see the sincerity of this decision. It simply makes me facepalm every 5 minutes.4) No Logic: I annihilated foes with Avada Kedavra while accompanied with others. There was absolutely no effect to my characters relationship with them. WTF! Not even a dialogue after the fight? Cheesus...Please do yourself a favour and do not pay the full price for this game.

author: Prince of Sight Gaming| YouTube
review: If you are looking for an adventure that will keep you on for almost 100 hours to full completion then this is for you!  This game has incredible attention to detail, from the buildings, towns, rooms and UI.  You will immerse yourself for hours on end is this magical world authenticated in the potter verse.   Solid gameplay an incredible amount of hidden finds, from maps, puzzles , chests and hidden ares. You will thoroughly enjoy walking and flying in this wizarding world simulation.  You get to customize your character to the fullest, from gear to face reconstruction to almost near perfection. You have quest after quest to help you get into this world and all are beneficial to help you level up or in some way give you better gear or spells to boot! Nothing really is wasted time. The story the gameplay is really rewarding...also there is news about expansions maybe touching Quidditch and Azkaban? Totally worth the full price for this title...so don't wait any longer...go out and purchase this gem of game before the entire world spoils it for you....enjoy!!

author: AnnieIsOk
review: oh my...While the developers definitely showed a love for the HP universe and tried to include as much detail as possible, I simply cannot recommend the game because of its game design. Lets start with the good stuff:The good:- The game is extremely faithful to the source material- it tries to beinclusive: the player is able to create a character to his/her/their liking, there even is a transgender character in game, you have some missions with. I like, how they handled the character of Sirona even though I'd love to have had more missions with her.- the background-NPCs have animations and dialogue, which gives them life and increases immersion. Between students getting angry letters from their parents, getting caught and reprimanded by teachers and funny pieces of dialogue hinting at mistakes or magic fails, the devs showed a lot of love towards those background-characters that otherwise are ignored by players. I found myself stopping to watch and listen to them quite a few times. I really enjoyed that.- Extremely beautiful open world. The general design of waterfalls, small villages and abandoned castles feels fitting and like a realistic environmentThe "meh" (the not-so-good):- I have played the game in german and, sadly, the quality of the voice acting sometimes is lacking. Sometimes the voices almost feel mechanical as opposed to the words they are actually expressing. - In game, you can actually select your own house. This, of course, poses the question on how to approach the fact of the players house, but only a few dialogue lines by Sebastian Sallow really mention your house. In all other cases the devs gloss over the fact more or less elegantly. To me, it was very disheartening to have the final celebration and being awarded the winning house points only to have the final game dialogue go "100 points to THE HOUSE". - Generally, I would have loved to have a fixed name for my character, so he could've been mentioned by name. A lot of times it feels quite impersonal to be called 'the new one' 'your friend' and so on.- speaking of house points: In the potter-verse house points never were really thought through and have always been a point of ridicule. Why the developers then decided to have teachers give us house points with undisclosed amounts is a mystery to me. They'd easily get away with "50 points for x" without really breaking something. Currently they just say "points to x". It just feels weird.- In the beginning, I hoped to interact more with side characters. For example the player needs to find some marbles for a ravenclaw girl, so I hoped to be able to play with her after the quest. Nope, no can do. You cannot really talk to them anymore, so interacting with them is pointless.- some spells: A few of the spells we only use like 2-3 times in game. Why implement a spell like reparo if there is almost nothing to repair around, exept for a few pseudo cinematics?The bad:- Hogsmeade: I really really hate that town. Not for its beautiful and detailed streets and shops, but for the simple fact that I cannot do what we all wanted to do: Assemble my friends and visit the three broomsticks for butterbeer and Honeydukes for sweets, buy something funny at Zonko's. Instead our character walzes in everywhere just takes a randomly placed mug or muffin and chomps down on it like a caveman (or -woman). It is such a shame that we cannot meet there with our friends, even after the game concluded.  - the inventory system, sellers and money: Honestly, game mechanics like this should be forbidden under threat of prison time. The player can get new gear by opening up chests and loot drops by enemies. However, the slots for clothing (which improves our stats) are very limited. So limited in fact, that I ran out of space before even having access to hogsmeade and its vendors. So, with no other option, you start to sift through your gear in front of chests, in an attempt to weed out bad gear and destroy it to make room for new. Destroying gear does not give anything back however and the content of chests always is randomized. The values of that gear in fact are so randomized, that quite often i got gear that my level was too low for, but the stats of the gear were way worse than what I had. So, after a while, you'll find yourself visiting hogsmeade practically after every encounter, as your inventory is way too small, to sell the gear. Yes, one can expand the inventory by solving merlin's puzzles of which there are 95 in game, but still the game could've done with less merlin and more inventory. Collecting loot and selling it is very important, as you need a ton of money to advance in quests and expand your crafting room. I still dont get why it was necessary to hide those things behind a literal grind-wall. Merlins puzzles are really easy and repetetive btw.- the equipment system: You can equip things in your face, on your head, wear gloves, scarves, cloaks and outfits. You can even decide on a specific look. so why is it bad? Because you cannot lock in your desired look and everytime you try to optimize your gear to get better stats, you need to change your look back. The game throws A LOT of gear at you and you will change your gear often in order to always be protected the best. After a while it really is annoying to always change it back. This could've been fixed so easily, why did none of the play-testers notice that?- Too many collectibles, puzzles and so on: The large world holds a lot of collectibles and challenges. 95 merlins puzzles, 33 demiguise statues, broom challenges, caves, enemy encampments.. To get 100% in this game would take about 90 hours of grinding every region. This is way too much and, in my opinion really walks the line of being abusive to the player.- The world is too big. There, I said it. You can cross the world on your mount if you want, but be prepared to mind-numbingly fly in one direction for more than 5 Minutes. Combined with the head-ache inducing amount of collectibles and explorer-content, it really takes a lot of time to see everything. You really need the floo network, like the kind Ms. Wildsmith is very kindly reminding us, everytime we use it. Thanks to this lady's quibs it really is torture to travel.- Ignatia Wildsmith: Extra point because her dialogue quibs are so horribly annoying, modders rushed to release a mod to combat this annoying torture-by-chatter. You can get it on NexusMods.- game logic, stealing: In a quest to find gear to wear or sell, you will break in almost everywhere. Somehow this is normal, even if you break in someones cellar during a quest, there are no consequences at all. The NPCs just will stare at you, else nothing happens.- game logic, poachers and saving: The poacher quest line is a major part of the game, in which we set out to save the poor animals from their evil hands. Yet, in the same line we are given poacher gear and are told to "save" the animals... by kidnapping them from their habitat locations (spawn points) and trapping them inside the room of requirement in hogwarts, where we force feed them, breed them and clean them via spell, so they produce resources for us. So basically we save them from exploitation by kidnapping and exploiting them? And all characters in game know this and are not only fine with it, they advocate for it, even those who should advocate for the animals to live in a free natural environment. That's prime logic- the story: God it feels so forced. I think having the character be older was a good decision, but it comes with no rewards other than unlocking the next part of the story. The Character is a very special guy, who can see old magic and the story suggests he is on his way to unlock a lot of might. In order to prove his character he is sent to multiple boss fights (only one of which is unique). After each section, the player is shown memories in a pensieve, that are there to show the responsibility that comes with it (1/x)

review: visually stunning

author: mochiman202
review: I loved how it has a lot of Easter eggs and has plenty of side quest for people who like to take their time instead of rushing through the main story. After playing for 48 hours I can say that this game has yet to bore me. I look forward to finding all the secret hidden stuff around the map and building relationships with my fellow students and teachers at Hogwarts!

author: LtEndlol17
review: Hogwarts legacy, as suggested, lights the legacy of Hogwarts. I know that is crazy. Except it fails to do so. This is a game made for those who love Harry Potter. It fulfills that promise. For those who came here for a groundbreaking story, a magical combat system, you are not getting that. Most of that is an afterthought, The story is very stereotypical, you can see the plot coming a mile away. The threat is very underplayed and the antagonist is not very threatening, nothing feels at stake, and you are the typical protagonist chosen by fate for an obvious purpose. The combat is nothing groundbreaking, but it is satisfying. One thing that does shine is not only the open world but also its characters. They FEEL developed, except for the antagonists. You actively understand their struggles, joys, what they stand for in life, and their emotions(the last one is underplayed by the game's lack of face capture). Overall, the game is fun. Side quests take 5 to 10 minutes to complete and don't feel like as much of a chore. If you want a good Harry Potter game, this is it. Get it. It is worth it. As a harry potter fan, I give it an 8.5 out of 10. But core gamers may give it a 7 out of 10.

author: Sid_The_Geek
review: One of the most exciting things about Hogwarts Legacy is the level of detail and attention that has been given to the graphics and game-play. The game promises to have stunning visuals, with detailed environments and character models that truly capture the magic and wonder of the Wizarding World. The game also promises to have a rich and immersive story-line, with a wide range of quests and activities to explore and delivers on it positively.It offers players a range of customization options, allowing them to tailor the game's graphics and performance to their individual preferences. This means that players can adjust settings such as resolution, graphics quality, and control schemes to optimize their game-play experience and ensure that they are fully immersed in the world of Hogwarts.The game also need a bit of polish here and a bit of optimization there with some bug fixes.The only need from players' side would be the missing Quidditch game. I would like to formally request WB to release a DLC for the same.

author: DudeMan
review: Excellent game. Plenty of hours of gameplay outside of the main story. They did a tremendous job making the player feel they are immersed into the world of Harry Potter. Things I think they could have improved on would be making more difficult puzzles (tho the primary audience may be younger and prefer easy ones, I'm 34) and reworking the room of requirements. I'm hopeful for DLC or sequels in the future as well. 8/10 game.

author: Rainere
review: If you're a Hogwarts world fan you'll love playing this. The game is simple enough for new gamers and can be set to a higher difficulty for gamers that are more experienced. Would recommend this to anyone.

author: jukuRi™
review: It's a good game, but still far from perfect. I think the best thing about the game is clearly the HP universe. The attention to detail, including a lot of amazing animations especially inside the castle, is the real tidbit of the game. But as soon as you leave the castle and Hogsmeade, you can clearly see that the world just acts as a scenery and doesn't feel as alive as in other open world games. Still, the game simply looks awesome and was, at least on my PC, running without any bugs or FPS drops. The other big thing of the game are the fighting mechanics. Using various combinations of spells feels very powerful, especially as soon as you unlock the unforgivable curses. But apart from that has the game unfortunately a lot of flaws: - Main story not that catching but okay- Side quests are very very boring and uninspired except for a few (they feel more like "we have to implement stereotype xyz in order not to offend anymore, what can we do with these characters?")- Dialogues in general are extremely poorly written and destroy the immersion in a lot of scenes. Everyone is just so f*cking nice to everyone all the, it's ridiculous and doesn't feel natural at all - Loading screens to enter caverns, dungeons etc. - Way too many collectibles (especially Merlin Trials and chests)- Repetitive enemies (mostly spiders and other wizards)- Often moments that are intended to feel epic can't really create this feelingThe game still was worth playing and I hope there will be HL2 which fixes many flaws of part 1

author: WiredSamurai

author: wideg3cko
review: Loved the game, hardly noticed the "agenda". Truly a great story as it stands but there is ample room for DLC content to flesh  out parts of the story, maybe add some recurring missions, Quidditch, more in depth stories with your friends, make it a tad more open world. author: Sir Ranger
review: Hogwarts Legacy is an amazing single-player open world game in which you will be the protagonist of a completely new story in the wizarding world. You will fight against a goblin uprising and wield an ancient form of powerful magic which you will learn more about through out your mission.The game has really surprised me, you can actually feel as if you really where a student in Hogwarts. You will learn new skills and spells from your teachers, whom they all have interesting backgrounds. You will also be able to visit iconic places from the books/movies and interact with them.This game will give you around 50 hours of complete fun and immersion while you fight for the future of the wizarding world and explore all that it has to offer. The music and ambience are incredible and the combat system is really fun, letting you combine some of the most popular and well-known spells and curses to defeat your opponents. Most of the side quest also have interesting stories and even some of them will prove your morale as you debate on what's right and what's wrong to achieve your goals. The open world feels alive and really invites you to explore, the graphics are amazing and the soundtrack really slap much of the time, specially when you're flying with your mount over the magical landscape.Right now I've only found two main problems with the game.-The first one is that the game will force you to 100% it if you want to "finish it": The final mission, which is sort of a prologue mission after you finished the main story, requires you to have completed all challenges, all missions, found all missing pages throughout the world, etc. Which can be very annoying if you don't have the patience for that.-Second problem: Although I mentioned that some missions will make you make moral decisions, these hardly affect the story, if not at all. Those who wanted to play with different moral alignments, try to see how their actions would impact the world and see the opinion that the people would have towards them, will be a bit disillusioned to see that you can only play as "the good guy". It doesn't matter whether you are a lawful good student trying it's best to help everyone or if you extort and bully them and proceed to start blasting the unforgivable curses to everything that moves; the story will be the same with no noticeable changes.Overall, it is an amazing game worth playing and it will give you hours of genuine fun. But don't expect to find too much complexity on any aspect of the gameplay or the story.

author: Top Guy
review: Pretty sick. Cool exploration stuff, good combat, fun puzzles. Weird social choices considering the time period, but still really cool regardless.

author: Thaumatoulhs!
review: Ouaou Game!!!

author: jade
review: I never planned on purchasing the game or even anticipated the release, however I was absolutely blown away by the attention to detail, Easter eggs, and Customization. If you enjoyed the original games, books, or films, or even just a cozy game I HIGHLY recommend Hogwarts Legacy. I am most impressed by the design of the world with the accuracy to the franchise and the beautiful graphics, I also can't get over the Room of Requirement! The Room of Requirement has to be one of my favorite aspects of the customization, there are hidden surprises and customization factors you can earn through quests and exploration; it's like a serotonin feeder. Don't get me started on all of the vivariums and beasts you can collect. On top of all of these beautiful base features we can thank the Modding community for additional shaders and many other things to bring more life to the world. However unfortunately, there are some downsides to the game, none deal breaking in my opinion.  While this isn't meant to turn you away from the enjoyment of the game play or purchasing it is worth mentioning the cons. Considering this game is in the early stages I don't doubt the Developers will make due of the communities collective constructive criticism. The first major take away a lot of players including myself were disappointed by was the lack of involvement of Ravenclaw in personalized story side quests, lack of house events, and no Quidditch. Adding in possible future DLCs would be an amazing opportunity. Minor things I noticed was the lack of interactivity with Npcs and non magical animals. As a take away I think for how well the game is so early on from release I am very pleased and fully enjoyed the narrative.

author: Veil
review: doesn't deserve any of the hate it receives, great game

author: Bunnie
review: 10/10 you can pet magic animals and cats. My Harry Potter fan heart is very happy

author: alaenya
review: I've been thinking about writing a review throughout my entire playthrough but I kept running out of words to describe the game. Magical feels overused but that's exactly what this game is. There is so, so many magical things and details from which you can see how much love went into this. I've finished the main story now, played almost a 100 hours and I still keep gasping and tearing up at every corner. This game made me laugh, cry and everything in between. I'm not a completionist but this game makes me want to complete every single thing just so that I discover all of the astonishing details to the environment and the characters. I'm someone who skips through dialogues in games because it's hardly ever interesting or well written and I haven't skipped a single sentence here. I hate combat that counts on your reflexes because I have anxiety but this game made the difficulty so well balanced I actually enjoy being able to react.But my absolute favourite and by far the most unexpected game mechanics is the room of requirement and the ability to decorate so much space. As someone with hundreds of hours in Sims 4 spent mostly building houses, I have to tell you that I cried every time the room expanded and gave me more space. Honestly, it's even a bit overwhelming and I begged it to stop but I guess it knows what's in my heart.Do I have things I wish the game had? Absolutely. Do I still think it's the best, most intricate and most magical game I've ever played? You bet. The amount of gameplay and the size of the world makes up for any details I would've welcomed but I do hope we'll get some future content because I want to continue living in this world. Though to be honest, I'll continue to do just that even without the content. Still so much space to decorate, so many sunsets and sunrises to see and gasp at and so many cats to pet!TL;DR: This game made me laugh at all the little details and cry literal tears over some others. 10/10 would cry again. Also, they kind of had me at petting the cats.

author: Ruu
review: I really enjoy this game. I had a bit of issues with lag and such during the first few days of release, however, all the lag and stuff has been fixed for me now after recent patches. This game is really fun, and the mechanics are really cool. I recommend everyone give it a try. The choices you make determine your outcome, the combat is flawless in my opinion, and the exploration is top tier. My only grievances are that some of the puzzles feel a little too easy, but all in all I think the game is very fun and enjoyable. As well as some of the visuals of the castle and the lake don't line up with the books / movies, but that is a very small detail. Definitely game of the year so far!Also : "Don't let anyone tell you that you can't buy Hogwarts Legacy. Remember that there is no such thing as ethical consumption under capitalism. No matter what you buy, you are supporting some sort of unethical practice. So by their own logic, these people shouldn't buy anything at all. In the end, they are just hypocrites who like to hold others to impossibly high ethical standards that they themselves don't follow."

author: FreddieTheGreat
review: After having played it to finnish & completed around 90% of the field guide. I do not in its current state recommend the game. If we're talking story, graphics, exploration, world building, voice acting, combat, I would 100% recommend it. So do not take it as the game is bad in anyway. It's amazing.My beef is with the performance. I had pretty much finnished game besides the last quest, which takes you to the credits. Celebrating your year at Hogwarts. I came back now after multiple updates & the game ran even worse. Big memory leaks, big fps drops & stutters. I have a pc well equipped to run in Ultra, but even on High am i getting problems. Which is known issue amongst all players & many youtubers who have done deep dives in to what the best options are. I'm just tired off triple A games always having ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ performance on release. I would suggest coming back in a year & checking up on it. Like a video "Hogwarts in 2024" & see the current status.

author: Link
review: This was a game I was not expecting to enjoy so greatly. After the consideration when my friend had begun to play, I decided it was the right thing to do. I hadn't given myself proper retail therapy for a long time, and as the HP franchise is something I did grow up with but drifted away from, this was the perfect opportunity. The game is great! It's very simple in its story and reminds me of how games used to be. Not necessarily stale or linear, but enough so that you can easily follow along while still stopping to do side quests or to look for collectibles. The characters are quite memorable, and although Sebastian seems to have more of a spotlight, many of the other characters make up for it in personality. My favourite character is Ominis. The graphics are stunning, and even with a now outdated laptop, still runs quite well as the game streams its content in a way I'm not used to. Bugs happen, but that's the norm these days. The developers are working quickly on updates and seem very connected to the community, which is a great privilege considering the controversy surrounding the series. If you plan to play this game due to the controversy and wonder if it's worth it, I do recommend this game. Even if you expect it to not be the best, you may still find yourself having a bit of fun.

author: nomorebunnies
review: I had more nostalgia playing Hogwarts, back to the days of  Harry Potter & The Sorceress Stone, & Chamber of Secrets when it was on PS1. Great game for a young audience being introduced into the wizarding world, however I believe the real target audience are gamers in there 30s that grew up with it.My first play through was on Hard and the game was still relatively unchallenging, if you go to sleep and you don't dream of Revelio did you even explore?I do believe the game should have more content, as you do not really get a common room or house experience. Since house points do not matter an you receive almost all of your quests outside the common room. Think I only went there 3 times.New Game + into another House would be nice so you do not have to recollect everything. Seeing as you will beat the game before you collect half of it. Great game for what it is, but severely lack luster when you start to pull it apart. Also, not worth the pre-order I was level 20 before I got my mount and to that part of the game.

Levitating someone, drawing them to you, then setting them on fire never gets old.  Great game.  A game that I 100% recommend.

author: Rorschach
review: This is a Great game to say the least. Lots of addictive fun and interesting lore-full activities to immerse players into the wizarding world that made up the Hogwarts stories. For all who have an interest in the fable, magic, animals, and more, Id say this game is worth playing. As I played, I enjoyed the characters in each encounter, The enemies had a bit of uniqueness that kept me on my toes, the animals in the game were fantastic as expected, and the world was expansive enough to give the feeling of full open world exploration despite the game play being a narrative. The potential for this game is in its dialogue options, Unique approach to specific targets when casting, resets on loot chests, expanse on world exploration, and class/task interactivity. (Replay-ability also)All in all, I am glad I didnt wait to play this game, and in spite of the above mentioned potentials, I enjoyed the game thoroughly. Im sure players with a general interest, will enjoy the game too.

author: Linio
review: There are a lot of positives review there, so I'm going to focus a bit on what is not going so well with Hogwarts Legacy to balance a bit the massive vision shared here.I will start by the big "pro" of the game which is the universe. Let's face it, it's good, very good even. The sensations of the game are good, the vibe is there, and the whole world is pretty and feel indeed "magic".Now, this is the skeleton of the game, and it could hold a great game, but let's face it, when we take a look at the meat, we clearly see that it's more fat than actual meat.The game resolves around "collecting" stuff. Let's face it, the story isn't that great and all missions together would make for quite a short game, so the game is more on the stuff to find, and this is where the issue lies. There are around 1500+ stuff to gather. Yep, you read it correctly, and it's not stuff that you collect by the dozen, it's stuff that you have to handpick one by one. They are divided in several categories (chest, pages, etc etc) but in the end it's always the same stuff, go somewhere, potentially use a spell, collect, rince & repeat. And where at the beginning it's nice, to gather stuff around, when you reach a certain milestone it's an horrible chore.And those collectibles unlock very underwhelming stuff. You have vanity stuff which is nice, and combat stuff. And there are small stuff that make the combat unenjoyable also, the system around spells is good but the UI is at times a bit clunky, which make the game really hard on hard, but a bit easy on normal, rendering useless the whole plants/potions/gear.I'm always a bit bewildered by the idea that asking gamers to do again and again the same stuff feels like a good gameplay mechanic.You add to that that the performance of the game is really subpar, and all in all the joy of the experience is really short lived, and although it is a good experience, it could have used some trimming to pack it up in a more rounded experience.

author: jayson_westbrook

author: `KokoJacK_^
review: Very good game for its story, graphics, music, ambience, easter eggs, fan service and combat gameplay. It is also lore friendly. It has a good longevity (I beat it 100% in ~100h on hard difficulty with all collectibles). However, the game is far from perfect and not exempt of issues.- Secondary quests that are not companions one or treasure maps are very forgettable fetch quests.- No quidditch mini game, it's a shame for a game set in the Harry Potter universe.- It is barely an RPG game, more like an open world action game, quests are very linear, with meaningless choices. Weak NPCs interactivities. Also, there is no morality system. This leads to poor replayability.- Itemization is among the worst I have seen in a game like this, just random gear with random stats, nothing exciting.- Some activities are too repetitive like Merlin's tasks.- Game is missing some QOL improvements, in exemples, transmogrification only applies to items and not gear slots, no separate keybinds for utility spells or mounts.- Performances are bad, with stuttering and frames dropping (Spec : AMD 2700X, 32 GB RAM, NVIDIA RTX 2070, Samsung M.2 860 EVO).- It is very easy, even in the hardest difficulty. Once you perfect the timing to dodge, you have won the game.- Some translation issues in the French version of the game, albeit very minor.All in all, it is still a good game, especially if you're fan of the license, and I had great times with it but it isn't stellar.

author: Chef
review: I spend the last decade of my gaming life playing multiplayer, co-op and very few solo games because most of them have mostly story videos and too little actual gaming.. Hogwarts legacy is not that case, is the first solo game i played in a long time and actually didnt stop after 3-4 hours. Everything is amazing, nice graphics, nice fights, all the quest keep you busy not just for the main story but to explore, map is big, the game is just Awesome!! I think I will play at least 200 hours before i get bored, which is pretty good amount of time for a single player game.!

author: SO HYPED WITH HADES 2
review: Então, vamos la. Não confundam, o jogo é bom. Os graficos são lindos. O mundo é gigante, e cheio de lugares a serem explorados. Mas ele custa 250 reais.250 reais em um jogo que em 40h foi possivel terminar todas as quests principais e secundarias, e boa parte dos eventos repetitivos e massantes que tem ao longo do mapa. Uma historia onde, apesar de você poder fazer escolhas menores ao longo do jogo, pouco elas afetarão o final dele, ja que tal final é simplesmente decidido pelo jogador entre duas escolhas, na ultima quest. Apesar da historia interessante (mesmo tendo seus problemas), tanto da principal, quanto das sidelines (Te amo Sebastian), não existe uma grande possibilidade de escolhas, e isso me deixa desconfortavel, ainda mais tendo o The Witcher 3 como base para um jogo mundo aberto com enredos lineares, mas bifurcaveis. A imersão é muito boa, e isso se faz pelos efeitos sonoros, graficos, e animações de alta qualidade. Dizem que é todo jogo que um fã de Harry Potter gostaria de ter jogado, e sinceramente, talvez seja verdade mesmo. Mas ele não vale 250 reais.Vale a pena jogar, mas se quiser jogar, a Empress ja crackeou. Não me arrependi de ter comprado por ser um grande fã da franquia. Mas comprar o jogo sem ser esse grande fã, vejo como um desperdicio de grana. Com um preço mais acessivel, recomendaria de cara com certeza, não somente para os fãs da franquia, mas para todos aqueles que gostam de jogos mundo aberto. Mas 250 reais é simplesmente salgado demais para o HL.

author: BerserkWolf UK
review: If you're a Potter fan this game is probably a must buy as it would have always been your dream to explore Hogwarts without running into an NPC who looks like their face had been squished with a Looney Tunes frying pan. Even if you're not it's a solid game to play with tonnes to do, and a massive map to explore. Although admittedly, some collectable objectives are a little boring after a while, there is PLENTY of them though so feel free to sink into that if you're a completionist!Honestly though its got a really engaging combat system in my opinion, especially with the easy to master spell combos, which add to the satisfaction of depulsing someone off of a cliff for a fitting killing blow. As someone who normally button mashes on Mortal Kombat instead of learning combos, that's saying something. I've had a thoroughly great time with it, the Story was great, not perfect and felt kind of rushed at the end, however the characters are good and are very likeable from my point of view, even when they're stubborn and do stupid things. i wont name names. Performance is a bit of on issue on higher settings, with frame drops and stuttering, especially around and inside the castle, at least until you've fully loaded in the area, it gets better after a while but you still get them occasionally to a lesser extent. Still i managed to get solid highs of 110 fps exploring with lows of 70-80 during heavy combat scenes on medium settings 1080p with a OC Kaby lake i5 and 3060, the game still looks beautiful on low settings however! Still. It is a great game, well worth AAA price and it will give you many hours of fun if this kind of Singleplayer RPG is your thing... Especially if you love or even like Harry Potter!

author: Glitchbyte
review: I can barely stand writing this because I just want to get back in the game!I LOVE it.  Its a polished, creative, GAME.  Lots of stuff to do.  Main quests, side quests, pages to collect, 8 million Merlin Trials, treasure caves, potion brewing, plant growing, combat trials, etc etc etc....  and just the sheer fun of exploration!  The quests have nice little story lines and great voice acting. The controls are intuitive and make things fun instead of frustrating.  The combat is wonderfully fun....  Pulling enemies toward you and igniting them with flame.... Wonderful.  OH!  And I could beat wolves out of their fur for hours and not get tired of how their pelts howl when i loot their skins.      When you think it can't get better you learn flight, get mounts and get your own customizable room.  Now, you know I can't stand divisive narratives being pushed in games.....  This game gets the all clear from me.  There are a minority of NPC characters who are LGBTQ, in the 1800s no less, but it doesn't bother me because the story isn't about forcing someone's identity and sexual lifestyle down your throat and trying to destroy you if you misgender.  Their identity comes about naturally as you encounter them in the story, for example, when one refers to her wife, or where one has a deeper voice than you'd expect.   Its not announced in a pride rally with dongs being flung around children while demonizing Christians or white western men.  What a breath of fresh air to see my fellow human beings from different lifestyles being portrayed as just people instead of mentally fragile activists hellbent on sewing discord.  Thus, the story stays focused on the story, and in no way grooms or marginalizes one segment of the population!  Mostly, the game is GREAT at immersion.  Why has it taken THIS long to have a good game come out?  My character looks like the Invoker from DOTA2, I'm having a blast playing through Hogwarts as the one and only Kael'thas Sunstrider.  I've said enough, the game is great, not some cheap release like Cyberpunk full of bugs and woke story.   This game is pure, polished entertainment.

author: raeindeer
review: Honestly, a huge missed opportunity. Starts off magically charming and seemingly challenging due to limit initial capability, intresting because there is loads to do and discover -be it in a somewhat predictable model for an open world game- to develop your wizardy skills, great environment due to the amazing world the game is set in, some time getting used to the best combat mechanics, ...but it's so amazingly stuck in its seemingly limited concept and developmentthere are an amzing 4 (?) different layouts for treasure caves with all of maximum 3 possibilities to open them - repeat 50+ timesEvery beast is captured in the same way, put in the same place and cared for in the same way, every spell is unlocked by doing challenges no sane school teacher would give you, every enemy camp is the same and nearly every "boss battle" is the sameThere are all of 6 possibly solutions to a Merlin trial - repeat 70 times-; where on the 50th time your character is still spitting the same line as on the 2nd; "Could it be? :o A MERLIN TRIAL?! :O"Bringing me to the repeated dialogues -non stop- from start to finish, the character, the NPCs, the enemies, ...collect 40+ different broom handles you never see, 100+ decorations for a room you don't care much about apart from its functionality, but only 9 potions and 13 animals (really, what student can't do this in a year?), and 26 spells to learn sounds like a lot but it REALLY isn'tEvery wand is the same -just reskins-, every broom is the same -simply reskins-, every mount is the same -is it still okay to be a reskin?-Conversations with NPCs usually give an average of 2,3 options, the obvious decent one and the teenage rebellion/rude one, with the occasional extra, outcome never seems to matter whatsoeverKind of fitting with the ridiculously straight line in the game and the flaw in questline challenge"WE HAVE AN INEXPLICABLE THING FOR THE LAST 50 YEARS/MONTH/DAY IN THIS AREA WHERE EVERYONE IS A WIZARD" / "I AM WITCH FOR 30 YEARS BUT I CANT BEAT BAD SPIDER" / "I WORRY FOR PERSON BUT AM SISSY AND SO I SEND A RANDOM MINOR TO CHECK" ...so now your 'special late freshman student specific tool' takes you straight to the thing we can't find and you have a chance to 'solve' it in 2 minutes - rinse and repeat 100 times for nearly every side quest and even some of the main questsI understand being a -fresh- student at a school brings it's limitations, but really?The guidance in the game is also to the point where they kind of WANT you to go for high completionREVELIO, walk walk walk, REVELIO, walk walk, REVELIO, walk, REVELIO, wa, REVELIO RELEVIO RELAOOIVA REVOOLVERIO - everything in the world is discoverable and predictable with just the R button. you can't miss a damn thing or fail solving or discovering anything without it.THIS SPECIFIC TOWN HAS 7 SECRETS IN IT, THAT BUILDING HAS 3 FOR YOU TO 'DISCOVER' AND THAT PLACE YOU FLEW OVER HAS A SECRET BANDIT CAMP/ ANIMAL NEST THAT NOBODY HAS FOUND IN A YEAR. ALSO HERE'S ANOTHER SKIN AND ANOTHER AND ANOTHER AND MORE AND BLUE CAPE AND THE RED BAND IS NOW 1 CM TO THE LEFT AND MORE SKIN REWARDScontent for the sake of content, did you completely run out of things to reward a WIZARD with after 3 minutes of brainstorming?Also ♥♥♥♥♥♥, if you want to keep getting 'talent points' to at least change something about the gameplay or to make certain spells remotely, you HAVE to do all of these things over and over and over and overThe first 10 hours are logically somewhat of an introduction and gradual evolution, but the learning curve just stops and the game actually gets easier because you do more and more damage without the environment evolving or getting more challenging.I could keep going and going and goingand yeetingabout so many more things, but in short and good graphics aside, this game would have been amazing 10 years ago, great 5 years ago, but to me in todays age is simply below average for a 60 euro game -yet sweetly nostalgic due to its environment- at this point. I will finish it for that good reason alone, but it's way too straightlined, WAY too guided, and WAYWAY too repetitiveIf this is the challenge of becoming a student at hogwarts, it would be embarrassing to say it took you 6 years to complete or to even be a wizard. Do better.

author: uwurawr
review: While there is a lot of negatives to the game, I like it. The game is baby food but it's fun baby food.  Negatives:It has a lot of dumb collectibles and some are gated until later on in the story. Also a lot of repetitive puzzles. Countless amounts of them. UI is terrible. Animation for everything and when you press 'I' to skip the the menu book to head straight into your inventory I want to be able to press 'Esc' and not have to go through the stupid book. The map is also over done. Floo lady needs to shut it. The first 6 hours of the game feels like the worlds longest tutorial. There had to have been a better control scheme for spell casting on mouse and keyboard. I had to use nvidia vsync for a stable fps. RT is incredibly unoptimized, one moment I'll have 60 fps and in the next moment in the same room I'll have 20 fps. This tends to happen without RT but only infrequently. You also can't sleep or sit anywhere. The only way to pass time is to go into map and press 'F'. The gear slot limit is just annoying. You can increase it by doing puzzles scattered across the world. I'd rather if the limit just hadn't existed to begin with so I could sell my gear when I wanted to, not when I had to. Positives:The world is engaging. I feel like I am in the world. Even if I can't make the choices I'd want to make if it was a real RPG. Story is decently engaging. It's pretty. The seasons changing is cool. The Talents are actually useful and there isn't a silly amount of them. Room of Requirement is very cool. Defeating enemies for cosmetics and traits are nice bonuses. There's a lot of additional content to do and work on outside of the main story that isn't just puzzles and collectibles.

author: Dust Gasser
review: A truly magic game for any fans of the Hogwarts saga. They will be able to experience everything they have always dreamed of. Beautiful to look at and with an atmosphere that only a few other games can achieve, you will always find yourself progressing through its systems and unlocking new things at a steady and well-crafted pace. But if you are looking for a complete package comprised of choices and freedom for the player, you won’t find it here. This is a wonderful adventure if you are willing to accept the limitations of the setting.Let’s get one thing out of the way first. If you are a fan of Harry Potter’s universe, buy this game now. You probably did already, and you are now having the time of your life playing it. Enjoy, it really is awesome. Good. Now, for the players that, like me, don’t know much about Wizarding World and its characters, and are wondering if this might be a good game, this review is for you.Hogwarts Legacy is a very good game, with sky-high production values, fun combat, and tons of secrets to discover and puzzles to solve. The game starts with one of the best, if not the best, opening in the history of videogames. It can create a sense of magic and awe that no other game can achieve. It will make you want to continue playing just to see if the magic stays with it or if it fades away. Personalizing your character, your outfit, your spell sets, even your wand, and your flying broom are all truly wonderful moments this game delivers; the atmosphere that the setting, the music, and the graphical art can create, make everything more astonishing than you could ever imagine. Add a combat system that it’s very fun to mess with, thanks to the different spells, and you will have an almost-complete package that could become a classic. Keep in mind that if you are looking for a true RPG, you won’t find it here. Your character will have no class, they are mostly a pre-determined hero with a pre-determined path. They will have no alignment, and this speaks volumes of the general tone of the game. Every dialogue is very polite and there are few choices within them. Sure, you can be a d**k with other people. Sometimes you will have the choice of a “bad” response during dialogues, but you will always sound like a very well-educated d**k.A beautiful-looking game that runs well on most computers. Shaders pre-compilation is present and the game didn’t suffer from any stuttering issues during my playthrough. Could have been better optimized though, the performance hit when enabling Ray Tracing doesn’t justify turning it on. It is mostly CPU-limited, so framerates will vary depending on your system. It has all the latest tech, DLSS, Ray Tracing, and Nvidia Reflex. All in all, it’s a great technical marvel.This game is catered towards a very specific type of player, you are controlling a character of young age during your adventures after all, and of young age is the main type of NPCs you will deal with. So, whilst the main quest is always fun and entertaining, side quests are pretty boring and do not have branching paths to them. Even the world outside Hogwarts, with its enemies and dungeons, never feels dangerous. And even though there are quite a few things to discover in the open world, few of them are engaging and appealing. Things are mostly locked by default too, waiting for you to reach a certain point in the main quest or that you have the necessary coins/resources to unlock them. Want a new flying broom when the game finally unlocks it for you? You have to pay for it. Want to explore a dungeon that you have just discovered? You have to unlock the quest connected to that dungeon. You need consumables to unlock puzzles in the open world, or coins to purchase that one missing ingredient to create the potion needed to complete a quest. You need coins to do almost everything. And if you stick to the main quest, you will not have much in your pockets; I reached a point playing the game where I decided to discover all the puzzles and secrets within Hogwarts’ premises because it seemed the most fun thing to do since I didn’t have enough coins to do anything else. The incredible, fantastic sense of magic experienced at the beginning of the game had faded away. I had grown tired of the long, overly-polite conversations with other NPCs and bored of completing meaningless side quests.This is not a game with mature themes, be warned. It’s a game that will entertain you with tons of things to unlock and discover about the world of Harry Potter. And everything connected with that saga, you will probably find it here. If that one is the experience you are looking for, you will adore this game. Just don’t come looking for something more.Dear reader, please be informed that this game is the subject of a lot of controversies, due to the fact that JK Rowling, the author of the Harry Potter franchise, is actively pushing, in her position as a wealthy and famous individual, for legislation that will hurt trans people. Please make some research and judge for yourself if you are willing to buy this product or not.

I was annoyed as hell. -The Controlls are an absolute Overload, but okay´ish, but not realy intuitive-the Character seems to have just 4 to 5 Voicelines and repeating them every encounter->your Character as well and it can be annoying as hell too-Cutscenes arent skipable at some points what annoys me too-Levellock for Spells, Missions and Stuff...not nice...would like to play the Game in my Way, without being forced to reach a certain levelover all it was an OKAY-Experience, but i need to say that i almost deinstalled the Game before being able to End it, because of those Levelcaps...Hope many others could ejoy it more, but if you have no Problem with my Cons...Give it a tryAs a Potterhead i think it would be a great Experience!Edit: More Accio-Duells would be Great...those where fun, but way to less possibilities to play them

review: Yo, as soon as this game came out I ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ no-lifed it. The combat isn't the best but it's def good! It's got both a dodge and parry mechanic, and the difficulty you choose will determine how much time you have to react to incoming attacks.Story is aight, I felt like my character smiled too much but iunno! I have a ♥♥♥♥♥ face half the time so I kind of wanted my character to have the option to be a massive grump but I'm cool with it. I mean ♥♥♥♥, I play games so I can see my character do ♥♥♥♥ I don't do so smiling all the time is pretty amazing in all honesty!A lot of collectibles and the world is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ huge and feels lived in! It was kind of trippy to see! It was like a hella vastly improved version of modded Skyrim for me, I couldn't believe how open everything was and how good it all looked! Why am I comparing it to Skyrim? ♥♥♥♥ if I know I got back into it after modding and now I'm a Redguard and have Inigo with me man I just wanna stab some ♥♥♥♥ okay?You got the money? You wanna have fun? Buy this thing, I ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ loved it tenderly for 48 hours and I only have warm feelings thinking on it.Here's some completely irrelevant stuff that somehow is applicable to owning this game;I guess there's some weird ♥♥♥♥ going on with J.K Rowling too or something and her twitter beef got all up in Hogwarts. I have no idea what that's all about, but if you wanna ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ up and become a Wizard Harry, well here's your chance! Just you know, don't blow up your PC. Clean the dust off that ♥♥♥♥ you filthy casual, make sure it has some damn space too! I bet you play with the power button with your big toe don't you?...I did too when I was younger, it's okay. author: Ivu ☾

Even after 100 hours,I am still lurking and uncovering stuff! Definitely recommend.

author: Lightman
review: WB doesn't make too many games, but they are always decent, Hogwarts Legacy is no exception. The story is predictable, most character is very hard to get attached to, what the game has to offer, you've seen it thousands of times in this genre, nothing extraordinary, but it kinda works. The game sadly also have a lot of wasted potential from quidditch to school attendance, it really feels like you're just playing a rando wizard, who happens to be allowed set foot on schoolgrounds and nothing more, so there is definitely room for growth in the sequel.And I must take a note of the ABC+ stuff as well, because thats how it is nowadays. For all of those who worried, there isn't terribly much of that stuff in the game, but unfortunately all of it sticks out like a sore thumb. It is painfully obvious that all of that ♥♥♥♥ is in the game only because of the people who choosed to boycott the game. But I hope it was a good lesson for the devs and in the future they won't try to cater to a group that doesn't even like or care about videogames.

Well worth the price as there are many side quests and puzzles to keep you happily occupied for quite some time.

author: クリス
review: When this game was officially announced I was very hyped about it. However I went through a roller coaster of emotions with it leading up to its release. When I found out this game was being developed by an app games studio I was a bit hesitant to pre-order but was willing to give it a chance anyway. Then Gotham Knights came out and it was an utter disappointment. Event though it was not made by the same studio it was still a WB game and it was the deciding factor on me not going through with the pre-order for this game.A week after its release I decided to give it a shot because I was hearing a lot of good reviews. I'm not one to spoil things for myself so I went in not knowing or expecting anything other than it was not a disappointment like Gotham Knights was. And to my surprise this game ended up being one of my favorite games to date. I have over 100 hours on it already on my second play through. I work from home and have a lot of free time while at work and this game has definitely made my days go by way quicker.I will start off by saying that this game is not perfect, it does have its issues just like any other game. BUT MAN IS IT FUN! If I had to compare it I would say this game is a mix of Jedi: Fallen Order mixed with Assassin's Creed Odyssey. Two of my all time favorite games. The combat is fresh and feels polished. The story is sort of a copy paste of other stuff we've already seen but I'll give it a pass. The side quests and the lore deep within the game is what matters here anyway.While playing this game you can really tell the developers are huge Harry Potter fans. From the lore to locations and everything else in between you are always grinning as you walk thru the halls of Hogwarts. That is if you're a Harry Potter fan. Overall I would rate this game a solid 9/10 taking one point away for the generic main story and minor quality of life issues. Extra tip: Go ahead and get sorted and build your wand on their website so you have a more personal experience in game. Enjoy!

author: Doragon
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a good game for anyone who enjoys exploration and combat in their RPGs. The other features (e.g., economics, herbology, potion brewing) are passable but a bit mediocre, but in no way detracts from the experience if you're primarily here as someone who either read or watched the Harry Potter series and want to immerse yourself in the universe. Turn off your brain and let your inner kid run wild, it's a great experience. If you're trying to 100% the game, there are many things that are hidden away; use a guide for it.

author: xemsyt
review: TLDR: 8/10 - Great game but full of missed opportunities. A sequel could easily be a masterpiece if they build off of this.Highly unorganized review- In terms of feels -- a genuine trip back to Hogwarts for weirdo millennials like myself.- Hogwarts school simulator aspect was well worth it, very exciting finding secret rooms/ locations form the books/films. The fact that your choice of house has little impact on the game is pretty disappointing. Would have loved to see a 'house points' system that could lock/unlock certain areas and change the environment depending on who's winning at that particular moment. Would have really helped with replayability as well (as there's not much of that to be found here)- Combat gameplay is pretty good, far better than I was expecting. Overall pretty fun/complex enough- Story was fine, nothing amazing here but we didn't really need it to be amazing- Music, Wonderful. Very John Williams-esque while still sounding unique to itself.- Customization pretty good. The value of the ability to change appearance of gear without affecting stats should not be understated.- The largest negative for me -- npc student characters aren't nearly as memorable as they could have been, they almost exclusively interact with the player and no one else. The game sets you up to have 3 or 4 "friends" but it it feels too much like just a vehicle for side quests. It would have elevated the game to masterpiece levels if there was more character interaction/choice and consequence in this area. The ability to make friends or enemies of different students on different playthroughs would also have boosted replayability to ridiculous heights.-Broom/creature flying = fun. Lack of Quidditch = disappointing-Fantastic beasts system was fun, but a little much. It was at this point that I realized the game is getting stretched a little too thin.- Room of Requirement was good, but underutilized in terms of immersive options (see nitpick #2)- Puzzle system was a bit of a letdown. Merlin trials are all relatively easy and too numerous. This could have been a real Breath of the Wild type thing, but was instead very mediocre. The Depulso puzzle rooms were good, but there are only a couple of those. - Lacks a moral system but feels like it was intended to have one. There is no consequence for being 'evil' and the 'evil' dialogue options still feel like you're a relatively nice person. --- Allowing for more roleplayability in this area could have greatly benefited the game. You have very little choice in the type of character you play as. I would have liked to have had the option to ignore caring about pets for example. Obviously this type of system this would have taken a huge amnt of more work to implement, but that's kind of the point of this entire review. If this was a 'normal' game it would easily be a 10/10, but the expectations here, unfair or not, were much greater than that of a normal sized AAA game. It is for this reason that a sequel building off of this could easily be a masterpiece.Nitpicks1) Would have liked a buildup/cool-down for basic cast attack to make it a tad more challenging2) You can't sleep in beds, sit in chairs, etc. Pointless? yes. Immersive? (in an already well build immersive setting) yes. Little things like this go a long way imo.3) Can't fly a broom through/ take off from certain areas for seemingly no reason.4) Lockpick minigame is extremely simple (and also makes no sense, as you're casting a spell) removing it completely would be a +5) breaking in to steal money and clothes from everyone's houses was a weird way to build that system. Would have preferred a more immersive system in that regard.6) Witcher 1 cutscene style dialogue was annoying. Would have liked something more modern where time continues around you and the camera stays in your perspective.7) FOV too low for comfort. Also can't zoom the 3rd person camera back as much as I would have liked.8) Almost not a nitpick. Revelio pages could have probably been implemented a little better. (i.e. not having to cast revelio every 5 seconds) I get the scavenger hunt thing, but you just get fatigued after a while knowing that you're probably missing pages if you're not spamming it.9) Don't really care about bugs/glitches too much as none of them are game breaking and they'll probably be patched eventually. but some oversights (particularly character lines when you enter/exit Hogsmeade (acts like you're entering even when you are leaving) are quite annoying.The End. (I probably missed some things)
