For every dollar paid, I need to play 1 hour and it didn't rendered what I expected. After 27 hours in game, I finished the principal quest and the 3 majors secondary quests. Needless to say I also collected all the creatures, did my share of side quests but 27 hours? I'm a bit disappointed. I can't give a good review because the game was way too short for me to enjoy completely the money I put in it. Still a beautiful game but I wouldn't recommend it if you expect to play it as much as RDR3 or other open worlds . I'm kind of sad it's over but I'm not thrilled anymore having to find a lost canvas or sneaking in a teacher's office for a potion component.

author: βων random
review: TL/DR: boring, uninspired, offensive, but pretty and has some nice music score. Not worth full price, get with a 50% discount and drop it once you're bored with it. Performs like crap too.This game must be one of the most disappointing games I have ever played. On the surface it is great: huge beautiful world, a lot of abilities, and an insane amount of side activities. But aside from quite competent combat, stunning looks and an incredible score, it doesn't really offer much.The characters are bland, the story is boring and side activities are... well openworld side activities, you get the drill. There are only a couple of side quests that are kinda curious, and that's about it. Worldbuilding was bad in the source material, but they did absolutely nothing about it. It sucks here as well. Don't expect rules to be consistent or world to be coherent.I should also mention that this game is how you not make a diverse character cast. They are so uninspired that only things you end up kinda recognise them for are their accents. It ends up being a mockery of racial stereotypes. I never cared about diversity in videogames, but somehow this game has managed to rub even me the wrong way. Ask someone who's into politics about how offensive some of the themes in the game. They will tell you about it better than I ever will.Oh, and padding, so much padding. This game WANTS you to spend dozens of hours playing it, so you get $60 worth of gameplay. Honestly? Not worth it. Every Assassin's Creed game I've played had more going for it than this... thing.Oh, and the performance is incredibly inconsistent. It was fluctuating between 15 and over 60 fps throughout the game, and setting everything to lowest possible value did not really help.

author: [BNS]  RaNDoM(PReCiSioN)
review: I have to start this review with the cliche but honest statement that I don't like or follow the Harry Potter series of films and books. That was more of a fascination for my kids at the time :)I didn't even consider buying this game until a day or so before it released. I'm glad I did.Referring to the visuals in this game as great graphics is not really telling you anything. What it delivers, graphically, is art. Everywhere you go, be that in Hogwarts grounds or out in the world beyond, if you stop for a moment and just look around, you'll see or witness something new. I've been playing on/off for around 30 hrs and still loving the quantity and variety of assets in this wonderful game.The gameplay and controls are really intuitive to pick up. I'm typically your classic mouse/keyboard player in most other games of this genre, but for this title, I feel just as comfortable using the gamepad. The story is very well scripted as you'd expect for a AAA release. The main story and side missions work quite well in tandem, so you can't simply rush the story to complete it, then do all the sides as some are intergral to the main story.  This is all on the premise you're there as a student and you have classes to attend, in between extra-curricular mayhem :DAll in a great experience so far and would say if you're on the fence because its a "potter" game, ignore that thought. Worth the money & hands down prettiest game in my collection so far.

review: Gotta recommend this one, I had a blast playing it. Relationships build nicely. The transmog system is simple and gratifying. Also, kept ~100-144 FPS on a Ryzen 5950X + Nvidia 3080 12GB. author: stmisabella
review: When it realeased, I couldnt wait to play and explore Hogwarts' World. Dont be fooled, it is a nice game, but it is incredibly limited. They missed out on so many opportunities for side quests. After a while it becomes so boring that it is painful to play.I know, i know, a game is supposed to end.  But I feel like they didn't really exploit the world they created.Sebastian's character could have been so much more! The whole storyline with his sister could have gone to so many other directions. And so on!I am a little disappointed by what was offered, I'd still recommend to play though.

author: YourEvilClone
review: Disclaimer: I never got into Harry Potter (♥♥♥♥♥ stole from Narnia anyways) - so no clue if this game is representative of the IP or not.Somewhat decent open world story rpg game.Combat is entertaining and getting new spells for carnage is a blast.Enemy variety is abysmal - Wolfs, Spiders, Turtles, Goblins, Trolls, Humans, Zombies. That's it (yeah they come in reskin variations - but for such a high fantasy setting this is really disapointing).Lots of physic/logic based puzzles. Got the same vibes as from more open world-ish lego games (if you ever played one of those).Exploring Hogwards is fun - focus on development definitvly went there - the outside world is way less interesting.Story is okay, Voice acting too.Fun for 30-40hrs.Won't have much replayability though as this is one of those RPGs where non of your choices matters anyway and is just for fluff.IMHO not worth 60 bugs.

author: rivi
review: Probably one of the best games I have played. It is so rich with lore, with every single corridor in Hogwarts offering something — from talking paintings, to puzzles, to NPC dialogue, to fun activities, to seeing a suit of armour get so annoyed at his humming colleague, he progressively turns from grunting, to arm punching, to wielding his axe and turning him into crumpled tin. It's full of things to do. I get lost in finishing collectables because they are fun to do and offer rewards. Simply explore, open chests, finish a puzzle, and you earn more EXP than smashing your way through a camp of goblins with an armoured troll to contend with. The Room of Requirement is fantastic to decorate, ever expanding. Breeding monsters is just so much fun. YOU GET TO PET THEM. Feed them. Brush them. Races on the back of a broom are fun, side quests are interesting. The makers of this game have gone above and beyond with their attention to detail, and flatly, I am 50+ hours in right now, no where near finished with so much to do, it's a joy to slap it on and swish about with my wand, being Hufflepuff as my childhood deserves. For me, it's a 10/10. One of my favourite games and one I'll treasure forever.

author: Anargo
review: tl;dr; 9/10 - do not regret buying and playingPositives: 1. Lots of content.2. The open-world you'd expect from a decent single-player game with many travel systems in place to make getting around simple and fast.3. Experienced almost no bugs (none game breaking)4. A fun combat system with many hidden features to do large amounts of damage (either chunking a large amount of health if not 1-shotting them).Negatives: 1. Linear gearing and talent system makes for a experience that will be quite redundant thus hurting replayability. You get enough talents to learn most but not all talents which is a little vexing. Later on in the game you can modify your gear with a trait to empower an ability or group of abilities... this makes it better but still too linear... imo2. Puzzles seemingly are too simple. I understand some should be easy, but I would hope that there was at least a few challenging ones. Perhaps I haven't encountered them yet?

author: Dumflex/Sugad
review: I have zero interest in Harry Potter books, movies or the franchise as a whole. Found the hype to be unwanted and certainly aimed at a very young demographic. When the developers released footage of the game, again I had little to no interest in it due to my previous experience with the franchise. #how wrong was I. The games very very good, great main story line and side quest chains, exceptional open world with seasonal changes as story progression occurs. Array of enemies to defeat with named sub bosses located around the map. Hidden areas and secrets to find. Overall a very enjoyable experience, regardless whether you are interested in the subject matter or not.My only gripes are the hidden base you received which you can upgrade gear or create loot box style gear and profession items. It just felt like this wasn't thought through well enough and legendary gear is so easily dropped by chests it felt unrewarding when receiving them. This whole area could of done with a better induction into the main game as it felt like a secondary thought to make filler and can almost be skipped if it wasn't for a main quest tie in. Great game, enjoyed every moment. Would recommend.

author: Nain
review: The best way to describe this game would be bad / boring gameplay & story carried by the fact it's Harry Potter.One of the biggest issues with this game is the lack of variation with all the houses and main characters where it's the exact same gameplay regardless of changes. The custom naming feature also seems like a cop out by the developers to ensure people don't hate the main character. The game also falls for the same trope the movies and books take where it's almost exclusively the Gryffindor and Slytherin good versus bad trope with little or no inclusion of the other houses. Most of the open world is repetitive with no development over the course of the game and the map is strangely split in two with no explanation why the last part of the game basically only occurs on the second half. Despite what people keep saying I had no issues with running this game with zero crashes throughout the entire playthrough and pretty consistent FPS. The price of this game is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ with the stupid €10 extra to play the game early and it feels like there's going to be load of stupid €15 DLCs added in the future. Also ♥♥♥♥ J.K Rowling the stupid ♥♥♥♥♥ is a terrible person so far up her own ass she'll never change.

It had a lot of potential, getting me on the edge of my seat in some moments but the ending is completely predictable. Also, your decisions dont matter much and the path is clearly scripted other than your choice to learn the unforgivable curses-Buggy controls (but you get the hang of it eventually)-we need a companion system, that would make the side quests and challenges 1000% more interesting and immersivepros:There are so many but I shall only list a few as I am high whilst writing this-completely true to the actual wizarding lore-you finally get to choose your house instead of being a boring gryffindor-the world map is huge and so so SO BEAUTIFUL-THE GRAPHICS MWAH-interesting characters

author: LizabethRose
review: Beautiful game! You can tell there was a lot of love put into the game based on the attention to detail alone. There is so much content and it's all fun! I've never had so much fun playing another game for HOURS in one sitting. I have to tear myself away from it every time. I'm really impressed with it, especially in the world we're in now, where it seems just about every game is created for the profits and not for the passion. There are currently some bugs and glitches, but they're nothing compared to most games released these days and they can be patched out. They're minorly frustrating, but until they are patched, literally everything else makes up for them!

author: mack.hill122
review: This game is easily the best single-player game I've ever played. I was skeptical about the price at first since it's single-player and usually games like this is a one and done. However, Hogwarts Legacy is enjoyable no matter how many times you play it. There are so many things to do and explore. Calling it a masterpiece of a game doesn't even do it justice.

author: nanO.bytez
review: It's an exceptionally rare occurrence for me to finish a long game. I usually lose interest somewhere in the latter half of a game which most often can be attributed to issues with pacing.Hogwarts Legacy made me want to explore every nook and cranny of its world and uncover its secrets. It made me fall in love with the world of Harry Potter all over again in a way that no other entry to the Wizarding World since the original movies and books managed to do.Where Fantastic Beasts was a shameless scheme to push merchandise this game truly feels like a labour of love.There are problems - most of which are related to the main character and their lack of personality. This isn't a Commander Shepard or Geralt of Rivia but rather a They / Them [Enter House Name Here] who often comes across as rather bland in dialogues which is a problem of voiced nameless protagonists all throughout gaming.Limiting the player's choice during character creation and the sorting ceremony probably would have benefited the story. Yes, you can play as your ideal witch or wizard but that breadth of choice came at the cost of depth. No one ever uses the name of the main character which makes conversations feel a little awkward at times and they are exclusively referred to using the gender neutral they / them while the ability to choose join any of the four Hogwarts Houses means the relationship between the MC and the other students, including the three deeper "friendships" that can be formed remain incredibly shallow to the very end.Other than the MC there really isn't anything major for me to criticize. I didn't even have the huge performance issues that so many have reported despite my PC getting a little old in the tooth at this point.One more thing I will say however is that both navigating the world and combat feel a lot better using a controller rather than mouse and keyboard. This isn't to say that you can't play with mouse and keyboard, just that the UI was clearly designed for controllers. Trust me on this as someone who generally vastly prefers mouse and keyboard; just use an old 360 controller or whatever else old broom you can dig out of the closet. This game does not require mouse precision To conclude I can happily recommend the game. Already it's a personal contender for GOTY and it's not even March yet. In fact, I'd go as far as to say that this is probably one of the most captivating games I have played in my life. I haven't really touched any other game for almost three weeks. Most games can't retain my attention for more than a couple of days at a time.

author: QbertTheKiller
review: It's barely an RPG, but it is a really good open world sandbox in the hogwarts/harry potter world.  I played it with the attitude that it's an action adventure. There's a few minor choices you get to make but nothing that really changes up the story in any substantial way. There are no moral consequences other than maybe you can anger NPCs if you don't give them the quest items, and theyll grumble at you in passing.   You get gear but after a while I was just selecting the gear with the best stats and changing the appearance to the same outfit for the whole game.  good though. You get to romp around the wizard world and go adventuring. Combat is good, especially the kinetic stuff. I felt like I was playing force unleashed using those abilities. The dark arts are really powerful too.  No, there isn't any story consequence for using them. if you're a fan of harry potter and the movies and stuff youll probably spend hours in the castle, it's like an indoor city and I'm always getting lost if I don't have the tracking dots on the map.

author: Sara-Autumn
review: I'll be the first to admit that I am an absolute SUCKER for open world games. Skyrim, ESO, Valheim, and even Elden Ring, despite never playing a Souls game in my entire life, are the recents. I thrive off watching the achievements pop up, the closer to 100% I get, the more precious dopamine pumps through my veins. I'm 32 hours in to this gem of a game with tons more to go but I keep getting lost, getting distracted, getting *immersed* in this world. I haven't even touched the south half of the map. I'm looking forward to whatever is coming my way in the next 32 hours and then some. Despite the controversy, Avalanche did a fantastic job with this game and I commend them for it. Try it or don't, but I fully believe you'll be missing out on an experience that transcends the author of HP, and is exactly what the industry needed for 2023. An example has been set.

author: Ansil
review: Pretty good RPG. Broom flying feels amazing, main story is awesome and features various characters that aren't all likeable but are at least interesting if not. Side quests are a mixed bag of enjoyable ones with interesting story tidbits and typical rpg fetch quests. Exploring feels really good and there are lots of cool areas to explore over a decent sized map. Combat is fun and intuitive and crafting your own build with your choice of spells and talents feels rewarding. Endgame combat is not balanced especially with the cursed spells but is still fun and you feel like a powerful force of nature in the wizarding world.Overall this is a solid RPG with a great story and fun exploration. Im excited to see what they come up with for DLCs and expanded content.

author: Karvlok
review: Hogwarts Legacy is the single player RPG gamers have wanted for a very long time. There is a lot of depth to the storyline, it's not a sandbox to get bored of and yet it's not a railroad track with amusing set pieces to glance at on the way by. Love, passion and dedication went into the programming, writing and overall development of this game and you can breathe it in with every NPC interaction and visual blast of magic and thundering crash of a troll's club in the ground so close to your feet that your anus puckers.Given what I have and haven't done, I believe I could have finished the main storyline in about 30 hours, but I kept having too much fun exploring and seeking out colectibles and challenges (which is a rarity for me anymore). 80 hours with only 10 achievements and about 10 hours of scrounging left to do to collect everything and make sure my primary save is fully prepped for DLC is awesome and I cannot describe how much I truly think anyone would find at least 1 thing to fall in love with about this game, if not far more than that.● well fleshed out and interesting NPCs with convincing and human dialogue● engaging main story and optional quests● well designed combat with speed, accuracy and challenge● good balance between predictable enemies you can strategize for in fights and enough diversity to keep things interesting● giant map with lots of areas to explore● good customisation options● may get you in trouble with tumblerinas and twatterflies for streaming/playing● clipping issues that sometimes cause enemies and loot to spawn or fall through graphics● quests can be slow to update● still has some rendering issues during new area loads and cutscenes● may get you in trouble with tumblerinas and twatterflies for streaming/playing

review: This is the Hogwarts game of my HP-obsessed childhood. I spent 30 hours just exploring the school, grounds and Hogsmeade before really digging into the story to prolong the first (best?) playthrough. There are so many places where I see something that triggers an "OH! That must be X, Y, or Z mentioned in that throw-away line from [book]. I can't believe that they put that in!" moment. If you're avoiding it solely because of politics - congrats on missing out on this mountain of a game due to a molehill of controversy.

author: foob
review: OBS: Minor spoilers ahead. Personally, I would divide the game's main story into 4 quarters. The first half of the story was phenomenal. There was not a second I was bored. Constantly exploring hogwarts and its secrets. Doing main story mission revolving around going to classes, learning spells and interacting with other students. You could easily spend hours getting lost, as I did. However, around the third quarter is where things, (for me), start to go downhill. In my opinion, It may be the ratio of main quests to side quests. With so many side missions accessible at this time, the major objectives almost feel diluted. (Depending on how you play.)Contrarily, the fourth quarter is when things start to get interesting again. Avada Kadavra is taught to you during this quarter, and despite what everyone else says, it is actually "fun" to use. Paired with crucio it makes one hell of a combo. I did encounter a handfull of visual bugs: - The facial expression of an npc after a conversation would lack any form of emotion. As the face would transfom from talkative to being stern.  - Articles of clothing not being where they are supposed to be. This would normally be the robe glitching.  - The player model glitching. For exemple, the hands would stretch in a linear pattern towards a singular point when performing swift dash.  - Weird lighting on the snidget eggs. They would appear to have a square pattern repeating itself on the top half of the eggs.   - Both the save symbol and the field guide displayed the same type of bug. The lighting on the field guide's  "main-page" has the symbol of the animal of your corresponding house. (I think). This lighting would glitch out and in a square outline, randomly display bits and pieces of this lighting. Although it was now very distorted. The save symbol would behave in a similar fashion.Furthermore, throughout the game I also experienced significant performance drops. Overall I would rate this 8.5 / 10.

author: RegisOfCorvoBianco
review: This game is an achievement in design and detail. You FEEL like you are in the wizarding world. There are so many hidden details, easter eggs and quests hidden all across the huge map that make you want to explore every nook and cranny! I just finished it (almost) and have to say, I haven't had this much fun with an RPG in a long, long time.The side characters you meet have depth and development. Sebastian's questline was my favourite.Gameplay, Music, Worldbuilding, Graphics, and Lore, everything has been nailed here. The story is the only weaker part about the game but it is still a respectable 8/10 for me. Overall, the game is a 9.5/10 from me. They couldn't have done it better except the story. Definitely worth playing since it made me feel my money was well spent.

author: cartoonboy24
review: My girlfriend and I have played this game almost every night since it came out. Which is great because she's not really a gamer and there's not a lot of games we can play together. There's enough exploration, mini games and side stuff for her to enjoy and I enjoy the combat. I'm used to games like dark souls and bloodborne so the combat is a bit easy by comparison but It's fun enough to keep me interested and wanting more. On that note I wish there were more combat opportunities. They seem a bit sparse. And you're given so many spells and items to aid in combat but I rarely use most of them because it's pretty easy to succeed with just parrying and basic attacks. It's also pretty fun just watching my girlfriend play and enjoy the world. The devs did a great job making a beautiful Hogwarts world and I'd recommend this game to any Harry Potter fans that like rpgs.

author: TitsOfWar
review: After over 50 hours of gameplay, and starting 3 different characters, I can confirm that Hogwarts legacy does indeed make you A WIZZZZZARRRRRDD!!!!Firstly, this game isn't as much an RPG as it would like to think. While the game succeeds in giving the illusion of choice, dialogue decisions shape your character more than anything in the plot. I was a little disappointed by this, but honestly i soon forgot about it because i still got to be a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ WIZARD!!!!! The story starts off really strong, with amazing visuals, puzzles and intriguing dialogue. Unfortunately, as the game progresses, the story starts to fall off more and more, becoming predictable, filled with lazy dialogue, and lower quality visuals with less climactic moments. It also feels as if it concludes too quickly compared to the almost 10 hour intro tutorial filled with scripted events. I'd rate the story around 7/10, filled with some amazing moments, and some that fall very short. The voice acting is phenomenal, and the male character sounds like daniel radcliffe, so coming from the movies into this felt like the perfect transition.The world of Hogwarts legacy is filled with tons of easter eggs and magical details. The world feels full and alive, aside from your inability to directly interact with students unless scripted.  It's thoroughly fun and immersive to just fly around, search building , caves, and complete side quests for every tidbit of story or cool animations.The gameplay is simple yet complicated. It's an easily accessible entry for new gamers while still providing more than enough for the hardcore gamer to sink their teeth into. It constantly progresses as you unlock new spells and talents, keeping combat fresh and allowing you to create your own destructive spell combos. The game lets you go full Fantastic beasts, capturing creatures, breading and building environments for them to play in, it's like a little animal crossing in hogwarts. The mounts are so very fun, although initially tricky to control. I'd spend ages gliding around instead of fast travelling, because it's just that fun and immersive.Overall, this was one of the most enjoyable gaming experiences I've ever had. Were the story given a bit more time, it would sit among the likes of games like Arkham City and Spiderman ps4, but as a Wizard sim, it succeeds in every way. 8.5/10- You're a wizard!!!!

author: Panophobia
review: The combat is really fun in this game. They managed to make the wand combat of the Wizarding World fun, fast paced and cinematic looking. The spells are lore friendly and fun to use, and you can make some pretty interesting combos and really satisfiying fatalities. The blood and stuff is censored, but the way you can execute enemies, is way worse then Avada Kedavra. So the name of the game should be, Mortal Combast XVII: The Legacy of Hogwarts instead.The main issue here is the amount of spell slots. You have to constantly change between spell sets, for the 4 avalible hotkeys you get, and you do not get enough spell sets, to use all spells, so you have to rearrange them constantly. This is extremly annoying, epsecially on PC. It would not have been much effort, to make a PC UI, but obvioulsy they favor the console players.The game world especially the Hogwarts Castle itself is filled with side quests, puzzles, secrets lot of opportunities to learn about the Wizarding World lore and stuff to explore. It makes the time you spend in the game world rewarding and fun.Sadly this can't be said about the enemies. There are only a limited types of enemies, which makes combat encounters, boring and repetitive after a while.The Room of Requirements basebuilding and creature collecting is a really great thing. Though it feels like, there are a lot of stuff, that they cut from it. So right now, it only exists as a timesink and ingredient farming place.The game looks amazing. The detail of the game world, especially the design of the Hogwarts castle shows how much care the team did in designing and building it up. They even payed attention to stuff on the designs, that only lore nerds and history nerds would find.Th music, the enviromental sounds are just exceptional. They also found great voice actors for even some background characters expect... well you know who. That charaters voice actor sounds so bore with his role, like they just dragged in a junior dev to a studio, before he drank his morning coffe to record some lines.The game has a godd story. Bit short, choosen one MC story. Fun to play trough, but what it misses is provided us by other parts of the experience.The side stories are also nice, but nothing extremly great about them.The biggest problem here, in my opinion, is that we do not experience much from the school life. No school events, and only a few classes. I did not expect a school life simulator, since i payed attention to what the devs promised, but still expected a bit more.Sadly, this is where the game falls flat. Most characters are just 1D personalities, and we do not spend much time with them, to actually know them better, like how we do that in other games.This is one of the big negatives to the game.The NPC-s are really static in the game. And at night they just disappear. If you look around, beds are empty, NPC-s are nowhere to be found. I expected more, since even Skyrim, 12 years ago, was able to make NPC-s do stuff and have some daily schedules.There is not much. No big decisions and only 1 quest difference between the different houses.Hoigwarts Legacy managed to live up fro a hype and become and amazing game. It has it's issues, there are a lot of parts where you can feel they cut content, and you can feel some level of caution in every part, thanks to the idiotic twitter boycott. But other than that, as i already said it is an amazing game, especially to a Harry Potter fan.

author: GagaGugu
review: + :Always been an Open-world adventure girl, and I've been obsessed with the Harry Potter franchise since I was a kid. This is honestly the BEST of both worlds.The Map is HUGE and there is so much to do beside the Main Story quests, with the Merlin trials, ancient magic hotspots, the numerous animal dens, Goblin/Poacher/Ashwinder camps, astronomy tables, etc. And, of course, the side-quests!- :There ARE some very annoying bugs, like disappearing locks on cages (if you unlocked them too early in the game) and I had to restart the last part of the 'Snidget' quest because the last cutscene wouldn't trigger (ran around for about 10 minutes trying to figure out how to continue lol).The character customization is good, but not amazing.All in all, amazing graphics, so much gameplay, since you have some different missions per house and you have the choice to be 'good' or 'evil', some annoying, but fixable, bugs and honestly a very engaging story.

author: Talnot
review: A good game but not flawless.On the plus side, combat feels like Arkham Asylum - a lot of counters, dodges and fluid feel to it. Flying feels great and can be used in most outdoor areas. Looks great, even on lower settings. Good (but not perfect) transmog system.On the negative, the voice acting for several characters, including the male protagonist is terrible! Very flat, sometimes has a weird tinny noise as if it was recorded on an iPhone and the male protagonist sounds far too much like Daniel Radcliff! The exploration can get repetitive, as can the diaglog lines that go off when you get near a place or item. Like a lot of open world games, there is tonnes of things to do but there are only about ten things which are repeated over and over.Overall, a 7/10.

author: Decree
review: TL;DR: Amazing immersive game, if you like a fantasy world setting then you should play it, even if you're not a fan of HP stuff.Great game, lots of good things done right and that's why I'm leaving a positive review. However, I'm gonna focus and start with the cons:- The game has a huge FPS drops and stuttering (I'm using a high end GPU) in some parts of the world, this started to be noticeable during the winter season so it might have been the reason, also the game crashed twice on me, but it has an auto save so not a big deal.- Second issue is, a lot of the mechanics and animations in this game get repetitive over time, like picking locks and doing Merlin puzzles was nice for a while but having to wait for the animation every single time is tiring and boring, and yes a large part of this was felt when I was 100%ing the game but I felt this way earlier too.- Another mechanic that felt useless literally the second you get it is potion making, you never run out of potions and never need to use them at all, same with the plants. - Speaking of useless mechanics, even money/coins gets obsolete at like mid to late game which makes you not really being rewarded for exploring and picking up armor to sell.- SELLING GEAR SEPARATELY every single time is tedious af, and you can only carry 20 at a time while wearing 6 pieces of those, so you gotta take a turn to the shop every time and sell one by one... Please add the option to sell them all, it will make it much better, especially when you're doing a good job by not displaying the currently used gear. And yes I know you can increase it to 40 by endgame but that's still nothing, in fact 40 should be the starting capacity if not more.- Game is waaaay too easy, but I guess this is to be expected.- Enemy variety leaves much to be desired.- For some reason, you can't pause the cutscenes which is annoying since sometimes I have to. Anyway, it might seem that I'm just whining since I'm only focusing on negatives, but that's not the case, I really enjoyed the game a lot, exploring Hogwarts and Hogsmeade for the first time was such a joy and a fun experience, flying is well done, the characters are fun to listen to and the dialogue is good, most of the quests and lore are cool and it made me read a lot even tho I'm not a lore guy.Overall, definitely play this game.

author: Phoochie
review: I can't really say anything bad about this game as it really throws you in to the world as who ever you choose to be following a well thought out story. The combat is fluid and and feels fairly natural and also provides a few combination spells that can deal out a large amount of damage once you learn them. You are not pinned down on what school you choose but it is still enjoyable to give the sorting hat an honest set of answers to see where you stand in the wizarding world of Hogwarts. The map is actually a decent size.If you're not much of an explorer at heart this game might seem tedious at times.One small complaint i did have was that each school was very cordial with each other and had no sense of rivalry between each house making it seem more competitive.All in all worth the money.

author: Enigma_z9
review: I only wrote one other review for a game before but really wanted give my impressions of the game. First off, I am not a die hard Potterhead, never read the books, but loved every movie they made.  If you are a HP fan of either the books or movies, I think you will easily get lost in this game. The devs really caught the magic(no pun intended) of the universe JKR created. I only encountered 2 or 3 bugs in over 200 hours of gp, and it ran really good on my Nvidia GTX 1650 card with most settings on high some on ultra. I got so sucked into game from the opening sequence and never looked back, played the game to the end while being in house Slytherin, and when I finished, I started a new game immediately, House Gryffindor, and did not get bored.      The magic combat is great, learning how to use the different spells to break down defensed and then go on the attack made it feel like you were in the movie fighting against other wizards and witches. The room of requirement was awesome and how it changes based off of what you require was totally unexpected. I normally dont ever go after collectibles in games because I always felt it was just a waste and all you got was some stupid achievement that did nothing for you in game. This was the first game where I actually chased after the challenges because you were rewarded with either gear or upgrades. As you fly around on your broom, you are always getting side tracked onto something else. The customization of your character was pretty cool, if you dont like the way a more powerful piece of gear looks, you can keep the appearance of a piece of gear that you like instead. Seeing all the strange creatures and how they tie into the story line added to the ambiance of the world.      Now for some negative remarks but not much, I was disappointed that there was not some type of morality meter, so that if you go down the path of a dark wizard, it should have affected the story line with consequences. The customization of your character, again was great but it was a little too much too fast, I think the better gear should have been more rare. Also, I wish there were larger encampments in the open world with more enemies just because I liked the combat.  I know there seems to be a lot of negative reviews on the discussion page, but if you didnt fall for the hype trap and you go into as a Harry Potter fan, I think you will love the game. I have to give this game a 10/10 for the simple fact that I actually started a new game right after finishing it the first time and played it right to the end again.

So its definetely managable with some effort. Looking forward to see what else this game has in store.In all honestly, its probably the better game release I have seen in years, but that is thanks to alot of these week 1 mods, so grats to the modders for that. But the devs have built an amazing world.

author: OG_Horsechuck
review: Great AAA. Similar to Witcher 3 which is a class of it's own. If you like games like Witcher III Wild Hunt, Horizon 0 Dawn or Red DEad Redemption 2 - you will feel like home here. If you like Harry Potter Universe and skillful games - this one is for you too. You can go through using some simple spells but if you want to delve into switching cast sets and queueing combos - you're gonna enjoy it. I really recommend the game so easy to spend lots of time in. Just learn some tips for a start (for example to push main story until... minor spoilers). So decide if you want to maximize the output because there are clever ways to make the game a lot easier and enjoyable. Just prioritising certain tasks. Good luck have fun! <3

author: Lowbudget_Soup
review: Is it neat? Yes I think I would enjoy it more if I were younger. A good chunk of the exploration quests seem to be focused around puzzles and that's not really my jam. I don't particularly care for the dialog either. The NPCs seem pretty long winded in their conversations. The game is lacking in moral choices too, as i feel there isn't a lot of nuance in perspective and that may just be a limitation of having a voiced player character. Granted I sunk about 10 hours into the game to try it and In that time I wasn't impressed by any of the quests or NPCsI think the strongest point that the game has is in its exploration and combat. It's legitimately cool to fly around the castle on a broom and find hidden secrets around Hogwarts. The combat feels pretty awesome especially once you unlock new spells but it feels like they're drip fed to you and in the 10 hours I played there just wasn't enough duels to satisfy that need. Honestly I feel like Hogwarts Legacy is most like a Legend of Zelda type game and It's just not my cup of tea.

author: Bismarck
review: Game is an absolute gem, but unfortunately has some little points that require further polishing.Pros:-The Map is big and full of easter eggs and references, giving Potter Fans something to smile about. -Hogwarts Castle itself is perfect, it is really fun to just explore the castle and find places featured in the movies. -Combat is really fun and easy to get into and the game itself offers good tutorials on how to fight properly. -Since it plays in a different time than the Harry Potter or Fantastic Beasts series, one does not need to invest in the franchise to have fun with this game. -The Side Quests, especially for the close friends are really good, but outshine the main story unfortunately. -Can pet cats. -You can do side tasks and have a customizable (to a degree) base and hub. -You have a vast selection of clothing that you can wear, even changing the appearance of equipped gear, so you can have both fashion and good stats. -Voice acting in english is really great, the characters feel alive and natural. Cons:-Runs a bit rough, but has gotten a little better with the patches. -Main Story is less interesting than character storylines, but still not bad. -The amount of collectibles on the map is a little too much for my taste and some (achievement relevant) tasks are not tracked on the map. (Take this with a grain of salt, as I tend to miss stuff if it isn't in my face)All in all I rate it 9/10, fantastic game.

author: kjjkjh
review: If you like Hogwarts and the Harry Potter universe this game is worth playing and you'll enjoy it but if you're not playing it for the Harry Potter universe and just as a magic open world exploration story based game it's pretty bland in my opinion. Nothing offensive and bad just super mid and doesn't really bother to do anything new or innovative. The main story is fine (from what I've played) and the side quests are normally just go here and pickup 5 gumbleflumps or something then give it to the person or you can just choose to not give it back as some like half assed attempt at allowing you to be evil or something. I leaned towards not giving the stuff back because it was at least slightly more interesting than it being a barebones mmorpg fetch quest. Again this quest design isn't bad per say but super bland and uninspired.I chose to play on Hard and the combat is ridiculously easy. You have a dodge which pretty much works against anything and a block spell which only works against some attacks and allows you to follow up with a stun. The combat boils down to having damaging spells on 1,2,3,4 so you dodge left click 4 times and then press 1,2,3,4 dodge and repeat. Against non-tanky enemies you have spells that allow you to push, pull and generally manipulate enemies in various ways but it's kinda worthless when you get an indicator that tells you when to dodge so controlling your enemies and environment isn't important since you have spider sense and can see attacks coming from all directions constantly. Sometimes enemies will have shield but its just a colour matching game then back to pressing damage abilities. I actually think playing on a easier difficulty would be more fun since all hard does is make enemies super tanky and just extends fights with no extra challenge. Lastly, you have an ancient magic bar which lets you do a big attack that insta kills weaker enemies and massively damages stronger ones. Credit where credit is due I do like the animations on these attacks because it actually feels like your casting strong spells and not pew pew pew spells. I also think the developers have done well adapting what they could into a game because ranged magic is hard to make fun and the Harry Potter world was never written with a game in mind so adapting the magic system I imagine was a challenge for the developers.Overall, I think Hogwarts Legacy is worth playing if you're a Harry Potter fan but if you're not wait till a sale because I cannot recommend it at full price.

author: Swash
review: This is the first triple-A game I've liked on release in years and surpassed my expectation. CoD, OW2, Fallout 76, BF2, the futuristic dystopia that shall not be named; They were all a bug-filled bag of empty promises on launch and some of them still are. They've set the bar so low, this game seems almost godlike.The game is pretty much Witcher 3 with simpler mechanics. Keep in mind throughout this review, I have played thus far on hard difficulty. I only use healing with bosses or new enemies. I loved The Witcher 3, but was never able to finish it. The time investment required for researching hunts was always more than my attention span could take...eventually. This game doesn't have that problem. As soon as you run into an enemy a guide will update and you can view it if you're struggling. I advise taking on every new enemy blind and seeing what happens.The combat is fun and you can get creative with it. It's like Assassin's creed if there was never a skill ceiling. You have a plethora of spells, you can have 4 queued at a time and simply switch to a new 4 (4 total groups) like switching a weapon in a shooter. There is a crazy amount of combination attack potential for a most different combinations of spells. It's a lot of fun figuring out new combinations, or if you want take some they teach you and use them the entire game.The part of this game I probably like most is how fleshed out everything is. Every task you're introduced to feels like it contributes to your overall success in the game. I practiced dueling and flying over and over because it was tricky at first, and I could have gotten in by just spamming but that route felt like I'd be cheating myself the rest of the game. The game has tons of content and all that I've found so far are an enriching experience, no throwaway or filler quest. Everything is meant to be fun and not just take up time. As soon as you start to get bored of one mechanic on task type the game seems to offer you plenty else to do. I played this game for several hours this weekend and didn't get bored one time. This game makes me feel like I have a lot of control over my own experience via my skill despite having a guided story (with some variations).Now at this point, I feel a should mention some faults I've found. None of these take away from the game they are just adjustments I believe could improve the game. The first thing I noticed is the pacing was odd for me. I found it difficult to balance when I should be doing Main Quest and when I should be doing Side Quest. You unlock spells, mechanics, and items as you play both. I found myself wishing I had gotten a spell before heading into a mission to pull off fun combos with the enemy. Maybe the developers could add a hint section with the quest for what spells might come in handy.This game peeks the imagination in most components, but I do think the dialogue could use more options. As of now, you are limited to mainly Good, evil, and sometimes extort. I would really like the addition of a to make a joke, flirt, or remain silent. Some options to develop my character for the RP element.This game is very politically correct. They have several nationalities and are LGTBQ influenced. I find it can be a bit rough on immersion. No random sample would be this rounded in the ways people choose to categorize each other. I also think they made it very black and white, which has the opposite effect. It's like being able to walk up on the street to someone, share one sentence, and being able to confirm that person is an asexual Nigerian. I feel like they are pushing stereotypes in an effort to normalize prejudice. This could be a much more subtle experience If handled more delicately. Maybe have some interactions with a character first before they blirt out all this personal information I'm not concerned with. How does your nationality or sexuality help me collect flowers for my potion? Why does my character care? Most prejudice in this world seems to be about species or blood ties. Another small thing is I and many others missed the mechanic at first; where you could change the appearance of your items to other items you've collected. I thought the game was forcing me to dress based on what I found for at least an hour. Maybe draw more attention to this at the beginning of the game. Another addition I'd recommend is the ability to equip and save custom clothing sets. I like to change my characters clothes based on where I am and it can be time consuming after a while.Lastly, the biggest fault I've found in this game is the audible hints. If you struggle even a little on a puzzle your character will automatically throw you a hint. If you take too long he will actually just tell you the answer. I actually turn my dialogue off when I'm solving puzzles so my character doesn't solve it for more. I enjoy challenging puzzles. Don't give me hints or tell me the answer unless I ask otherwise you just ruined that puzzle. You waste my time and yours If I don't get an opportunity to figure it out for myself and learn from the experience. The time before hints are nearly immediate and the hints go on repeat until the solution dialogue comes up. It would be nice to have the option to turn this off so I don't have to mute myself. The entire game is built around honing skills, don't leave puzzling out.In conclusion, the game looks great, plays great, is fun, has tons of content, and is well worth the money.

author: Arncil
review: Hogwarts Legacy is an exciting action-adventure game set in the magical world of Harry Potter. The game offers an immersive experience that allows players to explore the vast Hogwarts Castle, interact with various characters, and participate in thrilling quests.The characters in the game are well developed and add depth to the storyline, which is both engaging and entertaining. I found myself invested in the plot and eagerly anticipating the next chapter of the adventure.Unfortunately, the game was plagued with numerous bugs and glitches that detracted from the overall experience. It was clear that the game was not adequately tested, and many issues could have been avoided with more thorough optimization.Despite enjoying the game, the frustration of encountering so many bugs took away from my enjoyment. In particular, I was disappointed that I could not obtain the Collector's Edition achievement due to a bug that prevented me from completing a particular quest.Overall, I believe that Hogwarts Legacy has the potential to be an excellent game, but it was released prematurely without adequate testing and optimization. Despite its flaws, the game's engaging characters and storyline make it worth playing for fans of the Harry Potter universe.

author: Sicsen
review: As a trans guy, I've been loving this game. I'm honestly mortified by the way some people in the LGBT community are attacking others about playing this game, and it makes me embarrassed and ashamed to be lumped in with them.Let people play what they want to play. To the people saying that the game is actively causing harm to trans people... relax. I don't need people to protest on my behalf, especially in such a toxic way. This game is literally just pennies to JK Rowling. There are Harry Potter theme parks, for Christ's sake! If the woman never got another dime again, she'd still be set for life. Where is this energy when it comes to the countless big brands with unethical practices? Coke is the leading polluter of the environment, Nike has been charged with employing underage labor, Amazon workers hardly even get bathroom breaks... the list goes on. And yet they all stay in business because there is no ethical consumption under capitalism. So, sending death threats to people who just want to play this game is absurd.Controversy aside, I've been loving the game. Sure, I don't agree with JK Rowling's beliefs, but Harry Potter was my childhood. I grew up reading all the books and watching all the movies, constantly imagining what it would be like to go to Hogwarts. This game is my childhood dream come true. It's honestly way better than I had hoped, and I'm already looking forward to future DLC or maybe even a sequel. It's a shame that JK Rowling ended up being an intolerable wench, but you can't deny that the Harry Potter world is majestic, and the game does a great job of showing it.

author: RiftSquid
review: This game bleeds personality. Seriously, from a studio who's last game was cars (yes the pixar cars) this is brilliant. The game isn't perfect. Expect jank. But expect a great time while you experience that jank. If you love harry potter and games like red dead redemption, You will enjoy Hogwarts Legacy.Graphics: 9/10 sometimes shadows are glitchy and ugly on moving plants.gameplay: 8/10 tons of puzzles, lots to do, fun combat with tons of spells, but can get repetative.story: 10/10 feels like watching a prequel to the philosopher's stone. excellent voice acting.summary: If you've been dissapointed by the lackluster releases that plague us as gamers lately, this will be a  breath of fresh air.

author: Zalda
review: Hogwarts Legacy, a visually stunning game that captures the magic of the wizarding world, is an impressive display of artistry. The art team deserves big kudos for the stunning visuals that make the game look beyond beautiful. From the intricately designed Hogwarts Castle to the spellbinding environments, the attention to detail is phenomenal.However, the same cannot be said about the game's storyline, which falls short of expectations. It lacks depth and fails to engage the player. The missions are repetitive, offering little variety, and the side missions are lackluster, seemingly thrown in for the sake of being there without providing any real challenge.Despite the game's shortcomings, it is undeniable that the art and music teams have done a fantastic job in creating a captivating world. The music, composed by a team of skilled musicians, perfectly complements the visuals and adds to the immersive experience.In conclusion, Hogwarts Legacy is a game that looks beautiful but lacks substance. While the art team has done an excellent job in creating a visually stunning world, the repetitive missions and uninspiring storyline are a letdown. Nonetheless, fans of the wizarding world will still enjoy the experience of exploring Hogwarts and interacting with the magical creatures that inhabit it.

author: Taylorrae
review: For me, there's not much else to say apart from that this game is pretty fun to play and I think that's enough for most of the Harry Potter fans out there that have an interest in this game as there's not enough decent Harry Potter and wizard games out there in general anyways.There are a few areas that I think the game strongly lacks in such as mob variety. The mob variety in this game is very, very bad. The game would feel a lot more exciting if there were different mobs (not just different versions of the same mob that essentially all do the same thing) and random bosses to fight around the map when you go exploring because at the end of it you're still fighting the same mobs you fought when you started the game. I know that Elden Ring is not really comparable to Hogwarts Legacy but I do think of Elden Ring, Sekiro and basically the entire Dark Souls series as a prime example of a game having great mob variety.In my opinion, I believe that the story was okay, the quests were good and Sebastian's questline was great but the plot almost fell flat at the end and felt like it got lost somewhere. I won't spoil anything but I will say that I wish that they tried to make some things make more sense because it felt like some of the things that happened, happened "just because" or they happened because they didn't know how to tie the end together. It was very "meh" for me but maybe I just didn't understand that part very well.The gearing system felt quite boring and it feels like you don't really need to change your gear that much since mobs and bosses don't feel that difficult, even on hard mode. There was probably one boss where it felt like the gear did matter and it did make things easier but most of the time, you just have to be good at dodging and reflecting attacks but with that said the gear appearances and the outfits you can make are truly unique and, again, aesthetically pleasing. This game, for sure, does not fail at appearances.Character creation in the game was great but there's a few things that I wish to be fixed and it's the character's voice pitch. It seems that if you move the slider anywhere that's not the default pitch, they sound like a robot. Siri, for that matter but that's definitely not the end of the world. The character's facial animations seem a bit stiff depending on what face you choose when you're creating your character (a few faces go quite well with the facial expressions), I mean, the animations are not bad at all but I feel like they could be improved. Perhaps a mod will be brought out to improve these two things.Hopefully they keep adding new things and plan to make DLCs and expansions in the future because this game and the world that it's set in has so much more potential and it definitely has the ability to be greater than what it is right now.Overall, I did enjoy playing the game and the combat, for me, felt pretty good, the interactions between spells was good and it's definitely a unique playing experience fighting with a wand and flying about on broomsticks and mythical creatures, exploring the world which is, again, aesthetically pleasing to look at- really pretty world. It's probably one of the best wizard combat games out there right now and the graphics are absolutely amazing, the castle is breathtaking and the moving / talking paintings are just great to see whilst you're exploring the grounds.In short, good game but could do with adding to the mob variety. Hopeful that they will release new content through updates, DLCs and other expansions.

review: This is a beautiful game, no question about it. And the world you traverse in has a lot of stuff to do in it and lots of puzzles, though it can get a little repetitive.The story itself is.. alright. Though lacks a bit of an emotional investment in my opinion. The things that happen never really feels like it has much of a personal effect on your character, other than sensations of wonder which are aplenty. If you expect to go on an emotional journey such as in games like Last of Us, Red dead redemption 1/2 and God of War, you will get disappointed.There are one or two features they tease us about in-game but never gives us, which feels a little disappointing. I can understand they probably ran out of time/budget for it, but still...Is the game worth it, even at full price? Yes I would definitely say so. Though you might want a powerful computer.

That being said, I absolutely ADORE the game. The main story line is a little bland, but picked up interest towards the end (for me at least.) However I found love in the side missions and the companions that you get from each house (Sebastian, Poppy, Nat and Amit.) The game has several bugs and things that DESPERATELY need to be fixed. There's a quest to rescue a beast and I cannot unlock the cage since I cleared the camp beforehand and unlocked it, not knowing it would break the quest and rendering it impossible to complete. Other than the little things, I highly recommend and would purchase DLC or a second game happily. BUT ONLY IF THERE'S MORE OMINIS GAUNT <3

author: Sinlash
review: So after 90 hours and 100% completion here is my review. Hogwarts legacy does an unbelievable job at creating a breath taking world to explore, so many small details added to hogwarts/hogsmeade really makes this a great game to explore for anyone who enjoys the Harry Potter world. Flight with brooms and combat feels very smooth on mouse and keyboard is actually very enjoyable. Placing exploration, combat and flying aside what is wrong with the game? It feels like you are playing a movie with D list actors, the main story line does nothing to draw you in or make you really care about anyone or anything that is happening, I found myself zoning out more often than not at the INSANE amount of useless dialogue and cut scenes. The voice acting is very bland no emotion is truely shown and most of the time you just feel very disconnected to what is happening around you, I found that cut scenes with other students in normal robes and looking like a student should were just made into funny cut scenes for myself when i;m running around with glowing robes of my house on with a mask and dark arts gloves. There is no draw back at all to using unforgivable curses, it feels more like "do I want to make this game easier?" rather than I really shouldn't use these. Key spells to help you explore come very far into the game if you dont just focus the main quests, alohamora, flight, unforgivable curses come so late into the game that you just want to rip your hair out as you focus nothing but main quests. There is no quiditch, house points are pointless and the room of requirements is nice but the final upgrade is more of a headache then a help since you have your room setup then its all messed up with the next expanion. Things I'd say need to be worked on or added:Quiditch, faster spell accruing, Sell all function, better voice acting an a rewrite on the dialogue, interactable environment (let us sleep in our common room, sit on chairs, eat food ect), better spaced room of requirements (Give us a new room rather than extending the second one), Can we get more than just the 1 phoenix please? OCD is a thing and this angers it. Max 4 beasts is annoying and 12 slots is too few. The idle chatter you hear from students is so so so bad, two people standing/sitting next to each other having 2 completely different convos and if Deek tells me to proud of how many potions ive made imma turn hogwarts into a firing range.Things done well: World graphics are breath taking, the accuracy of Hogwarts and Hogsmead is great. Combat feels smooth and on Very Hard has just the right amount of difficulty. Flight feels great (on broom, would be better if you added free look). Side quests were decent. Immersion was a solid 6 out of 10 (again add sleeping eating sitting and better idle chatter.)Over all rating: 6.5 out of 10, this could easily be 7.5 or even 8.5 with voice acting and a story that didnt make me either laugh or want to fall asleep at how poorly it was. Is this worth a buy? Id say 100% if you're a potter fan maybe if not save your money, and I would wait till the game goes on sale. 30-40$ range.

author: Memnock
review: I just finished the game and all i can say is that IT IS GOOD! Here are my bullet points for this game : The Good : -The story is decent ( although very linear with no choice at all , except for 1 option at the very end ) , -side quests are mostly standard stuff but they are disguised well enough to not get boring and on top of that they usually force you to explore locations where you can find interesting stuff so its all good -the side characters are very nice and their stories very fun to go through especially for Sebastian , -combat is good with all the spells and combos that you can do as you unlock more spells  and on top of that add the plants and pots and you can have varied enough combat sequences that it doesnt get boring -nostalgia is strong with this one , exploring the castle and hogsmeade along with the rest of the world is great The bad :-As is standard procedure apparently with games in recent years , tech issues are there , especially realated to graphics , for some reason when the game launched it was decent but after the day 1 patch it got much worse al least for me , so unless you have a NASA computer , expect some loading on the castle doors , some texture popins and stuff like that , if you can't deal with it , i would say wait for maybe  a month of 2 untill they stabilize this thing -Spell slots bars are not enough , since we are playing on steam all of us are on PCs here so i was hoping they would port the game in such a way that we get access to all the slots all the time not having to go through 4 different spells tabs with 4 slots on each , which by the way is still not enough , since by mid game you have way more that those bars can cover , especially if you consider the non-combat oriented ones , like lumos and the ones for beast taming modifying the room of requirement. At least for the room and beast care spells they should have a dedicated bar that pops up the moment you enter the room and is active only in there so we dont have to waste time slotting them every time we go in.

author: Andres
review: In Short, Good game with some major issues.This game contains many jaw dropping features such as a loading screen free Hogwarts, stunning visuals, and fantastic performances and humor. However in many ways it seems to all be pretty surface level. Dialogue choices and player agency is shallow at best and linear at worst. With no morality system, the game does not offer you the chance to truly fit into the role you decide for yourself in this RPG, and all play throughs will inevitably lead you down the same path, with very slight variation between the houses. The game functions as a pseudo wizard simulator without the depth needed to truly immerse yourself.That being said, I still think the game is fantastic and I still find myself coming back it regularly, and in my opinion if you're a fan of the series, well worth the price of admission. Hoping to see additional content added in the future, and a fix to the drops in FPS despite the running the bench marks for my PC.

author: Dinkeist
review: For me the first 10-20 hours of the game were the best. After that the game becomes tedious and repetitive. I guess the writer went the easy way with the script, but still they should made a darker or a deeper approach to each character development. The vibes this game gave me were unique at the beginning, especially if you somewhat saw the movies or read the books. The music keeps the game going, but like I mentioned before, after the initial hours it turns repetitive. But still fine though.Overall it is a good game, with many stuff to improve. But as a starting point for future open-world saga games it has a lot of potential. The ingredients are there; they just need to have a better acknowledgement of mission creation, dungeons/in-game rewards (treasures/chest) and script to improve substantially the work done here.Note: It´s incredible, how the studio gave an exclusive mission to PlayStation users that almost seems like a DLC, most vanilla secondary missions are plain and boring.

author: Ryn
review: Everything I've wanted since I was a kid, tbh. Never done a review before and it ended up a bit long. No spoilers, though. Also to note, I play on the PC., you don't just activate four at a time and are stuck with those four for the duration of an entire combat or mission. Lots of quality of life aspects make the game more enjoyable - like you can mount your broom from being in a lake or while in combat, and you can 'teleport' while on your broom and it'll keep you on your broom when it loads you into the next place. Loads to explore, tons of puzzles, lots of reasons/space to go back to previous places to explore more. You can   immediately and anything you get is on the table for being transmogged to immediately - and it's free. Getting money isn't arduous, buying/selling prices seem fair. You can quickly start growing your own potions, plants (combat and ingredients) and they take a reasonable amount of time (simplest potion takes 15 seconds, longest plant takes 15 minutes). There's a variety of ways to upgrade your gear and moves to hone in on your play style. Combat  are very forgiving - the automatic saves are *very* frequent. Almost never hard stuck in combat. There's one exception to this and it's very fair - you know what you're getting into - but even then it'll give back your potions and such. It also gives you kind of a "1 HP" moment to pop a potion before you die - no one shots. Furthermore, on death, you don't lose gear, upgrades, exp, etc. Other  are relatable, have their niches, and their story lines/quests/adventures feel productive. Not always the most rewarding in terms of gear or gold, but to be fair I'm a bit over leveled because I enjoyed exploring early so much.  itself is engaging and well thought out, the player character is "unique" but doesn't feel necessarily op. Lots of easter egg-like details for those who were into the books and movies and then some more who are into trivia, of course. I've never played a game or watched a movie where I was privy to those details and it's very exciting and rewarding.As far as the controversy surrounding it, I think the developers did a phenomenal job with . You have immigrants, different accents, backgrounds, family makeups, values, and a trans character who does play a decent role in the story. Normally I'm apprehensive of a game or movie pushing these ideas too hard, but none of these aspects seem forced - they just make the game more lively and characters dynamic.It's also  pretty,  wise. Lots of details and scenery and the seasons do change! There's also a space for you to customize for yourself. ^^ I wish there was more of a consequence for doing so. Some people on reddit have suggested a  system, which I think would be great.Because the game is so pretty, a way to take screenshots without your character in the way would be nice. Or if we could get our characters to pose in said shots/interact with the environment (like sitting down)?Recently, and I'm a good way into the game (with so, so much more to do still) I've been having some fps drops and freezing, mostly while in Hogwarts. Wasn't an issue until very recent, but I know some people were having this problem before. It resolves itself quickly, but until then it's nigh unplayable. Sometimes dodging feels finicky but with the 1HP grace and combat deaths being forgiving, this can be frustrating but negligible.I wish you could sell more - like stated above, inventory is very, very generous. I make my own potions and plants, however it'd be a nice to be able to sell them as well - ingredients and/or final products. Money isn't  hard to come by, but it'd be nice option.

author: PearlCandy
review: I can't really say whether or not other people would enjoy this game, I can only talk about my feelings for it. I've been reading the Harry Potter books since the first one came out and I was around 4 years old. I saw the movies in theaters, even if I didn't like the later ones as much. When I was 11, I waited for my Hogwarts letter and I was (obviously) disappointed, even if I didn't really believe it was coming. I didn't wait for this game to come out, because I didn't want to have hype or anything affect my experience with it. I was not disappointed. Playing this game gives me a chance to live the story I always wanted to write in the Harry Potter universe, even if it takes place a while before Harry got there. I'm a huge fan of collectibles and puzzles, and I love that they fit so seamlessly into a world that already has things like "fast travel" (floo powder) and secret passage ways. Most of the game so far I've spent just exploring the world of Hogwarts (and beyond), just like I've always wanted to! It's also been an amazing way to escape reality, as we all so often need nowadays. I guess if any of this sounds good to you, then you should give this game a try. I'm really happy I did.

author: [TS3H] Dark Messiah

author: Mr.RainbowFluffUnicorn
review: PROS- They really did Hogwarts justice with all the details and fun facts all around the place, that really made me feel like I attended a real magical school- As for gameplay, it's like any other open-world RPG, nothing revolutionary, but it's just as good as the others, so if you like the genre, you will probably enjoy this game too- I really like the variety of discoveries you can make in the world, and even within them, there are different ways to solve them without being told how to, so it gives the feeling of using your spells experimentally to see what works- It's a really nice and easy spellcasting system that allows the player to learn a variety of spells and still being able to use them fairly easily!CONS- I would have loved there to be more sidequests, and in them, more sidequests with some degree of sillyness. Since it is in the wizarding world, I think there should have been more "my potion went wrong, and now my kneecaps are jelly, can you go out and find this plant that is the antidote?" or helping Peeves prank some first-years. There were maybe 2 silly quests and the rest were mostly combat oriented- I would have loved there to be more kinds of potions, plants, and beasts (without even having gameplay effects), like brewing a potion that gives the player character blue skin, or big ears or whatever. Or walking around and coming across Gillyweed, and then getting a revelio page about the plants properties or what it's used for, just to learn a lot about the wizarding world and the objects therein, and to get a feeling of all the sillyness that takes place, because magic IS silly- I had hoped that the going-to-classes thing was about going to a lot of classes in game, and then evolving the characters skills in those particular subjects, and not having time to go to all classes, therefore carefully choosing which subjects to be extra good at (again giving a feel of actually going to a wizarding school, because only Hermione Granger is good at everything), of course the basics in every subject would be necessary to complete the game, and I think that part is very well executed, including the way to learn new spellsConclusionI enjoyed the game very much, it is well made and fun and it's a very beautiful open world, but I do think there are missed opportunities for making it feel more magical and experimenting, which would distinguish it from any other open-world RPG and really make it a game about the wizarding world.

author: Hellschild
review: This game is quite good as a Harry Potter fan and as a game in general. While the game hasn't been so split about your choices in the world as some people would have seemed to like, there are still choices to be made in how you respond to people in the game. It's by no means a perfect game, but it's quite good. As far as the graphical issues that people have been complaining about, check the date of their reviews, I had similar stuttering and frame drops that were fixed by a driver update that was released shortly after the game dropped. Otherwise, some of the best things about this game are: - Combat feels smooth and engaging, although for me the difficulty on normal could be a smidge more challenging at times as prolonged combat can become a bit slow as I wait for cooldowns, but is easily changed by upping the difficulty.- The soundtrack and the audio is beautiful and well done, feeling right at home in the wizarding world but unique from the Harry Potter series.- The little touches are nice to see, while a more reactionary NPC system would have been appreciated as well, the attention to detail in the world and the various references you can uncover are really nice for someone like me who enjoys exploring and finding those details. - The transmog system is a joy to see in a game like this where gear matters, being able to keep my character as in theme as I so choose is really nice to see, giving options for those who want immersion and those who want a more unique look.- Account linking to the wizarding world is a nice feature as well to be able to have all the things that for me have become apart of the version of me that I envision in the wizarding world, although it would be nice to be able to choose to test again for a house or my wand if I wanted to try and get different results.All in all, a good game, worth the money and to see what updates they'll give us in the future. Just ignore the hasty reviewers that didn't allow time and consideration for any day 1 patches or post launch hotfixes. My only real gripe is the inclusion of a system specific questline and I hope dearly that it becomes available to the rest of us, WITHOUT having to pay more for it.

review: Pretty game but formulaic and repetitive - 6/10 overall rating. It doesn't feel like a satisfying RPG because they focused too much on cosmetic appearances and personalization features instead of taking the time to put substance behind the quests, especially the side quests feel hollow and repetitive. This game has been designed to look good on the outside but on the inside its lacking the charm and soul of actual top tier RPG/fantasy game that it should have and that should have been possible with all the world building and lore that Rowling has written. Definitely not worth the full price, wait for it to go on sale for less than half of the original price.Edit: Also wanted to update that I had no issues with performance at all and it ran smoothly without any major issues, I'm surprised at all these reports of crashes and stuttering which never was an issue for me. Running a RTX 3080 16GB laptop, Ryzen 5800H, Windows 11, connected to an LG C2 - running it at at 4K 120 fps with DLSS set to quality. Also I look forward to a player created mod where you can kill NPCs and other students with Avada Kedavra, cause this game could use a lot more violence, the PC is too goody too shoes for my personal taste even when picking the "bad" choices hah.
