author: Thermal
review: This one is a bit of a mixed bag for me. It's not one of my favorites, but it's a very solid game in its own right. Also I give immediate points to anything based on a big property that isn't owned by Disney, so +10 for that.So to start off with, I read all the Harry Potter books and saw all the movies when I was young. I was never a huge fan of the property, mainly because it was clear that JK Rowling had no idea about the concept of Chekhov's gun (time turners, felix felicis, etc.) That being said, I know all about the Harry Potter universe, and this game did an amazing job staying in the universe. There are subtleties in the quests and open world that are perfect tie-ins to the books and movies without shoving them in your face and just saying "Remember Harry Potter?". If you like the Harry Potter universe, you will love this game. Now onto the game itself, it's a puzzle collect-a-thon, but one of the better ones at that. The world is incredibly open and interesting to explore with good graphics that make it fun to go where you need and complete a puzzle to get the collectable. The puzzles did a great job staying engaging throughout the entire game, which was surprising given the vastness of it. I ran into only a couple bugs, nothing game breaking or even annoying. The facial animation is some of the most consistent I have seen in any video game. You could see emotion and it gave a depth to the characters that I really liked. The movement felt good, but what was spectacular was the flying mechanics on the broom and flying mounts. I swear, it felt like a flying simulator at some points. My frame rate and graphics seemed to increase even though I could see a great distance across the map. Overall incredibly smooth.Another sometimes overlooked thing in puzzle games or games in general is the camera angle and movement, but it always seemed like I was easily able to look at what I wanted and focus at who I wanted to cast a spell at. This game did an amazing job not making you feel like the camera is another enemy. Now what I dislike:The tone of the game is so incredibly mismatched it's bizarre. At certain points it is one of the most morbid games I have ever played, and then there's puns and the whimsical music and cute creatures running around. It was baffling to me. There's certain morbid aspects about the Harry Potter book, but generally it keeps a lighthearted tone. In this game, there's dragons eating people in front of you, the professors are talking about plants gouging a man's eyes out, you literally watch the light go out in someone's eyes close up in a cut scene, and even besides all that, literally almost every quest revolves around or involves death.Contrasting that, there's the music. It was frustrating to listen to, not because the music is bad, but simply because the entire time I was wishing it was the classic John Williams score. It is very close and they did a great job emulating the spirit of the original, but at the same time that makes the tone even more weird. I don't like listening to cheerful bells when there's someone trying to kill me and I am trying to kill them back.I mentioned there are puns as well. The first couple were okay, I thought "huh that's kinda strange, there was a pile of human remains back there, but the pun was moderately okay" and I chuckled to myself. And then there were like 20 more. I swear there are like 25 bad puns in the dialogue of the main story. They were all terrible and further confused me about how I was supposed to feel. This is the worst part of the game by far. Get that out of here. A lot of them were on Sebastian's questline too, so while his sister was dying you were joking around with him. I really felt nothing for him in particular other than annoyance. Most of the voice acting is good, and some of it was even great, but if I'd have known that the pitch shifting of the main character would be so blatant, I would have left it at default. It was distracting and made the possibly good voice acting of the main character terrible. Also, Simon Pegg. I love that guy, I was so excited to hear that he was in the game. Unfortunately, his character's voice was the worst. He was trying really hard to have a character but it was so clear that he had no context behind his lines because the ones that were supposed to be comedic were delivered flatly and the 'snide jokes' felt more derogatory. The whole quest where the player becomes his character is probably the worst because of this and, again, the fact that it felt lighthearted in an otherwise dour game. The combat isn't great. I'm not sure how I would fix it other than allowing more than 4 spells in one bar, but it felt restrictive. I got a headache from the monochromatic level. They wanted a unique art style, but something about it was very wrong because I got a literal, physical headache. Epileptics beware.Lastly, the final few lines of dialogue are a huge slap in the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ face. Throughout the whole game there wasn't really any exploration of morals even though there was clearly the setup for it with the whole goblins v wizards fracas, which is fine because it's a video game based on a young adult book series. But then at the end of the game having one of the main characters the story has developed completely change his personality and views based on one piece of unsubstantiated evidence is just utter garbage. Completely take out that last cutscene where the player talks to Sebastian and it would be much more consistent, and not feel heavy-handed.Worth playing, but probably won't be remembered with the greats.

author: SRBias
review: PC gaming is not what it used to be. Gamers had to beg for the scraps of console players, and major third-party releases either came in an unplayable form or not at all. I honestly thought for the longest time in the Playstation 2 and original Xbox era that PC gaming would eventually die off. I don’t know how, but something shifted in the landscape and now everything under the sun comes to PC. While that may be glorious, and much appreciated, a disturbing trend has arisen. Most major titles today launch day and date with their console counterpart, the problem is they lack optimization and land at our feet a broken mess.   Pc gaming saw a major boom even when the graphic card market was out of control. Throw the Steam Deck into the equation, no matter your opinion on it. And the PC market is massive. More and more people are joining the ranks every day, So the question is, why do companies with their major releases let these games out in such a state? There is no reason for the stutter, frame drops, or crashing. It is unfathomable that these studios don’t have people testing this software before shipping it to the public.   I had to change ini files, and add a dll to my computer (A 5900x, and a 3090 RTX) just to keep this at a stable framerate, and minimize stuttering. That is unacceptable because Hogwarts Legacy is a wonderful game. Probably one of the best single-player RPG experiences in a long time.   Now keep in mind Hogwarts is made for a broad audience, this isn’t a game where your choices change the entire aspect of the story, and no it doesn’t have endless depth. What it does have is an extremely high production value, and a fun factor to boot. I spent countless hours zooming around on my broom finding secrets and exploring the countryside. I was finding something new upon entering every room in the school itself. The combat was very pick-up and play-friendly and I had a blast slinging spells at wolves, spiders, and poachers.   The tale it weaves kept me hooked and guessing as to where this was going to all end up. It also never overstayed its welcome. I never had the “Oh man I need this to end.” feeling that seems to haunt the back third of these types of games.   The glaring concern someone should have with this game is that Warner Brothers KNEW this was going to be a massive hit. Millions of people were going to buy this across all three platforms. There is no reason this shouldn’t have been given more care. It’s as if companies ask their employees if the console version is ready to go and when they answer yes they force them to ship.   “But what about the PC version? It is unoptimized.”   “Screw it put it out, we’ll patch it after release.”   How many times is this going to happen? The scary part about that mentality is that gamers are having to tighten their belts due to the current economic climate and when a game doesn’t sell a lot of publishers just abandon it. So it’s a crap shoot if this stuff ever gets fixed. I’m sure this will get a performance update but why do this to the consumer?   Should you buy it? If you have the knowledge to go tinkering. Then absolutely it is one of the funniest times you can have. If not, stay away until the day it is given the tender loving care it deserves.   It’s a real shame too.

author: pykir
review: I'll leave a positive review but I have very mixed feelings about this game.First of all, if you are not a fan of Harry Potter world you probably won't enjoy this game as much as you think you could. In my opinion this game for someone without the knowladge about the lore can look like a bit of mess at the begging. That being said this game relies on the books and movies quite heavily but yet distance itself from it as much as it can (in my opinion).Talking about story... well I dont want to spoil anything so i'll say that it's just not the best. One of the side quest have better plot than the main one but at the same time all of the others side mission feel so blant and shallow that i just dropped them after first line of dialogue. The ending of the main story is also pretty disappointing with very obvious choices that in the end don't matter at all.Graphics are phenomenal, Hogwart is simply beautiful and also very detailed. Hogsmeade is very alive and also nicely done. Other locations feelt very generic to me, like if you showed me a screenshot of a dungon from this game i would have a hard time to say in which game i've already seen it.Also talking about dungeons and map for me it felt empty and it was filled with ubi style filler content like bandit camps, treasure chest or monster nests like in Witcher. It didn't really have the "magic" that it could be filled with.The main problem of this game was for me very weird facial expressions and overall animations. They feel very unrealistic and in a game that aims for realistic look it feels to be badly done or just left to be done on the last moment without second thought. I would compare it to Horizon Zero Dawn in this category, if you ever played HZD you know what i'm talking about.

author: TheRealSadRed
review: Without claiming to constitute an open world next-gen rpg hogwarts legacy comes with all the requirements of the ludic masterpieces that dictate history. If textures and polygonality give the flower of the contemporary without overdoing it and without surpassing other productions of recent times (read, e.g., elden ring, assassin's creed valhalla, etc.) the attention to detail of an epic and magical Nordic world, a little bit inside history and a little bit fantasy, of the 1800s is truly spectacular. In the allure of a rich and compelling adventure, well supported by a splendid story line and a framework of fine graphic effects, technical aspect and gameplay, worthy of the best works of the genre, are also absolutely to be considered. A world and a story that harkens back to the harry potter saga but can thrill anyone and not necessarily just fans of anything that conforms to that kind of fantasy. Splendor!!!

author: Endorphines
review: I am a 52 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 16. My son recently started Hogwarts LEgacy and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, did the tutorial but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: Neb
review: I was a huge Harry Potter fan as a child, I read all the books and I cannot count how many times I've seen the films. This will probably be the case for the majority of people playing this game and it does a fantastic job of catering to the people who ARE going to play it regardless while also offering a great experience for people who might have very little knowledge of Harry Potter games with the ability to learn about all kinds of lore. Booting up the game was super exciting (troubleshooting the performance issues ruined that), it started off incredibly strong and I was immediately invested.Exploring this iteration of Hogwarts was absolutely incredible, so much to find and do, I was having an absolute ball. Then came the next 2/3 of the game and oh boy, the childlike wonder started to wear off like Barty Crouch Jr's Polyjuice potion, gradually and in a very uncomfortable manner.I'm gonna rip the band-aid off straight away and go through the bad stuff so I can finish on the high note that I overall think this game deserves. The story was meh. I think the dialogue is what ruined it the most. In quests and side-quests, your character and the various side-characters are just repeating the same things over and over in slightly different ways as you progress through the story-lines. I appreciate the commitment to deviate from the existing Potterverse lore by introducing this theme of ancient magic and overall it definitely works but a lot of plot points just had me kinda watching the cut-scenes and spamming through dialogue like "yeah? okay?". Does the plot make sense? sure. Is it engaging and interesting? No. I often felt like I was trapped in dialogue cut-scenes pressing whatever answer I wanted and ending up with the exact same result which begs the question, why even give me the choice of answering in an evil manner or a good manner if I'm just going to be the hero anyway? This game stuffs SO MUCH CONTENT in but they didn't even bother to make some sort of reputation system or a slightly branching darker story-line which makes the option to choose what you do only align with what you believe and not what your character believes. You can be horrible and sarcastic to a side-quest character and then just do what they say anyway but ask for more stuff at the end, it just feels really under-utilised. Either make it a system or don't bother giving the choices.Speaking of choices, as I alluded to before there's so much stuff in the game. There is TOO MUCH stuff in this game, to the point where it's overwhelming and a chore. The map is huge, it is absolutely vast and it did not need to be that big considering you just fast travel everywhere anyway because you have to bounce between the overworld, Hogwarts and Hogsmeade so frequently for fetch side quests. Growing the plants and brewing potions, needing the spells and tomes, seeds, recipes, it's so much stuff that is just chucked at you through a side quest-line 1/3 of the way in. It should've been explained earlier on and brought through much more gradually so you could get to grips with doing one thing then learn the other thing and juggle them a bit better. It felt like I just should not bother brewing potions because I had to go grind money, buy the spellcraft, grind materials, brew the potion. It's just so tedious. I really did not bother doing that stuff and I get that it's just a preference but they could have made it a bit cheaper to buy the potions for people who'd rather just get through the game without having to do all that stuff. A minor issue would be the lack of response when you use unforgivable curses. It just kind of gets glossed over after the laughable quest where you learn Avada Kedavra. I literally laughed when the character, after EVERYTHING that just happened to him was like "So you wanna learn to kill people too?" and just teaches you the spell, for which there are no consequences for using.The engine is phenomenal. The developers really put the time in to make a system that is easy to pick up and you can play around with all sorts of spell combos and the game does not hold your hand to work out the puzzles, most of which just need a bit of common sense to work around. It really is a COMPLETE game (irregardless of my complaints about the scale of it) and I hope we get another one because with a bit of polish, the next one can be even better.Looks incredible. Even on low settings, the game looks amazing. It has a lot of performance issues yes, I was changing settings almost every time I played but that could definitely be my system and the game was not horribly glitchy. I had a few particle effect and audio problems but honestly, I'm never gonna sit here and say a game should have no bugs because it's always gonna happen and if they're minor, I just ignore or restart the game or wait for them to fix themselves which they often do. Irregardless, it always looked great and the atmosphere of the game was just incredible.Of course I'm biased towards a positive review because this is THE Harry Potter game, it's what I always dreamed of playing while I was playing the old EA games on Playstation. Yeah I have a lot of gripes with it but I feel like I have to give credit where it's due because although the execution is a little bit clumsy, you can really feel the effort put into the game, I really enjoyed playing it and even when I wasn't having fun, I'd take a little break and come back to it and I'm having fun again in no time. I want to try and 100% this and I may amend my review after that if I discover I was just playing it wrong or whatever but I feel like I've been more than fair.If you're a Potter fan, you will enjoy this game, it's fantastic. But depending on your tolerance for what I mentioned in the bad section, you might have to grit your teeth through some of it

author: Elyktronix
review: As far as Harry Potter games go, this game is unparalleled. Fantastic setting that provides players the opportunity to finally getting as close as you're gonna get to being a Hogwarts student and experience life as a witch or wizard. But as far as RPG games go, it's incredibly weak, boring, and unoriginal. The passion from the devs is evident, but it falls flat when you consider it's just another game with choices that have absolutely no impact on the outcome of the story, unnecessary and monotonous dialogue, needlessly large map, and senseless quests and activities that only serve as filler content.The PC version is poorly optimized. I have a decent enough rig (3070, i7-11800H, 16GB RAM, 2TB SSD) on which this game shouldn't have trouble running, but the stuttering and framerate drops are ridiculous regardless of the settings I change or use. Hardly does the game ever run at a consistent 60fps. I understand that under 60 for many is playable but I personally hate it. We live in a world where the industry-standard is 60fps and has been for years. Call me spoiled, I don't care, but I shouldn't have to resort to fiddling with settings going as far as to significantly reducing the visual experience because the devs did a ♥♥♥♥ job at optimization.

Emotional scene but  else.No explanation on the motivations of the boss, no explanation on the past which could have led him to his desire for "always more power".And above all, keepers just disappear letting you alone with all your questions, like nothing ever happened, even if everyone in Hogwarts know about the secret no one should know about.The only endgame content is to find collection's items with a  revelio...

author: InfinityTriceps
review: The game is not bad at all, however as much as I tried to LOVE the game, after having 50hrs on steam (says 37h on my save) on hardest difficulty, and almost 100% completed, I couldn't go above the: "the game is okay" feeling...Like every game, this one has it's negatives and positives. I'll start with the negatives:- Firstly, the developers stated that there will be from 30-35 hours if gameplay. I did not find this to be true.With A LOT of exploring, looking for fast travel points, field guide pages, and doing a hefty amount of side missions, it took me 23h to finish the story. I imagine i will need 5-10h to 100% the game.- The story is okay, nothing special having the whole Harry Potter universe in mind, but it covers up some of the plot holes from the movie.- The final boss was tedious in my opinion. Not saying it needs to be complex, but it didn't feel like it had any variety, just one simple gimmick.- Exploration is fun, HOWEVER, if you are looking to 100% the game, exploring anything outside Hogwarts can and will get boring. The scene of empty fields with some ruined castles here and there will make you just go to the map and mark where you need to go next, just so you can finish the area.- Having to do the same Merlin trials over and over again gets old real fast. - I found myself using one outfit, because other outfits felt goofy and out of place for a student.- I wish the game made you attend classes so you feel more like a student, but I do realize that developers immediately said that that's not the direction they want to go.- Finally, you can be a total jerk in the game, but for the most part, your decisions don't feel like they influence anything in the game that much, apart from few exceptions.-----Now before I continue with the positives, I just wan't to point out that this is just my opinion and what seems boring to me might be something good in someone else's eyes.-----The positives:- I LOVED exploring Hogwarts! Finding new rooms and spontaneously doing something random because I felt like it, felt being in one of the movies, especially when coming across some recognizable rooms and areas.- One of my favorite things about the game was learning and using spells. I couldn't wait for a new quest with a new spell at the bottom to pop up. I wish there were more spells, but I realize it would be overwhelming to choose which one too put in the spell selection and use.- Very fun using different spell combos.- Flying is very fun for me, also waiting for the upgrades, however, the races could've been better by being more intense and having actual npc's there- Connecting the quiz to the game was a great idea, and I recommend doing it for the immersion.So overall, the game is not bad, but not mind-blowing amazing either... I'm at the point where I feel like i'm forcing my self to 100% the game, just to justify giving 60 euros for it, which isn't a small amount of money.I do not regret preordering the game, but knowing what I know now, I wouldn't mind waiting for the discount.Again, just my opinion, someone might feel about the game differently.As a HP fan, and someone who's been playing games for a long long time, it saddens me that (for me) it's not THAT impressive.

author: Aryz
review: - Nice combat- Likable characters- Lots of mechanics, secrets and puzzles- Exploration is really rewarding, you can get more powerful by exploring than by doing the main story or killing mobs- A lot of things to do outside of the main story. I mean, a LOT of things- If you like the franchise it will be a dream coming true- A LOT of collectables (if you like it, it's good)- You can get really OP if you explore a lot, which makes the game really easy even on hard mode (I killed last boss with 3ish skills). The world does scale with your level, but that isn't enough since you can have a lot of side progression like - Main Story is cliché (well, it's harry potter after all, it works tho). I liked the  more than the main story haha- The enemies are the same everywhere- Some things related to the unforgivable curses doesn't make sense: you can use them in front of all the professors without any consequences- Your choices don't really affect anything for the most part - Technical issues on pc. The game is not well optimized, you will have to tune down your settings to play and it will still stutter on some places and occasionsThe game is good and it's worth playing, even though it surely has it flaws

author: Clanoman
review: I had some expectations that this game looked amazing but was going to be a small wizarding world confined to the area of Hogwarts & Hogsmead area but it was so much larger than that! I love to explore any open world game I play to seek out hidden areas or secret passage ways and this game certainly delivers on that! There are so many different aspects of this game to explore! I certainly think I can get at least a solid 100 hours of enjoyment out of this game or more as there are so many puzzles - which I find are just challenging enough to keep you at it for a while - and areas to utilise like the quiditch pitch and the other mini games that are spread out around Hogwarts. The only thing that would make this better is if there was a separate online world where you could explore, solve puzzles and fight other wizards with your friends. I also have enjoyed the narrative story so far. It keeps you engaged enough to want to find out what happens next like any good story does. I give this game a solid 9/10!

author: isabellanne
review: I feel like I've been waiting for this game my entire life. As a fan of Harry Potter, this is a dream come true (I mean I always wanted to fly on a broom), and ... don't get me started on the hippogriffs. There's so many hints of the Harry Potter series, small stuff that makes you feel that they really took time and effort to build that world. A work of art!I feel like I'm very engaged with the story and the world, I'm taking my time to really enjoy my experience. I think this is a game I will play over and over for years, because it's just so fun, beautiful, calming, and immersive. Very refreshing to buy a new game that is so good.

I Pre-Ordered game last minute after solid reviews from people.Money well spent. The game is solid.  I did not have high expectations but it beat anything i had set for a modern RPG. author: Oppai-Lover
review: took me around 60 h to finish the game at my pace and mixing things up between main story q and side missions and collecting bits and bobs around the world. you can see that the devs. paied close attention to the books and there are many eastereggs spread around. the perfomance was ok on my 5 y old pc with an GTX1070 8 gig vram and 8 gig ram and my 4 ghz cpu on medium to high settings. never rly had any crashing issues and it ran fine most of the time around 50-60 fps. i can recommend this game. it has a basic combat system of attacking, blocking and weaving in stronger spells for big dmg but its nothing new but it is also very well implemented and fluent. i would rather have a system like this in a game thats "old" but very refined and polished instead of an "new" original system that does not work or is unbalanced.If you like the Harry Potter universe you can safely buy this because its the world we all know and love. If you dont know what harry potter is you can still buy this since you dont need to know anything about it to play and understand this game or its story.

author: Zeladis
review: At the time of writing this, I have just 100% my first play through, and I can honestly say that it has been a thoroughly enjoyable 67 hours. There has been a lot of content to go through with the game, and whilst some of it can become a bit repetitive in terms of puzzle solving, the story that has been put into this game, even through the side/relationship quest lines has been nothing but fantastic. In terms of music, the soundtrack for this game is amazing, and really gives a lot to the atmosphere of the game, in addition to a lot of classical pieces being included whilst venturing around the Hogwarts castle.If there is one thing that I could truly fault the game with beyond some performance issues, is the facial expressions of some of the characters throughout the game. It can be often confusing and hilarious to see a character being full blown upset, and then it gets to the end of their 'scene' and the facial expression just defaults back to blank. It really takes away from the feeling, and immersion within the world, and could have done with a bit of refinement to make this better.Overall though, I would highly recommend this to anyone, and for a AAA game of recent times has shown how lax other developers have become when it comes to releasing new games when a smaller/lesser known company like Avalance can release a mostly polished game, this is enjoyable the whole way through.10/10

author: ERK
review: 9.5/10สำหรับการเล่นมาประมาณ 50 ชั่วโมง (เนื้อเรื่องหลักยังไม่จบ)- ถ้าคุณเป็นแฟนหนังสือแฮรรี่พอตตเตอร์ และ เป็นเเฟนโลกเวทย์มนต์  เกมจะพาคุณไปสัมผัสประสบการ์ณแบบที่เห็นในหนังการ ร่ายเวทย์มนต์ การต่อสู้ การเดินเล่นเที่ยวชม บรรยากาศภายในปราศาทฮอกวอท และการสำรวจโลกภายนอกปราสาทมันเป็นอะไรที่ประทับใจและฟินมากๆ- แต่ถ้าเป็นแค่คนชอบเล่นเกมส์ Open world โลกในเกมนี้ก็สามารถพาคุณไปเจอโลกใหม่ที่ มันมีอะไรให้ทำเยอะมากในเกมส์นี้ แต่กิจกรรมบางส่วนมันค่อนข้างซ้ำๆ โดยเฉพาะ การไขปริศนาของเมอร์ลิน ถ้าจับทางได้แปบเดียวก็ทำได้แล้ว ไหนจะดันเจี้ยนที่เป็นจำพวกถ้้ำให้เข้าไปสำรวจเพื่อเก็บเครื่องสวนใส่ที่ มันแทบจะไม่ได้ช่วยเสริมตัวละครเราเท่าไหร่- ในด้านเกมเพล สิ่งที่ชอบที่สุดคือความลื่นไหลในการทำคอมโบคาถาต่างๆ แต่ข้อสังเกตคือ มันค่อนข้างน่ารำคาญนิดหน่อยเวลาต้องคอยผวงทั้ง การปัดป้อง ป้องกันดาเมจ และ การดูคลูดาวน์ กับ การสลับสกิลแถบ- ในด้านเควสอยากให้การเลือกตอบ เลือกกระทำของเราส่งผลกับเนื้อเรื่องไม่ต้องมากก็ได้บางส่วนก็ยังดี- สิ่งที่อยากติมากที่สุดเลยคือ การ optimize ทำออกมาได้ค่อนข้างแย่หวังว่าจะมีการออกแพชต์มาแก้ในเร็ววันนี้นะครับ อีกเรื่องนึงคือความมีชีวิตชีวาของ npc ในเกมส์ค่อนข้างขาดความมีชีวิตไปหน่อย โดยเฉพาะเวลากลางคืนของเกมส์ ถ้าทำให้ npc รู้ว่าตัวพวกเขาเองมีชีวิตและดำเนินชีวิตตัวเองไปด้วย ก็คงดี

If you JUST want to experience the main story, maybe buy it on discount.a bit lack luster on RPG elements. would say its more of an action-rpg that lets you "live" its story, not so much shape your own. for example: no consequences really for decisions and stuff. replayability is also low due to this. house is just an "accent" to the game - doesn't really define anything. i hope we will get dlcs with a focus on story telling and questlines. because that is what the game did really well imo and could've used more of to make it more memorable. regarding performance:was able to run it with an 8 year old system and a 970. which honestly.. had no buisness in running that game. played for 40h until my upgrade to a 3060 was possible. finished the game on that, ran decently enough on 60fps :)

author: BROlympic
review: This is everything I've dreamed of for a Harry Potter game since I was a child reading the books.Sure we got the linear Harry Potter games in the mid 2000's and 2010's but this, this is it. This game actually brought the fantasy truly alive.I haven't played a single player game since Jak & Daxter 2 on the PlayStation 2. I've grinded every multiplayer game under the sun since then though. Somehow this game has captured me in ways that I've forgotten about. There's a few things I wish they did better. The progression from a no-name wizard to a Hogwarts student could've been better. You're inserted as a 5th year which really takes away from the wonder and world-building in my opinion. I wish there were ways to speed up repeatability, beginner quests kinda stink doing them more than once. Just wish there were more unique questlines for each House. This game is worth every penny and then some. I just hope we get DLC because I need more of it.

author: DeathAvengerIII
review: As a long time Harry Potter fan, I was nervous about a game diving into this world in RPG form. So nervous, I didnt buy the game and it was gifted to me. I have now completed the main story-line with 45 magnificent hours under my belt. I have been absolutely blown away by the level of detail in the game. The vast area to explore and the side quests still leave me with many hours left to play. There are times when you can tell they have paid homage to the movies in subtle ways. (piertotem locomotor) < This one got me good.For any HP fans, long time RPG fans or someone wanting to dive into a vast open world with plenty to do - I highly recommend this game.TLDR: Game is 100% worth the investment. Highly recommend. Praying for future DLC.

author: Blacknote
review: I just want avada kedavra

author: Kazen
review: Headline: Its like playing a part in the movies while being a bad-ass wizard..Story: Absolutely amazing! Better than Magical Beasts and on-par with Harry Potter. Should have been its own movie as it made you feel like you were in the magical world we all love. What a ride..Graphics: Nothing amazing, but had a great tone and ambiance about it. Combined with the fantastic musical score it really added to the immersion of the Harry Potter world.Gameplay: Was a really unique experience with some minor flaws but nothing that can't be improved upon in the future. I would liken it to Assassins Creed: Odyssey. The open world, the numerous quests and side adventures really made you feel like you could do what you want when you want all in the setting of Harry Potter.Combat: This is almost my favorite part about the game (behind the story line). It really allows you to play the style you want and exploring different ways to kill your enemies is endlessly satisfying. Summary: If you like the Magical world of Harry Potter and miss the good ol' days of the original movies, this will satisfy you more than you would expect. I can't wait to see what additional DLC they come out with as it does leave it open at the end.

author: Mippoose
review: What really stands out, above everything else, is just how well the game is made... in a time where we're all used to getting served half baked garbage. It's one of the best realized translations of a fantasy world into a game I think I've ever seen. It's really an incredible game in terms of quality.If you had a positive experience with Harry Potter in your youth I hope you experience the immense whimsy I did as you walk through the wildly diverse, expertly crafted, and seemingly endless smorgasbord of discoverables in hogwarts - or when gliding in and out of the canopy of the gorgeously spooky forbidden forest.The story is fine, but nothing mind blowing. There's a loooot of stuff, and most of that stuff is pretty shallow. I think I've seen "wide and shallow" as a decent explanation of most of the content. I enjoyed the combat thoroughly and, despite not having a massive pool of enemies, I never grew tired of my opponents.I mean, forgive the pun, it's a magical ~50 hours of fun.If you don't like Harry Potter, or fantastic beasts, it's probably a pass.

author: Warlord
review: I have fun playing the game i'll be honest. There is a lot to enjoy here but there is just enough issues that I can't recommend it. If you have a really strong computer and want to explore hogwarts then it might be worth it. But even with a high end pc you'll likely encounter some performance issues. For reference I'm running a nvidia 3060 and on all low graphical settings there is lots of stuttering and textures take ages to fully render. Enemy variation is fairly boring, most of the locations outside of the school and hogsmead just feel generic. Most every tunnel, spider nest, mongrel lair, bandit camp, goblin camp all feel the same as every other location of their type. If you're looking for 100% completion then expect hours of walking around aimlessly casting revelio hundreds of times just to pick up around 200 field guide pages, or spend hours walking around at night to find demiguise statues. They promise a lot with this game, but its a lot of the same. I know I just ripped into the game for a lot, but once they make some fixes to the performance I'd say this would be a pretty solid game with some interesting mechanics and story. My only other gripe is that they have a lot of characters who you maybe do a side quest or two with, and then they don't matter at all.

author: Germanicus
review: Whether you are Harry Potter fan or not, this is well crafted world with time and effort put into its game play and story telling.  It really does capture the magic of the world and make you feel apart of it. This game is a solid start to what could turn into a great franchise in the Wizarding World, lots of potential for story telling and exploration in this world. Great so far, look forward to 100% this one.

author: JIRWINKO
review: Hogwarts Legacy is the ultimate experience you can have in the Wizarding World short of developing actual magical abilities yourself. Catch my full thoughts below!

author: Flynnik
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a rather fun RPG. I've never really cared for the Harry Potter franchise so when I bought it, I wasnt expecting to care too much about the story. The story had other plans. I found myself captivated by the story and the unique characters. Combat can be a bit stale at times but there are plenty of spells to choose from. There are a ton of different collectibles to get and puzzles to solve. Overall, this is one of the better games i've played recently. There are a few problems that need solving on PC. I ran into some pretty heinous frame drops a few times and i managed to glitch and inadvertently soft-lock the game a few times(Saving and reloading fixed it). This game is a solid 9/10. I would highly recommend adding it to your library.

author: Osman
review: On the whole, I would say the game is enjoyable. Its very beautiful and there is a lot to explore and do in the game. But there are several issues with it.1) The game is heavily front loaded. The first day I got the game, I reached level 20 pretty quickly and outpaced the story level for the game. In the week following, I have only reached level 33. Level only really effects the gear you can equip, but at least to me it makes the pacing seem really poor.2) The consequences to the choices you make are nothing more than surface level. Cast an Unforgivable Curse in front of a teacher? You get scolded. Disagree with an NPC? Well they will get mad at you for your choices, but we can't stop the story so they will still give you the next quest. There are ways to cut off stories and quests, but that is by not doing the quests before a time skip.

author: OhCheez
review: This is a great game, I love the visual effects, voice acting, and gameplay...HOWEVER, I am at level 15, before I even got a broom, my character is soft-locked out of bounds and none of my keys work aside from the objective guide button. I am not going to start over.

author: marvelouswebs
review: Honestly, I still have a long way to go. But so far, it's basically the game I waited my whole childhood to play. I'm loving the mechanics, the scenery is beautiful and full of nostalgia, the characters are interesting and well-written, the story is keeping me on the edge of the seat. As a minority, I feel well-represented and find that I can identify with some of the main cast for once too, which is pretty nice. You can tell the developers put their heart and soul into this - cannot recommend enough.

author: Tyl*
review: This review comes from the perspective of someone whoa) not only grew up with the Wizardarding World, but grew up  with itandb) is a super harsh - PC race master race only - game critique.Personally I generally prefer more colorful, vivid, fantastical styles and dislike things the more it goes towards "realism".With that said, it's ok für the franchise I believe, but for some reason I find the characters seem to be off a different "quality" than the creatures or the world. Like someone pasted a low res picture on a 4k wallpaper or something - can't really pinpoint why I get that feeling.The same kind of non-cohesiveness I've observed in all kinds of animations. While combat animations seemed fine, all other character animations - especially expressions are rather horrible and cheap. Meanwhile all these little details, of moving objects and ghosts and what not, (that have no "use" but are just for world building) were really super good.First the Music: I am a person that can be moved by animations and music. Wizarding World fans will recognize all the music, as they are altered versions of movie soundtracks. I like them very much!The Audio design was ok, tho one combat effect when having a certain trait active gets super loud somehow.As I had to play it in english (see UI Section), I only know those VO. It was terrible. Not only the Voice Acting (which ofc not only VA but also voice directors etc are involved), but also the script.A lot of lines are said waaay too often (for example Floo Teleporting woman, or Revelion, cuz one (or me) lit. spams this all the time. Even my stream audience got tired of it. [More on this in UI section]I can assure everyone, I have a more than enough machine to play this game on max settings (which is btw also recommended to me) and I also usually had NO problems at all playing on it. But usually at around 4h playtime, it started to have SEVERE input lag (sometimes a key Input would only play out 3-4min later!). Something like that is an absolute no go, and it made it feel scammy, especially if it was interfering with the early access.Horrible. I super appreciate that there is such detailed Key Mapping, but sadly it makes no sense in some parts, and is brilliant in others. The UI as well as controls make it an obvious console game, which I super hate. While it is a better port than most of the games - it also doesn't make it good. I hate how console games are unable to have menus and windows open and overlaid everywhere. And the always the same repeating, non cancelable animations (for example opening Map) doesn't make it less annoying.Examples of these are: Flying - it is super clunky and unintuitive. There are lit. preset Keys that let's one set mouse up/down movement as a key! But why is it not set like that for flying? Also the key behavior from broom and flying mounts are different, even though it uses the same set of key settings.There are "Treasure Maps" we have to figure out, but we are unable to ♥♥♥♥♥ having them side by side with the map.Based on Steam Languages, there are some Audio Languages available and even more UI languages. But they areOnly changeable through steam itself, rather than the gameNot separated by UI and AudioWhich is a super huge nogo for me. I prefer playing my games in English, but have different VO, but that was not possible.It was also not possible to adjust Volume individually (by characters for example) and weirdly the characters voice lines did not count as "voice". So turning down voices was only for dialogues. Aka it was all a super mess.Again attributing to mostly it being a console game: A lot of things had to be done individually, there was no option for bulk actions (such as selling, buying, destroying, upgrading etc) and again common for console games, loooots of clicks necessary to do the "UI gameplay" (for example upgrading gear is UI gameplay) or get to certain menus.Aside from all the controls and UI shiz, the actual game system and mechanics are actually quite nice and varied. There is a lot of stuff to do, which is not only combat (like in a lot of games). But again I have to deduct points heavily. While there are a lot of different things, it feels like all the things are there only on a basic level. As if all was a prototype, not fleshed out or refined or anything.For example:There is swimming, but it's barely used and nothing special. Might as well not be there.It's "open world" but there are a lot of instances and also things like "jumping over" and "climbing" and even flying, are only possible where it is intended to be. So feels more like a weird hybrid of non open world and open world (depending on the definition). It's quite frustrating to sometimes be able to do something, and doing the same thing in another location doesn't work. And then one gets stuck on the third thing, by not trying the same thing again, because this is where one actually has to use that thing. It all seems super arbitrary.There is catching creatures and breeding, but the babies don't ever grow up.There is flying, but no quidditch.There are classes, but only based on quest, no "School System" (like for example some Dating Sims do it, to learn and improve skills)All the things seem to be in baby shoes and have so much potential and I could mention a million things on how the feats could be extended and improved upon.That said I have to give a huge plus point. I am someone who tries to avoid action combat games (specifically RPG) due to finding their combat boring usually. This is the first and only game EVER so far with action combat, in which I've really enjoyed the combat! (I also include the sneaky stuff in this)The story is super generic and superficial in my opinion. One gets just thrown into the "you are the chosen one, even if u blacken a little bit, u are still the good one vs the bad guys - final boss fight" also the known harry Potter Formula of "Everyone who is some kind of adult/father/guardian figure is dead/dies"I prolly dislike every single character except for Sebastian. I don't know what it is, most of them seem annoying, those who aren't are boring and just… not likable to me.The details of Hogwarts are amazing and the world is also pretty (tho super plain repetitive, but I blame the setting/location for that). But the world is waaay to empty. No matter if day or night, Hogwarts or not. All seems empty. There seem to be more animals and "enemy" humans than NPC everywhere.All in all the most interesting part out of all of it, except for getting to explore hogwarts a bit, to me, was prolly the slight touching of the "Blackening" topic and also "morally gray" areas (such as using dark arts for the right things etc)But the same as with the Mechanics, one can see here clearly, that it seems superficial and unrefined all over. Which I find sad.With that said, I in fact do have a mile long list of complaints of this game and I realize a lot of it are things others might not be bothered by. I recommend this game to those who:like playing RPGlike RPG but are looking for a refreshing combat style and more variety in activities (more than combat and story)are into Wizarding World

author: 99 PROBLEMS
review: Im not a Harry Potter fan.  Im a little too old to have been swept up in that fanbase.  While I enjoyed the books, the movies were only okay for me.  So when I heard of this game, I wasnt enthused.I bought it on a whim as a skeptic (and because all my friends bought it).  I knew nothing about its development and I havent been following it.It is amazing.  Literally hours of wandering and exploring Hogwarts and the world.  The quests are absolutely fun and the developers have put in so much detail its astounding.  The storyline is compelling and I am enthralled.  Partway through the game I was stumped when I noticed the seasons changing and holiday decorations going up.  Subtle touches like these just add to this amazingly lovely game.  From a skeptic to a fanboy.  Absolutely one of the best games I have ever played.  5/5

author: Z A S H
review: Brilliant game. Great combat and story and good amount of content.But this could go WAY harder. Multiplayer would take this game so far, please please please for the love of god add multiplayer elements!- instances/sharding or something like gta where you can encounter other players by roaming the world. Doesn't need to be a lot of players but would make the game so much more fun. opens up coop too.- Online duelling arena: 1v1 2v2 3v3 cant go wrong.- quidditch in general but also vs other online teams would be amazing too.- Broom races.Just adding some of these ideas would give the game replayability and stay relevant for much longer instead of dropping off after completing the story.

author: liamcleary2015
review: It's a solid game. It has a horizon: Zero Dawn feel to it. Nice big open world and a lot of freedom, but a clear linear story.100% is quite dull to get in the end. Having to start 3 extra saves to play 2-ish hours in each to get to the chamber is just stupid. Set it to the sorting hat. Pointless.Side missions, speech was skipped after about 20 of them as the chat is boring. Merlin trial were confusing at the beginning. There are far to many of them, it felt a bit bloated.I ended up not casting Lumos in the dark, as I drop to maybe 10-15 FPS. NTY.It could do with a keep over-ride option. I wanted my outfit and having to change it every 10-15 minutes of game play was annoying. 67 foes, more like 20 and re-skin them.I'd give it a 70-75. 5 more points, if they fix the graphical glitches and the lumos lag.

author: Custardx
review: This was an excellent game - by no means perfect but gives a solid foundation to build on for future games in the series.I enjoyed the story (albeit a standard 'chosen one' one) and the side missions complimented it. In many ways this feels like an adventure game with RPG elements with conversation choices doing little to affect anything beyond the 'in-passing' comments made by NPCs.I would like to see a morality system introduced in future instalments. I loved that the power of the unforgivable curses wasn't watered down but there was no consequence for using them along with the rampant amount of thievery you get up to.Overall though I thoroughly enjoyed this games and the money spent on it.8/10

author: VasG1
review: I'm absolutely blown away by Hogwarts Legacy (game of the year status contender no question). This game is a true work of art that transports you to the magical world of Harry Potter like never before. The level of detail and love that the developers put into crafting this world is absurd. The castle is massive and incredibly faithful to the original, and exploring it never gets old. The world outside of the castle is even more expansive, with different villages and hidden secrets that you can discover at every turn. I never felt forced to explore, but I was always encouraged to do so.The gameplay is fantastic, combat is satisfying and the spells you can use are varied and fun to experiment with. It would have been nice if there were more enemy types, but each one has its own unique weakness that you can exploit. There's not much customization when it comes to your character, but the gear you can equip is well-designed and can be augmented for specific situations.The story is intriguing and the sense of urgency is balanced perfectly with the need to explore and master ancient magic. The sidequests are also a lot of fun, and the game introduces collectibles and puzzles at a good pace. The game also has other great features like flying, a customizable Room of Requirement, and the ability to catch your own beasts.

author: Dally
review: Review after 100%In all honesty the saving grace for the game was the combat. I found most of the story just okay, it was enough to keep me playing but if you were to follow the main story as a top priority you would find that there isn't a lot of fights to be had.The side content was mainly just fetch quests that would have you going from A to B releasing peoples pets from poachers, the relationship side quest that have you going to the same character to get quest were a little more in depth and were only a bit more enjoyable as they had more combat encounters, one relationship quest line giving you the unforgivable curses was nice and also very handy for blazing through combat if it were to ever get to hard. Getting the 100% was by far the worst thing I could have gone for as you had to complete the collection which got very boring very quickly and half the time having to google where the last item is that you need or the final side quest that you found out was a note from a cave you completed near the start of the game and didn't show on the map because it was underground. The puzzles in some of the caves and the ones in hogwarts were very fun and had you thinking a lot to get some of them done, at least I did because I'm a smooth brain.TLDR; A good game to play because the combat is really engaging, story is there but dont expect to be completely captivated by it. One shotting bosses with avada was fun but took away from the challenge.

author: MistressTorturess
review: Performance issues aside this game is everything I ever wanted since falling in love with the Harry Potter world. Highly addictive content, beautiful scenery, loads of things to do, places to explore and so many features included that I can't get enough of. Stretching out the story because I just want to keep enjoying the world. HIGHLY RECOMMEND for any fantasy or H.P. lover. At the moment I have about 76 hours in and I have 3 main quests left and I'm loving every minute of it. Only cons I have with it so far is:- Performance still needs to TLC- No Quidditch- No online co-op- Would love more options for customizing characters face - Allow the ability to lock the mini-map so that it stays with North being on top10/10 aside from those minor things.

review: This game is a joyous recreation of my childhood. Finally a game that allows us to experience the Harry Potter universe in our own way. The story is intriguing and I was always looking forward to what may happen next. The music and sound is fitting, nostalgic, and powerful. But my favourite aspect is the graphics, every scene of this game is a piece of art. The combat is fluid, easy to learn, satisfying to master. Even looking out over the lake on an overcast and dreary day was damn beautiful. My only complaints are the occasional bugs but these are bound to be fixed anyway, and do not take away from the entire experience.

review: I think that if you enjoy the idea of an open world time sink where there is lots to do with a story, this is a great game.  From what I have seen on Youtube, you can create build that will break the game and there are a few frustrating points in the game but a great game for completionists.  The downsides I'd say are the broadness of the crafting, the diversity of the opponents and the repetitiveness of some of the dungeons.

author: LunaRoll18
review: 6 / 10A good game as a vast open-world RPG.Pros:- The storyline draws you in very quickly.- The graphics are well done. - The characters and the NPC dialogues are rather interesting.- Enjoyable NPC interactions.Cons: - A few glitches, but the game is still new. - There are no companions for most game scenarios - unlike most RPGs, you do most of your quests alone. - A minor annoyance is that you don't sleep in your common room (very little time spent in a room that so much effort went into designing), you can go to class in any random outfit & you can't sit. - There are no romance options, which is a little sad as having a "high-school sweetheart (pg rated)" is part of being a teen for most people.This all could be changed/updated with patches though.The storyline sometimes feels like it was written for a character over 18, you get quests from adults who should be more capable, and you spend very little time at Hogwarts.But it is worth playing, though :)

author: Vojem
review: This is well made RPG. The way that the game slowly builds your character through the main story is well paced and doesn't over-power you instantly. You actually have to play the game and explore if you want to get better spells/gear etc. Graphics are phenomenal, best I've seen in a while this year so far (apart from the NPCs).The only drawbacks are that the game doesn't utilise the GPU, sometimes crashes (for me, a lot during launching the game), and needs to be run on high-spec systems installed onto an SSD to be run properly.After some optimisation and other patches to fix FPS issues, it's easy to look past the ugly. I know friends who dislike HP but love this game. Be sure not to miss out, and buy it!

author: Matricks_
review: 41 hours in (restarted a few times, choosing different houses) and I still haven't completed the main campaign. That's usually how it goes with open world games for me! Anyways, this game is pretty great. Surprisingly deep combat, huge map to explore, and there's little lore tidbits scattered throughout the world that really help to deepen the Wizarding World and immerse you in it. So far the story is really intriguing and the characters within are interesting enough to actually care for them a bit. The world is georgeous!That said, I do wish the enemy diversity was a bit deeper, and that the keybindings for the combat a bit more complex - being limited to four spells with the controller and having to switch "pages" on the directional pad is a bit cumbersome. I'd prefer if I could use the left trigger as an alternate spellbinding key as well. I have yet to play with a MKB setup (I prefer controller for these types of games). I'm also having a helluva time getting the game to perform at a constant framerate right now, with major stutters being very common. It may have something to do with the fact that I'm only running 16GB of RAM, and the RAM usage is constantly at 100% when running this game - I believe you need well and above that amount to run it properly, so might be time for me to drop in a couple more GBs worth.A solid game so far, and I'm very happy to NOT have to resort to a cheap "pay to win" mobile game for some Harry Potter gaming excellence.

There's your character saying "There's trouble brewing and I'm without my friends" and NPCs saying you should "come pick them up if you need help", which hints for a trashed companion system.That said, the game is still a knockout, I cannot imagine how good this game will be in around 2 years when modders perfect all the rough edges it has, it's going to be such an amazing experience.But like every game, in Brazil, it costs R$ 99999999999,99 like every game that's launched recently. I thank my friend Roger for sharing the game with me through family share on Steam. It does not matter how good you game is, I'm not paying that much money for it. I'm just not.

author: Sleepless Owl
review: Let me start off by saying that the reason I cannot recommend that anyone buys this game right now is to do with techincal issues, not the game itself.I believe that if you enjoy the harry potter universe, this game is 100% for you. If you however have no connection to this universe then you should probably stay away because without that, the game is very mid. The combat is great and amazingly fun but occurs a bit too rarely and even on hard is not that challenging. The side quests are a mixed bag. Sometimes you follow a treasure map, sometimes its "find x amount of y item". I personally enjoy the dialog, and the dialog options for your character are very reminiciant of the witcher 3 style of dialog. Youre character drives the story with the others largely by themselves but you have the ability to imprint a personality on them through minor choices (perhaps there are larger choices that I am not aware of yet, but enough said with "its like the witcher 3"). I think the characters are well written, fun and  interesting to interact with, and fill the world quite nicely. The game world is beautiful if you can get it to run at that setting (more on that in a moment), and the overall design is actually really pretty and conveys a magical feeling really well. The animations for combat do the same. All the spells feel powerful or cool to cast. Heres is the reason I cannot recommend the game: My PC exceeds the recommended specs by a lot. I am running this game with a radeon rx 6700 xt and a ryzen 5 processor. This should be more than enough to run this game on high, if not ultra quality settings and my rig can do that for many other games of similar calibar (elden ring comes to mind, which I can run the highest settings while getting over 100 fps). This game is so poorly optimized for PC that my rig struggles to run the game on medium settings without stuttering frequently. This is the main problem and I assume that this will be fixed in the near future, and once it is, this is an okay game. But as of right now (and from what I am seeing in other reviews, many people share this sentiment or are having similar issues) this stuttering even on medium settings has a signifcant impact on the game and I cannot imagine that you can even properly run the game on the minimum graphical settings with the specs they recommend on the steam page. If you have a $3000 PC, youre probably good to go, but anything less than $2k and youre not running it at any decent graphical quality, if at all.There are also lesser issues such as lighting bugs (but how much something like that bothers you is ultimately up to you).As it stands at the moment, this is a pathetic effort at a port and it's sad to see so many people being okay with having ♥♥♥♥ on a plate served to them.

review: This game is fun af.  It's a tad bit off putting that you sound like harry potter as a male. author: Anarshia
review: I just wanna discuss about Hogwarts Legacy for a bit.Okay so I've never watched any Harry Potter movie, never read the books and I had no information about the franchise in general, However I was interested in the game so I played it, Been playing for more than 10 hours and I can say this game has astonishing graphics even at medium settings! Everything looks gorgeous, lots of details to behold and generally a beautiful game. The combat mechanics are great, I really love learning new spells and every spell has it's own use and benefits in certain situations. One thing I like the most is how this game makes sure that you stick around and just explore and lets you find about certain things by yourself.You can explore almost "everywhere" and "anywhere" you come across or see in the map.The riddles and puzzles are great, lets say some of them may take a minute or two to figure out.I love the customization, though the hairs could do some work but overall, great customization. The game is not that buggy I have came across a few bugs but they're not annoying just funny. I like everything about this game and look forward to finish it and do another playthrough after!Truly a game you should be playing in 2023 and worth every single penny you pay.

author: PIERCING_SILENCE
review: Hogwarts Legacy is an absolute gem of a game. Detail orientated (whispering spells when in stealth mode) and exquisite scenery. There is so much to do and new areas to explore. The PC version has its hiccups but nothing that ruins the overall experience. The one complaint I have is the flying mechanics. For open world its fine but when completing flying trials where you have to be more precise, its a nightmare. I use an Xbox one remote where you use one joystick to fly up or down and the other joystick for left and right steering. Even playing with the controller and camera sensitivity/acceleration settings, I still have problems with missing targeted rings etc. That is my biggest gripe. Everything else 10/10. Can't wait for DLC content!

author: I3luefire
review: Shut up and take my money (not all of it, bought it from a reseller :p)Pro:- detailed beautiful world, you can interact with many things, animals and objects- feels like home for me, that after reading the books and watching the movies ;)- the battle system is awesome (could need one or two spell sets more ;))- i like the story, well written, nothing too spectacular, solid stuff- i love the room of requirements, (deeds small random dialog beside... yeah i am proud of my potions...)- the mounts are awesome, love flying by animal or by broom, also the ground mount rocks :D- i liked the puzzles, could be a bit harder for my taste- the beasts rescue is awesome, i wished there would be more animals to rescueCon:- good or bad behavior does not effect your character or the story- you decisions do not really matter to the outcome of the game, stories, quests- cannot sell resources created or collected- no housepoint system- no quidditch

author: Shinzon
review: 9 out of 10 A Total Worth While Game! A MUST BUY, even at full price it's worth it. You will quickly lose yourself in the game,  the music, the story, the open world and everything else. Now the game still has room for improvements some of which I figure will be added and addressed in future updates and  DLC/Expansions. Like  more spells locations and so on the possibilities are nearly endless. Now a few cons. Controls, you only get 3rd person over right shoulder view/control of your character. adding a first person viewing and controlling option would only add to the game. Furthermore better controls and handling of flying would be a better but the controls  feels clumsy and clunky.  so in closing, a solid 9 out of 10, So get it and settle in for an adventure (WARNING-PLAYERS MAY EXPERIENCE LOSS OF TIME AND GET  URGE TO PUT ON HARRY POTTER GLASSES AND WIZARDS GARMENTS AND NERD OUT) Enjoy

author: Wyx
review: Sum-UpIn-depth analysis further down.🟩 Pros🟥 Cons- A vast, detailed and impressive recreation of Hogwarts and its neighboring regions, packed to the brim with locations to discover, collectibles and activities to clear. A Potterhead’s wet dream made manifest.- Varied and satisfying combat system that constantly opens up new opportunities as you learn more spells, and stays fresh, engaging in the long run.- Excellent customization possibilities, featuring a myriad of cosmetics and skins, other than your very own customizable ‘base’ to furnish by hand at leisure.- Exciting progression that portrays your growth as a wizard (or witch) rather well, giving you new tools and utilities to access previously-locked content and areas.- Solid roster of side characters; most of them are likable / unique enough, and incredibly, their writing isn’t complete garbage - kudos to that.- Excessively repetitive open-world activities in the long run, that create bloat and annoyance for those who want to complete all side activities.- Combat balance issues with potions, ‘healing spam’ and unforgivable curses: especially when upgraded they prove overpowered and make most fights quite too easy.- Most named foes and quest bosses (but not all) are just normal enemies on steroids, that don’t vary in mechanics and don’t have unique behaviors.- Some inconsistencies with lore and character behavior. Example: if you use unforgivable curses in public or during quests (with witnesses), nobody will give a damn.- Underwhelming finale that doesn’t really reflect the importance of what you accomplished, and doesn’t give any detail about how your actions influenced other characters afterwards.🟨 Bugs & Issues🔧 Specs- Significant frame-drops inside Hogwarts when transitioning between different sections, and also in specific places throughout the castle, regardless of settings.- In some cases, fall damage doesn’t register on enemies.- 3900X- 2080Ti- 32GB RAM- SSD- 1440pContent & Replay Value:It took me 82 hours to complete Hogwarts Legacy, taking considerable extra time to clear all optional content and find around 90% of collectibles / secrets on Hard difficulty. I don’t see a reason to replay the game once finished, except achievement hunting, as the content is linear.Is it worth buying?Yes, especially if you’re a fan of the saga. This amount of content and quality are more than fair for the proposed 60€ price, expected from an AAA release.Verdict: GoodRating Chart HereBy far the best game ever made based on this franchise, but not a masterpiece by any means. Fans of the series will almost certainly like it, but it’s still drawn back by its issues.Follow our Curator page, Summit Reviews, to see more high-quality reviews  & WritingHogwarts Legacy takes place in the iconic Wizarding World setting created by J.K. Rowling, at a time far before Harry & friends were even born. You’ll play as a fifth year student in the titular magics academy, admitted this late because of unspecified ‘special circumstances’. The virtual rendition of Rowling’s works is nothing short of exceptional, with not only Hogwarts itself, but also its environs (like the town of Hogsmeade or the dangerous Forbidden Forest), all recreated faithfully and down to the most minute details. Of course, some things will differ from movies and books, with the game being set in the 1800s.The main story follows the classic ‘manifest destiny’ archetype, where your custom-made character will discover hidden potential that ties them to a greater purpose. Despite some genuinely memorable characters and some interesting side- and main-quests, the overall narrative can’t help but fall a little flat and stale, especially towards the ending phases. Nonetheless, many enjoyable adventures await you. Notably, there are no romance or love/hate dichotomies in the relationships you have with side-characters, as your choices will always end up in pretty much the same results during questlines.Exploration, Collectibles & SecretsThe world is vast and visually magnificent, peppered to no-end with points of interest that often hold collectibles, currency or other utilities. Initially on foot, and later on with the iconic enchanted brooms and even flying magical creatures, you’ll be able to explore at leisure and clear the enormous amount of side-activities. A good portion of these, however, will prove inaccessible until you gain the right spells or abilities, in a sort-of ‘metroidvania’ fashion that promotes meaningful backtracking. Fast travel and an item-highlighting spell prove invaluable in saving time while exploring. Collectibles are mostly cosmetic, enabling the customization of both your wizard and your own private room once you unlock it, to suit various styles.Most dungeons and locations have additional puzzles or hidden paths that often lead to collectibles or extra resources; exploration feels rewarding, with a genuine sense of mystery surrounding each new point of interest you’ll find. Despite that, most dungeons and locations play out in the same way, and become repetitive in the long  System & BossesMagical battles use spells as sole means of offense and defense. Usually against multiple enemies at once, sometimes supported by allied NPCs, you’ll have to time your protection spell right in order to deflect incoming attacks, or dodge-roll away in case of unblockable ones. Enemies are varied and range from magical creatures to dark wizards and goblin soldiers, to name a few. Some of them may be weak to specific charms, others have shields you can break by using specific spell categories (damage, utility, movement) or other special abilities, like immunity to certain effects.Combat feels engaging, well-paced and is more than a little gory for this universe’s standards, death will be far more common than in the movies or books. The way you can combine spell effects to your advantage and use the environment further adds to the base system, while the amount of passive upgrades with item traits and spell-related talents you can gain progressively add another layer of depth. In late-game however you’ll become overpowered between potions, passive traits, talents and endgame spells - so much that supposedly fearsome dark wizards will prove little more than a nuisance due to power creep.Quests, Minigames & ChallengesQuests usually involve retrieving something, talking to a specific NPC, solving a treasure hunt based on visual clues, getting the solution to logic-based puzzles and more, depending on the case. While some side-quests are unique and memorable, most will be fetch chores or dry open-world shenanigans that you’ll have to repeat over and over in the same fashion. Less, but more meaningful and unique quests would have been better than this bloat, for sure.Challenges are paramount in unlocking unique bonuses like increased inventory capacity, many cosmetics, and even unique passive upgrades to equip in gear pieces. They often require you to slay X of a specific enemy, finish X of the same activity, and such “long-term” goals. Some of them are a massive grind and will only give you the 25th pair of gloves you don’t need, or other cosmetics that aren’t worth the effort.

author: Nylfie
review: enjoying it a lot, actually. I wanted to get this game when it launched but I couldn't, but now that I'm playing it I'm really enjoying just running around and goofing off and doing all the sidequests.

author: General Inaptitude
review: I am usually very critical of games, especially ones that focus on woke ideology at the expense of gameplay or other elements. Fortunately that hasn't happened here. I also deeply resent games that are frustrating or 'fake' the experience that you're getting. That too, doesn't happen here.You succeed or fail, based on your merits. If you do stupid things, the game tends to be quite forgiving, even at normal difficulty, but if you really use your brains, respond quickly and properly, combat is truly engaging.The environment is very well done and exudes that Harry Potter atmosphere, everywhere. Consequently, I have to say that this game has lived up to my expectations. Gameplay, sound design, animations, performance, story, all are of pretty high pedigree. This is one of those games I can play for hours and not 'grind', but explore while also getting better at the core mechanics all the time. And that's a great experience.

author: pinkD
review: tldr: GAME IS GOOD HAD LOTS OF FUN, STORY TAKES 20-30 HRS TO COMPLETE, TOOK ME 90HRS TO 100%STORY IS PRETTY GOOD, PREDICTABLE BUT LOTS OF COMPELLING THEMES AND CONFLICTS.SIDE QUESTS MAKE SENSE IN CONTEXT OF OVERALL NARRATIVE AND ARE SLIGHTLY MORE THAN COPY PASTE DO XYZ IN ORDER TO GET MORE EXP TO LEVEL UP. GETTING COSMETICS FROM SIDE QUESTS ALSO MAKE THEM MORE REWARDING, WHICH WAS GREAT.DUNGEONS ARE REALLY BIG AND SOME HAVE REALLY INTERESTING MECHANICS. THE PUZZLES IN THIS GAME ARE PRETTY FUN AND VARIED, BUT I WISH THERE WAS EVEN MORE VARIETY OF PUZZLES.COMBAT IS FUN. DECENT SKILL REQUIRED FOR HARDER DIFFICULTIES, BUT OVERALL I ENJOYED THE FLUIDITY AND COMPLEXITY. ONLY DOWNSIDE IS THAT THERE AREN'T THAT MANY ENEMY TYPES SO COMBAT EVENTUALLY GOT A LITTLE BORING.THE OVERALL ATMOSPHERE OF THE GAME IS AWESOME, VERY DETAILED FOR HARRY POTTER FANS. LOTS OF INTERESTING UNIVERSE BUILDING IN THE GAME.RUNS POORLY ON PC AS OF 2/18, BUT STORY AND GAMEPLAY ARE REALLY GOOD, AVALANCHE DID A GREAT JOB WITH THEIR FIRST MAJOR RELEASE AND HOPE THEY CAN MAKE EVEN BETTER GAMES IN THE FUTURE

author: Skittlez
review: Never been a fan of Harry Potter but my wife loves it so we got the game for the PS5.I watched a little, and it looked fun so I decided to give it a shot and my god...It's Harry Potter Red Dead Redemption.

author: Quincy.
review: The first 10 or so hours is really enjoyable, after that you start to see the same patterns repeated several times over. There is a lot of unique content outside of the main quest line but all of it feels shallow and designed just to fill in time to make the game feel expansive. The game touches on some really cool concepts but you'll find a lot is to be desired. Not the kind of game I'd have any interest in playing again but an overall enjoyable experience nonetheless.

author: PenDev0us
review: Now that I've had a decent amount of time with the game, I can honestly say that this game is an absolute blast and is wonderfully faithful to the original source material. There are areas around the over-world that feel directly ripped from the movies! (a few that immediately comes to mind is the lake in the forbidden forest where harry casts his patronus, and the snake on the taps in moaning myrtles bathroom).Positives: - Casting spells is fun, I love how fluid it all seems- Gorgeous over-world that feels alive and very atmospheric depending on location- Side quests don't feel tedious even in the end game- Love the little quips from foes depending on what you've been up to both in and out of the main story- The map for the over-world works really well with the 3D design, little landmarks here and there make it easy to get to grips where to go- I love eavesdropping on foes before engaging in combat, the goblin banter is hilarious- there isn't much of a grind. I haven't found that I've been under-levelled at any point in the game- an absolutely amazing soundtrack, really adds to the whole experienceNegatives:- The 3D map of Hogwarts is too simplistic, it works for the over-world, but not so much here. Too many times I've aimed for a certain room when hunting down the field guide pages, and wound up in the ass end of nowhere- Unfortunately my game has been buggier than most. Astronomy tables randomly work (have double checked if its night), collection counter fails to update reliably, I've had NPCs and items fall halfway through the floor, and my character has also fallen through the floor in Hogwarts after running through a door a little too fast. All in all it hasn't really ruined game play, but after so many instances, it is noticeable. (though i wont argue with the eyeball chests bugging out and letting me loot twice!) ;)- the sound balancing is a bit off, one example i can think of is that characters tend to get drowned out by the floo network ladyWishes:- For a castle as big as Hogwarts, we would really benefit from a floor by floor map for ease of exploration- It would be nice to see the full outfit when previewing in the clothing store - for the completionists out there, a little check mark for outfits already obtained in the stores, animals already bred, and for enemies killed with ancient magic would go a long way. Pretty much just extra tracking for anything that might have an achievement connected to it would be lovely- To be blunt, I have a rather lousy memory. Numerous times I've switched to the wrong hotbar mid fight for that one spell. Increasing the visible spells to 8 even if you drop the overall no. of bars down to 2 would be great (though that might just be a me thing)
