author: Cuintus
review: 7/10 (8.5/10, if you are a Harry Potter fan)Disclaimer: I really enjoyed my time playing this game, and I'm sure you will find plenty of reviews praising the game. I find reviews to be more useful to me when they point out what was less than ideal/not enjoyable, so that I may decide if I can live with those shortcomings.Review:The game requires you to open and close various menus in order to do many things. For example, when you equip a new piece of gear and change it's cosmetic view, after equipping that said piece of gear, you need to go back to the inventory menu and enter to change it's cosmetic instead of allowing you to change it's cosmetic directly through the slot menu. Or in order to upgrade your gear, you need to select the item, enter one menu to upgrade your stats, and then you need to again select the same item and enter the other menu to add attributes, instead of just allowing you to select the item, have one button to increase stats, and another to add attributes, without deselecting the item itself.There are not enough quests in the game to make you reach max level, meaning you are forced to do Merlin Trials, Pop Balloons, etc, in order to get to max level. There is no optional boss/challenge that promotes you to level up and gear up, a challenge for higher levels. The max level is there just as a "complete checkmark" on your To-Do list without any additional incentive.Ever since you start the game and you see the spell list, everyone eyes their locked spells, specially the Unforgivable Curses. But in my experience, by the time you unlock them, you don't get anything out of them. They are not as powerful/useful as you thought they would be, with the exception of the Crucio curse.It personally annoyed me that the game the Revelio spell, which is a spell that allows you to find things, "dings" when it reveals field pages inside of a lock you cannot open at that moment. You have no way of knowing if that field page is inside the locked door, or somewhere you missed a spot. Unless you have the capacity to enter a place, the game should not "ding" in such situations.Finally, this might not be true when you read this review, due to patches, but the volume in this game was completely out of sync. Story Cinematics had their own volume, ignoring my volume controls. Gameplay Cinematics had certain sounds muffled like grunts or screams, while others, like blasts and explosions are sometimes very loud or very quiet. Sometimes the music would just end and you would be playing in silence. Also, you would be receiving owl messages as you finish a quest and are listening to the end dialogue between the characters, meaning you would be hearing the owl message and the quest dialogue at the same time. I believe those things will get fixed in the future.

author: TheLark
review: -- I feel like there is so much wasted potential in this game . +++ Graphic is awesome , sound .. just *muah* !- Gameplay ... kinda meh : spam dodge , block , cast spells - repeat , get lvl 20-ish , you get even more overpowerd from talents , and not in the good way , you are just hard-er to kill .Some spells combos are very funny .. the first few times . - Grinding supreme . Almost every fight/search/gather feels the same .- Your spells don`t rly change , you don`t "learn" nothing from using them , swish - swash congrats you know the spell , no matter if you use it 1000 times or 1~3 its still the same , so RPG elements are out of the door .- Story - absent , like meybe 10-15 minute read , or 5 minute narrate. Totally shallow.- Choices .. oh boy ,... NONE ! (ok , right you can choose to learn/use the unforgettables but NOTHING CHANGES ! ) , you can be a bastard , or a goody two shoes but in the end every quest has the  same end , every cut-scene , just the voice-over is different in it and that`s that - Probably close to 0 , or worse , replay value , i started new game in different house , 30 min         in i was bored AF .Conclusion:    The price tag for such an experience is too much .It's just not worth it .   A very-very-very wasted potential.   On sale : ok , worth like 15~20$ , max.

author: Twitch Ladstra
review: The Harry Potter franchise/world has always been a little lower in my top 10 series of all time, so when this game was announced I was excited, but not going crazy and feral over it. But after playing it, and expecting not too much, I can safely say this is one of the best gaming experiences I have ever had, especially in a single player game.The world design, graphics, puzzles, story, voice acting, music all gets a 10/10, this game is a fantastic game. Obviously no game is the perfect masterpiece, and my only negative things to say would be PC optimisation, lack of originality in cosmetics, lack of interaction between NPCs, objects, food, non interactive buildings while in the vivariums and lack of customisation in room of requirement.But! These do not at all take away from the game, story or fun you can have in this amazing world. I was absolutely surprised by the insane amount of detail everywhere, the staircase creating itself as you walk up it in hogwarts, the puzzles that lead to secret rooms, being able to fly almost everywhere. When the game runs without lagging, it is so smooth, magical and breath taking.

author: TimmyProves420
review: Simply incredible....I'm not a Harry Potter fan, since I never really pay attention to any of the movies but this game really got me hooked from the start. I really love the world, it's gorgeous and you can explore anywhere you want. Don't really pay attention to the music, but it compliment the game atmosphere perfectly. The combat is really good. I never play a bad character on a game before, but here since they give us the option to use the 3 unforgivable curses I just couldn't resist. It's basically like other WB's game, attack and parry with combos, but the spells and the flourish when casting it makes it special. Now the story is the weakest part of the game in my opinion. They don't really show the bad guys nor tell what is their motivation behind why they are doing what they are doing. It's a shame really, and could be more flashed out more. The side quest with other Hogwarts student are more engaging and interesting. What I'm disappointed at is that it feels like they kinda push an agenda for LGBT. If you play it you'll know what I'm talking about. Where I come from, this kind of ♥♥♥♥ is whack, and take me out of an authentic 19th century wizarding world experience.Overall very good game and you should play it8.5/10P.S Don't shy away from the dark arts, it one of the reason this game is so good

author: Jonko Wick
review: What a lovely game, if only the developers lived it up to it's potential.Let me get this out of the way first, the game is fun, it's extremely detailed and I can walk around hogwarts for hours just looking around without getting bored.Although, the game is way too easy, I played it on the most difficult setting and I think I only died 3 times in my entire playthrough (two of them were misjudging a jump and falling to my death). Using unforgivable curses are foreshadowed the entire game as UNFORGIVING and yet I can cast all three of them in succession and avada kadavra 5 people at once in front of teachers and they'll compliment me for my achievement....Your actions don't have consequences, you can either be overly nice or a ♥♥♥♥ to people and no matter how much of a ♥♥♥♥ you are people will end up adoring you. That's the entire evil/good part of the game.The voice acting is at points so horrendous that I ended up not really caring for all the sidequests anymore.There are WAY TOO MANY puzzles that don't feel worth doing and are just repetitive chores.There are no new spells made for this game, there is no ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ quidditch (NO ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ QUIDDITCH??!?!?! REALLY?!?), there is no morality system, there are only a few plants and potions to craft. The main story is just a same old ''chosen one'' story and doesn't really do anything to stand out. Overall the game just seems to not live up to it's potential and feels like the developers just tried to play it as safe as possible....Despite all of this (and forcing myself through the last 3 main quests of the game) I still manage to enjoy the game, nothing beats flying around on a broom or managing to chain avada kadavra to multiple enemies at once. Playing the game just keeps reminding me of all the potential the game had and that makes me sad.

Avalanche Software has done it — the comfort, the nostalgia, the freshness, the thrill — everything in Hogwarts Legacy emulsifies together to create a celebration of what the Wizarding World is and what the fans have always dreamed of. author: Strawberry Rose
review: I *love* this game. It's beautiful, combat is so much fun (various difficulty levels if you find it too easy or too hard), flying is fantastic, spells work really well, the story is marvelous. They mostly did a great job with fabrics (EXCEPT for capes. I don't like how those move at all. Stick with coats). There are characters I honestly care about who have stories I care about. No, not everyone is like that. And it's subjective. The world is MUCH bigger than I expected. I just expected Hogwarts and Hogsmeade. It's WAY beyond those two. There's a few things I'm sad about: Houses don't really matter in some regards, such as not having to use your bed to go to bed or advance time to night or day (which could have been done in ADDITION to being able to just use the map); There aren't really any morality issues if you use evil spells on another student in front of people (or if you break into someone's house in front of the entire town). But those are mostly minor and could be changed with a patch if they wish to go that route. There is so MUCH to do and explore. I've barely touched on things. Yes, you WILL get to mess with plants. Yes, you WILL get to deal with magical creatures. They do a pretty good job on touching on all the subjects.CON: I run after centaurs shouting "BE MY FRIEND!" and they ignore me ;_; I'll hug a puffskein insteadOf note, I run this game on medium settings. Even that tends to make my office area and computer pretty hot. And I'm not on an ancient machine. It is VERY demanding. But even on lower settings, it's absolutely beautiful.

author: Kud
review: By Merlin's Beard!!I was really excited on playing this game since I heard and saw trailers years ago. After getting the game, I was very impress on the world and roaming around Hogwarts. The castle is created really beautifully and get to explore the whole castle really which is fantastic. The story of Hogwarts Legacy is good enough of a plot as a student starting at the 5th year that needs to catch up for beginning late while discovering the special ancient magic the main character is gifted with. There is also plenty of side story or relationship story (not in a romantic way kinda sadly) where we do quest from other fellow classmates of Hogwarts with some like Sebastian and Poppy having more story quest that are also at the main quest. I pre-odored the game with the 3 day early access and had bad performance issues playing the game all throughout my gameplay most of the time. Patches will mostly will fix that issue but besides that including the dialogue character saying the word Merlin plenty of times, I really enjoyed the game and exploring the world that really feels like I am exploring the school of Hogwarts which the developers did a fantastic job.

author: Unitard AB
review: Yes it has it's flaws.. But it doesn't cut away from the absolute beauty of a game.If you play to nitpick, you won't enjoy it what so ever.If you play to be a student at Hogwarts- I gamble you will enjoy it.55+ hours in and I've not even finished all collections because I keep getting sidetracked. There's so much to do to keep the competitionist entertained for a good while (me, I am the completitionist). And the combat system is fun and engaging, keeping you somewhat in the zone when you need to use different schools of spells. While I wish the main story was waaaaaaay longer and more intricate, I'm still satisfied with the ending and how I got to play it all out.Moral of the dumb story:recommended for the hogwarts fan, not for the person looking for an open world with amazing graphics and story.

author: Sixelared
review: I was not sure what to think of this game because my expectations have not been met lately with AAA games. However, it offers a nostalgic experience while introducing more secrets that Hogwarts has to offer. I thoroughly enjoy this game and it has shown me that not all hope is lost. With that said, I have come across a few minor bugs here and there but this could easily be fixed with a patch or two. I play this game on my PC and my steam deck. It is relatively playable on the steam deck but my PC is where I go to enjoy the full detail and ambiance.Brooms are fun btw.

author: Caffeinated Quill
review: Coming from an avid reader and gamer who hated wizards when she was a kid and thus knows very little of Harry Potter:This game is even fun for people who have never read or cared about HP (me, I'm people.)They left things around the world for you to pick up and read from to get the lore. You can eavesdrop on classmates and enemies to get context clues, and side missions and extra conversations with professors and colleagues bring me to a world I've personally never been in before and never cared about till now.I tested it on easy, normal, and hard, and the combat is really fun in all 3. I tried to test the random dialogue ticks your character does when trying to figure out something. I think it happens no matter what but I'm not 100% sure. If it does, I do wish we as the player were trusted to figure out the puzzles, but on my time spent in hard mode, I didn't think to pay attention to see if that dialogue happened. I personally wish there were levels to the mini games. I read a LOT of people that were happy the lock mechanic is the same for all 3 levels but I feel it's tedious BECAUSE it's the same. But that's personal preference, but I do notice that across the board. Let me catch ALL animals! I want a pet rat <:3)~~~There's a mod for both spiders and to make the floo lady stfu. Thank me later.

author: Ravial
review: A genuinely good, well-made game. I am not interested in Harry Potter much at all, but the game isn't the books or movies.The mechanics, the atmospherics and especially the combat feel very satisfying and immersive. Story leading is pretty good, though some events and "friendships" you make are sudden, seemingly out of nowhere, and very fast-tracked.The story in itself is good. It is engaging from the beginning, it shows you a mystery that you want to solve and learn where the clues lead. You live a life of a student of magic and, while attending classes part is very hand-waved, it still feels as if you actually -are- a student. The only strong criticism I may have is that the game doesn't care about whether you're a morally good or bad person. It doesn't punish or reward you for choosing either path, or even for using forbidden magic. Some NPC next to which you use an Unforgivable Curse may comment "You shouldn't use Dark Magic!" but that's about it. However, I think the story is meant to be linear- it's meant to be like a book or a movie you're watching. In this way, the game does it well.Overall, kudos to all developers of this game!

author: thewilddj
review: Not a Harry Potter fan. Jumped in as it seemed like a decent RPG. Boy was i wrong.Its a GREAT RPG in a Hogwarts world. The combat, visuals, sound, environment is all amazing! The story and puzzles are satisfying and you can feel the world and the magic as you play and explore. BUT! Im not going to go on about how good it as that's most reviews here. MY ONE GRIPE WITH THIS is you cant be evil. Like imagine a 2nd play through. The elder magic has 2 sides where some try to turn you evil. Be a student and hide amongst the sheep. Sabotage, legit take over the Hogwarts world. New quests for the new found evil. Once unleashing the full potential of the dark arts go full Anakin Skywalker mode and raid the Hogwarts castle fighting the other students and the professors with an army of undead and other dark wizards and witches. The potential it could have would be amazing! Please bring something like this as a DLC10/10 for a f***ing great game0/10 cant go Anakin Skywalker mode on stupid Hufflepuff younglings

author: SNOW
review: Si amas el mundo creados por J.K.Rowling esto es algo que no te puedes perder. El poder descubrir y ver casi cada rincon de Hogwarts es una maravilla y un sueño hecho realidad para muchas de nosotros. Desde que nos vimos las peliculas de pequeños o nos leimos los primeros libros siempre soñamos con poder recorrer Hogwarts siendo mismisimos estudiantes  o poder recorrer sus alrededores como por ejemlo la estacion o el pubelo de Hogsmade o el el poder visitar el bosque proibido etc son tantas las maravillas satisfechas que solo por eso vale la pena adquiri este titulo. El apartado grafico esta realmente increible no es una revolucion grafica pero no se queda atras actualmente, el apartado sonoro no esta nada mal y la historia se pasa rapido y te mantiene enganchado hasta las ultimas horas de juego, si es cierto que algunos de nosotros nos hubiera gusta poder tomar decisones mas importante que afectaran al final del juego como poder cambiar el final dependiendo de si decides ser un mago malo o bueno, pero aun asi recomiendo encarecidamente este titulo. 10/10

author: astrix
review: I'm so impressed! It's wowing me still after 31 hours in 3-4 days. Story is intriguing, characters amazing and relatable and the world is very beautiful. Jam packed with sidequests, puzzles, plants, and enemies. Combat is fun and different and very fluid. The graphics is over the top on this one. Really like playing a pixar/disney movie. There are some issues with framerate on pc, but have not have any crashes or bugs.

author: BCSnowball
review: This is the game we have waited for. So far the Hogwarts experience is exactly what you'd hope for. Peeve's is amazing and they left so many references to the 7 books that it feels like you are really in the same universe as the boy who lived. You just have your own set of problems that set you on a wonderful adventure! Light your way! "Lumos" and see the magic.

author: Zylo
review: I'll preface by saying I'm a huge HP fan, but this could have been a whole new world with different spells, a different but equally mystifying castle, and I still would recommend it. The game really has it all from specializing in different forms of combat (herbology, potions, stealth, ect.) to tons of open world challenges to a great supporting cast of characters. The story so far as been so so, but I'm more playing for all the mysteries to solve in this beautiful world as well as the incredibly crisp combat. Top that off with a home base you can build in and customize to your liking with all sorts of crafting and animal raising and.... chef's kiss from me.

author: SaltSouls3
review: This is a wonderful animated series to provide an addition to the Wizarding World! However, your choices don't really matter and most of the time you are forced into the story direction. So I really wouldn't say this game is open-world or an RPG since the story is linear and the world is mostly locked until you complete the 10-hour tutorial. I'm pretty disappointed because they decided to go with a no-name main character and could have made this a wonderful experience! Instead, you're forced into your quest line and your decisions seem unimportant. It's like why not just have it be Harry Potter if the whole story-line is already going to be decided for you? I love Harry Potter and tried enjoying this game, but it just feels like I'm being pushed along a singular track and not rewarded for exploration unless it exploration in the form of a quest I've been Given.The times I did explore the map I was met with "Dungeons" that looked like they had potential only to be disappointed with a singular chest of loot and no story or enemies.I'll probably pick this up this summer to see if it's worth it, but doubt it. The structure of the game is just boring.

review: I really love this game. There are some small issues here and there from the game mechanics. Mostly has to do with swapping magic that I don't like, but that can easily be changed later during a patch. Overall I would definitely recommend playing this game if you love harry potter.

author: Deadroth
review: The very first hours were extremely satisfying and I kept lurking around castle for almost 10 hours straight. This is the only game I will probably finish all collectibles without pushing myself. Puzzles in castle are very well made and addicting. Combat is fun and absolutely not boring or way too easy. Side quests are full, rich, diverse and way better than main story. After getting my broom I was baffled how insanely large and full the world is. Music and sound effects are perfect, graphics is to this day the best I saw so far. This is the Red Dead Redemption 2 detailing and world quality. I almost never sprint in castle, only walk and enjoy every single corner thoroughly. Oh and there are like 0 bugs.But enough of praising. Personally I really hate main story levels, those shiny, boring zero interaction corridors full of same enemies and crappy puzzles reminds me of some of those boring corridors in God of War, that you just can't wait to finally get the hell out. Also almost every single student has very similar face, looks like everyone is everyones cousin.

author: Frenz183
review: Portkey Games, Hogwarts Legacy is an amazingly immersive game, filled with puzzles, quests and a captivating story. You will make friends along your journey who will accompany you through thick and thin. With a limitless open world experience, this game is definitly worth trying. Here is my rating for some of the game aspects:8.5 - Gameplay: Occasionnally can be tricky to maneuver due to the flexibility of the open world aspect and combat view, but this flexibility is also a nice addition and makes combat smooth and quick.7.5 - Storytelling: The game feels like it depends on storytelling. The score is lower due to this. It can be difficult to find a balance in these sorts of games, between doing immersive story quests, and exploring quietly in the open world. 10 - Graphics : This is a very competitive game in terms of graphics. With a good setup, this game looks amazing, even at medium settings. 10 - Inclusivity/Variety: WB Games's mission was for everyone to feel welcomed and at home in this magical world. And I think they did so in style. With trans representative characters, to a lesbian married couple. I feel very satisfied with the amount of subtle inclusivity in this game.7.5 - Audio: I wish there was more ambiance music or just a constant, more upbeat music to make exploring more fun and captivating. 9 - Continuity: Although one is not able to continue the story once it is finished, with one save, it is possible to try out different house choices outcomes using whole different saves, to experience Hogwarts Legacy at its fullest.

author: Didn't I Do It For You?
review: [Mostly Spoiler Free]This is probably the best Wizarding World game to have come out in a long time, which I'd definitely give it points for considering the last one I can remember is Lego Harry Potter. It sticks really well to the source material except for a couple things for game play reasons and the castle is amazing, but I can't recommend this game. The world is big, but when you go exploring it feels like it's pointlessly big. I'd find a cave, get ready to explore it, walk down 2 flights of stares only to find a dead end with a chest that has a pair of glasses in it that you're just going to sell. Most of the non-quest caves are like this except a few that have a puzzle that can instantly be solved by using the "Revelio" charm. It doesn't feel rewarding to go into these caves and explore.Your choices DO NOT MATTER at all, for a game that advertises about becoming the wizard you want to be it gives you very little wiggle room on the type of person you can become. If you're rude, nobody treats you differently. If you're nice, nobody treats you differently. In the end everybody treats you the same. The only choice that matters a little is what house you get sorted into because one or two side quests are different based on your house. There are no consequences at all for knowing the unforgivable curses, and your character remains acting like a nice proper little British boy while knowing how to use a curse that tortures people in horrific pain that requires malicious intent to cast.Here's something I can compliment though, the combat is pretty good. The spells are based on cool downs so you juggle the spells you have and it forces you to be creative with the way you fight, it also lets you interact with the environment while you're in combat in some areas.  The dark arts are especially fun, but once you learn them you just B-line to all of the spells that are considered "curses" to the game and become overpowered real quick, making any of the challenge that was once in the combat immediately vanish. Which would be fine if people cared about the unforgivable curses, but nobody bats an eye except for one off voice lines from followers. The story is okay, but I can't get into it without spoiling events so all I can really say is that I wish there were more choices to explore YOUR character and how they'd turn out in the end, but you stay one-note and so does every one else. I can't get invested into the characters because all they do is just serve roles to keep the plot going, you don't learn much about them. The side quests are way better than the main story, especially Sebastian Sallow's questline.There's not a lot of beasts, and you only find beasts for upgrade materials for your armor. You don't have to explore to find the beasts either, you get every single beast from quests (except one but it's super easy to get because it's every where.) Unless you're going for the breeding achievement where you breed them all you don't have to go out of your way to find them.Finally there's a huge lack in student activities, you barely spend any time in the classes or doing school activities. There's no quidditch, you do maybe one or two duels in the school and all of the classes are a five second cutscene that has no interaction at all. This game has a lot of potential to be great, it should've stayed in the works for just a little longer and had more polish.

author: GivingCri
review: NO STORY SPOILERSIt's a masterpiece. With an assumption: you have to be a Harry Potter fan (of the movies in particular).At first you're gonna cry. The way you actually feel Hogwarts it's unbelievable, truly magical. It's Hogwarts! I mean, the real thing, as in the movies and in the old games (to be precise, this one is an older version of the castle we're used to see). And it's Hogwarts with all of its mysteries and intrighi and possibilities and secret paths and its dark past. You look around you, amazed. And there's even the rest of the map: Hogsmeade, the Forbidden Forest, the woods, all the little villages, the dungeons.The castle looks and feel alive, for real. You can go ANYWHERE. Through every door, in every room, on every step. You can really explore Hogwarts like never before, you see more of the school than in all of the movies and the old games put together. It's incredible, for real. Heartwarming.This is what I was going to tell you before things changed, or rather, before they never did.When you experience the combat system for the first time it feels okay. Not great, not that bad. There's the Souls roll and the "Arkham" parry. There are many spells to use in combat, but the truth is that they're all just one spell per type, with different visual effects (so 4/5 actual spells). You can either "enjoy" the combat system just pressing buttons, or trying to create useful combos, but you have to trust me on this: it's gonna bore you in some hour, no matter what.After I beat the main quest I switched the difficulty to the Story mode to get the fights over quickly. There are ability trees sort of, but I didn't even put every point I got to unlock the upgrades, I just got 6/7 things that could actually get handy, and never levelled up anything else. I didn't even started 2 of the 5 ability trees.The quest system is a bit like Fable. You go 'round town and you hear somebody saying something like: "Where is my Kitty? I can't find her." and see the NPC with the quest icon on it, so you go there and talk, and you get the oldest stupidest quests that a game could ever give you.When I started the game I was happy for, finally, not being Harry Potter. But that's a lie, you are Harry Potter. You are the chosen one, you can see things others can't. Your magic is stronger than anybody's. You and you only can defeat "sto cazzo" and finally bring peace to the yadda yadda yadda. Every single NPC will constantly tell you how special you are and how unbelievably you did something. Oh, and they gonna talk to you like you're an absolute idiot ofc, 'cause this is a game for children, right? (Except is not, the majority of players is between 20 and 30. The first movie got released in 2001).The whole time in your first hours you look around you with heart shaped eyes, you can't think anything other than: "Wow! Will I be able to do that later?" and "What if I could do it? Maybe I will at some point, or after the end! Yeah, for sure"Things like: "Maybe when I'll find this, it will unlock the possibility to do that"; "Maybe I can't reach that point 'cause I don't have a [...] ..I will surely get there later, probably after [...]."Oh, and what if there is sea life? Can I see the giant octopus that lives in the lake?There will be the Room of Requirements? Will I be able to access it?There will be the Chamber of the Secrets? Will I be able to open it? There will be the basilisk? If I stay quiet, pressed against a wall, will I be able to hear some slither noise?The game is full of wonderies with extreme possibilities, with dungeons and puzzles and easter eggs and animals and plants and potions and ingredients and consumables and gears and skins. Yeah. But you know what?The answers are: no.You will never be able to do that.You will never reach that.You will never "solve" the thing that's a mystery, because there's nothing to solve. There's no mystery at all.The dungeons? One dungeon repeated over and over and over again.The puzzles? One puzzle repeated over and over AND OVER again.Gears/skins? One model with different materials and colours, and some "minor" ones that you're never gonna use except for the memes.And do you know what you do with all the animals, and all the plants and all the ingredients?The game it's just: "Well you know, collect them all.""Why is that?" You may ask."So you can brag about being able to reach 100% in the statistics""Oh. Don't I need them for anything else?""Ofc not! Now go and mak'em yours, tiger! You got this!"That's it.And this is true for every single icon on the map.It's Ubisoft. It's Assassin's Creed (the new ones), it's Far Cry. It's a map cleaner simulator. You got a big map with HUNDREDS of icons and, you know, just go there and ungrey them, unlock the icons on the map. Come on, collect them all.This is not real content, this is not quality, it's solely quantity. And it's without variants, it's without that something that pushes you to explore and unfold every inch of the map for completism.When you see one dungeon, one quest and one meter of the out-of-Hogwarts map, trust me, you've seen it all. That is the entire game right there.There is no Chamber of the Secrets.There is no mysterious, mythological creatures that lurks under the surface of the water (there's no underwater either, you can only swim in 2D).No snakes behind walls.Nothing to hope, to speculate.This is not a "realistic" simulation of what an actual magical world like the Harry Potter one could and should be.There is no THAT magic in the game.There is no RPG elements, there is no choice making. Oh wait, I haven't talked about this yet. Fine:The game makes you choose from various (two, it's always two) lines of dialog when someone asks you a question. Ok, but even in the main quest, in the MOST IMPORTANT MOMENTS of the MAIN QUEST, your choices are totally, completely, irrelevant. I'm not exaggerating this at all, I swear. The game wants you to think that you can have different stories, different endings maybe. At least SOMETHING, ANY THING different based on your lines of dialogue. LIKE EVERY OTHER SINGLE F*CKING GAME FFSDoesn't work here. No no. No matter. The game it's literally: "Yeah, ok, I know you said that, but you know what? Who cares? That's just your opinion. The story goes like this."Maybe you made a choice and wanted to kill someone? I mean, the game itself gave you the possibility. You killed the man, the game goes like: "Well... I know you thought you just killed him, you literally picked the option "I'll kill him myself" but to be totally honest... you didn't kill him. Sike. Sorry but you know... the story could not go in the direction we wanted if you actually did, so... He's alive! Have a nice day!"WHY THE F*CK DO YOU MAKE ME CHOOSE THEN?! DIO CANEYou really get immediately tired of this sh*t.You get tired of the animations, you get tired of the caves, you get tired of the literal three enemies, you get tired of your character's voice (that's even fn bugged if you change the pitch from the default one), you get tired of the one meter map copied and pasted for kilometers, you get tired of the fn broomstick, you get tired of the clunky and annoying and uselessly complex spells input system, tired of the combat system. Really, everything becomes just tedious in the end. And I'm saying all of this with 40 hours. 40 HOURS!!! Not 4000. Look at my other game times to get a comparison.I was screaming at start. I said, with tears in my eyes: "Fable. The new Fable".I was falling in love... And maybe I did at some point, maybe I fell.And as always in love, I fell not for the real person, but for my own vision of it, for my desire of what it could have been.But there is no such beauty, there's only disappointment.We all trust the illusion of love.But no matter how tender, how exquisite.A lie will remain a lie.In the end, as you all know, love can only lead to one thing.Pain.Go play Dark Souls, kids.

author: RoBoz
review: Hogwarts Legacy is everything that I ever wanted in a Harry Potter game (minus quidditch - but who knows!) and is one of the first games in recent history that has lived up to the hype surrounding it. The world is huge, the graphics are spectacular, the fighting mechanics are perfect, the gameplay has variety, and the voice acting is superb - it has continued to check all of the boxes for me.With that being said, this may be the best game I’ve ever played in my entire life and I cannot believe that I am saying that. Not only do I see hardly any flaws (except pc performance), but this game just continues to get better with each quest completed, each spell unlocked, and each new item looted. It’s spectacular and I honestly don’t know what to say - it just gives you that feeling very few games can give.Overall: 10/10 - my new favorite game of all-timeEdit:After beating the game, I was pretty underwhelmed by the main story and definitely cringed out by the ending. In most cases, this would cause me to really drop my rating for the game, but somehow this game is still a 10/10 for me. Perfect mechanics,beautiful graphics, and an awesome recreation of hogwarts. Well-done devs.

author: WildMoon
review: Family friendly game, tells a magical story in magical world. Pros:Combat is simple, but very satisfying and visualy represented extremely well.Alot of puzzles.Visual world design can only be described as magical, in some places it feels like you are in a Harry potter film.Story is interesting enough to keep you engaged in it.Cons:Combat gets repetive fast, when you unlock all spells, you will prety much fight all fights the same way.Puzzles are fun, but some of them are repeated way to many times specialy the merlin trial ones.Item visual design is awful without transmoging you apperance you will look in most cases like a mad clown.Game performance is not the greatest alot of stuttering and some visual glitches.The game offers a good story, satisfying combat and visualy stunning world, completing all story qeusts, sideqeusts and full world exploration gives you around 55-60 hours of gameplay (depending on how well you solve puzzles it might be much faster). Game is no dout a contender for GOTY and lets hope expansions or dlc's with more content will follow.

author: Mido_Elprince
review: In my personal opinion, I have thoroughly enjoyed playing this game and believe that it fulfills everything I have ever wanted in a Harry Potter game. The story is well-written, and the voice acting by non-player characters is exceptional. However, the player characters' voices do sound slightly robotic, likely due to the pitch, but this did not significantly detract from my gameplay experience. The combat system is engaging, but I would have appreciated more variety in the enemies we encounter. The game's depiction of Hogwarts and the surrounding world is incredibly detailed, and I have found myself getting lost in exploring the castle multiple times.Unfortunately, I do have a few criticisms of the game that I hope will be addressed in the future. For example, the lack of a photo mode and certain animation issues with foes such as the trolls who sometimes lag in completing their animations. Additionally, there is a noticeable lack of enemy variety, and I would have liked more school-focused missions and student life activities, such as Quidditch and Wizards Chess, to make the game feel more immersive.Despite these minor criticisms, I believe that Avalanche has done an outstanding job of bringing the Harry Potter universe to life through this game. I look forward to future developments, including potential downloadable content (DLC) or similar games exploring other parts of the wizarding world, such as Ilvermorny, Beauxbâtons, Durmstrang, or stories focused around the adults of the universe, such as Aurors or Unspeakables. I believe that many others would also enjoy playing these types of games.

author: Grand Fornicator Baron
review: The gameplay is fluid and fun. The story is interesting for the universe it is based in. The game looks good with or without RTX. There are a few lingering issues regarding stuttering and frame drop but future game and driver updates should hopefully address them soon. The world itself is massive. Hogwarts is fun to explore and the studio did a good job conveying the scale of the castle. There are a few easter eggs regarding locations that we encounter in the novels with dialogues as well.All in all - A fun game to sink a lot of hours into.

author: Leoh :)
review: Yes, this game have big FPS drops.Still, this is the only bad thing to say about it - and even this is totally fixable via patches in the future.Game feels awesome since the first second. It reminds me a lot of the 1st arc in Fable 1, where you are learning to be an adventurer in the Hero Academy. But with breath taking graphics and the powerful mythology of the HP series.Combat is really good. I follows the same template of the Batman Arkham francise utilizing auto-aim (which i am not a big fan). However, where it takes the challenge away with Auto-Aim, it gives with a really creative style of magic use during fights, including a parrying system.Attention to detail is another great point. You can clearly see that people took extra time to fit  seamlessly into the lore, honoring the books and at the same time expading it.I never take my time to write any reviews for the games i ow, but this one i think it trully deserves it.Recommend to anyone, for sure.

author: Bart
review: Good story line, beautiful graphics, the fight system isn't just button bashing and not too strict on timing either, didn't run into any bugs what-so-ever on release day. Took me a solid 40+ hours to finish the main quest and the obvious side quests. Very enjoyable, last time I got this invested in a game was with Oblivion. I hope they release a sequel.

Excellent visuals, fun game play, good ambience overall. Runs perfect on both my computer and my Steam Deck, which it is an excellent use case for.  Right off the bat I love that every bit of equipment is cosmetically unlocked as you acquire it to apply at any time so unlike most RPG's, you don't spend the first half of the game looking like you're playing dress up with garbage.  Speaking of being an RPG, so far there is definitely a fair share of fetch quests.  Buuuuut, they're fetch quests in Hogwarts, and you use fun bits of magic to complete them so it's not really that much of an issue with me.  People have talked about the lack of diversity in choosing your house and it's minimal impact on the game.  I can see that affecting replay value for sure.  That being said, I grew up with first, the books, I remember the waiting list at the school library, then the movies.  At the point in my life I am, working full time, married, children, I don't have a massive amount of time for gaming, and if I did, I'd be doing other things.  The lack of pressure I feel knowing I can't break this game making a stupid or rushed decision, is refreshing actually.  I can change what I want on the surface, but ultimately, I just get to enjoy playing through a story I enjoy, the way I would like to.  After playing through Elden Ring (excellent game don't get me wrong) with it's 19841749817 endings, dark story and visuals, and completely unforgiving "HAHA your playthrough is screwed now!" game play, I can certainly handle something that's not another souls like.  Speaking of game play.  The spells you learn come along fairly regularly and all I have so far, have some kind of utility.  I look forward to unlocking the optional spells to see if they change any dynamic of the game.  I enjoy how flashy everything you do seems to be, along with the music for ambience.  It makes even those mundane tasks like the fetch quests I mentioned enjoyable.  The puzzles, mixed with combat, kind of makes me feel reminiscent of the old Zelda games in a way, has some similar vibes at least.  I can certainly say I will enjoy going through Hogwarts Legacy.  Exactly what I think a Harry Potter game should be.

author: Reapdog
review: When I saw the game, I was sceptical, as I was not sure if it was going to be a flop or not, nevertheless, I ended up getting the Ultimate edition, as it was only 10$ more than base. After spending the first 2 days of the Early Access playing this game, it ended up exceeding my expectation by a long shot.Pros-The Combat system is tight, and allows you to attack enemies with fluidly, making it feel incredibly smooth-The main story is well told, and does not feel like its rushing in content.-You can use the 3 unforgivable curses in the game, one of which is the killing curse-You are able to brew potions, grow your own potion ingredients, care for animals and upgrade equipment-The ability to customise your wand-The ability to fly with a Broom or a Hippogriff-Lots of secrets, optional missions, and collectablesCons-There is currently no inbuilt multiplayer functionality, however there is already a mod in production for it.-You can't play Quidich-You being rude in the game [Evil], does not really affect the main story much.-Regardless of what House your in, the story does not change much at all.-You can't brew potions, use grow boxes, or tend to animals until half way through the story-The voices in the game are currently bugged [The pitch shifting is broken, so it sound roboticy]-The face tracking is scuffed-Once you have customised your wand, you can not edit it, or change it-The story can be beaten in one sitting, if you completely ignore side missions.OverallThe game is not perfect, far from it, however it is still a really good game! Despite the attempt to cancel the game because people on the internet are saying its  'Transphobic' and 'Supports J.K.Rowling', both of which is bollocks, its a very strong start to the year of good games, I'm happy to say that its on the right track to being a masterpiece in gaming today.

author: Lunk Drake
review: Wow!  I've played a lot of games over the years and this one stands out.  It is polished, very polished.  I'm not a huge Harry Potter fan, but I enjoyed the movies.  If you're into the fantasy RPG genre, this game is a must.  I'm only 5 hours in, but so far I'd compare it to games like The Witcher or Dragon Age.  There hasn't been a lot of combat yet, but I feel like I'm getting the whole "this is how to be a Wizard" introduction to the game still.Highly recommended.  This is how $60 games should be.

author: Shayba
review: My inner child is happy. Despite on Rowling's attempts to ruin this universe for the fanbase in the last few years, due to her extreme views that she constantly makes public, I hope people will focus instead on the team behind the game that actually put hundreds of hours to bring this universe alive in a virtual environment, and with great attention to detail. This game exceeded my expectations in more than one way.Of course there are some bugs and some visual issues, like with every other game out there. Don't let it get to you, just enjoy the game. I highly recommend for anyone to try it out! Especially to all the Potter heads.

author: Zubetx
review: This game has amazing visuals and the combat system is pretty good too. But this game is sold as a RPG and it has no RPG elements. You don't have choices in this game and you can't be a particular wizard either. Instead you're a wonderboy perfect, can do everything wizard that is always cheery and respectful.Oh, and how did they make learning new spells fun? Every time you're ready to learn a new spell you have to complete the most boring assignments to learn it. Either it is doing some combat feats or drinking multiple potions at the same time, throwing out some plants at the same time. It's so freaking tedious!And also what's up with the menu design? Navigate with a freaking pointer while its much faster to just press up or down. No sell all button while you have sell a LOT of gear.Yeah, they shower you with meaningless gear in this game, probably 99% of my play time was spent just changing gear for a green that is better then a legendary 4 drops later.There's more but ♥♥♥♥ listing everything. Also to be fair, good music and voice acting, although the voice acting doesn't really have to push itself when it comes to emotion.

author: TTV/Divuad
review: I have 47 hours into this game and I bought it just a few days ago. I'm barely at 30% completion and there's still SO MUCH more content that this game has to offer. I highly recommend this game to both Harry Potter fans and non Harry Potter fans alike. If you love Fantasy-Science Fiction and Open-World, then you'll absolutely love this game. It's the Harry Potter game that we've all been waiting for.This game literally offers EVERYTHING that would be a MUST-HAVE in the perfect Harry Potter game: open-world exploration, immersive game-world environment, beautiful and highly detailed game graphics, gripping and immersive story, flawless combat mechanics, crafting, gathering, in-depth dialogue system, interactive NPCs, dynamic game-world environment, dungeon diving, and of course BROOM FLYING! One of the main things I absolutely LOVE about this game is that every piece of gear can be trans-mogged. So for example, if you want a cloak with better stats to look like a cloak that you really like, you can do that. You can do the same to every piece of gear except for Wand Handles. Also, if you sell a piece of gear, it's design is permanently saved in the game's transmog memory.The game definitely takes a lot of inspiration from the Dark Souls Games and The Witcher III: The Wild Hunt as far as control mechanics and combat mechanics go. It also takes a little bit of inspiration from Monster Hunter as well. I would personally rate this game 10.5/10. This game is absolutely amazing!

author: Driko
review: Graphically the game is marvelous, but seems like the studio behind the game only put the artists/animators to work and forgot to put writers and programmers in the team.World interaction is minimal, NPC don't react to you throwing spells at them, nothing happens, not even screaming or falling in the ground, I mean games from ps1 have better npc reaction.If you cut down the collect-a-thon aspects, the total gameplay time would be reduced A LOT, alohomora is mostly used to collect some pieces of decorative furniture and clothing, but because the stats are usually poor, you could mostly skip this, unless you're want to have new skins.Chests feel unrewarding because the shops sell you legendary gear that would probably be better than anything you find.Wand designs are meh, but I could be ok with it, since I almost never notice them anyways because of how tiny their are in the third person view.It's called hogwarts legacy but you mostly are in the world flying around doing uninspired missions of fetch quests.The puzzles get old REAL fast, becoming tedious....I'm almost finished in the game...The world seems big but the majority of quests/pages/objetives are located in hogwarts/north of hogwarts and everything else  below hogwarts is mostly filler.There's not much interaction going on...potion making is just selecting the recipe, beast catching is cool the two or three times, but then becomes busy work, because you can only have 12 of them, while only being able to have 4 species. You unlock more vivariums later on but feels quite bad to unlock everything in the late game...it loses meaning.Combat is very good and fast paced, spell combinations are fun, the game really shines here.It seems to me that they cut A LOT of things in the game just to deliver the product faster, for example quests even if you select something that should be considered bad have NO CONSEQUENCES, with exception of a very few you receive the same rewards, etc.You can't kill innocent people...so there's not much sense in unforgivable curses except in the damage, or for the roleplay...But then again these have no consequences in the game.There's no quidditchThere's a bunch of delayed content for the sake of it (alohomora, broom access, mount access, beasts access)Classes in hogwarts are basically cutscenes and you just unlock a new spell, no interaction, no mini-games, nada.It's a fun game to chillax and collect things but it's not a RPG in the slighest way, there's not much progression, talents don't make that difference, choices don't matter.But credit where credit is due...graphics and combat are solid. Everything else just seems lazy.I recommend the game with a big discount and after they patched it to iron out the perfomance and bug issues (there's a lot of frame dips, stuttering and other bugs)

author: Matt
review: Quick review because i really dont want to do write a lot.  All of the below will be written on the fly:Overall - It's a good game.  I have almost zero interest in Harry Potter and I enjoyed it.However the combat can get very spongy, the enemies get very tanky towards the end of the game on normal.  I found no matter what I did for gear most enemies would 2-3 shot me due to how squishy I was -and I was always squishy.There's items you can make/brew but I didnt like not being able to brew/craft on the field.The main story is objectively boring and poorly told - it's mostly in exposition dumps and flash backs.  However the side quests especially the three main side characters and their missions are awesome and much much better than the main quest.While we're at it, my personal order for the quality of the side characters and their mission quest lines are:1)  Sebastian2)  Poppy3)  Nattiewith the main quest line being a far/distant 4th.  1 and 2 are very good - I loved Poppys character and Sebastian's story is absolutely amazing and very well told.  Nattie is good too but the main villain in her quest line I did not connect with.I liked the combat, I liked how the spells their combos made sense.  I enjoyed discovering great spell combos like ice+slice or lift+slam, etc.  It does get a little repetitive over time so take the opportunity to go invisible with spells/potions when you can and stealth kill when you can to get through battles faster.The world map is large but not empty nor is it filled with too much to do.Performance wise I am using a nvidia 3800 with 3600x, running at 1440p.  The game ran fine but every now and then especially when you use Revelio or however it's spelled the came would drop frames for a few seconds...down to about 15-25fps.  Really annoying.  Game would constantly build/rebuild shaders on start up as well.I beat the game, 100% the side quests at around 40-45 hours.  I really dont know if Steam is correct (46 hours) or in game 37 is correct.  I dont know why there's a 10 hour game, i assume the game isnt closing or something weird - so let's meet in the middle at 40-45 hours.Final score is 4 out of 5.  If you're a Harry Potter nut I guess you can give it 4.5 or 5 out of 5.  The weakest aspect is the main quest-line.  The game also assumes you know what's going on Lore wise, it does a poor job in my opinion teaching me about the game world.4 out of 5

author: Ziperx
review: - The voice acting is incredibly good- I got tears a few times, so I can safely say I got involved in the stories- The stories are very creative and I rushed through them because I wanted to know what was going to happen- Lots of puzzles, chests to loot, camps and dungeons to explore- Beautiful world even on the lowest settings, the castle itself is even more beautiful- A LOT of little things here and there that you would find in the movies/books and could recognize- Outfits are different for each houses which is nice- Cute animals (shiny system seems to be only affecting the skin)- Romance. Dont even try to deny it; we all want it. Hogwarts Mystery has it, so why not legacy?- Main story too short: I felt the main story was more of a side story and Sebastian story was more important. Although I absolutely loved this questline, I felt wronged that it was more meaningful, more depthful than the main story itself- Friendship. I only felt really bonding with Sebastian and Ominis. I did enjoy the company of Poppy and Natty, and Amit. But I feel only Sebastian got the depth we deserved. I wish there was more quests or little events here and there- Friendship2. On that note, why are we not allowed to bring friends in our adventure? It just feels odd that a (idk, 15yr old) would want to travel alone and face so many dangers alone.- Some events like halloween, christmas dance or parties/hangouts, etc. wouldve been immensely loved im sure. As well as quidditch (i dont really care for that part but its a bit odd its... not in the game)- NPCs felt empty. They dont talk, dont have names or schedules. Its nighttime and nobody is there, its like everyone vanished. I wanted to creep stalk people goddang it!- Speaking of night time... Since when, in HP, are we allowed to roam free in the castle or outside hm? Where are the prefects? Sure it couldve been annoying to finish collections, but again it just adds to the emptiness.- Honor? I did abuse the 3 unforgivable curses but why was there no consequences at all? No choices either except one at the end? :(- Classes: We are supposed to be a student but theres almost nothing tied to it. The system in place was good though, going to a class to unlock a spell and etc.- Potions/Ingredients: Became irrelevant very fast for me.If devs read the comments and come across here: You did an amazing job. I am being critical because it is my job to... Test video games for bugs and such so its in my nature. I really really loved the game. I know I seem to have a lot of negative points but... yeah. Since its open-world I tend to compare it to RDR2 or Skyrim, which both have about 150-200hrs of content even though the main story is short in Skyrim.I hope the mod community will pull through until you bring us DLCs or content. If not, I really hope you take care of those modders <3Pssst... dragon pets/mounts when?

author: admiralkymia
review: Worth your time. I warn you, I write his review toasted, but I have played a lot of video games; at least half as mush while toasted ( I know it's spelled wrong; shut the fust up). Look at the period AFTER the paren (like a gentlemen).I did not grow up with Harry Potter in my life. I was forced (asked kindly by my misses) to watch the movies on her birthday. It was OK. So, I bought this game because JK Rowling said she believes in something and all the people that said she believes in "something" + "everything I believe she means when she says this" got all pissey (and I was bored).But, honestly, I ended up having a really good time. Despite WB Games DELIBERATELY adding a little something, something to DELIBERATELY say F U to Ms. Rowling in it, early on. The game play is (relatively) solid, the story-telling is superb, the open-world element compliments the existing canon well. Again, only knowing that Harry Potter "exists," I was still able to enjoy it, and yea, verily, even get invested in the universe.The combat is so-so. But, I will admit, the last game I played (literally, the day before I launched this game for the first time, was God of War 2018 (an EXCEPTIONAL game, if you're interested). My first response to my friends after playing the combat was "This is Fragging EEEEEAAAASSSSYYYYY." But, again, God. Of. Gorram. War.Portkey and WB Games made an honest effort here, to be original, while fitting into, I guess, I beloved universe. And given WB Games not-so-good, but super well-intentioned version of Batman Origins, I will give this a huge Plus 1. Buy it. Play it. Enjoy it. I did, I don't even give a rat;s bunghole about Wizard Jesus.. er... Harry Pot Her.

author: ARGO
review: Is it a perfect game? No.Does it have its own issues? Definitely.There's, however, a difference between simple cashgrabs and projects like these where you can clearly see that there was a lot of time and effort put into it. They certainly did. You may not like a particular element or two or perhaps this game is not for you all together, but overall I think it's a great product. So many people were hyped and since we never really had a wizarding game on a similiar scale, they could have easily put way less care into all this, and people still would have praised them for it. Instead, as cheesy as it may sound, looks like they've put enough effort and love into this game and it shows. It also leaves room for further improvements, DLCs and so on.VIsuals are very nice and I think I was lucky because on GTX 1080ti (well, I do have two in a SLI but I'm quite sure sli is long dead) I can play it fairly comfortably and smoothly on a high preset of 1080p and personally I haven't encountered many technical issues.Stories, quests, everything else you can do- there's plenty. Map is quite big, the castle is of course really well made, I really enjoyed it. I just hope people realize it's a wizarding world, not a typical fantasy where every dungeon has to have hordes of rats, skeletons and exploding magic all over the place- one example would be the random treasure vaults you can find. I do enjoy they way they approached it. Crypts are often empty, quiet and I really enjoyed exploring them.As for most other gameplay elements and the direction they've taken- I enjoy it. But below is what I think does not work that well.NPC students around the castle are often staring into the void, not reacting to what you do, they are there to occupy the space and while they do make castle feel more alive, there's definitely a room for improvement.I'd like to see few more interesting enemies, too. And, of course, spells. All that could come with DLCs, we'll see.My biggest concern, however, is the world not reacting enough to our choices, in fact they don't matter that much if any. Cast Avada on someone while proffessor's around? No problem. Put on some creepy robes and wander around the castle while everyone's talking about your recent feats- great, we all know what you did but hey, here's a young student, go find their enchanted pants or something.I'd also enjoy way more school activities and some more dialogue options- with not so clear good/bad responses most of the time, or rather- not just them.But the true magic happens when you are on your own, you put the robe on, the hood on, you either wander the castle and solve puzzles or go into this world. I must admit that it feels great, it's raining, you got your hood on, it's getting dark, you pull out a wand and pop Lumos and walk slowly or somethin- I think moments like these capture the magic in this release.And my last point is- I'd love a more mature, darker world, but I understand what they need to do so it sells well and reaches various age groups, too.I think there is magic in this title, plenty of it. If there is some in you, then you can combine both and have a really enjoyable, magical experience.

review: It feels like this is the first game in a long time that feels like it was released as a proper finalised product. Its not even "perfect" I get some frame rate drop every now and again, but at least there aren't any  ridiculous game breaking bugs as of yet. What should be the norm has become a thing of shock and admiration; which is just the sad indication of where gaming is today.Aside from that, if you enjoyed the Harry Potter books and the movies, this will surely make you smile with feelings of nostalgia and adventure. There's lots to do, and lots to see.

author: Kog
review: The story-line is good but almost entirely linear, do not be fooled by the "multiple endings" claim, the amount of difference your dialog choices make is laughable.The combat is fun and somewhat challenging on hard in certain areas due to mob spam.Mob variety is lacking, you end up fighting the same guys over and over.Exploration is enjoyable for a while, however, a lot of the puzzles and dungeons are copy-paste.NPCs do not react to your actions making the world feel a little dead, if you're looking for that try RDR2.Lots of invisible walls preventing you from jumping over small walls and objects.The broom controls (at least on pc) are frustrating, although there is already a mod on nexus addressing this.Performance has steadily increased since early release, I now get 60fps in areas where i previously got 30fps with a 1080.All in, its a fun game, the castle is really fun to explore. However, the lack of impact your choices have and consequently the replayability is severely lacking. I would recommend waiting to buy on sale, or waiting for modders to expand the game.

It runs good most of the time but there are several and critic frame drops during gameplay, specially during cutscenes or during usage of the lumus spell.Cons:1. You cannot play quidditch, wizard chess, gobstones but you do have a lot of things to do;2. No coop or multiplayer of any kind;3. Limited dialogue/actions choices, even though you can follow a darker path, your character won't be exactly evil since most of the time your character will act like a kind person;4. Character has a robotic voice when you use a different voice pitch;

author: PotykaPal
review: Great game, it really gives you the Harry Potter vibe except you don't really think about Harry Potter, it is your journey, your magic adventure everything is about you. I love the game's atmosphere, the graphics are very good and the gameplay is phenomenal and there are great puzzles in it, great characters and good voice acting and the open word is very well done. I started the game on the hardest difficulty because I play everything on hard and it was (small) mistake, my first fight with mages in the Forbidden Forest wasn't a pleasent experience, they kicked my a@@, I didn't expect that it will be a "hard" game, far from a Dark Souls experience but it was very surprising but after a little practice it became much easier. Of course nothing is perfect, the game could be very repetitive, the enemies are not too diverse and there are some collecting quests which are sometimes could be very boring. My biggest problem that the game could be very CPU limited in some areas and it causes stutters which is not immerson breaking but could be a little annoying. My PC: Ryzen 7 5800X3D, 32GB 3600mhz CL18 ram, RTX 3080 12GB, 2TB SSD in 1440p can handle the game on Ultra and I can enable Ray Tracing if I use DLSS and I can recommend to everyone to replace the DLSS file to version 2.5.1 or 3.1.1. 8/10

author: Demy
review: Now that I have played for more than 100+ hours of the game I feel like I can give a fair review. Please do not judge me for playing a game based on a series I absolutely enjoy written by a person who I absolutely loath. Pros- Attention to detail. The game is beautiful, and a lot of attention went into details most people wouldn't notice.- Flying! Its my favour way to travel if I don’t take the floo network. You can see major locations indicated from your broom/mount. It also shows the smaller things that are not related to quests such as treasure caves, activities, etc.- the size of the area/map is very open world. I love being able to explore at any time instead of being locked to just 1 quest. - Plenty of puzzles with the cave systems to get treasures and coin. Makes me think on how to solve them and gives me a little brain teaser.- I love the room of requirements as you can customize it to how you like AND you can keep your beasts that you rescue there.- Quest line is interactive and adventurous but not in your face as you have the option to complete it when you want. Its still a vary interesting plot line.- Field Guide, this is a live saver as it has everything you need to know, and it also helps you keep track of additional progress. Plus gives you the rewards you receive when you complete a challenge.- Side characters/ other students who provide quests are interesting and relatable. Partnering up with your fellow students make for interesting conversations during the quest. It also helps there is a backup wand with you when you really need it. - Random characters that you don’t interact with are well designed as well. They go about their daily lives and when they are grouped with other characters its fun to listen to their conversations. My favourite one was when - GENDER INCLUSIVE!!! I love this, when creating your character, even if you are a female, you can still be labeled a wizard or vice versa. They also use they/them pronouns instead of gender pronouns. – I FINALLY GOT MY HOGWARTS LETTER!!!! Pro and a Con- Magic in the game is fun and enjoyable to use, however, the button control for this game might get annoying. In the beginning magic is very simple to use and the buttons are easy to manage. Later on in the game you have to select which spells you will use since you have more spells then spell slots. It can be tedious if you are exploring since you must switch between spells you can use for puzzles, fighting, etc.- Flying beasts/mounts. They are fun to fly with and are very beautiful. However, landing, taking them out to fly or putting them back in your inventory are a pain. Its best to fly with them high in the sky while you are expanding your map range but after that its best to use your broom or just use the floo network.- Beasts are very detailed and fun to chase when trying to rescue them. Feeding them and playing with them is also a lot of fun.   Some beast can be difficult to find such as the graphon - clothing/gear are very beautifully detailed and I like that you can change the look even if you are wearing something completely different for the offence perks. I am not a fan of how they like to clip through characters, how a lot of the clothing doesn’t have a set so its kinda like miss and matching the items until you found a decent look that works for your character and some of them are just ugly.- The merlin trials are fun and very interactive. sometimes they can be a bit glitchy though. My least favourite one are Cons- I get the game is new but there are some major bugs (they are working to fix a lot of them). The quest regarding Save the Biscuit has a major bug at this time of the review.  - Graphics card heavy. I had to uninstall quite a few games and have the settings on low just to be able to play the game. I cannot run music or other applications in the background (discord) as the game will lag and stutter. - controls, I know there are the default control buttons but I have had to change most of them so that it is easier do magic and access my menu screens. Example: Inventory is L while I is Gear. I had to switch those around so I can access my inventory a bit better. (This is probably different from other users but this is what I had to do)– the loading screens can take quite a while to load so when I have to fast travel or enter a cave, or even load the game it can take a while before I can play again. (great if you need to hydrate or run to the washroom though). When the game is done loading there may be a lot of lag as the world reloads the new area you are in (this can also be very annoying since you just finished waiting and would like to continue to play).– items such as  money bags, or small things can clip beneath the ground and you can see the items when you use Revelio BUT  you cannot collect the items as they are unreachable.– Can’t sell potions or items collected from beasts. Hopefully this changes in the future.– once you have collected a lot of clothes, you typically try to sell the extra clothes to make room to collect more. I understand that the merlin trials help unlock more space but there should be additional slots.– instructions on how to use certain controls (did not find out you could change day from night or vise versa until I was 70% completed the game) or task Recommendations for the game (should the developers ever read my review)– better things to spend your coin with since once you buy all the major items you typically don’t buy things again unless they are clothes or a missing beast ingredient so you have coin sitting there– more beasts and space for said beasts like the Demiguise, Kelpie, Occamy, etc– a way to see if you are doing bad deeds or good deed (morality check)– space for additional spells and more spells like the Patronus charm (would be great to be able to use the Patronus you matched with), avis/Oppugno, Locomotor Mortis, Confundo– more variety of enemies to dual against, such as dementors, werewolves, Boggarts– underwater maps that you would need to use a spell to access since you would be underwater (bubblehead charm, gillyweed, etc)- make certain character dateable!!!!!!For those of you who have stuck around for my full review/recommendation, koodos. Thanks for reading! Hopefully this helps the developers and yourself if you are looking to buy the game. Please don’t boycott this game if you hate JK Rowling since she was not involved in this games creation/development. Even with some of the cons this game is still amazing to play and well worth the purchase.

author: GIGVanityX
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a great game overall, and I recommend it.  With some minor stipulations.  The character dialogue felt a bit poor overall and despite having moral options within the character you create they mean little to nothing aside from learning a couple of spells.  Some of the exploration items in the game can feel a bit redundant and some of the quests are still broken if you accidentally do something out of order while playing.  I do love how big the world is and how charming it can really be.  The Beast quests were my favorite ones aside from the "Dark Wizard" Quests.  Selecting my house was also a lot of fun.  Hufflepuff for Life!!  Although, I half considered if I should be a Slytherin near the end of the story due to the amount of fun I had acting like a Dark Wizard.  All in all.  The game is fun, and despite the lack of optimization out the gate I'm really glad I picked this one up.  STEAM DECK:  The performance is hit or miss depending on your perspective.  IF you are like me and have a hard time playing anything under 45-60 FPS than you might get headaches off and on and have to sacrifice the graphics.  I highly recommend user FSR 2.0 once you get in the game and set it for "Balanced" or "Performance".  I still get frame rate dips however, and sometimes I would get a fog glitch that makes the fog of a zone follow you around.  All the same, the game is still enjoyable on the Steam Deck.  Just be understanding of the experience this will allow for.

author: SkittyKat
review: Honest review, sort of spoilers? Probably nothing you haven't seen in trailers already.Pros:* You can pet every cat!* I actually really like the field guide aspect, I think it fits in so well with our story of starting as a fifth year and needing to catch up, I also love filling it up and the rewards system.* It's incredibly faithful to the source material, Peeves is as annoying as we all hoped.* All the little touches in the game are amazing and always unexpected, there's a suit of armour interaction I find hilarious whenever I'm passing.* The character of Sebastian is so compelling I'm helping him even though I'd planned to avoid anything Dark Arts related entirely.* For everyone complaining about JK, the developers worked very hard to show Hogwarts is home for everyone.It's the most diverse game I've played and I'm a big fan of Sirona the trans barmaid, I think she could be someone teenagers look up to and I hope to see her more in DLC or future games.* I've spent an unnecessary amount of time in The Room of Requirement, I love it, I love all the customizable options and I love finding more when I'm out and about in the world.* It is the game we all always wanted even if I do have a few gripes, there is no doubt the developers love the world as much as us.Cons:* Merlin trials, 90+ tedious puzzles, wouldn't have minded about 30 of them but when there's so many and they are so easy to do, It's just a slog to finish them.* Very few lessons, plants, potions and beasts, would have preferred a smaller world to have had a more in depth experience as a student.* I feel like I get attacked every minute or so outside of Hogwarts, and then enemies seem to just keep appearing so these battles take ages, I end up staying in the sky most of the time just to get ♥♥♥♥ done.* Female starting characters for some reason just look super weird compared to male characters, no idea why.* The spiders really freak me out but I think that's just a me problem.* The world outside of Hogwarts and Hogsmead feels less magical and more generic RPG, not a bad thing for most just a little disappointing for me. * No reason to use the common rooms. Can't sit, sleep, decorate etc I haven't finished it just yet, if it has a rubbish ending I will update, if not assume the ending is acceptable.

review: This game is a wonderful experience, as a Harry Potter fan and as a long time gamer, in all regards I can honestly say this game delivered, it really never made me think, "why am I playing this?" It was the contrary, I couldn't stop playing, without revealing too much, I'd like to just say, this game and all the mechanics in it, work, they just work, and all together, very well, there is never a moment where you think something could have been done better, I've heard complaints about the dialogue from some but I really can't say I noticed it, because I didn't, in my opinion, the dialogue was superb and a pleasure to listen to. If you're a gamer, if you're a Harry Potter fan, in any regard, to any extent, I can easily and without any question or doubt in my mind, recommend this game to you, it really is just so fun, a proper game through and through that is an absolute joy to play.
