author: Weary
review: The game is great, but I would wait for some serious updates before buying it. Below are a list of issues I have with the game. If you feel like this stuff wouldn't bother you to much, I highly recommend it.1) if you need help finding the place to buy combat seeds, it's north of Hogsmeade. The marker for the shop is conveniently blocked when you open the map. Scroll up a bit and you should find it. I had to look this up because shops don't appear until you zoom in on a town, and the default zoom has the marker blocked by the "world map" and "Hogwarts map" tabs at the top of the screen. Also, if you can't find the room of requirement on the hogwarts map, select the "Secret rooms" tab and it will show up. Not sure why it doesn't just show the floo. 2) The game does a terrible job of explaining things. The best example of this is the lock picking mini-game that should never have existed, and I wish you could turn off. You spin the wheels until the green and orange cogs start turning, then hold the position until the lock opens. Nowhere is this explained. It gives you the spell, throws you in the mini-game, then says "spin the wheels to open the lock" and that's it. I had to look it up since you can't exit the mini-game and there are no other indicators of what to do. Other stuff not explained listed below.- For the skeleton bridges, you have to stand on the marked platform for it to work. -If you hover over a quest, you can press F (Y on controller) to show it on the map-If you hover over an equipped item, you can press F (X on controller) to change the appearance of the item-There is a random chalkboard somewhere in Hogwarts that explains the triangular door puzzles-If you don't know how to do a combat challenge, look it up. There are a lot of interactions that are only explained through these such as trasfiguring an animagus back to a human or burring a spiders head in the dirt. These usually take huge chunks out of large enemies health bars and/or stun them and make them vulnerable.3)  the combat feels bad. It's not so bad when you have three of four enemies, but any more than that and you'll be spending more time dodging then casting. Not parrying by the way. The number of times a prompt hasn't shown and I lost half my health is absurd. It also wouldn't be so bad if spell switching wasn't so annoying. I'm playing on controller, so I have to hold RT and push a direction on the D-pad to change spells. Each direction has four spells slotted, and you swap between them. The problem is, RT is also basic cast AND held to spell cast. There have been COUNTLESS times when I'm try to change spells and accidentally cast something or vice versa. Then your stuck standing there staring at an enemy with a colored shield, who can't take damage until hit with a specific spell, while his friend comes in from off screen to chunk you for half your health bar. Because you know... missing prompts. 4) Summoners court is not fun, and it has more rounds than any of the other similar quests. Also, its faster to re-load your game than play it out if your going to lose. Something like this needs a re-start option for if you mess up. Especially when you can grab the wrong ball extremely easily if you aren't paying attention. I don't want to listen to npcs taunt me over and over on the worst thought out side quest in the game. I actively avoided this side quest until I had literally nothing left to do and still hated every minuet of it. Which was a lot of time because accio is not nearly accurate enough for this. Seriously take this side quest out. It will make the game better.Again, overall the game is fun, but I can't really recommend it since I've had situations where I've just had to put the game down in frustration and walk away due to stupid nonsense.

review: Fun Game, wish there was more customizability in terms of basic attack colour, broomless-travel, and a bit more feedback from the world when you use unforgivable curses or make evil decisions etc.Secondly, this game needs repeatable dungeons and coop to mess around in with friends.Other than that: Great Gameplay, decent immersion given my criticism.

author: Iolet
review: A must for every Harry Potter fan. Exploring Hogwarts on your own is the best thing ever since 1997 - for anyone in love with this franchise. Even for people who don't much care for it or don't know it, I would say it's a great opportunity to get to know the Wizarding World. It's great when, even after countless hours of play, you stumble upon another detail and location you know, but haven't found or explored yet. The story is engaging, the side quests are fun and entertaining. Characters are well written and the overall exerpience is immersive. Pretty sure other people have a lot to complain about, for me this game was worth every cent. Would buy again

author: Skeltor
review: If you've read Harry Potter books or at least watched the movies as a child, you must have been like damn... I wish I received an acceptance letter from Hogwarts... my life sucks... I am so sad... WELL BUCKLE UP ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, AN OWL JUST ARRIVED AND GUESS WHAT, IT BROUGHT A LETTER WITH YOUR NAME ON IT! Hogwarts in this game is so... organic.... it doesn't feel like npcs are walking oblivions trying their worst to convince you that you are not in fact in a video game, this feels like a living breathing world that is so magical and mysterious, I know, no ♥♥♥♥ but still; wherever you go in the main areas, it's just full of life, natural everyday life of wizards that is; you see people studying, laughing, being given a piece of mind by howlers, ♥♥♥ shooting firework spells during nighttime and laughing by the lakefront, the immersion in this game is insane! The combat system is also one of the stronger aspects of this game I must say! Only downside I can think of is that it is devouring my RAM and there's no quidditch, which I would gladly pay for as a dlc if they ever decide to release it but other than that it's just amazing! A must try, must have, must experience, must enjoy!

author: TPBnP
review: Lacks quality of life features.Lacks immersion - you can't sit, can't sleep, can't join the main hall dining table, don't have a schedule to keep up with.Puzzles are basically 'cast left-click three times'.Forces you to fulfill side quests and interact with characters you don't want to.Hogwarts itself is tiny.You can't have meaningful conversations with npcs.You can't have friends and spend time with them.You can't pet owls you encounter.You can kill. Nobody ever mentions this. As if it is normal for a 15-16 year old to routinely go hunt dark wizards.There are no house points on display, even if a professor says 'points to house', nothing changes.And last but not least - why does every professor treat the protagonist as a second coming of Merlin himself? They are almost licking the protag's boots.

review: if you read the books then you must play this game. I have been waiting for something like this for 15 years. My wife loves to say Im acting like a giggly school girl when Im playing/immersed in this world. It brings me back to my childhood and the great memories i have of staying up late reading harry potter. Internal bliss is the sensation i feel walking through the halls of hogwarts. HONEY BADGERS true and unafraid

author: ConCon
review: Story: The story had a massive build up and was really enjoyable, but it could not decide between daring drama or hilarity at each step, ultimately I found no major impact in the conclusion of the story. Especially since you only realize you're on the last major quest once you're already halfway through it. Albeit it was a enjoyable experience.Graphics: I liked the attention to detail in the world, the fact that you can experience all 4 seasons of it. I particularly loved Hogsmeade in winter snow, it was my favourite place to be during that time. The game looks fantastic and I could not fault it in a single way in that regard.Controls: Mostly this was okay, it was neither great and intuitive or lackluster. Flying on PC is not the easiest experience and running up and down stairs could be frustrating with camera angles and accidentally clipping the corner and bringing your character to an awkward halt. Combat controls however were very reactive and seemless feeling. I felt IN control with the battles I fought. The only mistakes were my own judgement in spell choice at certain times or opting to protego instead of dodge rolling. Gameplay: The gameplay loop consists of many narrative interactions with npcs in the world, puzzles scattered across the world to solve and lastly combat against a small variety of enemy types; dark wizards, goblins and then a odd assortment of beasts and monsters such as trolls, spiders, inferni and dugbogs. I do feel like the game presents you with your own choice of play, you could go off solving every puzzle or entirely ignore them, same with enemy groups, you can obliterate anyone in your path or actively avoid all combat and play stealthily. I liked having that choice and nonetheless I got lost in doing what every was thrown in my face next, because that will happen and you'll always have something to do until the very end of the game.Sound: I'm no sound expert and am probably a lot more easy going with these things but I found the sounds to be fitting and lively, though after a while I did turn the music down to 20%, though that may be personal preference. My only gripe is that sometimes you will hear certain lines from NPCs a little TOO much. Like from the floo flames lady.... "you wouldn't believe how difficult travel was before I invented floo powder..." can get a little overbearing. But in combat, sound was almost flawless. Overall it was immersive.Is the game fun?:Yes, I really enjoyed exploring the world and having collected everything in my challenges except for one bug blocking me out of the "rescue biscuit" quest. I had a wonderful experience. Once I figured out how to become powerful, I got lost in my absolute destruction of every enemy I encountered. I would recommend this game.

(MY CHARACTER IS SO ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ HOT ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ I WANT TO ♥♥♥♥ HER SO BAD UGGHHH UwU I LOVE THIS GAME 10/10 WILL DEFINITELY PLAY AGAIN)

author: lenciugas gaming
review: Great for casual gamers/HP Fans, not so great for more seasoned players expecting more depth. (7/10), no consequences for your actions, . Side quests are a bit mundane. And , you'd expect from the later books/films (think Deathly Hallows)Only a few 'dungeons' exist, which are all quest related. All scattered chests/caves are just: walk in > press to pick up 1 item > leave (No depth, no combat, no filler stories - compare to something like Skyrim/New Vegas where cave exploring feels a lot more rewarding)Combat could use more variety, but is still very enjoyable, visuals and attention to detail is very good. Puzzles are enjoyable as well.  - , unless later DLCs address described issues, to make the game more interesting.

author: Parry Hotter
review: The Good:Escapism - If you like the Harry Potter world this game is obviously for you.Music - The composers seemed to have studied John Williams style of music because the soundtrack is almost a perfect replica of that style. The music is absolutely wonderful and really gives this game a face-lift it needs to fill in the void.Combat - Surprisingly enjoyable and somewhat versatile.Detail - The developers put most of their work into the design of Hogwarts. The castle is massive and extremely detailedLore - If you're a fan of the books and/or movies there's quite a few homages and nods to the source material. A game made by fans for the fans.Side Quests - a mixed bag. Ideally doing the side quests helps to liven up what is, at this point, an empty world filled with people moving about in silence. The majority of NPC's won't interact with you (unless they are merchants, teachers or students). NPC personalities are mostly fleshed out, however, their involvement is temporary as some are merely catalysts in furthering the plot then before fading away among the backdrop of the school.Magical Creatures - Again, it's all about escapism and taking care of creatures can be fun for some while boring for others.Graphics - Atmospheric Ambience is what really makes the game shine. The vista are absolutely beautiful. When you get up and close to textures the fidelity begins to make the game look dated. Train tracks are, in some places, jagged as well as some tree branches. These simpler geometric shapes will probably help with fps performance. It's at this point one can tell that this is a console game first and foremost.Scripted Moments - They are fun to watch. Armored statues duking it out, ghosts having a spat, Peeves being Peeves, A student walking on a wall, etc. The only problem is that there needs to be more. As the year progresses we see the same scripted moments.The Bad:Story - The story starts out with a bang and then loses momentum. I'm not even half way through, however, so will have to refrain for judgement.Puzzles - If you're a completionist or like diving into the lore then some puzzles can be enjoyable. Puzzle difficulty is almost nonexistent. They serve more to have you explore the world in detail. Puzzle goals become repetitious. My only motivation for completing them was to help my character level up faster.The Ugly:Character - Your character is the least interesting thing in the game. The dialog is very basic (however, your nonverbal reactions to another character can look genuine). Your character has very little personality and his/her motivations are nonexistent. Your character's personal history is a complete mystery. The moment the game begins you're whisked off to adventure.As a 15 year old child/teenager you wield deadly power and can summon devastating spells butchering and torturing unsuspecting enemies (which are very one dimensional)... and yet those moral interactions/consequences have no weight in this world. By day you're a student at Hogwarts, attending classes with an uplifting montage of nostalgia. When you leave the school you're a deadly killing machine reminding yourself that "all roads lead to Hogsmeade" after having obliterated a group of poachers. It's such a stark contrast it breaks the immersion.Optimization - The game is still new as I write this so I can only imagine these issues get better. Currently It takes me many attempts to get the game to even work as it crashes constantly when the game boots up. For whatever reason I get better fps playing the game in native 4K than I do when I turn on DLSS. There's certainly plenty of room for improvement in performance.If you made it this far, thanks for reading.

author: CaSS
review: This is MY kind of game.Putting aside all the HP lore and ambience that I absolutely love since kid (and is a big plus for me), this is an exploration game. A game to relax and clear the mind after hours of stressfull "real-life".It is not a hard game by any means, even in the Hard difficult. Can be challenging sometimes but that makes it fun.Of course I have some critics. Nothing is perfect. And talking only about gameplay here, not technical performance issues (witch it has and a LOT right now), sometimes the game feels empty. I think that the interaction with other students should be a must. Now nothing happens if you try to cast a spell on a student. Just pick up and play Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix. You could jinx anyone and it was really fun.But in the end I think they created a very big and amazing world that can (and I hope it will) be improved in future DLC's.

author: Browork
review: Fantastic story with well written characters, and very satisfying combat. The main story at least.First let's look at the way the game runs... It runs (for me) really well without any major game breaking issues. Yes I did experience frame drops on cut scenes, and on very rare occasions in combat (but frankly it was never a serious issue). Played the game on the recommended settings for my hardware, which was basically the Ultra setting. That said there were many graphical glitches. Places the glare from the sun was too bright, or shone through a stone wall, and so on. Though nothing I'd call serious. To be honest it has been a long time since I had so few issues on a game just launched. It seems the modern trend is to shove it out the door half broke, and fix it with patches. That isn't this game, or I got extremely lucky and it was optimized well for my hardware/computer. With that said there is some aspects I would change/fix...Continuity on the side quests for one. For example I did not learn nor use any of the Unforgivable Curses in my first play through. Learning the Unforgivable Curses is a side quest. Yet I was constantly told by enemies I'm the student that has been tinkering in dark magic. My teachers hinted they had heard the same rumors. Plus one of my dialog options was "I regret I used Curcio on you." When I never used the curse on anyone nor even learned it for that matter. Another example is a side quest where you are asked to steal a Venomous Tentacula from someone. I choose not to steal it and completed the quest by giving them one of my own that I grow. Yet nearly every time I walked by Sirona after that they comment that they heard the guy was burglarized. How they were going to ignore rumors of my connection to the heist, or something to that effect. Even though I never stole the plant from them. Plus I can go on with three or four other examples of inconsistency in the side stories. However these are minor issues overall. A more serious issue to my thinking is simply your decisions do not matter. You can literally be a ♥♥♥♥ to everyone. Use dark magic left and right. In front of anyone you want. Stab all your friends and teachers in the back. Extort extra money for your "services" from everyone. Yet you are still praised as the hero in the end. The only difference is the dialog. In other words everyone seems to know of your exploits through rumors, but still praise you in the end. I think there is literally only one side mission that changes anything in the final outcome. That is because you turn them in, and I assume they were expelled from the school because of it among other things. Yet another character quickly jumps in to fill the dialog for the missing character in the later scenes. Therefore even that quest had no real effect. Finally I think the scaling is off. I played the game on Normal for all my characters. Enough to get 100% of the achievements in Steam. Roughly 1-30 was fine. It was a decent challenge with a reasonable risk of death. However at some point after 30 that changed. By the time I was 39 everything was so ridiculously easy it was pathetic. Only the last boss which was level 40 (with me being 39 at the time) managed to get my health below 80%. Still I wasn't in any real damage for death. Maybe I just got too good at the combat style. However more then likely the scaling was off.Overall...I really enjoyed the puzzles inside of the gameplay. They were a decent balance of difficulty and game play. Some of those puzzles really stomped me hard. Others I breezed through. The best advice I can give you is listen. All the side conversations and those options that are optional in dialog give you a more full and complete story of pretty much every character you interact with in game. Plus that information you gleam is used later. One such use is in a quiz style side puzzle/game that will be presented to you. It had me really racking my brain trying to remember while resisting the urge to just look up the answers on the internet. It has been a long time since I experienced that in any game. Normally I'm not invested in the story enough to care if I look up the answers. Yet this time I actually was invested enough in the main story that wanted to avoid cheating. That is the biggest praise I can give any game.

author: disparity8878
review: The performance issues aside, I"m going to focus on the actual game here. It's a Ubisoft openworld game in a Harry Potter wrapper. The quests are the same and completely forgettable. Instead of collecting 5 books, you'll be collecting 5 stones for the next one. The biggest hindrance being lifeless NPCs. No seriously, NPCs do not respond to you at all. You walk up to them, nothing. You cast a spell on them, nothing. It's as if you are walking through a pensive.  The side characters have zero emotion, it's as if the voice actors are simply reading their lines. The castle is well designed however, lots of attention to detail. The combat has a bit of depth to it and is fun. If a childhood dream is to simply walk through the halls of hogwarts, you'll like it. Do not expect a lively school, cause it ain't that at all.

author: FluffMamaTess
review: I love this game! The range of things you can do in this game is mind blowing. You feel like you are part of the Wizarding World. I have never played an RPG that would make me so obsessed in my life. Playing a game where you feel at home, cozy and at the same time challenging your moral ground while exploring a massive open world with tons of stories was the best start of 2023.Best bday gift I have ever got :)

author: Samri
review: The graphics are solid and beautiful. The audio (music and ambiance) are on point and perfect. The story is epic and rich. I've only had one bug with the chests when my inventory is full, beyond that, the game is amazing. The combat is diverse and fun. I love the flying on a broom. I love all the customization that you can do with everything, including your wand and broom and pets. Setting up the room of requirement for the first time was (sorry so cheesy) magical. It's a great game that I believe will have no trouble winning Game of the Year honors. I'm glad I bought it.

review: Any Harry Potter fan will adore this.  I also think non-Harry Potter fans will enjoy it.  It's a beautiful setting with tons to explore, great graphics, and fun combat.  Plenty to collect and a nice story (so far, I have not yet fully completed it).  Highly recommend to just about anyone that likes fantasy setting games!

author: Lemni
review: This review will get absolutely buried under the other 78+k reviews already posted, but that's okay. This game exceeded my expectations. I won't lie, I was skeptical this game wasn't going to match up to the hype, like several other games in the past, but I find myself actually addicted to this game. All I want to do is drop out of college and play.I can't help myself but to explore and discover as many details as possible. As a fan of the books and movies, seeing all of the magic and the easter eggs in a fitting environment in a video game feels refreshing and exciting. I'm taking my time to appreciate everything the devs created to give gamers a memorable experience - one that lets gamers feel like they're truly part of the wizarding world. I also really enjoy petting the cats, but their meows are a bit off putting. I barely have any hours in this game so far and that makes me more excited to see the rest as the story goes on.What makes the experience better is that there are not many bugs, at least that I have experienced myself or that have not broken the game. I did experience an issue when I updated my gpu's drivers where the game would not load, or took several minutes to load, but I simply reverted back to the previous driver and things started working as expected.

author: alvaroducas
review: Played 25 hrs so far, finished the main story in less than 5 days. Game runs just fine, storyline is good and you have plenty of things to do aside the main story. There's been a while since a game made me play so many hours. Graphics, gameplay and combat style reminds me of Star Wars Jedi Fallen Order so if you played that game and Harry Potter is a franchise you like this game might suit you for sure. I would have liked to play an online mode or coop mode, I think we will be seeing some story DLC later this year otherwise I don't think the game will make it as a possible GOTY at the end of the year

author: ML_ChadThunderC0ck
review: I'll preface this review by saying that before purchasing this game I had EXTREMELY low expectations for it, and am still not fully finished with the main quest. I've also enjoyed the HP series since I was a kid so a good Hogwarts game is something I've been wanting for quite some time now.Now for the review (organized in bullets because I'm lazy):- No Pausing for cut-scenes or dialogue. What the ACTUAL ****! You have no choice but to either skip these entirely or just let it play out. If I have to get up to go do something, I should at the very least be able to pause so I can choose whether to finish the dialogue or not. - World is lackluster. To be fair, there's a LOT of stuff to go do in the game. An overwhelming amount. I just wish there were more cool sights to see. After exploring the open world for a few hours at a time I find myself getting bored and playing something else for a bit.- Combat. Not too shabby, the effects are pretty good, and of course it feels pretty sweet being able to cast spells and what not. After a while everything feels a bit repetitive. After getting some levels, you do have the option of having different spell sets, even then I find myself only using one or two sets of the same spells over and over again.- Graphics are good. It isn't the most amazing looking game that I've seen come out of the recent years. It does look pretty great running it on maximum graphical settings but there's a MASSIVE caveat to this. This game is poorly optimized for AMD CPU architecture (at least I think that's what's happening). My PC should be able to steadily run this on Ultra at 1080p 60fps, however, in areas like Hogsmeade or Hogwarts itself, it absolutely CHUGS. I'm talking as low as 10fps in some instances. Now I understand this is loading an insane amount of textures almost seamlessly, but the magic of not having a loading screen behind doors is taken away almost completely with the massive valleys in performance.While I was expecting this game to release and be another AAA failure like CyberPunk, No Man's Sky, etc. It wasn't. There's plenty of things to do, as one of those people that run through the main questline as fast as possible and do the collectible stuff later, I still find myself getting distracted by side-missions and collectables. If you're looking for a good Harry Potter game, this is it. The world feels fairly developed for what it is, I just wish it didn' t have such a hefty price tag either. This review may end up getting edited as I continue my play through.

author: Sleepy Rat Squad
review: 8/10Overall I'm really enjoying the game, but some aspects are kind of meh. This is pretty much the game I've wished for since I was a kid reading the books. Just let me be a student at Hogwarts, and this game nails that and expands on it in great ways.THE WORLDAbsolutely perfect. Looks fantastic, is fund and beautiful to explore. The environment artists on this game knocked it out of the park. Seriously, they did an amazing job on the Castle and World.MAIN STORY LINEI am very much enjoying going through the main quests and side quests. There is decent storytelling and a good amount of variety in your quests. It's been very enjoyable going through these.PUZZLESMain gripes, there is not a lot of depth to the "puzzles" in the game. The tone of the game can lean on the more mature side, but the puzzles seem geared more towards kids. They are very basic to solve and often times I found myself overthinking something when trying to solve a puzzle. Often just missing a legend somewhere that tells you the missing info. They don't rely on clever ways to use your spells to solve something, it's more of just use this spell on everything to solve this puzzle. If you've played BOTW you'll know they take the abilities available to you and build elaborate puzzles around them. Not the case in this game. Most of the puzzle types you'll just end up doing the same thing over and over again to the point it gets boring and tedious.INTERFACEI have some issues with this. Potions and plants all require you to select them first, then deploy them. This leads to really clunky gameplay that is not fun. Most of the time I find myself avoiding using potions and plants as they are not smooth to use. Mounting your broom/flying mount should just be one button. I shouldn't have to bring up a menu to mount and dismount. This again leads to clunky gameplay that is frustrating at times when it doesn't need to be. These are really my only gripes, that and I need more spell hotbars - 4 is not enough. At least give me enough for every spell in my book so I'm not constantly switching out spells just to do one simple thing. Other than that, everything else is great.NAVIGATIONGreat so far. Running places, fast travel, flying mounts are all great. I found myself just sticking to the broom as it's quicker to mount/dismount/navigate  Granted I've only unlocked one flying upgrade for my broom so far, but I'm hoping the next ones improve on handling while flying. Flying on your broom kind of feels like a boat in the air. Turning, going up and down are kind of sluggish. I've just unlocked the flying creatures but I have found the broom more handy since it takes off, accelerates, and lands much smoother. This is a shame as the creatures should be an upgrade to using a broom in my opinion.COMBATCombat is pretty fun, it's great stringing together spell combos and blocking/dodging. It's a blast when you get the hang of it. My only gripe on combat is the limited spell hot bars leaves me using only two hot bars worth of spells for combat. This is not sufficient with the amount of spells in the game.CREATURES/CRAFTINGThese are areas in the game I really wish were expanded on. They're pretty basic when it comes to any kind of progression - it's very linear and not at all robust. Brewing potions is basic, there's only one version of potions, a huge missed opportunity to expand on that system in my opinion. Having plant quality, and potion quality levels would go a long way to help make this a more interesting system. Unlocking upgrades for stronger potions, etc. Same goes with the gear. It's pretty basic in that you get a new piece then upgrade it 4x. Most of the gear you come across you will sell immediately. It would be nice to have a more expanded system of upgrades and customization for your particular spell playstyle. Creatures are much the same way, only really scratch the surface of what should be possible with them. I feel like there is some depth there they can plumb to make that system more engaging and interesting. Catching them is also pretty disappointing. You use the same method for every type of creature you can craft. I would prefer having to use different methods for different creatures to add a bit more interest and challenge when it comes to catching them.Overall the game is solid and I'm glad I purchased it.EDIT: After finishing the main story and the bulk of the side quests, I'm kind of disappointed with the depth of things. I haven't even explored the map fully, and there's no real incentive to do so other than being a completionist. The "puzzles" and repetitive tasks you can do on the map get stale pretty quickly. And there's no real point in doing them once you've unlocked all the progression tasks. A real shame because it is a beautiful world to explore and be in, just need more interesting and rewarding things to do. A lot of the systems remained shallow with no real interesting mechanics. There are a ton of bandit camps on the map, that reward you with an item you can use to augment your gear. The problem with this system is 99% of those augments are useless. You can use the same augment on each piece of gear, which is nice, but it leads to really overpowered things like using the tier 3 plant upgrade, then throwing chomping cabbages everywhere. They melt everything. Really bland itemization at the end of the day.

author: Harley K. (Lyskari)
review: Though I've not yet completed the game, I have found that it keeps me coming back with the same level of excitement each and every day I get to play it. First I want to tackle the concerns about it being antisemetic. I know there has been allegations of anti-semetism, with specific focus on Goblins. The goblins feel like goblins, such as one would find in D&D or World of Warcraft. I know in the movies and books there have been problematic things, but so far I've not seen anything in this game that would be disrespectful, though as someone who is not Jewish, please do not take this to mean more than what it is. I cannot speak for a culture and people I do not belong to. (See also: I'm not saying it is antisemetic and I'm not saying it's not antisemetic. I'm just saying I, as someone outside the culture, do not see anything that makes me immediately think of the Jewish people when I interact or see the goblins.) Now for the gameplay! Perhaps one of my favourite things about this game is the fact it doesn't simply give me every tool right from the start. I like to complete what side-quests I can in between main story quests, just to ensure the pacing doesn't go too fast (and miss out on the fun of the side-quests). Even after hours of play I still don't have every single thing unlocked, and though I'm getting much closer with each set of quests, it feels brilliantly paced. The open world, though small according to the map size, still feels rather large because there are so many things to do and to enjoy. The controls feel very smooth and I don't find myself struggling to remember my keybinds as they were kind enough to provide little hints for those with their UI. Story wise it's very intriguing and it keeps me coming back because I want to know more, I want to know how it plays out which means I need to play it to know what happens! There is so much to do and it's so varied, and I feel they break things up really well. I'm also obsessed with the various puzzles. I find them just challenging enough to not be boring, but not so ridiculously challenging that I can't figure it out. With the exception being jump puzzles, so if you are weak at jump puzzles like me, those will suck a little but they definitely aren't the hardest ones I've come across. Just a bit frustrating. The voice acting is pretty strong, with my only complaint being that the player character with the feminine voice can sound a bit flat... not necessarily monotoned, just a bit too flat at times and a bit too calm considering the story the player character is going through. But it's a very mild gripe and it doesn't hinder my ability to enjoy the game at all. Mechanically, I love the combat system. I love it so much. There are so many ways you can mix and match your spells and there are other tools you can use as well that make it varied and fun to experiment with. It also feels relatively clean and smooth. It can get a little bit tricky when facing larger groups of combatants though, and the different shield types can be a little bit annoying to get used to fighting against. But once you figure it out, it can be reeeeaaaally smooth. Flying. Flying is pretty great. Smooth and simple to do. I hope that perhaps they'll release an expansion or something for quidditch, but I do see why they likely didn't include it in the game. Though the flying is fun and relatively smooth, I don't know how well it'd work with how quidditch plays. That said, they do have some activities you can use your flying for which makes it all the more enjoyable! There are some areas where they are a little too vague with their instruction but I find these to be very very very few and far between. Most times if you can't figure it out, if you just look around for some basic clues, you'll kind of piece things together. So needless to say if puzzles and riddles are not your thing, you maaaaaay hate some of the puzzles and riddles. But if puzzles and riddles are your thing, then this has a great selection of puzzles and riddles to enjoy! And lastly, the overall character designs. I really love how varied and diverse the side characters are! And that they actually play some important roles as side characters. It was cool to see. There is a lot of diversity in the game that I really appreciate (especially considering the issues with Rowling). So it was good to see the gaming company opting for that diversity and embracing it to the point that even the voice acting comes with a wealth of variety that seems to perfectly match the side character and where they come from. Now, don't mistake this to mean that everything is super authentic. I don't know if they are. I can't say. They aren't my cultures. But I do recognize the diversity they did bring and I applaud it and hope for even more in the future, with hopefully even more and more and more accuracy.

author: OccamAsylum
review: When I first heard about this game I wasn't excited for it. My expectations were rather low and I figured I would probably end up waiting for a deep sale before attempting to play this game. Then the controversy happened and I paid more attention to the development around this game. My curiosity was piqued and my interest in actually playing the game confirmed after watching ACG's review of it. I decided to pay full price for this game and give it a chance.I am happy to say my doubts were proven wrong. The sound in this game between effects and music is incredible. However, my biggest complaint is my characters voice. It almost sounds tinny and robotic. Hopefully that gets corrected in a patch.The graphics are good! Not amazing but very good. The weirdest thing would really be the facial animations.The combat and exploration is the best part of this game bar none. The spell combat is what really surprised me. I expected it to be boring and repetitive and it is anything but that. You can get creative with your approach to enemies and the encounters can be challenging in a satisfying way. The exploration is self explanatory. Getting to explore the castle and this world yields many rewarding surprises. If you have the funds and are on the fence, I suggest diving in and having a good time. You will not regret it. At the time of writing this review I am still less than 50% of the way through the quests.Edit:After finishing the game I will add that the ending was underwhelming to me. I had more fun with the rest of the content that built up to the end.

review: A truly immaculate adaptation of Hogwarts and the wizarding world! author: ZΣNAJ
review: I Like the game, it is a true product of love for any Harry Potter fan. It has beautiful aesthetics, a large open world to explore far beyond the school grounds and a lot of secrets to discover alongside people that need help. It offers quite a lot of versatility with the way one would like to dress up, experience the game and the path to follow.However while these things are there to keep you busy, there are a few things I must point out that make the entire Harry Potter feeling a little bit "off". First of all the setting, everything is "just a little bit different", there are a few points and locations that make it feel like hogwarts; however, in the long run the gameplay felt more like a fusion of harry potter with a bit of elden ring. Apart from that, I think the game suffers from not having a morality system. This is especially shown with the fact that unforgiveable spells can be casted back and forth like normal spells with no repercussions whatsoever. On top of this, the "friendships" you aquire through the game feel...hollow, you talk with some people and get to know them a little bit and help them along their problems. But it never gives off the old Harry Potter feeling of having friends with you that help you get through different missions and grow close with them. The only one I remotely felt this with, was with Sebastian. Then of course to get the obvious out of the way (at least at the current moment) there is no quidditch or multiplayer, I think it would also compliment the game if cooperative gameplay would be an option. On the topic of storytelling, I found that the story again felt like more of a story out of Lord of the Rings instead of a Harry Potter universe related one.Apart from these things, I still think that HP fans can have a really fun time with this game, the duelling feels incredibly smooth. The fact that you can finally jump on your own broom or other mount and just fly wherever you please is a treat if I've ever seen one. Concluding, the game is really good but I still believe that it has potential for so much more.

author: Nigerian child soldier
review: Game is alright, combat is really easy even on hard difficulty with health potions being so easy to use & cheap to acquire. Just got knocked to the ground 1 hit from death? Can use health pots while you can't move. Spells & fighting feels great but ends wayy too quickly, a simple combo kills most enemies. Main story is interesting but honestly kinda liked the side quests for unforgivable curses more. Good amount of content variety but not much depth to all of it, a lot of easy repetition for "challenges" to unlock things. Most challenges are entirely cosmetic rewards & don't look great.Overall like the game, even though very easy but I think that's mostly because it's Hogwarts. Only recommend spending this much on the game if you're a fan.Modders pleaaaase make it more fun soon

author: Velette Lei
review: 24 hours Playtime its time for me to drop my point of view about this lovely harry potter game in fact I am so in love with the game itself I am planning to purchase the deluxe edition for my Switch  (hopefully before the summertime as a preorder) anyhowThe World is absolutely stunning, lots to explore and see. It reminds me alot about the movies and the best part I can travel to hogsmeade at anytime to buy potion supplies or sell extra pieces of gear I dont need! Also another aspect I really happen to enjoy about this game is able to sneak about in some areas of the castle and be out past curfew without having to be on actual hogwarts grounds.A word about the boss fights as well I totally enjoy the mechanics they have came up with its a real challenge to block dodge and fire off spells to defeat enemies! a most unique combat system indeed!Second thing I have noticed within the steam community is the constant bashing of the performance, well let me just say I have cleared this issue up and the game runs like a dream for me I do not have the fps drop nor does the graphics look terrible for being on low. I had slow load times between travel but I disabled the "full screen optimizations" on the properties menu and i no longer have that problem and before you ask my game hasnt crashed on me at all since realese, overall I would recommend this game not only if your a harry potter fan but enjpy any type of game that has fantasy aspects.

author: D1vine-iwnl-
review: after 50 hours spent in the game, and being at last 2 quests, i gotta say that sad feelings are becoming to pour in because i' about to finish my first playthrough, when Witcher 3 came out i said no game will best it but Hogwarts Legacy is definitely in par with it. This is one hell of a great game, i absolutely love every bit of it and im not biased towards it if some1 thinks i'm just saying it cause i might've been growing up alongside Harry Potter movies and books. It's beautiful, well made game with interesting story and characters, love the "pokemon" system and the fact that there are shiny beasts (i do hope we will get more beasts and actual Phoenix den/spawn in the future). Also love that fact that we can partially play the role of "bad boy/girl" through learning unforgivable curses while they don't impact the final story outcome but still makes us feel badass cause characters do acknowledge and feel caution towards us IF we choose to learn those curses. I have tons of praises for this game and i absolutely love it. By far the best SP game i played since Witcher 3!

author: Reyks
review: This game is like a dream come true, it is exactly how I imagined an open world harry potter game to be like when I was a kid playing the good old PS1 Sorcerer's Stone and Chamber of Secrets.It replicates perfectly the fantasy of being a powerful wizard in the Harry Potter universe. I'm still processing the fact that such a game exists and I'm actually playing it on my computer, trust me it is THAT good, especially if you grew up watching the movies and playing the games.The closest thing I could compare this to is The Witcher 3, and that's not an exageration either, it really feels like the devs took quite a few notes from CD Projekt RED's RPG masterpiece, the level of care and attention to detail is insane.Unless something really mind-blowing comes out this is my Game of the Year.

Oh! and the most important thing, you'll find the most annoying character that will force themselves into your game experience(Trust me you won't need to thinking of interact with them, they'll force your hand to do that no matter what because if you don't, guess what? the story then won't proceed LOL. The copied-pasted map content is tolerable for me but this one annoying character almost make me want to quit playing and delete the game.

author: Pendyghast
review: Nostalgia is something that comes to mind when I play this and idc.Growing up I've always wanted a good "Harry Potter" game. BUT this is no HP game.When you we're little did you ever whittle branches in your yard into your own wand?Did you ever throw a vast array of edible and inedible ingredients into a bottle and say that you're making potions?How about dreaming of having your own hidden-in-plain-sight secret room?I love this game because it reminds me of those feelings.Being able to role-play as yourself as if you were a student in Hogwarts. The open world is fun, added to the novelty of finally riding your own broom, or catching shiny beasts.The combat is phenomenal too. The feel that you get when flicking your spells or combining them with other combat/utility spells, the fan girl in me is happy as can be.For me, I've always been looking for my comfort games, but with the wait on the new LoZ game, the novelty of being the newest (insert house name here) that can cast certain curses of the "Unforgivable" variety and the fun exploration, I feel that I have found the game that I've been waiting so long to play.

author: EJHowell
review: The game has a lot of good points and bad points, although I do believe that the good far out ways the bad.Visuals:The game looks amazing, even with me playing with a lot of settings on low and without ray-tracing enabled, although a brief look with ray-tracing was amazing. The world is largely interesting with places such as Hogwarts being magnificently well done, the castle is massive and sprawling and would take a long time to memorise your way around it. Spells/Combat:The selection of spells available is limited to around 26, though they do include all the spells that you'd actually want to use, in my time I never really thought of any other spell I'd like to have.This leads into the combat, which is good, if not a little repetitive, you need to use certain spells to break enemy shields, you can combo spells to juggle enemies and all the while you are building up a meter for some super strong attacks. The game does seemingly attempt to combat the repetitiveness by the inclusion of mini-challenges known as dueling feats. For example the game will say, hold enemies in the air for 10 seconds, or disarm an enemy and hit them with their own weapon. Little things that help to make each fight feel a tad more unique. The spells also see use outside of combat, be that for solving puzzles, destroying debris and spider webs or even allowing you to capture magical beasts.Story:The main story is good, not amazing but pretty good overall, I personally think it's better near the start and picks up again at the end. There are lots of interesting quests, such as sneaking into a castle and an illegal dog-fighting arena. Many of the side-quests are unique and interesting, some of the side characters, mainly Sebastian (a Slytherin student) has an excellent questline which to me is probably one of, if not the coolest and most interesting in the game. Overall, the character writing is very good and you really do come to like a lot of the cast. I will say, that the game often feels like you should be able to bring someone with you all the time, because sometimes on quests people, like Sebastian, will quip back and forth with you and make it more fun.The open world:The open world is a bit of a mixed bag, the game gives you relatively interesting ways to travel (by broom or on the back of flying creatures) so I never really got bored of the standard traversal. The world suffers from to much of the same thing, there are often so many random collectibles around that there is nearly always one on your minimap. These fall into a couple of categories, Merlin trials, which are a type of puzzle scattered throughout the world, there is various types of these which require different spells to solve and have a varyng level of difficulty. There are pages to be collected throughout, bandit camps to clear, catacombs to enter (though the catacombs are often very small), magical fragments to gather and more. There is almost too much in the world and none of it has a massive amount of depth to it, though they work well as distractions on your way from quest to quest.Gear:The gear system is probably one of the worst parts, you can apply appearances to make your gear look however you want but the gear itself consists of 6 items, head, face, hands, neck, back and outfit, all of these have offence and defence stats assigned to them. Gear can be upgraded to add offence or defence to it, as well as attaching enchantments to do things like increase spell damage or decrease damage from a given enemy type. Actually getting materials to upgrade is tedious and annoying as you harvest them from beasts you rescue, which then go on a timer that can be as long as 30 mins to get more.Customisation:You can choose from preset faces and hairstyles, altering colours etc, there are some scar options but they are limited to exact positions and colours. The clothing options for you character are pretty decent, though many of the facewear items I found to be rather poor, There are various unique clothing pieces that are unlocked through challenges, such as defeat 20 dark wizards.Overall:I'd recommend the game, and since I got it I've been struggling to put it down.

author: Crossiki
review: The more I play this game the more I fall in love with it! The story, characters, environment, and the attention to detail is amazing. I wasn't sure if I was going to be disappointed with it or not, but it was worth the price tag <3. Thank you game developers, artists, and story writers for this wonderful experience!

author: aidanrooney95
review: This is the game we've been waiting for.Hogwarts/Harry Potter fits the open world style game very well. Side missions, collectables, and many things that are boring in other open world games, feel interesting and fit well. I'm constantly getting distracted by them because of curiosity for the world you're in. This will be one of the few games i 100% and i think it will be the most enjoyable one to do it in.I recommend playing on hard.Only downsides after 11 hours are:- Flying broomstick feels too easy, but makes sense as it's made for transportation.  I'd love to be able to crash though.- Just released so optimisation isn't there yet.- Can't change characters name or appearance.- Changing outfit is annoying as the robe covers it so have to take it off and put it back on. A hide robe button would be niceQuidditch DLC and Quidditch multiplayer please.

author: Caesius
review: Just finished the game as Gryffindor after 75 hours. For the 3 other houses I stopped after the jackdaws mission. All 4 houses got a different story line at least till than. In my perspective they can easily make a book or film of this game.I enjoyed it very much and even I paid 49 euro for the presale deluxe edition it was worth every penny.The developers put in a lot of love in the game. Which you can see in the details.Furthermore, a flawless release for me for a AA game is ages ago.Though I have a minor bug for the saving Biscuit mission which results in not getting 100% completion or reaching level 40. I can live with that minor bug on release. In meanwhile there is a bug fix for the PC version. Although the characters can feel sometimes robotic the graphics where astonishing as is the story line. Combat system is a bit refreshing for me. Though drinking and creating potion is like The witcher 3.You wont regret it purchasing it at full price.

author: Steep
review: Hogwarts Legacy is beautiful. Yes, I realize that saying that is tainting the pudding by starting off with such a subjective statement such as I did, but I truly mean that in every definable definition of the word. Beautiful. The first thing that truly excited me, beyond the very premise of the game, was when I was asked to link my account with my old Pottermore account. Now I am not a stranger to every single online presence asking me to link accounts, and because of that I was already decidedly against doing such a thing, but the game promised me “special rewards” for doing so. I am glad I did.The story of the game revolves around the idea that there is an Ancient Magic that exists, but has been mostly forgotten. There are a select few Wizards that can see and use it, and you happen to be one of them. Because of this special trait, your professor and current escort to Hogwarts, Professor Fig takes notice, and you and he set off on an adventure trying to discover the secrets of this Ancient Magic. According to Steam I have played Hogwarts Legacy for 16 hours as of the writing of this post. I have discovered a rather sizable portion of what the castle has to offer, and some of the surrounding grounds, but I know I have barely scratched the surface of the game, and I am nowhere close to revealing all of it’s secrets. I am over level 20, but the story quests I am on are labeled as level 8 quests. This is not a problem however because all of the enemies scale with your gear and level. I think this is a great feature and promotes playing the game at your own pace. It is hard not to sing the praises of this game, as I had initially hoped that it would be good, but seeing as it was a game tied to a license, I wasn’t holding my breath. The depth and breadth of this game blow me away, and I cant wait to play more and continue my fifth year at Hogwarts!Read my full thoughts in my blog:

author: Callum
review: As a kid i was brought up on harry potter and this game just ticks all the boxes, from the mystery and wonder to the endless mini puzzles and quests. I believe core game is a 9/10 for me, i pick it up and struggle to put it down; and keep hoping for it to not end. The main quests are engaging with multiple plot points and endings, while side quests add the extra bit of lore; for the avid fans.Don't get me wrong the game has its flaws, it took me an hour or so to tweak the game on launch day to get it running with no stutter or FPS drops. I do not believe this is something we should have to do but it seems like all AAA games these days have some form of performance issues on release.In conclusion if you just want to sit back and immerse yourself in the world of witches,,, pick it up you wont regret it. Its just what i needed for a single player fantasy game.

author: UnicornXP
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a captivating and immersive game that will transport you into the universe of Harry Potter, allowing you to experience the wonder and excitement of attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. The game features breathtaking visuals and an enchanting soundtrack, an open world filled with fantastic beasts and hidden secrets, and the freedom to create your own unique character and shape your own story. With nods to the beloved franchise, the game evokes the same sense of wonder and excitement that made the original stories so magical. Hogwarts Legacy is a must-play game for Harry Potter fans and adventure game enthusiasts alike. So grab your wand, put on your robes, and get ready to embark on an unforgettable journey through the wizarding world!

author: oɴe cнυɴĸy вoι
review: Hogwarts Legacy is the best playable version of the wizarding world the franchise has seen to date. The world is charming and immersive, and a host of RPG elements, such as talent points and options to customise your character, add to the complexity of Hogwarts Legacy. Only the lack of a morality system that would influence the gameplay through choices of good or evil and the absence of a romantic relationship feature tarnish the gameplay experience somewhat. I sorely miss the latter in particular, as I immediately felt an attraction to some of the wonderfully animated magical creatures and could hardly wait to pursue this curiosity as the game progressed. Unfortunately, however, "Hogwarts Legacy" prevents me from kissing Deek on his hot lips, therefore 8/10.

author: Xirimbolo
review: Hogwarts Legacy provides a magical escape into a world that is perfect for those who need to unwind and relax. With its beautifully designed world, the game allows players to immerse themselves in a fantasy world where they can feel safe and at peace. For those with obsessions, introverts, or autism, the game can be an invaluable tool for escaping from the pressures of the real world. The game's secret rooms and hidden treasures add to the sense of exploration and discovery, making it a delight for players who love to uncover the unknown. Despite my lack of familiarity with the Harry Potter novels or movies, I have much loved the game.

author: F0nTastic
review: Truly UNIQUE experience and a must have for all Potter fans.It has great nods to almost all movies (including Fantastic Beasts).Saw some people complaining about the main story being too short but honestly, it felt great!The story is compelling and in between side quests and Main story you will have PLENTY to explore, get lost and overall enjoy the game and its stunning visuals! author: orangedoom13
review: Honestly not much of a Harry Potter enthusiast but just...wow. The development team who made this game were really committed to making something great. They have done a great job in adhering to the lore and ambiance of the fantastical world of Harry Potter and opening up our understanding of Hogwarts and the world around it. When first getting into a Hogwarts house you can tell the attention to detail straight away. When finally  getting on to later parts of the story and you are free to roam all over Hogwarts and the land about It left me with the feeling that my fever dreams of a good Harry potter game, that I believed I had played as a child, being able to see and interact with all the things that made the world so interesting.This game has  stunning visuals, a decant story and a wonderful world that I believe most of us have been curious about exploring at least a little bit. If you like, or are at least somewhat interested in, the Harry Potter world I would give this game a go(at least for the story and ambiance.)(SPOILERS BEYOND THIS POINT)Now If you are here for the gameplay and so on it is not all sunshine and rainbows. For at least the first 3-4 hours of the game, if you are not just always going straight for the main story quests, you will be just running all around Hogwarts and are unable to truly be free to explore the grounds around with your broom and griffin.(combat)The combat is a bit interesting with how it tries to “soft” auto lock onto enemies and so you will find yourself firing your spells at unintended targets. You can somewhat stun lock yourself in a “you can't do that right now” action in combat allowing enemies to get some hits in on you even when you do hit the deflect, or dodge at a perfect timing. This makes “hard” difficulty not only hard but near impossible in the beginning of the game when you only have one set of spells and no way to truly know when the cool down is done. This will make you unable to finish main quests to give you more spells and spell pools to begin with.I Would recommend easy or normal for the best experience in having a challenge but not an impossibility in combat.(story)Not going to actually go much into the story but there are many many cut scenes and some do go on for some time. Most of the interesting ones like seeing what actually goes on in class seem to be skipped over via a montage of how the class was going. There is a special quest for each Hogwarts house and you will need to play the game multiple times (or play and look it up later) to see all the game has to offer in this aspect.(side quests)So. Many. Side quests. The number one resource for experience to level up is the main story quests and side quests as the story will only progress with the main story quests there will also be an abundance of side quests that will pop up all over the map and just show up in your quest menu out of nowhere. If you are a completionist be very careful considering taking up the challenge. there it a 70+ hour investment in finding and completing everything.In short it is a passion project that we all could have used years ago and I'm glad we finally got it.

author: Cueban
review: Finally, after years of abuse of greedy publishers, we, the consumers get to enjoy a quality product!The crazy people actually went and done it. They made, and then sold a video game.This is like the golden age of gaming where you would buy a game and you play the game.None of this micro transactions bollocks that utterly ruins a game.No live services. - Excellent!Compelling story. - I'm enjoying it!Fun game play. - Yep, enjoying that too!Great exploration. - I'm a sucker for vistas, everything is stunning!Easy on the eyes. - This game, even on the lowest settings (my poor rig) is beautiful.Slight negative; the game did appear to be experiencing some optimising issues where frames drop significantly at points. It can be very distracting and off putting when it occurs. Given the quality of the rest of the game, I have no doubt that will get ironed out in time.If you're a Harry Potter fan, this is a great addition.

author: LAvA_Llama
review: This game is perfect for a completionist and story hunter. I have no shame in playing in 'story mode' as I'm mostly a cosy gamer and adore RP- but I have never experienced a game like this that truly reminds me of what it felt like to be a child. It is so incredibly alive and, even in the darkest times, there is a lighthearted atmosphere and sense of camaraderie that keeps you motivated to explore, learn and listen. (Mind you I am a lecturer and the least competitive gamer).Being a Huffelpuff with ADHD, it is in my nature to get distracted and immerse myself completely in the surroundings, getting blissfully lost in the magical world, where everything responds to my presence. There is whimsy and mystery around every corner, and it seems vast and endless- without the player feeling lonely or bored. Yes there are many things that can improve- the impact of your choices, potential co-op, some stale story plot points and pacing, some graphics performance stuff-  but so far this is the best game I have played...ever, I think? Taking it in slowly and savouring every moment. Well done Avalanche Software & WB, what a creative feat!

author: Cowboy!
review: This is easily the best game out released within the last 15 years. Exploration is wonderful, combat is brilliant, quests are fun. Anyone saying there are performance issues should get a better PC. I have not yet experienced a single bug, error, crash, stutter, or ...anything negative!!! For that ALONE, it is unique among the hordes of half-finished games that get pushed out by AAA companies (Looking at you, Electronic Arts and Activision), not to mention the clear effort and love put into this game.I had the same feelings playing this as when I played the original Starcraft on release day. I'm not used to having feelings anymore. Easily worth the price just for that! This is the first game I've paid $60 for that I felt actually deserved that and more!To the devs: I love you. If I ever meet you, I'm buying you drinks.

author: Balltastix_TV
review: Ever wanted to live out your wildest dreams as a witch or wizard... Well look no further than this game here. Not only are you a student at one of the most prestigious wizarding schools, but not a single rule applies to you! Curfew, what is that? Limitations on where to go, bah who needs 'em. and lastly unforgivable curses, completely forgivable. Want to play Quidditch? Believe it or not straight to Azkaban.As for the game play this was a well made and well thought-out game good job Dev. team! The movements were fluid and very well animated. Spell casting... oh the spell casting, smoother than butter on a freshly microwaved glass plate. I have enjoyed every hour I have played and will continue to enjoy this game until you know I get bored. Then DLC will release and ill pick it back up as we all will.

author: Solley
review: I want to rewrite this review based on my son laughing at my previous review. He was right. My initial review was based on having played much faster paced games more recently. HL does have a 'hold your hand' feel to it, and plenty of mechanics to help you solve riddles/puzzles, and couple take a little longer than others, but that is okay. The fight mechanics are great. While  I didn't really get into using all the mechanics available to you (e.g. herbology, potions) I still was able to complete every major task presented, and then some. Some of the recurring trials, Merlin, got a little old, same task different location. But all in all a good game for 113 hours of play.

author: DonnMa
review: Juego de mundo abierto que trae unas cuantas cosas innovadoras al mercado, al tratarse e inspirarse en la saga de Harry Potter, pero deja bastante que desear. Principales críticas que puedo hacer son las siguientes:-Como la gran mayoría de los juegos de mundo abierto, las misiones se vuelven muy repetitivas. -Carencia de especies y bestias para atrapar y "salvar"-Escaso uso de animaciones del personaje principal y NPC.-Sistema de batalla bastante entretenido pero muy sencillo-Economía muerta, es fácil hacer dinero pero tiene utilidad solo en early game-Sistema de pociones sin sentido, realmente no influye en gran medida usarlas o no en batalla y son muy pocas-No está disponible el "Quidditch" (hasta el momento)-Sistema de armaduras y vestimentas mal aplicadas. Es muy fácil obtenerlas y no supone un reto el "armar" tu personaje y conseguir así mejores estadísticas.A pesar de las críticas, aun así lo recomiendo. El mapa es medianamente grande, bonitos gráficos y ese toque mágico y misterioso propio de Hogwarts te atrapa. La historia es entretenida y hay un sinfín de misiones secundarias. El hecho de poder volar en una escoba merece jugarlo.

author: Taco Cat
review: Everything aside, this is a great game and it's totally worth buying at full price (after today's update, I'm getting a consistent 60 FPS, see specs below)The game is great - Combat is fun and sometimes challenging, the exploration pulls you in to a point that you almost forget you're not actually in Hogwarts. It's a solid game, besides the rocky PC launch.The story, I thought, was fantastic and really captured the atmosphere and vibe of the franchise. My only real complaint is the lack of consequences. I was really hoping this wouldn't be a fully linear story, and for the most part, it is. It would have been really cool if I really could create my adventure thru the decisions I made and spells I chose to use. Don't let that sway you tho, buy the game, enjoy the game - and don't forget to care for your magical creatures. SPECS: Ryzen 5 3600 with a 2070 Super and 16GB of RAM. I'm running the game on high settings with RTX off, and DLSS set to quality mode. I can run it on Ultra, but that starts to create some slight stuttering. I figure it's just my hardware but running on performance mode fixes it - I just don't like how performance looks.

author: Grimmy
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a game packed with everything a fan of the Harry potter books/movies would love! Anything from magical beasts to killing curses.In this review i'm gonna touch on multiple points where the game falls short and where it absolutely destroys the competition, so strap your seat belts! Let's start with pros and cons! Hogwarts legacy is a fantastic game if you're a pre-established gamer that is already a fan of the Harry potter universe!I'd also recommend this to anyone who enjoyed shadow of war/mordor, or loves collectables! IF you're luke-warm on slow-paced story-telling, don't enjoy fast paced combat or you're new to games, wait for a sale!Ultimately, i recommend this game!

author: Dux Imperius
review: Right off the bat- I need to address that I am in way too deep looking through the nostalgia glasses. I am incredibly biased, so just keep that in mind.Controversy- In my opinion, the game's backlash is incredibly shallow. I agree that JKR is incredibly bigoted, and that it's a huge shame she is so blind to a lot of important issues nowadays. But, that being said- the game developers have made something really special here. They have distanced themselves from her in every way possible. She had 0 input on the game- all she did was give a green light. They included a trans character (even though the setting is 1800's) in order to help fight the hate. Everyone that is hating on the game- is hating just to hate. They are blinded by it and are just grossly misled. I understand they are fighting for something important, but a lot of people are going about it in such a wrong way and it's incredibly discouraging. Tying a very real issue to something that has virtually no connection with the problematic person is daft. Incredibly dumb- but unfortunately it is how a lot of the world works today. The game is good- let it be good. JKR is problematic- let he be problematic away from Hogwarts Legacy. The developers have jumped through so many hoops in order to separate themselves from her- and their effort isn't being appreciated enough.Story telling- 7/10. Overall- I think the way this game tells stories is very good. It's not groundbreaking in any way, and absolutely not the best I've ever seen. But I will say there are a couple missions (side missions mind you) that pushed me to tears. Dialogue- 6/10. Paired with some of the animations, I think this is one of the games biggest weaknesses. The first word that comes to mind is basic. It tells the story, and gives you a basis to understand what's going on- and that's great. But more often than not, you find yourself rolling your eyes or knowing exactly how the conversation is going to play out as soon as they say the first few words- which means that even as a die hard Harry Potter fan- I found myself skipping dialogue on my first play through.Visuals- 7/10 overall.         -Performance: 3/10. On my mid level PC- not the best. Every single time I play, Loading new areas is incredibly difficult. I turned all graphics to the lowest setting, and still there are some pretty major stutters and loading times. For reference- I can run Cyberpunk on almost max graphics with zero stuttering issues- Yet it happens in this game around every 15 minutes.        -Graphics: 9/10. Due to performance issues, I'm having to run my game on the lowest possible graphics. Even with this- the game still looks great. I still have over 100 screenshots of the game enjoying how the game looks. I've seen gameplay of the highest graphics, and all of the praise in that aspect is completely deserved.        -Animations: 9/10. Spells, Running, Idle, Interactions... all of them are completely stellar. The spells feel fresh and satisfying to use. Seeing an enemy being flipped in the air by Flipendo, Seeing an enemy stiffen and fall like a statue instead of rag dolling due to Petrificus Totalus, The flames of Confringo or Incendio.... All of the spells in this game are beautiful and feel like home. The spells in the world of HP are fantastic and so great to see come to life with you as the caster. My only gripe on animations- Faces. Particularly NPC facial expressions are pretty outdated. basic rigging instead of motion capture. The rigging is still phenomenal- don't get me wrong. But rigging will never come close to motion capture and the age of Avalanche's technology on that front are beginning to show in this aspect.Completionist- This game is a very rich world to explore. I am always a sucker for open world games- and this one delivers on that front- even more than some of the greatest in my opinion. You constantly get pulled in so many different directions when playing. You could have a marker for a quest, you head for it- and see 15-20 other things in the way that catch your eye and before you know it, an hour passes and you forgot all about that quest. Some people see this as a gripe- But to me its a sign of a truly rich world. A place that feels alive. No matter how much you know about Harry Potter and the lore that went into every inch of the world and the game- If you enjoy open world RPG's, this is absolutely a must play. Loyal fans- This game is undoubtedly a love child of passion for every single developer that worked hard to give us this masterpiece. If you know ANYTHING about HP before playing, you will recognize it being represented in the game. Hundreds of references- coming from fantastic environmental storytelling. The more you enjoy HP and love the franchise- the more nostalgic you will feel playing the game. I promise if you even mildly enjoyed the movies/books- This game is a dream come true.Nostalgia- I am a die hard HP fan. I have been my entire life- My parents allowed me to go see midnight showings in middle school as long as I read the books beforehand. Harry Potter will always be very dear to me, I grew up with it. This game is undoubtedly an ode to that world. A beautiful experience I will cherish for the rest of my life, and show my kids when they can hold controllers. The more you enjoy HP- the more you will enjoy this game. I promise. It is a work of art and in my book, it is already one of my favorite games of all time.Replayability- The story is at least a little different with each house. Not to mention different dialogue options that give your character a different feel. I think it is definitely replayable, but not as much as some other open world games like Elden Ring or Shadow of War/Mordor. Room of Requirement/Vivarium- I really love what they did with this space in game. It is a very clever use of some basic gameplay mechanics in order to create a 'base' feeling area. With almost limitless potential, the game has for the most part delivered. You are rewarded for exploring the world with decorations and other fun bits to place around the RoR with almost complete freedom. It feels satisfying to see, and for me- is absolutely going to add an additional 100 hours of gameplay. It makes me want to find everything out in the overworld, in order to truly deck out my RoR.   The Vivarium is undoubtedly my most anticipated aspect of the game. Personally, I have always loved the beasts of the HP world and in the first gameplay trailer where they revealed the Vivarium and how it worked- I preordered the game before the video could end. I was incredibly hyped for what was possible. Being able to interact with these creatures is 100% a dream come true for me. All of that being said- I did find the vivarium to be at least a little disappointing. You are only allowed to have 4 different species in a space at a time. Granted you do unlock more spaces- still it feels bad to have to move between spaces in order to place down my creatures. I wanted to create a zoo. I imagined a walkway where I could look and see my creatures in little pens. I'd be satisfied with a way to connect the spaces eventually even. (I haven't completed the game- maybe that is a possibility but I doubt it.)Unlocking- I feel you unlock things very slowly. Having 43 hours in the game as I'm writing this- I unlocked my flying mount at around 40 hours in. A minor gripe- But unlocking most important convenience items would have been welcomed sooner into the story.There are only a few minor gripes I had about the game, and over 1000 great things I could say about it. If you're considering buying it- Do it. You will not regret it, I promise.

author: Cristy
review: Was debating whether getting this game now or on a sale. I'm also debating if I should buy a copy for every gender that exists.  The toxic transgender people* activists convinced me to to buy it now. I have my own, I'll buy the other for my friend.But, on a more serious note... It's crazy how well respecting the fans & source material along with avoiding pandering for woke points actually works. Who would've thought?Optimization wise, whew, it's quite rough... This game, unfortunately, isn't killing ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥... it's killing my graphics card. At moments the game just decides to follow the path of 51% of a certain minority and straight up commit suicide for a few seconds especially when loading new areas in the castle thus causing stutters. The game is very playable on my rig with DLSS but turning on Ray Tracing makes everything choppy and unplayable on video cards that aren't ranked at the top of the enthusiast price point...Graphics look pretty good and the atmosphere achieves what it intended. The OST is what it needs to be too. The story looks decent so far, a bit heavy on the dialogue but that isn't necessarily a bad thing. If you need to, you don't really have to pay attention to what's being said as the game is showing you most answers anyway. What I mean by that, though, is that the game likes to hold your hand and spoon-feed you the answer to every quest in the game through and through without the ability to turn off the way too generous hints.If you're a Harry Potter fan and the universe then this game is probably exactly what you've been looking for. Even for people like me that yes, I am not a hardcore harry potter fan but that doesn't make Hogwarts Legacy any less enjoyable, just make sure that your rig can run it alright..Also, YOU CAN PET CATS!Thumbs up as the LGBT Mafia copes & seethes;*really stretching the definition of the word "people"

author: Gtifighter
review: This game is absolutely brilliant and there is very little more to say.It has everything you could ever wish for in a good Harry Potter game.Yes, the gameplay is console-optimized, in ways that sometimes feel restricting for PC players.For example, you have a selection of 4 spells. Instead of giving you the option to add more spells to that selection, you have to unlock additional selections of 4 spells to switch between during combat, because that's all a console controller can handle. That's the only criticism I can come up with after +20h of gameplay.If you enjoy Harry Potter: play this gameIf you enjoy single player game: play this game.If you enjoy a mix of exploration with sidequests, combat, crafting and challenges: play this game.Really, this game is a  for me and it has my fullest recommendation!
