author: Leon_Lover94
review: This review may contain spoilers - read with caution~ooo~I'm currently sitting on just over 30 hours of actual gameplay and I think I'm about 4-5 quests away from completing the main storyline of the game. Now, I could wait till I have finished the main quest line before writing this review, but I doubt my opinions are going to change so why wait.To start, overall I've really enjoyed my experience thus far playing this game. It's not often I sink so many hours so quickly into a game. I've always been a massive fan of Harry Potter and the Wizarding world, so finally having the opportunity to fully immerse myself into that world felt like a dream. But unfortunately, the immersion I was hoping for just doesn't exist within Hogwarts Legacy...let me explain.Aesthetically, the game is beautiful; the castle is exciting to explore, the main village of Hogsmead feels just like it did in the books and movies, and the areas outside of the school feel fully fleshed out and interesting to explore. The characters of the main story feel interesting enough to hold the story together, although they did fall flat in some areas; in personality and motivational drive. The story itself is overwhelmingly short for a game that costs as much as it does, even if the game is inflated in other areas. The story should be able to hold down the price, not be boosted by the aesthetics and extra content in the game. I would expect at least another 10-15 hours of main quest game play for how much I paid for the game; which was just over $100 NZD for the deluxe edition.This game needed a morality system in my opinion because nothing that you do impacts the world and story at all. No decision you make, nor dialogue option you choose has a huge impact on the story and world around you; which was something that was promised in early trailers and teasers for the game. It was actually something I was looking forward to the most. But in Hogwarts Legacy, whether you make a good or a bad decision, the outcome is tragically the same. This means that the developers really only wanted to give you the facade that your decisions mattered when in reality you were just playing their story, and your decisions meant nothing at all.Outside of shop keepers and quests lines, you are unable to interact with the other npc's, teachers or your companions. This makes the world feel boring, empty and lifeless. Most of the npc's and students you walk past don't even talk to one another; you might see their mouth moving but no words are coming out. Instead the developers gave us the guise of "companions" that are dangled in front of our faces but then locked behind the main quest line or side quests. What is the point of pretending that we can have companions when they cannot accompany us on missions? And it's such a shame because a lot of the characters I've met while playing the game I really liked and wanted to know more about them, but simply wasn't able to. Characters like Ominis, Lenora, Sebastian and Poppy. It just feels like wasted potential.One thing I do enjoy about the game is the combat, I think they did a wonderful job translating the well known spells from the franchise into the game. I think they're easy to use, like most other RPG games tied to a button; and you can do a multitude of different combinations to find something that works well for you. I do think some spells like Alohamora shouldn't be locked behind a mandatory puzzle. It makes sense to do the puzzle the first time, but having to do it every time after that feels boring and repetitive. Not to mention that you then have to level it up twice more, putting in a lot of effort for very very little reward.To conclude, I do love this game, truly I do. It really brought the wizarding world to life (mostly), but it just falls flat where immersion and interaction is concerned. I'm hopeful that maybe things can be tweaked with future updates and DLC, which I have no doubt we can expect with how successful the game has been. If you enjoy open world RPG style games, even if you don't like Harry Potter I think you'll love this game.8.5/10

author: Nocturnal
review: TL;DR: It's not as good as the big three of The Witcher 3, Dragon Age Inquisition, or Skyrim, but it's still a damn good game! Highly recommend, even at full price. Read more for breakdown.===== What I liked =====- The Combat: So much damn fun, it's got a very unique feel.- Lovable Characters: All of the characters I've run into are awesome!- Slytherin Side Quest: You must complete this quest! It was fantastic.  - Music: It's really good, even the little jingles when you find something are amazing! - Room of Requirement: I love this concept, I hope they expand on it in coming games.  - The Sights: This game has a lot of breath taking moments and scenery.===== Things you should know =====- Limited Side Quests: Once you complete the main quest, there isn't much you can do. It's not packed with quality like TW3, DAI, or Skyrim. Not a bad thing tbh, means I can get my life back faster haha.- Weird Movement: When out of combat, jumping, running on uneven ground, and flying feel a bit unnatural. It's not a big deal. ===== What I didn't like ===== - Horrible Identical Side Quests: Most of the side quests given from random NPC's are shallow, repetitive, and brain numbing. This is not like TW3 where we are graced with side quests like "Wild at Heart". - Merlin Trials: Super boring, repetitive, and mind numbing. I can't believe we need to complete Merlin quests for more inventory.- Lock Picking: God I hate lock picking in this game. It's the worst of any game by FAR.- Extremely Linear: While the story was good, I won't be playing it six or seven times through like DAI or Skyrim. There is little to no change in the story regardless of what you do. - Slow: Damn, this game is so SLOW! Loading up, or fast travelling, it's so much slower than modern Assassin's Creed games. - Visual Glitches: Unloaded textures, wonky animations, broken side quests, nothing completely game breaking, but still a bit of a let down.- Restrictive Exploration: You can't explore nearly as much as you'd want, or at least, I couldn't.   - No Quidditch: What the heck is wrong with the dev team? ===== OVERALL ===== Solid game - 7.5/10 Unlike TW3 or DAI, your kids can play this! It's a fantastic game, and I can't wait for more content!P.S.: I don't even like Harry Potter, this game was just so much fun!

author: Not Max
review: Graphics:The graphics are amazing and true to the Harry Potter universe. The attention to detail is mind-blowing, from the castle of Hogwarts to the beautiful forests surrounding it. The characters are well designed and have a unique look to them. The creatures and creatures, like the dragons, centaurs and house elves, are also well designed and give a sense of wonder to the world.However, the graphics optimization is not the best. There have been reports of frame rate drops and some graphical glitches during play. This can be distracting and take away from the immersive experience of the game. Hopefully, future updates will address these issues.Music and Sound:The music in this game is fantastic and brings the world of Harry Potter to life. It captures the magic and wonder of the world and sets the tone for each scene. The sound effects are also well done and add to the immersion of the game. The spell casting sounds powerful and the creatures sound like they should.Verdict:Overall, despite its flaws with graphics optimization, Hogwarts Legacy is a fantastic game for fans of the Harry Potter universe. The story is well crafted and the world is beautifully designed. The gameplay is engaging and there are plenty of things to do and explore. If you are a fan of the Harry Potter series, this game is definitely worth checking out. However, if you are not a fan, it might not be for you. The game is also not without its issues it has quite bad fps optimizing and some few bugs (as expected on a new game), but the overall experience is still enjoyable.

author: Suniks
review: This game is great, yet almost perfect. The game has smooth and fun combat system that works great. You can also design your own room with all kinds of things, grow your own plants and make cool potions. The only thing this game is lacking really, is the unforgivably horrible dialogues. I would call myself a very casual gamer, so I can enjoy any story whether it's good or bad. But the problem with this one, is that the dialogue world feels so extremely unnatural. Everyone just acts like robots when you interact with them. This means that all these extra dialogue options you can choose aren't really there to get more invested emotionally to these characters, but are more there for just extra information, which ultimately leaves a kinda whacky story tbh.Other than that, they just need to optimize this game a bit better, and it should be just fineI'd give this game a 10 if the dialogue world was more natural spoken like uncharted or red dead redemption 2, but I guess nobody can make good quality anymore..7/10

author: HFC Steel
review: I barely recommend this game because it's fun, has a cool story, and because I love the world of Harry Potter. That's about it.The combat is unimaginative. Other than the graphical portion of combat, it's all very elementary.There is little to no engagement other than combat. The spell learning sequences and beast interactions are laughably pointless, to the point where it seems like someone said "wait, all this game is is 70% cut scenes and 30% repetitive combat. Let's make them move their mouse a bit so it's full immersion!"On that note, the cut scenes are gorgeous...but if you're strictly following the campaign with only some side questing, it feels like you're playing through an interactive movie. Maybe not so much of a complaint on my end, but many people don't enjoy that gameplay so I feel like it was worth mentioning.Somehow, someway, you're a 15 year old kid with 2 months of magic experience and you're able to take on groups of up to a dozen 30 year old witches and wizards with decades of experience. Why?This game is riddled with American politically motivated decisions. I don't even have to mention exactly what these decisions are, because every single person playing this game, no matter what "side" you're on, feels how unnatural these decisions feel when experiencing the game. I have no side...one side refuses to acknowledge that JK Rowling made awfully rude and disrespectfully remarks, and one side has become worse bullies than the ones they swore to fight against. This turmoil is on full display in the mess of rushed and forced development decisions littered throughout the game.Hogwarts Legacy is fun, in an arcadey way, but still entertaining in a movie sort of way. Take that for what you will, and I recommend a play due to those factors, but I believe it has still missed the mark on pleasing a good amount of gamers.

The lore is based on the books as apposed to be the movies such as the staircase etc, the paintings moving and talking as you pass, the knights in armour fighting sometimes. The devs deserve big kudos for putting this all together with such attention to detail and love for the HP universe. Each time the game introduces a new features I'm blown away amazed at how much content the game has already. [Slight spoiler] but the game throughout the story hints at qudditch so many times I wouldn't be surprised if it was a DLC down the line. Overall going to sync ♥♥♥♥ tonnes of hours in playing as every house, being a goody two shoes to being an evil wizard.

author: The Lamb
review: I have really enjoyed the game and highly recommend it. The graphics and atmosphere are amazing and really capture the feel of Hogwarts from both the movies and books. There is a periodic issue with rendering though I have the graphics higher then then the recommended settings. The game also has an interesting and engaging story/side quests that build up the world and the characters within it. Last but not least the game has a flowing and well executed combat system. This is the Harry Potter game I always wanted when I was young, and its wonderful to play as an adult.

review: I have played 11 hours so far in story mode on PC.   So not a review.  But as an elderly gamer whose hand eye coordination is, erm, not the best, I have found the hand holding helpful but not insulting.  I am enjoying the game very much.  So far, no glitches or bugs that I could spot.  I am glad the game offers a safe place to learn the controls and techniques at a pace I can manage.  It always takes me time, but I get there.  Had to go through the prologue on Witcher III several times .  If you are wondering if the game is playable by less than proficient gamers, my opinion so far is yes.  Is it fun?  Yes.  And I don't even have any HP nostalgia.

It pushes my 2080 to it's max on 1440p but that is expected.  If you have a newer system with 3070 or higher, and decent CPU you'll be fine.  At 60fps I've a had a great experience.  Some lag, not much at all, turn down settings to medium and DLSS to help out and you are right at 60 almost always.  That's a 2080 and a 9700K.  Don't judge me lol.  Anyway, great game.

author: cupkate
review: I think every Potter-Head from the 90's has waited over 20 years for a game like this. I've played every single version that had previously come out for PC, but you really can't compare.Although the game is still new and experiencing some issues (mine started randomly crashing when I go to Hogsmead), this is to be expected at this point and I am choosing to have faith that the devs will release updates to correct and optimize the game as it grows.The scenery is amazing, the castle is stunning and everything you could imagine Hogwarts would be. The world is vast and has plenty of exploration available as well as puzzles to crack. At the beginning it may feel slightly boring, but, as you progress through the story, you'll see that there's a lot to do.I am just happy I finally got my letter and can be a true part of Hufflepuff 🦡💛I hope that the future of the game won't stop here and we get to explore even more through DLC, and, who knows? Perhaps multiplayer?

review: The story is ok and that's it, don't go in expecting a great narrative. Also some menus take longer than they should to open, especially when you compare it to other games. However, the combat system is great, very easy to understand, but REALLY fun. author: Pqliar
review: IMO the game is overrated. First off, I had to spend a lot of time trying to figure out technical issues with the game. Even though the game utilizes about 50% of an RTX 3080 GPU the game still manages to completely destroy the VRAM forcing to tune down the texture settings to medium. Feels like there is some poor texture optimization going on with the game.However, this is not why I would negitively  rate a game. The whole game feels like a half baked open world RPG game.  Yes it is detailed but there are some elements that are just well, wrong. Character development for example. You create a character and bang, you are in the game, clueless who the f*** you are, what your background is. You just feel like some random character in a game. Then, in the prologue, they pretty much spoiler the s*** out of the game by revealing the final enemy. I just hate it when games do that.  The story feels blend and the characters extremely forgettable.The facial mocap feels like it is something from pre source engine. It is static, emotionless, and pretty much completely destroys the experience in wanting to explore this game any further.  On the surface, the game looks good but if you look a bit deeper the lightning feels off, there is this weird day & night cycle that doesn't add up, the collecting gear that doesn't make any sense whatsover. Potion crafting that requires you to wait endlessly.The guide book and menu is slow and sluggage due to the amount of animations they have put in. You have to access it a lot if you want to know where you are going or if you want to access your inventory. I would score this game 6 out of 10 at best because the developers did do a decent job at capturing the visual atmosphere of the harry potter movies. but everything else seems a forgettable and irritating experience. I severely regret paying full price for this and letting myself being led by the positive reviews that have been put on steam.

author: Tomzzter
review: Amazing

author: REAPER
review: great game would recommend. 9/10 needs some better optimisation to getting those fps higher sure it will come in an future update.

author: Naberius
review: Honestly, it doesn't matter if you're a fan of the universe the game takes place in or not. The lore, the characters, and the rather nicely sized open world map feel nice to explore in, the combat is fun, and for once we have the rare and exquisite quality of having NPCs that match your movement speed. Plus, being able to deck yourself out in whatever cool clothes you want as collected cosmetics and still keep the stats of the better gear is a wonderful addition that more games need to replicate. For fans of the franchise, it's a lovely delve into a world you're already familiar with and getting to see different sides of wizarding life like you haven't gotten to before. For those people who are just buying it to try it because of the hype, you will not be disappointed. Go out, explore the Forbidden Forest, jump into the Black Lake, and soar through the skies to your hearts content while blasting people apart with your favorite spells. The devs and everyone behind the scenes creating the game and storyboard for it have put together a fantastic experience.

author: Mr. G
review: First 10 hours in game really brings you back to early 2000, spending nights in your bedroom reading the books and dreaming about being able to some day enter the magic world of Harry Potter. Regarding the gameplay, the devs have taken a very interesting approach. The fact that it's an open world where you're free to visit any corner of Hogwarts and it's surroundings adds a huge depth to the immersive side of the game and the story. All the details are there and even more. The fighting mechanics are really cool so far but I feel them a bit stiff and repetitive at times. The combo mechanics give some Devil May Cry vibes - you either like it or not. Weird enough, there are some staircase that you'd like to jump from in order to take shortcuts and the character gets blocked by invisible walls. Meanwhile others staircases that are much higher will let you fall through and let you die.Adding the Dark Arts path was a great addition to the game.The flying mechanics on the broom are nice but they do feel a bit off at times. Also I really do hope they add Quidditch in a future DLC.Graphics 10/10Sounds effects 10/10Atmosphere & Music 10/10Storyline 10/10Gameplay 9/10So far the game is a masterpiece and I can't wait to dive even deeper and unravel all the mysteries that it has to offer.Highly recommended

author: DroopyButt
review: This game is Amazing

author: Bad_mojo
review: This is one of those games that you will have so much fun exploring and losing track of time. It does not require much learning the mechanic of the game if you have previously played game like this before; e.g. The Witcher 3, Shadow of Mordor, etc. However, this is a wizardry game so you will have to remember well where you put the shortcut for each spells to make combat go smoothly.The puzzles also required a bit of getting an understanding for each type, but once you are used to them you will not have a hard time solving them. I would say that you should stick to the main story quests until you nearly have all the core spells to start exploring and solving puzzles. This way you don't have to spend too much time trying to solve a puzzle that you might not have the spell for it just yet.Overall, I have not felt playing a game that I just get lost track of time since The Witcher 3 until I picked Hogwarts Legacy. I am not a hardcore fan of Harry Potter (I do enjoyed the movies a lot), but I could get into the lore and history of this franchise easily with so much information provided while exploring. I would recommend this game for those who can enjoy game without rushing to finish. There are so much to do beside the main story. However, make sure that you have a capable enough hardware to run this game smoothly before buying. At the moment (February 2023), this game still has not been optimized well to run on older hardware. I am running this game on Ryzen 7 7700x, 32 GB DDR5 (5600 mhz), Radeon RX 6800 XT 16 GB at 1440p on ultra setting without any real problem. Although, I have tried running this game on a portable gaming device with Ryzen 7 5800U, 16 GB LPDDR4 (4233 mhz), Radeon Vega 8 APU 3 GB on low setting at 900p, and it can struggle to keep 30 FPS sometimes.

review: Finally got the game working. Had to scour the internet for drivers compatible with the game. Game crashed every damn time. Having fun. But I still remember how difficult it was to get the game working. And it has left a bittersweet taste. More bitter than sweet. Wonderful premise. Solid mechanics and look.[edit]Crashing constantly again. Lack of assistance from developer, at this point. No patch. Just an unnecessary mess after mess.

author: Simp4Ghostface<3
review: Overall 8/10The game is an amazing game as a standalone, but as part of the Harry Potter franchise, for any fans, this is one of the biggest services to a fandom I've seen. From the music, to Hogwarts itself, to the way you learn spells like in the past games, this game is MAGICAL. So much work has been added to the small details of the game, as well as the game as a whole. Full voice acting throughout the entire game, even for your main character (which I don't know any other game that actually voice acts the main character that you play). This game is a love song to the Wizarding World.The only downside is the very poor optimisation that I seem to experience on PC. Playing on an Nvidia 3080 with a strong processor and 32gb of 3200ddr4 ram, its shocking that I experience the issues that I do. I cannot make full use of my Odyssey G9 monitor, and even playing on windowed, if I try to run YouTube or other streaming sites, even sometimes just general browsing, it hates me switching windows and often crashes. Heavy FPS drops are also quite common. Once these issues are patched out the game is a solid 12/10, but these have made my experience in playing the game quite regrettable at times.

review: I was not a HP Fan (watched the movies as a kid and never touched the books) and the game still impressed me, it's a good action RPG with an amazing setting, good characters and fast-paced combat.It's not GOTY material, and it's not supposed to win many awards, but it's still pretty amazing if you're not a fan of the universe.It's a must-buy for fans, but even if HP isn't your cup of tea, Hogwarts Legacy presents a satisfying magic gameplay that's lacking in many games today.
